title: divorce
sections: 他們的婚姻以離婚收場。
They advocated a complete divorce of government and religion.
他們主張政教完全分離。
Mr. Hill divorced his wife at the age of 70.
希爾先生七十歲的時候與他妻子離婚。
He is unable to divorce fantasy from reality.
他不能將幻想與現實分開。

title: scold
sections: 罵，責罵；嘮嘮叨叨地責備
She is always scolding her children.
她老是斥責自己的子女。
His father gave him a bad scold this morning.
他父親今晨狠狠訓了他一頓。

title: sympathy
sections: I have no sympathy for beggars.
Many people are in sympathy with your views.
I have no sympathy with your silly ideas.
我不贊成你那愚蠢的主意。
We sent our sympathies on the death of his mother.
他母親過世時我們去信弔唁。

title: wage
sections: His wages are three hundred dollars a week.
他的薪資為每週三百美元。

title: abuse
sections: He abused his power while in office.
You are always abusing and offending people.
你總是出言不遜得罪人。
那些俘虜遭受了肉體上的摧殘。

title: disaster
sections: We were all shocked by the disaster.
這場災難使我們所有人大為震驚。
我們的計畫以徹底失敗告終。

title: rescue
sections: He rescued three children from the burning building.
他從失火的建築物內救出了三個孩子。
The life boat was sent out to rescue the sailors from the sinking ship.
救生船被派出去救沉船的水手。

title: tragedy
sections: Tragedy is a type of literature that involves death, suffering or disaster.
悲劇作品是文學的一種，內容常涉及死亡，不幸和災難。
Shakespeare's Hamlet is one of the best known tragedies.
莎士比亞的《哈姆雷特》是最有名的悲劇之一。
The traffic accident is really a tragedy.

title: adjust
sections: She must learn to adjust herself to English life.
她必須學會適應英國的生活。
I must adjust my watch, it's fast.
我的表快了，我得把它校準。
Astronauts in flight must adjust to weightlessness.
太空人在飛行中得適應失重狀態。

title: contrast
sections: (對照之下形成的) 懸殊差別 [C] [U] [（+between）]
It is easy to perceive the contrast between their material prosperity and the emptiness of their lives.
他們物質富足，但生活空虛，這一差別是容易察覺的。
He is an amusing contrast to Russell.
他和拉塞爾形成了有趣的對照。

title: strain
sections: The heavy box strained the rope to a breaking point.
那隻沉重的箱子幾乎把繩子拉斷。
She strained her eyes in the darkness.
她在黑暗中睜大眼睛看。
使過勞（以致受損傷）；扭傷
John strained his eyes by reading too much small print.
約翰因看過多的小字體而弄壞了眼睛。
The official was warned not to strain his power.
那個官員受到警告，不可濫用職權。
He strained to finish the work in a week.
他拼命努力，想在一週內完成工作。
They strained to row the boat.
He strained at the rope and the boat moved.
他拉緊纜繩，船隨著動了。
The rope broke under the strain.
The athlete is suffering from muscular strain.
這名運動員正受肌肉勞損之苦。

title: unique
sections: 唯一的，獨一無二的；獨特的 [Z] [（+to）]
The custom is unique to the region.
這種風俗是這一地區特有的。
無可匹敵的，無與倫比的 [Z]
Beethoven's symphony is unique in music.
貝多芬的交響曲在音樂中是無與倫比的。
【口語】 罕有的；珍奇的；極好的
Her style of writing is rather unique.
她的寫作風格很不尋常。
The designs used in the indigenous arts and crafts of this tribe are unique.
這個部落自己生產的工藝品的設計很獨特。

title: awful
sections: We had an awful earthquake here last year.
去年我們這裡發生了可怕的地震。
【口語】 非常的，十分的；大量的 [B]

title: bitter
sections: The defeat was a bitter pill to swallow.
戰敗是不得不接受的屈辱（苦處）。
他們接受了慘痛的教訓。
Why was he so bitter against me?

title: eliminate
sections: Our goal is to eliminate poverty.
我們的目標是消滅貧困。
Our team was eliminated from the competition in the first round.
我隊在第一輪比賽中就被淘汰。

title: predict
sections: He predicted that an earthquake was imminent.

title: shortage
sections: There is a shortage of salt in this country.

title: distribution
sections: They could not agree about the distribution of the profits.
他們無法就利潤分配一事達成協議。
分布；(生物的) 分布區域 [U] [S1]
The pine-tree has a very wide distribution.
We have a good product but our distribution is bad.
我們的產品很好，但銷售情況不佳。

title: quantity
sections: Mathematics is the science of pure quantity.
數學是研究純量之科學。
There is a small quantity of water left in the bottle.
瓶子裡還剩下少量的水。
She has quantities of good clothes.

title: select
sections: Mr. Reed has been selected to represent us on the committee.
里德先生已作為我們的代表被選入委員會。
He selected a team for the special task.
他為這項特殊任務挑選了一組人馬。
A select group of their friends was invited to the wedding.
他們的經過挑選的一群朋友應邀參加婚禮。
She only stays at select hotels.
(學校，社會等) 選擇成員嚴格的；挑剔的
那所學院入學要求十分嚴格。

title: prior
sections: No prior knowledge should be required.
不需要預先學得什麼知識。
He feels a prior obligation to his job as a journalist.
他覺得要優先為他的新聞記者的工作盡職。
It happened prior to her departure.

title: laboratory
sections: This is our new language laboratory.
這是我們新的語言實驗室。

title: depression
sections: The trip to the seashore brought her out of her depression.
到海邊旅行使她不再抑鬱。
He lost his job during the great depression.
他在大蕭條時期失業了。
Water filled the depressions in the ground.
A depression usually brings bad weather.
低氣壓往往帶來壞天氣。

title: tide
sections: We must not ignore the tide of popular opinion.
我們切不可忽視輿論的傾向。
【古語】 (現僅用於複合字) 時，季節 [U]
Time and tide wait for no man. (諺語)

title: habit
sections: Smoking isn't a habit with me.
He never read these books, for he had long lost the habit of reading.
他從不讀這些書，因為他早就丟掉了閱讀習慣。
常春藤有攀緣向上的習性。
My mother was of a thrifty habit.
He admires her cheerful habit of mind.
他讚賞她那開朗的性格。

title: alarm
sections: The doorkeeper gave the alarm as soon as he saw the smoke.
守門人一看見冒煙就發出警報。
"What's up?" he asked in alarm. "出什麼事了？"他驚恐地問道。
"Don't be alarmed. I am no robber." "別慌，我不是強盜。"

title: substance
sections: Ice and snow are different forms of the same substance, water.
冰和雪都是水這一種物質不同的形式。
The substance of his speech was that he was better than the other candidates.
他演說的主要內容就是：他比其他候選人更好。
Later he became a man of substance.
後來，他成為頗具資產的人。

title: wrap
sections: I wrapped the book in brown paper before I mailed it.
我先把書用牛皮紙包好，然後郵寄。
She wrapped a scarf around her neck.
她把一條圍巾圍在脖子上。
The skyscraper was wrapped in fog.
He is wrapped up in his work.
A snake wrapped around the pillar.

title: stock
sections: 貯存；(知識等的) 積蓄 [C] [U]
The sailor has a rich stock of tales of adventure.
那個水手滿肚子都是探險故事。
There is not much stock in the shop right now.
Stocks of the company are falling.
該公司的股票正在下跌。
樹幹；插枝的母株 [U] 10 家系，血統 [C] [U]
The new employee is a man of Spanish stock.
新來的僱員是西班牙裔的男子。 11 (工具的)
We stock all types of fur coats.
You had better stock up with sugar because there is going to be a shortage.
你最好購進食糖，因為市場上馬上就要缺貨了。
I'm tired of his stock reply.
我已聽厭了他老一套的回答。

title: violate
sections: Dr. Thomas was condemned for violating medical ethics.
托瑪士大夫因違反醫德而受譴責。
He was accused of violating her home.
他被指控侵犯了她的家宅。
The soldiers violated the church by using it as a stable.
士兵們把教堂當馬廄用從而褻瀆了它。

title: abnormal
sections: 不正常的，反常的；不規則的
It is abnormal for a man to walk in his sleep.
An abnormal amount of snow fell here last week.
上週這裡下了異常大的雪。
It is important to make a study of abnormal psychology.
研究變態心理學是重要的。

title: gap
sections: She had gaps in her teeth.
間斷；間隔；間隙；(知識等的) 空白 [（+in）]
There are still gaps in my knowledge of English.
我的英語知識仍有空白。
The gap between the rich and the poor has widened.
貧富之間的差距擴大了。

title: symptom
sections: A fever is a symptom of illness.
The riot can be considered a symptom of political instability.
這次暴動可看作是政治上不穩定的徵兆。

title: plain
sections: 簡樸的；樸素的；不攙雜的
The meaning of the sentence is very plain.
這句句子的意思十分清楚。
I must be plain with you.
【委婉用語】 (相貌) 平常的；醜的
The child has a plain face.

title: release
sections: Release the dog. He has been chained up for hours.
放開這條狗。它已被拴了好幾小時了。
他很快地放開了她的手。
This releases them from personal responsibility.
這免除了他們的個人責任。
A new movie is to be released tonight.
今晚要發行一部新電影。
【法律】 放棄，讓與（權利，財產等）
He released his claim to the property.
他放棄了對財產的要求。
After my examination I had a feeling of release.
考試之後，我感到如釋重負。
The prisoner was questioned before his release.
囚犯被釋放之前受到了審問。
The end of the war brought the release of the prisoners.
戰爭的結束使所有戰俘得到釋放。
發行，發表；發行的書（或電影等），（發布的）通訊稿，新聞稿 [U] [C]
The film is scheduled for release next month.
You can't use these files without obtaining a release.
你得不到特許證就不能使用這些檔案。
He pressed the release to open the box.
他按下開啟裝置打開了箱子。

title: tactics
sections: 將軍們討論他們的戰術。
Different circumstances call for different tactics.
不同的情勢需要不同的策略。

title: accustom
sections: (常後接oneself或用被動式) 使習慣（於） [（+to）]
These people are accustomed to hard work.
這些人慣於艱苦的工作。

title: consist
sections: A university consists of teachers, administrators and students.
大學由教師，行政人員和學生組成。
The House of Commons consisted of 658 members.
下議院由六百五十八名議員組成。
The beauty of the picture consists in its balance of colors.
這幅畫的美在於其色彩的調和。
Tolerance consists in respecting the opinions of others.
寬容在於尊重別人的意見。
The information consists with his account.
消息與他的敘述相符合。

title: raw
sections: 大部分的水果是生吃的。
未加工的；處於自然狀態的
All the raw materials are imported.
The new teacher is very capable but he's still a bit raw.
這位新教師很能幹，但是還缺少點經驗。
(傷口等) 露肉的，擦掉皮的；刺痛的
His heel is raw because his shoe doesn't fit well.
因鞋子不合適，他的腳後跟擦破皮了。
It is a raw winter day today.
今天是一個濕冷的冬日。
【口語】 不公正的；苛刻的，嚴厲的
They were tired of their raw treatment by their boss.
他們受到老板的不公正待遇，對此實在無法忍受了。

title: moderate
sections: The hotel is moderate in its charges.
穩健的；溫和的；不偏激的
He is a child of only moderate ability.
他是一個政治上的溫和派。

title: transform
sections: The Greggs have transformed their garage into a guest house.
格雷格一家把他們的車庫改成了客房。
The situation has been greatly transformed.
A generator transforms mechanical energy into electricity.
發電機將機械能變成電。
【生物學/生理學/生物化學】 使轉化
A tadpole is transformed into a frog.
A tadpole transforms into a frog.

title: allot
sections: They were allotted a house to live in.
The factory allotted a parking-space to each employee.
這家工廠給每一個僱員分配了一個停車的地方。
Each speaker was allotted five minutes.
每個發言者限定發言五分鐘。

title: thorough
sections: The film was a thorough success.
這電影獲得極大的成功。
You must promise me to take a thorough rest.
你得答應我徹底休息一下。
The doctor was very thorough in his examination of the sick child.
醫生對生病的孩子進行了仔細的檢查。
She is not brilliant, but she is thorough.
她並非才華橫溢，但很仔細。

title: ancestor
sections: He is sprung from noble ancestors.
The abacus is the ancestor of the modern computer.
算盤是現代電腦的原型。

title: license
sections: We are applying for a license to sell wine.
(言行，思想等的) 自由；放縱，放肆 [U]
We must make a distinction between freedom and license.
我們必須把自由和放縱區分開來。
The restaurant is not licensed for selling spirits.
這家飯店沒有賣烈酒的許可證。

title: recruit
sections: Our club has recruited 30 new members this year.
今年我們俱樂部吸收了三十名新會員。
America recruited her population with new settlers from Europe.
美國透過歐洲新移民增加人口。
Most of the teachers there are recruited from abroad.
那裡的大部分教師是從海外僱來的。
Before sailing, we recruited our provisions.
開船前，我們補充了給養。
The rest and the drink recruited him.
休息和喝水使他恢復了體力。
His job was to recruit for the army.
他的工作是為陸軍募兵。
【罕用语】 恢復健康（或體力等）
He came to the seaside to recruit.
New recruits are trained at the boot camp.
新兵在新兵訓練營接受訓練。
Our music club needs new recruits.
我們的音樂俱樂部需要新成員。

title: surgery
sections: 外科，外科醫學；(外科) 手術 [U]
The condition is serious; it will need surgery.
情況嚴重，需要馬上動手術。

title: abhor
sections: Most people abhor cruelty to children.
多數人對虐待兒童深惡痛絕。

title: principal
sections: 主要的，首要的，最重要的 [B]
Drinking is a principal cause of traffic accidents.
酗酒是交通事故的主要原因。
The school principal read the honor roll list.
The interest on a principal of $10,000 or above is 0.2 percent higher.
本金一萬元以上的利息高百分之零點二。

title: temporary
sections: Ellen has got a temporary job.
艾倫找到一份臨時工作。
She works in the office as a temporary.
她在辦公室做臨時僱員。
The wartime temporaries will be replaced by permanent homes.
那些戰時臨時住房將被永久性住宅代替。

title: scandal
sections: It is a scandal for officials to take bribes.
政府官員接受賄賂是可恥的事。
A soldier should not bring scandal upon the uniform.
I'm not interested in scandal about the neighbors.
我對有關鄰居的流言蜚語不感興趣。
公憤，反感；(對醜聞的) 震驚 [C]
If she leaves her husband, she will certainly create a scandal in the village.
如果她與丈夫離異，肯定會在村子裡引起公憤。

title: gauge
sections: The amount of money one makes is not the only gauge of one's success.
掙錢的多少不是衡量一個人成功的唯一標準。
My car's gas gauge indicated that there was little gas left.
我車上的汽油表顯示剩下的油不多了。
This has gone beyond the gauge of her tolerance.
這已超出她的忍受範圍。
(槍管) 的口徑；(鐵道的) 軌距 [U] [C]
A 12-gauge shotgun was found at the crime scene.
在犯罪現場發現了一支十二口徑的獵槍。
The servant tried to gauge his master's mood.
那個僕人想揣測他主人的心思。

title: anniversary
sections: Next Monday is the anniversary of the day I first met you.
下週一是我第一次遇見你的週年紀念日。

title: emotion
sections: Love, hatred, and grief are emotions.

title: phase
sections: Luckily her disease was discovered in an early phase.
幸運的是，她的病在早期就被發現了。
They looked into the various phases of the problem.
他們研究了問題的各個方面。
The U.S. army will complete the phased withdrawal in four months.
美國軍隊將在四個月內完成分階段撤軍。

title: entertain
sections: We were all entertained by his humorous stories.
他的幽默故事使我們大家都很開心。
They often entertained their friends at weekends.
他們常在週末招待朋友。
I have never entertained any illusions about him.
我從來沒有對他抱過幻想。

title: engage
sections: The book engaged my full attention.
這本書把我完全吸引住了。
Housework engages much of her time.
They engaged a cook for the summer.
那個夏天他們僱了一個廚子。
He was busily engaged in painting the furniture.
The company engaged to finish the building by May.
那家公司保證五月份造好房子。
They engage in the study of music.

title: pension
sections: She lived on a small pension.
發給……退休金（或養老金等）
The Army pensioned the soldier for his years of loyal service.
陸軍為這位忠誠服役多年的士兵發放退休金。

title: strengthen
sections: It is a systematic attempt to strengthen our competitive ability.
那是為增強我們的競爭能力而作的有計畫的努力。

title: proportion
sections: The proportion of imports to exports is worrying the government.
進出口的比例令政府擔憂。
A large proportion of the country is desert.
這個國家的大部分地方是沙漠。
Steps must be taken to reduce the problem to manageable proportions.
必須採取措施將問題縮小到可控制的範圍。
使成比例；使平衡；使相稱 [（+to）]
The punishment was proportioned to the crime.
The designs in that rug are well proportioned.
那地毯上的圖案設計非常協調。

title: historic
sections: 歷史上著名的；歷史上有重大意義的
The historic battle changed the fate of two nations.
這一歷史上著名的戰役改變了兩個民族的命運。

title: preserve
sections: 油保護金屬，使免於生鏽。
We have taken effective measures to preserve our natural resources.
我們已採取有效措施保護自然資源。
醃（肉等）；把……做成蜜餞（或果醬）；把……製成罐頭食品 [（+in）]
Mother used to make peach preserves.
媽媽過去常常自製桃子果醬。
No hunting is allowed in the preserve.

title: voluntary
sections: Mr. Smith did a lot of work for a voluntary organization.
史密斯先生為一民辦組織做了很多工作。
He made a voluntary statement to the police.

title: adopt
sections: After much deliberation, the president decided to adopt her suggestion.
總經理再三考慮之後，決定採納她的建議。
Mr. Kern adopted the orphan as his own son.
克恩先生將那孤兒收養為自己的兒子。
The agenda was adopted after some discussion.
經過討論，議事日程獲得通過。

title: calm
sections: You must try to be calm.
The high wind passed and the sea was calm again.
大風過後，大海重又風平浪靜。
There was a calm on the sea.
We calmed the old lady down.
我們使老太太平靜下來。
Calm down, sir. What's the trouble?
冷靜點，先生。出了什麼事？

title: reluctant
sections: She was reluctant to give her money away.
她不願意把錢送給別人。

title: sweep
sections: He sweeps the room every day.
The boy helped Mother sweep the dirt away.
男孩幫助母親清除塵土。
(風等) 刮起；(浪等) 沖走；席捲 [O] [（+off/along/away）]
The wind swept the leaves away.
Willow branches swept the river's surface.
A cold wind swept through the north.
環視，掃視；掠過；急速移動 [Q] [（+past/to）]
Hunter's keen eyes swept from left to right.
漢特尖銳的目光從左到右掃視了一下。
The broad driveway sweeps around the lake.
這條寬闊的汽車道環湖伸展。
Let's give our room a good sweep.
讓我們把房間好好打掃一下。
There was a sweep of glistening snow on the hillside.
山坡上有一片連綿的閃閃發亮的積雪。
It's a clean sweep; we've won all the prizes.
我們大獲全勝；我們贏得了所有的獎品。

title: warning
sections: The son was so captivated with the woman that he didn't heed his parents' warnings.
兒子為這個女人神魂顛倒，全然不顧他父母的告誡。
The red light is a warning sign for stop.
紅燈是警告停止行進的信號。
Let this be a warning to you.
希望這件事能成為你的鑑戒。
The wall caved in without the slightest warning.
事先大家毫無察覺的情況下牆塌了。
警告的；告誡的；引以為戒的
The policeman fired a warning shot.
那警察鳴槍警告。 warn的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ warn)

title: contribute
sections: He contributed half of his savings to the relief fund.
他將積蓄的一半捐獻給救濟基金會。
He didn't contribute one idea to the document.
他對這個文件沒有提供一個主意。
He contributed generously to the Red Cross.
他對紅十字會慷慨捐助。
He never contributes to the discussion.
他在討論時從不發表意見。
The scientist often contributes to an academic journal.
這位科學家常常給那家學術期刊撰稿。

title: grade
sections: 【美國英語 】 (中，小學的) 年級；(某年級的) 全體學生
The twins will enter the fourth grade this fall.
這對雙胞胎今年秋季將升到四年級。
He received a failing grade on the term paper.
這些珍珠的等級分得很仔細。
The teacher spent all weekend grading the children's papers.
那位教師花了整個週末給孩子們的試卷打分數。
(顏色等) 漸次變化，漸次調和 [（+into）]
Red and yellow grade into orange.

title: protein
sections: 蛋白質是生命必不可少的。

title: conscious
sections: She may become conscious before morning.
她天亮前可能恢復知覺。
I suddenly became conscious that someone was looking at me.
我突然意識到有人在看著我。
His conscious lie exasperated his teacher to no end.
他故意說謊使老師非常惱怒。
She was conscious of her flat nose.
她為自己的扁鼻子感到難為情。

title: corruption
sections: The city is riddled with corruption.
"Nite" is sometimes considered a slang corruption of "night". "Nite"有時被看成是"night"在俚語中的訛用。
The heat accelerated the corruption of the dead body.
天熱加速了死屍的腐爛。

title: pollution
sections: We have freed the lake from pollution.
我們已經清除了該湖的汙染。
She was horrified by all the pollution on the beach.
她對海灘上的汙染感到震驚。

title: honor
sections: We fight for the honor of our country.
我們為祖國的榮譽而戰。
The business honor of the company is beyond suspicion.
這個公司的商業信譽毋庸置疑。
He is a man of honor.
He is an honor to our school.
Children should be taught to show honor to their elders.
應該教育孩子尊敬長者。
The general was buried with military honors.
You honor us with your presence.
您的蒞臨是我們的光榮。
Will you honor me with a visit?

title: nuisance
sections: 討厭的人（或事物）；麻煩事 [C]
He was nothing but a nuisance and a rascal.
他是一個十足的討厭鬼和惡棍。
【法律】 妨害行為，騷擾行為 [C] [U]
The prosecutor indicted him of nuisance.
檢察官以妨害行為起訴他。

title: prudent
sections: His wife is a prudent manager of money.
他妻子是一位審慎的理財人。

title: welfare
sections: She works hard for the welfare of the poor.
她為了窮人的福利而辛勤工作。
【美國英語 】 社會救濟（制度）
They are living on welfare now.
他們現在靠社會救濟生活。
People are concerned about the cutbacks in federal welfare programs.
人們關注著聯邦福利計畫的削減。

title: tip
sections: He burnt the tips of his fingers.
Some smokers don't like cigarettes with tips.
有的菸民不喜歡抽有濾嘴的紙菸。

title: propel
sections: 一個為野心所驅策的人

title: soul
sections: Christians believe that the soul lives forever.
She puts her whole soul into work.
她把全部精力投入工作。
It's quite an attractive building, but somehow it hasn't got much soul.
那是一幢相當漂亮的建築，但不知怎的它沒有多少生氣。
He feared the soul of his deceased wife would haunt him.
他害怕亡妻的鬼魂會來纏擾他。
You saw hardly a soul in the village.
在村子裡，你幾乎看不到什麼人。
Brevity is the soul of wit.
主腦；中心人物；推動力 [the S] [（+of）]
Philip is the life and soul of any party.
菲力普是所有宴會的靈魂人物。
He was the soul of the enterprise.
He is the soul of honor.
【美國英語 】【口語】 黑人靈歌 [U]
他是一位黑人靈歌歌手。
美國黑人的；美國黑人文化的 [B]
他是一位美國黑人歌手。

title: remote
sections: 相隔很遠的，遙遠的；偏僻的 [（+from）]
She taught in a remote village.
她曾在一個偏僻的村莊裡教書。
That happened in the remote past.
(在血統，因果等方面) 關係疏遠的 [（+from）]
Much new knowledge is remote from the immediate interest of the ordinary person.
許多新知識與普通人目前的利益關係甚遠。
She was a silent girl, cool and remote.
她是一個沉默寡言的女孩，對人冷漠而孤傲。
I hadn't the remote idea what she meant.
我一點不明白她是什麼意思。
The missile is guided by remote control.

title: appoint
sections: He appointed Williams as his deputy in the city of York.
他任命威廉斯作為他在約克市的代理人。
Our visitors arrived at the appointed time.
我們的來賓在約定的時間到達了。

title: nervous
sections: 他見到陌生人就感到緊張不安。
神經興奮的；有力的，剛健的

title: false
sections: 不正確的，謬誤的；不真實的
I don't want to give you a false impression.
我不想給你一個不真實的印象。
He was accused of giving false witness.
Better an open enemy than a false friend.
She wore false hair to the dance.
她戴著假髮去參加舞會。

title: inevitable
sections: 不可避免的；必然（發生）的 [R]
他們被擊敗是不可避免的。
【口語】 照例必有的；老一套的 [B]
He greeted us with his inevitable smile.

title: faith
sections: He always puts his faith in the future.
他對未來總是抱有信心。
People of every faith attended the mayor's funeral.
信仰不同宗教的人士出席了市長的葬禮。

title: weaken
sections: We never weaken our efforts in face of difficulties.
我們在困難面前從不鬆勁。
His sense of duty never weakens.
他的責任感從不會減弱。

title: exhibition
sections: We went to an exhibition of Chinese paintings at the museum.
我們去博物館參觀中國畫展。
I never saw such an exhibition of bad manners before.
我以前從未見過如此無禮的舉止。

title: familiar
sections: 世所周知的；熟悉的；常見的；普通的 [（+to）]
(某人) 熟悉（某事）的，通曉……的 [F] [（+with）]
I am of course familiar with your work.
She wrote in a familiar style.

title: desperate
sections: 情急拼命的，鋌而走險的
A desperate man will stop at nothing to get what he wants.
一個亡命之徒為了達到自己的目的什麼事都做得出來。
危急的；絕望的；孤注一擲的
He was desperate when he lost all his money.
當他丟了所有的錢時，他絕望了。
He was desperate for work to provide for a large family.
他渴望有個工作，掙錢供養子女眾多的家。

title: fare
sections: (交通工具的) 票價，車（船）費 [C]
She didn't have enough money for the bus fare.
The taxi-driver stopped to pick up a fare.
計程車司機停下車來搭載一名乘客。
He fared better in the second test.
他第二次考試頗有進步。

title: freeze
sections: When the thermometer is at 0 degree centigrade, water will freeze.
當溫度計降至攝氏零度時，水便會結冰。
(因恐懼等) 呆住；戰慄，變僵硬
She froze at the sound of a gun.
她一聽到槍聲就嚇呆了。
The cold weather froze the lake.
寒冷的天氣把湖凍住了。
He was frozen stiff after sitting so long.
他坐了好長時間，人都凍僵了。
She froze her noisy children with a single look.
她一瞪眼，她吵鬧的孩子們馬上動也不敢動。
凍結（物價，薪資，資產等）；凍結（存款）
His salary was frozen at 200 dollars per week.
他的薪水凍結在每週二百美元的水平上。
Several people were found lying dead in the street during the big freeze last winter.
去冬嚴寒期街上發現好幾個人凍死。
The retired workers demanded a freeze on prices.
退休工人要求凍結物價。

title: owe
sections: I owe the landlord one hundred dollars./I owe one hundred dollars to the landlord.
We owe a great deal to our parents.
We owe to Newton the principle of gravitation.
我們全靠牛頓才知道引力的原理。
你應該給自己安排個假期。
I still owe for my car.

title: negative
sections: He gave me a negative answer.
他給了我一個否定的答案。
他們的批評並不是負面的。
Minus ten is a negative quantity. -10是一個負量。
The tests for hepatitis were negative.
否定，拒絕；否定的回答（或觀點等）
His answer to my request was a negative.
我的請求遭到了他的拒絕。
In Latin, two negatives in the same sentence always amounted to an affirmation.
過去拉丁文中兩個否定總是相當於肯定。
父親否定了我們的計畫。
The suggestion was negatived by the school board.
這提議被教育委員會否決了。

title: retire
sections: The company retired him as soon as he reached sixty.
他一到六十歲公司就讓他退休了。
The general decided to retire his troops from action.
將軍決定將他的部隊撤出戰鬥。
The government retires worn or torn bills from use.
政府將破損的鈔票收回作廢。
Mr. Weller retired last month and now lives at his ease.
韋勒先生上個月退休了，現在過著悠閒的生活。
Our armies have retired to regroup for a fresh attack.
我們的軍隊後撤重新編隊準備發動新的進攻。
He retired to bed, but he did not sleep.

title: shift
sections: In August we shifted our furniture to Dublin.
八月時我們把傢俱搬到了都柏林。
A sunset like this shifted its tints every moment.
像這樣的日落時時刻刻在改變著色彩。
He always tries to shift the blame to someone else.
他總是試圖將過錯推卸給別人。
Should I shift gears before making a turn?
我拐彎之前該不該換擋？
No detergent can shift these stains.
任何清潔劑都不能除掉這些汙跡。
The boy shifted uncomfortably in his chair.
這男孩不舒服地在椅子裡動來動去。
He shifted hastily to a new subject.
他匆忙轉換一個新的話題。
The man went abroad, leaving his wife and children to shift for themselves.
那男人去了海外，留下妻子兒女自謀生計。
You have to shift as you drive around the corner.
A sudden shift in weight caused the boat to turn over.
重量突然轉移使船翻了。
The lazy man tried every shift to avoid doing his work.
這懶漢採取各種手段迴避工作。
She works on the night shift.

title: manufacture
sections: The bikes are of home manufacture.
這些自行車是本國製造的。
This country imports many foreign manufactures.
這個國家進口許多外國產品。

title: routine
sections: 例行公事；日常工作；慣例；慣常的程序 [U] [C]
As soon as she learns the office routine she will be an excellent assistant.
她一旦熟悉了辦公室的日常事務，就會成為一名優秀的助手。
(經常表演的) 固定劇目；一套固定舞步（或動作） [C]
The Marx brothers were famous for their comedy routine.
馬克斯兄弟因表演一套喜劇劇目而出名。

title: fix
sections: Her image was fixed in his mind.
她的形象深深印在他的腦海裡。
Shall we fix a date for the picnic?
我們定一下野餐的時間好嗎？
We are going to have the TV fixed.
我們要請人把電視修好。
If you want to interview the Mayor, I can fix it.
如果你要採訪市長，我可以安排。
Let me fix you a drink.
操縱（選舉，賽馬等）；用賄賂取得……的支持
Tell him to behave, or I'll fix him.
告訴他規矩點，否則我要收拾他。
固定；變得穩定；(目光等) 注視
Her eyes fixed for a few minutes.
好幾分鐘她的眼睛一動也不動。
Give him a hand; he is in a bad fix.
拉他一把吧，他已陷入了困境。
The horse race was a fix.
Can you get a fix on the submarine?

title: mood
sections: I am not in the mood to argue.
That evening he was in an unusual light-hearted mood.
那晚他的心情異常輕鬆。
She was in a bit of a mood this morning.
He is a man of moods.
他是一個喜怒無常的人。
The mood of the music was almost funereal.
音樂的調子幾乎像哀樂。
A mood of optimism pervaded the gathering.

title: brilliant
sections: 光輝的；明亮的；色彩豔麗的
傑出的，優秀的；輝煌的；出色的
He came up with a brilliant idea.
他想出了一個絕妙的主意。
才華橫溢的；技藝高超的；英明的
她是個技藝超群的游泳健兒。

title: affirm
sections: He affirmed his loyalty to his country.
他聲言忠於自己的國家。
She was affirmed as a candidate.

title: expand
sections: He is thinking of expanding his business.
他正考慮擴展他的生意。
They have expanded my view on the question.
他們已更充分地闡明了我對這個問題的觀點。
In ten years the city's population expanded by 12%.
十年之中，該城人口增加了百分之十二。
A tire expands when you pump air into it.
變得和藹可親；感到心曠神怡；變開朗
My father expanded a little when he had had a drink, and started to talk more freely.
我父親小酌之後，就變得開朗可親些，話也說得多了。
Her face expanded in a smile.

title: register
sections: No register of his death was found.
沒有查到他的死亡記錄。
That note is in the upper register of this instrument.
那個音在該樂器的高音部。
Official documents are written in formal register.
官方文件是以正式語體寫成的。
Waldo went to the city hall to register the birth of his son.
沃爾多去市政廳為他兒子作出生登記。
她臉上露出了驚異之色。
Thousands joined the march to register their opposition to the cuts in education.
數千人參加遊行表示反對削減教育經費。
I registered at a hotel near the train station.
我在靠近火車站的一家旅館登記住宿。
【口語】 (常用在否定句中) 留下印象
I told them I would be leaving, but I don't think it registered.
我告訴過他們我要走，但我想他們並未留意。

title: overwhelming
sections: 壓倒多數 overwhelm的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ overwhelm)

title: evil
sections: The man was punished for his evil acts.
此人因其惡行受到懲罰。
Some people return good for evil.
Money is thought to be the root cause of all evils.
金錢被認為是萬惡之源。

title: surrender
sections: The criminal surrendered himself to the police.
She surrendered her dream of becoming a model.
她放棄當模特兒的夢想。
He was ordered to surrender his gun.
The mother surrendered herself to grief.
The surrender of the soldiers saved themselves from being killed.
士兵們的投降使他們免遭殺戮。
The enemy were forced to make an unconditional surrender.

title: wheel
sections: (汽車的) 方向盤；(船的) 舵輪 [the S]
【美國英語 】【俚語】 掌大權的人物，大亨 [C]
Some of the big wheels in the city attended the party.
本市一些大人物出席了聚會。
He wheeled his bike through the narrow lane.
他推著自行車穿過狹窄的巷子。
He wheeled round and dashed for the door.
他一轉身便向門口衝去。

title: root
sections: These plants have very deep roots.
這些植物的根長得很深。
This is the root cause of poverty.
Money is the root of all evil.
【文學/文學用語】 字根；原形
Hope is the root of hopeful. hope是hopeful的字根。
Do you think it is possible to root out crime?
你認為可以根除犯罪嗎？
有些植物容易生根成長。
The crime rooted in his greed for money.
這一犯罪行為起因於他對金錢的貪得無厭。

title: acknowledge
sections: I acknowledge that her criticism is just.
我承認她的批評是公正的。
The candidate waved his hands to acknowledge the cheers of the crowd.
候選人揮手對大眾的歡呼表示感謝。
I acknowledged her letter at once.
我馬上告知收到了她的信。
Stella didn't even acknowledge me when I waved a greeting.
我向斯特拉揮手致意，可她連招呼也不打一個。

title: psychology
sections: He has obtained a degree in psychology.
他已在心理學方面獲得學位。

title: native
sections: 出生地的，祖國的，家鄉的 [B]
They are native speakers of English.
He has been away from his native Poland for three years.
他離開故土波蘭已有三年了。
The giant panda is native to China.
大熊貓是中國特有的動物。
I am still struck by the native beauty of the lake.
我仍然為湖泊的自然美所吸引。
Are you a native here, or just a visitor?
你是本地人？或者只是過客？
The kangaroo is a native of Australia.
袋鼠是澳大利亞的土生動物。

title: illustrate
sections: The teacher illustrated his lesson with pictures.
這位教師用圖片來講解課文。
He illustrated his point by relating his own experiences.
他用自己的經歷說明他的觀點。
This English textbook is well illustrated.
這本英文教科書有精美的插圖。

title: rent
sections: I've got to pay my rent this morning.
今天上午我必須付房租。
They rented a cabin for their vacation.
他們為度假租了一間小屋。
I have rented the house out to a very nice family.
我把房子出租給了一戶很好的人家。
This house rents for US$ 800 a month.
這間屋子月租八百美元。
This farm rents for $1,500 a year.
這農場以每年一千五百美金出租。

title: swing
sections: The lamp swung in the breeze.
He swung around and shouted at me.
他突然轉過身來，對著我大聲叫嚷起來。
He swings his arms as he walks.
Tom swung his hammock between the two trees.
湯姆把吊床掛在兩棵樹之間。
The swing of the ship made many people seasick.
船的搖擺使許多人暈船。
The children are playing on the swings in the park.
孩子們正在公園裡盪鞦韆。

title: pure
sections: 純粹的，不攙雜的；道地的
Is the cup made of pure gold?
這隻杯子是純金做的嗎？
The air by the sea is pure and healthy.
海邊的空氣清新又有益健康。
It was pure luck that he was home when we called.
非常幸運，我們打電話時他在家裡。

title: overcome
sections: The learner of a second language has many obstacles to overcome.
第二語言學習者有許多障礙要克服。
He was overcome by the heat.
我相信真理將會獲勝。 overcome的動詞過去式、過去分詞 (→ overcome)

title: specialist
sections: Dr. Li is a specialist in information retrieval.
李博士是位信息檢索專家。

title: aggressive
sections: Tom thought of the war as an aggressive one.
湯姆把這場戰爭視作侵略戰爭。
有進取精神的；有幹勁的
An aggressive young man can go far in our firm.
有進取心的青年人在本公司能大展鴻圖。

title: pen
sections: The contract must be signed with a pen, not a pencil.
這合同一定要用鋼筆而不用鉛筆簽字。
She makes a living with her pen.
I penned a letter to my aunt today.
今天我寫了一封信給姑媽。

title: resign
sections: She resigned her children to the care of her sister.
她把孩子交給她妹妹照管。
He is resigned to his fate.
He resigned himself to his fate.
The simplest thing is for him to resign at once.
最簡單的做法就是他立即辭職。

title: species
sections: There are many species of chrysanthemum.
【生物學/生理學/生物化學】 種 [M]
The giant panda has become an endangered species.
大熊貓已成了一種瀕臨滅絕的動物。
Today the survival of our species is threatened.
今天人類的生存受到了威脅。

title: afflict
sections: The poor old man was afflicted with diabetes.
那可憐的老人受到糖尿病的折磨。
Famine and war still afflict mankind.
饑荒與戰爭依舊給人類帶來痛苦。

title: clever
sections: She knew him to be industrious and clever.
她知道他既勤奮又聰明。
My brother is a clever carpenter.
我的兄弟是個靈巧的木匠。

title: fortune
sections: He received a large fortune when his uncle died.
他在叔父去世時得到了一大筆財產。
He did not deserve such fortune.
他不配得到這種好運氣。
She told my fortune by reading my palm.

title: physical
sections: Playing basketball is one form of physical exercise.
打籃球是體育活動的一種形式。
I have no idea how large the physical universe is.
我不知道物質世界有多大。
自然科學的，按自然法則的

sections: The dispute has scared away potential investors.

【物理學】 勢的，位的；電壓的
She has acting potential, but she needs training.
她有表演潛力，但需要訓練。
A current of high potential is used in transmitting electric power over long distances.
高壓電流被用來遠距離輸送電力。

title: stem
sections: Bindweed ran up the stems of the corn.
旋花纏繞著玉米杆往上長。
高腳酒杯的腳；菸斗柄；手錶的轉柄

The sea ran high, and swept the little craft from stem to stern.
海面上風急浪高，小船從頭至尾都被浪頭沖刷著。
He descended from an ancient stem.
他出身於一個古老的家系。
When you swim up stream, you have to stem the current.
當你往上游游的時候，你得頂著水流而上。

損失是他的魯莽冒失造成的。

sections: The child would not let go his grip on Tom.
這孩子緊緊地抓住湯姆不放。
He is just beginning to get a grip of the subject.
他剛剛開始能掌握這一科。

掌握；控制；吸引；抓住（注意力等）
他的表演深深地吸引住觀眾。

title: province
sections: British Columbia is a province of Canada.
不列顛哥倫比亞是加拿大的一個省。
(首都或大都市以外的) 地方；鄉間 [the P]

那個流行樂隊現在在外省巡迴演出。
(學術) 領域；部門；(活動，職務的) 範圍 [S]
It's within his province to issue orders.
European History is not my province.
歐洲歷史不是我的專業範圍。
(特定動植物的) 生存地區 [U]
Australia is the province of the kangaroo.
澳大利亞是袋鼠的生長地。

title: intense
sections: The fracture caused him intense pain.
骨折給他造成了劇烈的疼痛。

這位候選人有許多熱烈的支持者。

title: hire
sections: We hired a driver to take us on a tour of the city.
我們僱用了一個司機帶我們遊覽這個城市。

title: genuine
sections: 真的；非偽造的；名副其實的
真誠的；不造作的，由衷的

title: outcome
sections: I think there can be but one outcome to this affair.
我認為這件事只可能有一種結局。

她對自己努力的結果很滿意。

title: flexible
sections: 可彎曲的，易彎曲的；柔韌的；有彈性的
A piece of rubber hose is flexible.
可變通的；靈活的；易適應的

title: antique
sections: 古代的，古老的；年代久遠的
In the museum we saw antique pewter plates.
我們在博物館看到古時的白鑞盤子。
This antique chair was made in 1750.
這把古老而珍貴的椅子是1750年造的。
那輛汽車的式樣確實是陳舊過時了。
Mr. Hunter is very much interested in collecting antiques.

title: compete
sections: We can compete with the best teams.
我們能與最好的隊競爭。
These paintings can't compete in expressive power with those ones.
這些水彩畫在表達能力方面比不上那些。

title: modest
sections: He's got a drawer full of medals but he's too modest to wear them.
他有滿滿一抽屜的獎章，但是他很謙虛，從不戴它們。
(女性及其衣飾) 端莊的；穩重的
She wore a modest bathing suit.
她穿一件不太暴露的游泳衣。
不太大（或多）的；適度的，有節制的
Prices tended to rise year by year, but at a modest rate.
物價年年上漲，但幅度不大。

title: complicated
sections: 複雜的；難懂的；結構複雜的
That puzzle is too complicated for the children.
那個謎語對兒童來說太難了。 complicate的動詞過去式、過去分詞 (→ complicate)

title: desert
sections: Nobody likes to live in that desert region.
沒有人喜歡生活在那個沙漠地區。

title: circumstance
sections: In normal circumstances I would have resigned immediately.
在正常情況下，我本會馬上辭職的。
事件，事實；(有關) 事項 [C]
His arrival was a happy circumstance.
他的來到是一件令人高興的事。
They have been living in reduced circumstances since John lost his job.
約翰失業後，他們一直生活拮据。
The explorer told of his adventure with great circumstance.
探險者詳細敘述了他的冒險經歷。
He became a victim of circumstances.

title: jail
sections: He went to jail for drunken driving.
She was jailed for three months.

title: combine
sections: Some films combine education with recreation.
有些電影把教育與娛樂結合起來。
We are going to combine the three departments soon.
我們很快就要合併這三個部門了。
The two old schools are to combine to form one big new school.
這兩所舊學校將合併組成一所新的大學校。

title: path
sections: They walked along the path through the woods.
他們沿著林間小路走去。
His path through life was hard.
他的人生歷程十分坎坷。

title: tight
sections: The lid was so tight that I couldn't open the box.
蓋太緊了，我打不開盒子。
He made sure that the rope was tight.
他看清楚繩子是否拉緊了。
The shoes are too tight for me.
(時間，空間) 緊湊的，排得滿滿的，沒空的
We hope to finish the work next week, but the schedule's very tight.
我們希望在下週做完這工作，但日程安排很緊。
The principal has a very tight schedule.
校長的日程表排得滿滿的。
Losing my wallet put me in a tight spot.
我的錢包丟了，弄得我很尷尬。
We had a tight volleyball match.
我們進行了一場勢均力敵的排球賽。
(文字等) 緊湊的，精鍊的；排得緊的 10 整潔的，整齊的 11 吝嗇的
The old man is tight with his money.
商品難得到的；銀根緊的
Money is a bit tight at the moment.
The doctor tied the bandage too tight.

title: cooperate
sections: Let's all cooperate to get the work done quickly.
讓我們一起同心協力把這工作快點做完。
They would not cooperate with him.

title: lecture
sections: Professor Lee will give us a lecture on poetry.
李教授將就詩歌對我們作學術講演。
Father gave me a lecture for speeding.
父親因我超速行駛而訓斥了我一頓。
He continued to lecture on criminal law at Rome University.
他繼續在羅馬大學教授刑法。

title: chat
sections: They chatted about the film shown last night.
他們閒聊著昨夜放的電影。
He often asked Philip to come in for a chat.

title: monitor
sections: 檢查學生出席情況的班長

The nurse monitored the patient's condition carefully.
護士很細心地監察病人的狀況。
It is said that the police monitored his phone calls during that period.

title: impose
sections: The government imposed a heavy tax on luxury goods.
政府對奢侈品課以重稅。
The present trouble was imposed on him.
目前的困難是強加在他身上的。
I don't want to impose on you by staying too long.
我不想打擾你，不多耽擱了。

title: enterprise
sections: 冒險精神；進取心，事業心 [U]
Tom is a man of great enterprise.
This enterprise is doing a good business.

title: luxury
sections: A refrigerator was then a luxury.
那時候冰箱是種奢侈品。

title: pursue
sections: The policemen pursued the bank robbers.
警察追趕搶劫銀行的罪犯。

She pursued the goal of perfection in her
He has set his heart on pursuing his studies abroad.

title: therapy
sections: The doctor prescribed walking as therapy for my weak knee.
醫生囑我多走走，以此治療我乏力的膝蓋。

title: qualify
sections: I am a qualified doctor, who will not hurt you.
我是一個合格的醫生，不會傷害你的。

兩年的資歷使他有資格獲得升遷。

In "blue pencils", the adjective "blue" qualifies the noun "pencils".

I qualify it as a plot.
Can you qualify yourself for the job?
你能證明你自己有能力擔任這一工作嗎？
取得資格；具備合格條件 [（+as/for）]
He qualified in London as a teacher of English overseas.

title: otherwise

我們總要設法去那裡的，乘船也好，用其他辦法也好。

今天我身體不太舒服，否則這事我就親自去做了。

title: trap

我很清楚這是一個陷阱。
To break out of the poverty trap they need help from the government.

農夫駕著雙輪輕便馬車繼續趕路。 10
The police trapped him into a confession.
Many women are trapped in loveless marriages.
許多婦女陷入沒有愛情的婚姻之中而無法擺脫。

title: outstanding
sections: 未解決的；未完成的；未償付的 [Z]

要成為鋼琴家需經多年訓練。
A little discipline would do them a lot of good.
略加懲處對他們將大有好處。

那樣跑了一陣之後，他氣喘吁吁了。

一項工作；一次努力（的成果），一下子 [S]

(幸運等的) 機緣，意想不到的事

他從名單上把你的名字劃掉了。

title: recession

他的工廠在經濟衰退時期關閉了。

title: dig

他們正在挖一條貫通這座山的隧道。

Do you dig what I mean?

這動物挖洞比任何貓或狗都快。

title: beat
sections: He beat his brother for lying.
他因為他的兄弟說謊而揍他。

我認為傑克可以勝過這個國家的所有賽跑選手。

title: assertion
sections: We do not believe his assertion that he is innocent.
我們不相信他關於自己是無辜的聲明。
(權利等的) 主張，維護；(意見等的) 堅持 [U]

title: suspend
sections: The lamp was suspended from the ceiling.

一股煙雲飄懸在天空中。

和那個國家的貿易中斷了十年。

Tom was suspended from school for bad conduct.
湯姆因行為不端被休學。
暫緩作出（決定等）；暫緩執行（刑罰等）

讓我們在了解全部事實之前暫時不要作出判斷。

title: urban
sections: In some developing countries more and more people are migrating to urban areas.
在某些發展中的國家，越來越多的人向市區遷移。

title: adhere
sections: There were several pages that adhered to each other.
有幾頁書黏連在一起了。

title: news

幾天之後他告訴我一個令人振奮的消息。
Come in, Mary. I've got good news for you.
瑪麗，進來。我有好消息告訴妳。

title: planet
sections: The planets move around the sun.

聚會將在軍官食堂舉行。
The whole mess burst out laughing.
全食堂的人都突然笑了起來。
一份食品（常指半流質的）；(獵物等吃的) 雜食；足夠一頓吃的量 [C]

他捕到足夠飽餐一頓的魚。
Her hair was in a terrible mess.
髒亂的東西；(狗，貓的) 屎 [U] [C]
Would you please clean up the mess?
請你把這些骯髒的東西清理掉好嗎？
困境，狼狽的處境，一團糟 [S]
She made a pretty bad mess of it.
【口語】 骯髒的人，邋遢的人 [C] [S1]

我對他把廚房弄髒已經習慣了。

在這個兵營裡，士兵不和軍官一起用餐。
搞亂，陷入混亂；把事情弄糟 [（+up）]

He spent all day Sunday just messing about.
他星期天胡混了一整天。
You'd better not mess in the affairs of others.
你最好不要干涉他人的事情。

title: bare
sections: The child was bare to the waist.
All they had were the bare necessities of life.
他們所有的僅僅是生活必需品而已。
The little room was almost bare of furniture.
這個小房間幾乎沒有什麼傢俱。

title: plot
sections: A plot to assassinate the President was uncovered by government agents.
刺殺總統的陰謀被政府特工人員發覺了。
The play has a very complicated plot.
這齣戲的情節相當複雜。
I grow vegetables on my little plot of land.
我在我的一小塊土地上種蔬菜。

He made a plot of the route of the hike.
他為遠足的路線畫了一張圖。

犯罪分子正密謀搶劫銀行。

護士繪製了一份病人體溫圖。
They plotted the new positions of each vessel.
他們測定了每一條船的新位置。
He is plotting a new novel.
他正在為一部新小說構思情節。
New residential districts are all plotted out.
新居住區的地塊都已划定。
The rebels plotted against the government.

title: thin
sections: The air became even thinner when I climbed to the top of the mountain.
我爬到山頂時，空氣變得更加稀薄了。
空洞的；淺薄的；不能令人信服的
她的演講聽上去頗為空洞。
Don't cut the bread too thin.
使薄；使細；使稀；使瘦；使淡 [（+out）]
The wine has been thinned with water.
變薄；變細；變瘦，變稀；變淡 [（+out）]

title: crop
sections: They get two crops of rice a year.
There was a record wheat crop last year.
去年小麥收成創最高記錄。
He cropped several acres with barley.

title: rear
sections: 後部，後面；背後，背面 [the S]
To the rear of the house is a piece of woodland.
在房子後面是一塊林地。
The horse kicked him in the rear.
The front of the car was damaged and we had to get out by the rear door.
車身前部受損，我們只得從後門出來。

title: install
sections: He has been installed in his new office.
He's going to install an air-conditioner in the house.
他要在這屋子裡裝冷氣機。

title: disclose
sections: The lifting of the curtain disclosed a pretty house standing by the riverside.
幕啟後露出河邊的一幢漂亮的房子。
這封信揭露了他的祕密。
She refused to disclose her name and address.
她不肯透露自己的姓名和地址。

title: demonstrate
sections: The lawyer demonstrated that the witness was lying.
The doctor demonstrated the harmful effects of tobacco.
醫生用實例說明菸草的有害的影響。
The salesperson demonstrated a new washing machine.
推銷員示範操作新的洗衣機。
This fully demonstrates their willingness to cooperate.
這充分表明他們願意合作。

title: lean
sections: They came to Pisa and saw the leaning tower.
他們來到了比薩也看到了斜塔。
She leaned down to hear the child.
她彎下身子聽孩子說話。
Mr. Ford went to his window and leaned out.
福特先生走向窗口，把身子探出窗外。
She leaned lightly against his shoulder.
她輕輕地靠在他的肩上。
We lean on our friends when we are in trouble.
我們遇到困難時依靠朋友幫助。
他在政治上傾向於保守主義。
Lean your head on my shoulder.
把你的頭靠在我的肩膀上。

title: zone
sections: I'd like to see Europe as a nuclear-free zone.
我希望歐洲成為無核區。
帶；氣候帶；動植物分布帶
Most of the world's wheat is grown in the North Temperate zone.
世界上大部分小麥種植在北溫帶。
The U.S. and Canada are zoned for postal delivery.
美國和加拿大劃分了郵區。
The downtown area is zoned for commercial use.
市中心被劃出供商業用。

title: biography
sections: I have read a biography of Abraham Lincoln.
我讀過一部亞伯拉罕‧林肯的傳記。

title: vision
sections: People wear glasses to improve their vision.
人們戴眼鏡以改善視力。
The vision of the table loaded with food made our mouths water.
看見桌上堆滿了食物使我們垂涎欲滴。
He is a man of great vision.
幻覺，幻影，夢想，幻想，憧憬 [C] [（+of）]
When I was a child, I had visions of being a prince.
小時候，我曾想像自己是個王子。
She is a vision of loveliness with her golden hair.
她長著一頭金髮，真是可愛極了。

title: spite
sections: They trampled his flowers out of spite.
他們出於惡意踩了他的花。
I am sure he took my parking space just out of spite.
我很肯定他是為了洩憤才搶我的停車位。
They are being provocative and controversial just to spite us.
他們這樣挑釁和爭論就是要故意刁難我們。
He took my parking space just to spite me.
他為了使我惱怒而搶我的停車位。

title: instruction
sections: They had carried out my instructions to the letter.
他們嚴格地按我的指示把事辦了。
I read the instructions on the bottle.
我讀了瓶子上的用法說明。

title: expose
sections: They consider it almost a crime to expose children to violence and sex on TV.
他們認為讓兒童接觸暴力和色情電視節目幾乎是一種犯罪行為。

title: burden
sections: 重負，重擔；負擔，沉重的責任
The old man bent with a heavy burden on his back.
老人因背著重負而彎腰。
加重壓於，加負擔於，煩擾 [（+with）]
The government burdened the nation with heavy taxes.
He was burdened with a large bundle of magazines.
他吃力地捧著一大捆雜誌。

title: encounter
sections: 遭遇（敵人）；遇到（困難，危險等）
I encountered great difficulties in learning English grammar.
我在學習英文文法時遇到了很大困難。
The first person she encountered was Cyril Scott.
她遇到的第一個人是西瑞爾‧史考特。
A fortunate encounter brought us together.
一次幸運的邂逅使我們相識。

title: lease
sections: The lease on this house expires at the end of the year.
這房子的租約年底到期。
出租（土地等）[（+out）]；租得（土地等）[（+from）]；長期租用
He leased his apartment to his friend.
他將他的房間租給他的朋友。
As we don't have money to buy a new house, we have to lease one.
因為我們沒有錢買一棟新房，所以我們只好長期租用。

title: margin
sections: We came to the margin of the wood.
He made some notes in the margin.
他在頁邊空白處做筆記。
They were an old couple living on the margin of respectability.
他們是一對老夫妻，過著幾乎是不太體面的日子。
(時間，花費上保留的) 餘地，餘裕
We allowed a margin of twenty minutes in case the bus was late.
我們預留二十分鐘寬裕時間，以防汽車晚點。
He passed the exam by a narrow margin.
This price will allow a good margin of profit.
The reserve board raised margins from 50 to 60 percent.
聯邦儲備銀行董事會將定金從百分之五十提高到百分之六十。
The shore was margined with foam.
Every page was margined with comments.
每頁的頁邊上都加了評註。

title: stir
sections: Mother stirred the flour and milk to a stiff paste.
母親把麵粉和牛奶攪成濃漿。
激起；激動；轟動；鼓動；煽動 [（+to）]
The news stirred him to action.
這消息促使他採取行動。
A shriek stirred me from sleep.
尖叫聲把我從睡夢中喚醒。
She stirred now and again in her sleep.
她睡覺時不時翻來覆去。
The book caused quite a stir.

title: pledge
sections: I gave him my pledge that I would vote for him.
我向他保證我將投他的票。
She left her watch as a pledge with the taxi-driver.
她將手錶留給計程車司機作為抵押。
He put bonds in pledge for a loan.
他將債券作抵押以取得貸款。
Take this ring as a pledge of friendship.
將這隻戒指拿去作為友誼的信物吧。
We drank a pledge to their success.
我們舉杯祝願他們成功。
He pledged never to come back until he had found her.
他發誓不找到她決不回來。
I pledged myself to fulfil the promise I had made.
我保證實踐自己的諾言。
The property was pledged as security for loans.
這地產被當作貸款的抵押。
Everyone at the table stood up and pledged the success of the new company.
桌上每個人都起立為新公司的成功祝酒。

title: smooth
sections: The sea looks calm and smooth.
(運轉) 滑順的；(事情) 進行順利的
(文體，言語等) 流暢的；(音色) 柔和的，悅耳的；(味道) 可口的，均勻的
The same principle may make for smooth writing.
同樣的原則可能有助於流暢的文體。
The old man has a smooth temper.
People don't trust those smooth businessmen.
人們不相信那些油嘴滑舌的生意人。
(液體，漿糊等) 調勻的；(酒) 溫和的
這是一種醇和的葡萄酒。
使光滑，使平滑；把……弄平；燙平 [（+out/down）]
She smoothed her dress with an electric iron.
In winter many people smooth moisturing cream over their faces.
冬天，許多人在臉上搽潤膚霜。
This kind of beauty cream is said to be able to smooth away wrinkles.
據說這種美容霜能消除皺紋。

title: fine
sections: She is really a fine artist.
她真是一位傑出的藝術家。
Jane had a fine time in the evening party.
珍在晚會上玩得很開心。
This pen has a fine point.
There is a fine distinction between the two words.
這兩個字之間有細微區別。
(講話等) 過於誇飾的；炫耀的
We've had enough of their fine speeches.
他們的漂亮言詞我們已經聽夠了。
The watch is made of fine gold.
He made a fine mess of it.
They are doing fine in school.
他們在學校學習得很好。
We will have to go in rain or fine.
無論晴天下雨，我們都得去。

title: consult
sections: I'll do nothing without consulting you.
我採取行動之前一定和你商量。
He went to town to consult his doctor.
He consulted his notebook repeatedly during his speech.
他講演時不斷看他的筆記本。
We will consult together about her education.
我們將一起商議她的教育事宜。
The retired executive consults for several large companies.
那位退休的總裁在好幾家大公司當顧問。

title: assess
sections: (為徵稅) 估定（財產）的價值 [（+at）]
The value of this property was assessed at one million dollars.
這財產的價值估定為一百萬元。
確定（稅、罰款、賠償金等）的金額
事故後確定損害賠償金額
assess a tax of $ 300 on somebody
It is too early to assess the effects of the new legislation.
現在來評價新法規的效果為時尚早。

title: throat
sections: She sang at the top of her throat.

title: output
sections: With a sudden output of effort he moved the rock.
他猛一使勁搬動了石頭。
The measures will enable us to double our output of bicycles.
這些措施能使我們的自行車產量加倍。
【電子】 輸出；輸出端；輸出功率
the power output of a transformer
The program will output it into a file.
這個程序將把它輸出到一個文件裡。

title: renew
sections: I came back from my holiday with renewed strength.
我度假回來，體力得到恢復。
A lot of the cost of maintenance went into renewing brakes.
很多的維修費用都花在了更換煞車方面。

title: bore
sections: I think he is a dreadful bore.
我認為他是個極為討厭的人。

title: cautious
sections: The old lady is very cautious with money.
那位老太太用錢很謹慎。
My nephew is a cautious investor.
我侄子是個小心謹慎的投資者。
The boss is cautious about making promises.
老板對承諾持謹慎態度。

title: strip
sections: The children stripped off their clothes and jumped into the river.
孩子們脫掉衣服跳進河裡。
It was wrong of him to strip his daughter of the right to education.
他不該剝奪他女兒受教育的權利。
The boy stripped to the waist.
There is a strip of garden behind his house.
他房子後面有一小塊狹長形的園地。

title: reverse
sections: This time it came in the reverse direction.
這一次它是從相反的方向來的。
She then looked at the reverse side of the coin.
接著她看了看錢幣的反面。
他們的地位現在顛倒過來了。
His coat can be reversed when it begins to rain.
他的外衣下雨時能翻過來穿。
He reversed his car into the garage.
法庭撤銷了原來的判決。
Alternating current reverses from negative to positive about 60 times a second.
交流電由負到正一秒鐘大約變換六十次。
They did the reverse of what the teacher told them to do.
他們做的與老師的要求相反。
The truth is just the reverse.
The reverse of the coin was stamped with an eagle.
硬幣的反面壓印的是一隻鷹。
His career met with many reverses.
他的事業遭到許多挫折。
Drive the automobile in reverse until you get out of the alley.
倒開汽車直到你開出這條巷子。

title: ceremony
sections: The wedding ceremony was held on April fifteenth.
婚禮在四月十五日舉行。
There need be no ceremony between us.

title: muscle
sections: He developed the muscles in the legs by running.
他藉著跑步使腿部的肌肉發達了。
It'll take a lot of muscle to remove the rock.
搬走那塊石頭要費很大的力氣。
The party's political muscle is growing.
該黨的政治力量在增強。
He muscled his way through the crowd.
They muscled the old piano out of the room.
他們使勁把舊鋼琴搬出房間。
She muscled through the throngs of people, frantically searching for David.
她使勁擠過人群，拼命尋找大衛。

title: deadline
sections: Can they finish this before the deadline?
他們能不能在最後期限之前完成這項工作？
The deadline for making an application is next Friday.

title: chain
sections: The dog was fastened to a post by a chain.
那條狗被鏈條拴在柱子上。
一連串，一系列；連鎖，連續 [（+of）]
The traffic accident led to a chain of events.
交通事故引起了一連串的事件。
He chained his dog to a post.

title: passage
sections: The road is too narrow to allow the passage of gondola.
這條街太窄，大型貨車不能通過。
He forced a passage through the crowd.
Magellan was trying to find a passage to the Indian Ocean.
麥哲倫試圖找到一條通向印度洋的通道。
His office is at the end of the passage.
他的辦公室在走廊的盡頭。
Their friendship has survived the passage of time.
他們的友誼經受住了時間的考驗。
We had a stormy passage across the channel.
我們橫渡海峽時遇到了風暴。
Passage of the bill depends on public support.
這一法案的通過依靠公眾的支持。
The king granted them passage through his realm.
國王准許他們通過他的領土。
(文章，樂曲等的) 一段，一節 [C]
People have different interpretations of the passage.
人們對這一段文字有不同的解釋。

title: offend
sections: We were offended by his vulgar language.
我們被他的粗話所激怒。
I hope I haven't offended you.
She prayed that she would never offend.
她祈禱但願永遠不做錯事。

title: drain
sections: Ditches were dug to drain water from the swamp.
He drained a bottle of beer.
The civil war drained the country of its manpower and wealth.
內戰耗盡了國家的人力和財富。
Luckily the water drained away in time.
(土地) 排水；(衣服等) 滴乾
Put the raincoat on the balustrade to drain.
把雨衣放在欄杆上去滴乾。
浴盆的排水管需要修理。
The cost of his children's education was a great drain on his money.
他孩子的教育費用造成他極大的負擔。
(財富等的) 不斷外流，逐漸流光 [U] [S1]
What he has spent is a drain on the savings of his parents.
他所花費的會耗盡他父母的積蓄。

title: era
sections: Some say the computer has ushered in a new era.
有人說電腦引入了一個新時代。
The Christian era is counted from the birth of Christ.
公元是從基督的生年算起的。

title: rank
sections: They catered for everyone regardless of social rank.
他們為所有人服務而不計較其社會地位。
He was promoted to the rank of captain.
He joined the ranks of the unemployed, too.
他也加入了失業的行列。
The company commander ranked his soldiers in a column four deep.
連長將士兵們排成四列縱隊。
She ranked her students according to their grades.
她按成績排列學生的名次。
They'll rank you for the accident.
他們要你對這次事故負責。
They ranked high in their class.
The major general ranks at this camp.
少將是這個營地的最高級軍官。

title: pet
sections: The little girl keeps a lamb as a pet.
那個小女孩養了一頭羔羊作為寵物。
Mother loved us all, but David was her pet.
母親愛我們每一個人，但大衛是她的寵兒。
作為玩賞動物豢養的；寵物的
He addressed her by her pet name.
Improving the local park is the mayor's pet project.
改善當地公園是市長最得意的工程。
Everybody liked me, everybody petted me.
每個人都喜歡我，寵愛我。

title: dismiss
sections: He was dismissed from the hospital a week later.
The teacher dismissed the class on time.
He was dismissed from his job.
(從頭腦中) 去除，不考慮，拋棄 [（+from）]
She dismissed the idea of going to Paris.
她打消了去巴黎的念頭。
The judge dismissed the case for lack of evidence.
法官因缺乏證據而拒不受理這宗案件。

title: analogy
sections: There's no analogy between his position and yours.
他的見解與你的並無相似之處。

title: mate
sections: He found himself separated from his mates.
他發現自己與夥伴們分開了。
配偶（夫或妻）；動物的配偶
The widow mourned for her dead mate.
那寡婦為她已故的丈夫服喪。
Where is the mate to this sock?
與這隻襪子配對的另一隻在哪裡？
使成配偶；使配對；使交配 [（+with）]
They mated a horse with a donkey.
他們把一匹馬同一匹驢交配。
Many animals mate in the spring.

title: pour
sections: She poured herself another cup of tea.
她為自己又倒了一杯茶。
傾注；大量投入；大量生產 [O]
They have poured money into the tourist industry.
他們已經把大筆錢投入了旅遊業。
She often pours her troubles to friends.
她經常向朋友們傾訴自己的苦惱。
The crowd poured out of the concert hall.

title: scheme
sections: Jack's scheme for raising money is practicable.
傑克籌款的計畫是可行的。
The color scheme of the room is blue and gold.
這個房間的色彩配置是藍色和金黃色。
It's hard to see any scheme in this piece of writing; it's very confused.
很難看出這篇文章的結構，它非常混亂。
That so-called sale is a scheme to swindle the customers.
那場所謂的大賤賣是一個欺詐顧客的騙局。
We are scheming out a new method of traffic control.
我們正在擬訂新的交通管理辦法。
They have been scheming to overthrow the government.
他們一直在策劃推翻政府。

title: ruin
sections: 476AD saw the ruin of Roman Empire.
公元四七六年羅馬帝國滅亡。
We visited the ruins of the temple.
我們參觀了那個廟宇的遺跡。
Drink was his father's ruin and it will be the ruin of him too!
酗酒是他父親毀滅的原因，他也將遭同樣的厄運！
The heavy rain ruined our holiday.
大雨把我們的假期徹底搞毀了。
The hurricane ruined all the houses here.
颶風使這裡所有的房屋成為廢墟。

title: twin
sections: He is the younger twin of the two.
他是這對雙胞胎中的弟弟。
她是克萊兒的孿生姊妹。
The government has to deal with the twin issues of inflation and unemployment.
政府必須對付通貨膨脹與失業這兩個密切相關的問題。
The plan has a twin purpose.
Our city is twinned with Seoul.
本市與首爾結成姊妹市。

title: vomit
sections: The volcano vomited flames and molten rock.
火山噴出了火焰和熔岩。
The unpleasant smell made her sick and she began to vomit.
那難聞的味道令她不適，她開始嘔吐起來。

title: anecdote
sections: She told us anecdotes about the hospital and the patients.
她告訴我有關這家醫院及病人的趣聞軼事。

title: mobile
sections: 可動的，移動式的，活動的 [Z]
流動圖書館（由大圖書館按時派往小鄉鎮或是特定社區的圖書館，常是一部小貨車，內中裝滿書籍、卡帶、錄影帶等。）
The sick woman isn't mobile yet; she still has to stay in bed.
這位女病人還不能走動；她仍然需要臥床休養。
She is on a mobile cinema team.
He had a mobile, expressive, animated face.
他有一張多變的，富於表情的，生動活潑的臉。
The squadron was protected by a highly mobile anti-tank and air defense.
這個中隊由高度機動的反坦克和防空部隊保衛。
It was Alexander Calder who originated the mobiles.
活動雕塑是亞歷山大‧考爾德首創的。

title: repay
sections: I'll repay you all the money you lent me next week.
我下週還你借給我的所有的錢。

title: tissue
sections: Her dress was of silk tissue.
她的連衫裙是用薄綢做成的。
He carried a big bunch of flowers done up in white tissue.
他拿了一大束用白色薄紙包著的花。
It's more hygienic to use disposable paper tissues.
使用一次性餐巾紙更為衛生。
She told a tissue of lies.
A tissue is a group of similar cells which have an identical general function.
組織是一組具有相同的一般機能的類似細胞。

title: behalf
sections: I wrote several letters on his behalf.
我代表他寫了好幾封信。

title: slice
sections: For breakfast, she had only a slice of bread and butter.
她早餐只吃了一片奶油麵包。
Each partner receives his slice of profits.
每一個合夥人得到他的一份利潤。
She sliced the onion and put it in the beef stew.
她將洋蔥切片放入燉牛肉中。
One side of the hill had been sliced off.
The estate was sliced up into very small bequests.
這份產業被分成了很小的一份份遺產。
The plough sliced through the earth.

title: exhaust
sections: He had exhausted his supply of water.
The marathon talks exhausted him completely.
馬拉松式的談判使他精疲力竭。
Her book on child-care exhausts the subject.
她那本關於兒童保育的書寫得詳盡透徹。
The engine exhausts through the muffler.
Something has gone wrong with the car's exhaust system.
汽車的排氣系統出了故障。
Effective measures have been taken to prevent exhaust pollution.
業已採取有效措施以防止廢氣汙染。

title: sail
sections: They took a sail to Dover.
Our ship sails tomorrow for Hong Kong.
我們的船明天啟航前往香港。

title: rush
sections: He sprang up and rushed to the door.
趕緊；倉促行動；冒失地做 [（+to/into）]
Torrents of water came rushing down from the mountains.
The injured passengers were rushed to the hospital.
受傷的乘客被急忙送到醫院。
It was a bit of a rush to get the job done in two hours.
兩小時內完成這項工作是有點匆忙。
There was a rush for the concert tickets.
出現了爭購音樂會入場券的熱潮。
A sudden rush of business kept us on the go.
營業突然激增使我們忙個不停。
The boss gave us a rush job.
上司派給我們一個緊急任務。

title: ragged
sections: The collar of his ragged coat was turned up.
他那破爛上衣的領子向上翻著。

title: angle
sections: These novels mirror life in today's Japan from various angles.
這些小說從不同角度反映了當代日本的生活。
We would like to hear your angle in this dispute.
我們想聽聽你在這場爭論中的觀點。
If you look at the quarrel from another angle, you will see how funny it all was.
如果你從另一個立場來看這場口角，你就看得出這整件事有多好笑。
He angled himself out of the car.

title: crack
sections: 砸開，砰地一聲打開；強行進入
He carefully cracked a nut and then gave it to me.
他仔細敲開一顆堅果，然後遞給了我。
He wanted to crack the rowdy over the head, but refrained.
他想猛擊小流氓的頭，可還是忍住了。
They sat by the fire, cracking jokes.
他們坐在火堆旁講笑話。
The police cracked the case in one week.
該案警察在一週內就偵破了。
The glass cracked when I poured icy water into it.
當我把冰水倒進杯子時，杯子裂開了。
There are many cracks in the old wall.
We heard a crack of thunder.
This is my first crack at cooking.
這是我第一次嘗試做飯菜。
He's always making cracks about my big feet.
他老是取笑我的一雙大腳。
He is a crack baseball player.
他是個呱呱叫的棒球運動員。

title: marine
sections: Seals and whales are marine animals.
海豹和鯨魚是海洋動物。
船舶的，航海的；海運的，海事的
The marine barracks were built ten years ago.
這個海軍陸戰隊的兵營是十年前建造的。
(一國之) 船舶；海運業 [the S]
America had the largest mercantile marine.
美國當時擁有最大的商船隊。
Her husband is a U.S. marine.
她丈夫是一名美國海軍陸戰隊士兵。

title: triumph
sections: The football team achieved a complete triumph.
The conquest of outer space is one of the greatest triumphs of modern science.
征服外層空間是現代科學最傑出的成就之一。
勝利（或成功）的喜悅，歡欣 [U]
Great was his triumph on hearing this.
Justice will triumph in the end.

title: universal
sections: The government introduced universal secondary education years ago.
幾年前，政府就倡導普及中等教育。
足球是一項全球性的運動。
This machine has a universal use in the home.
這種機器在家庭中有廣泛的用途。
多才多藝的；博聞廣見的
Such a universal genius is hard to come by.
這樣的全才是很難得的。

title: light
sections: She was reading by the light of a candle.
Turn off the lights when you leave.
They set off at first light.
Can you give me a light, please?
A light of recognition came into his eyes.
他的眼神顯示他已認出來了。
The mystery has now come to light.
這個祕密現在已被揭開了。
We have to interpret his words in a modern light.
我們得以現代的觀點來解釋他的話。 10
Perhaps you can throw some light on the matter.
或許你能使這件事明朗些。
The room is brilliantly lighted up and full of guests.
房間裡燈火輝煌，賓客滿堂。
A smile of triumph lit up her face.
她的臉上閃耀著勝利的微笑。
The beam lighted the ship into the harbor.
燈光指引船隻進入港口。
Her face lighted up at the good news.
她聽到這好消息臉上露出了喜色。

title: vast
sections: A billion dollars is a vast amount of money.
That will make a vast difference.

title: stingy
sections: She tried to save money without being stingy.
她設法節約錢但不要顯得小氣。

title: myth
sections: His story about being very wealthy was a complete myth.
關於他非常富有的說法完全是捏造出來的。
沒有事實根據的觀點（或理論） [C]
I don't believe in the myth of love at the first sight.
我不相信一見鍾情的說法。

title: scream
sections: 尖叫；放聲大哭；放聲大笑 [（+for/with）]
The child bumped into a table and started screaming.
這小孩撞上了桌子，大聲哭喊起來。
(機器，汽笛等) 發出尖銳刺耳的聲音；(鳥等) 尖鳴；(風) 呼嘯
They were about to leave when they heard a siren screaming behind them.
他們正要離開時，突然聽到警報器在背後尖叫起來。
The gang was screaming for the immediate release of their leader.
那幫人吵嚷著要求立即釋放他們的頭兒。
The old lady screamed out that there was a burglar inside the house.
老太太尖叫著說房子裡有賊。
她尖叫得把嗓子喊啞了。
尖叫；尖銳刺耳的聲音；呼嘯聲 [C]
I was awakened by the sound of screams.
【口語】 極其滑稽可笑的人（或事物） [S]
The dumb show was a scream.
那齣啞劇真是滑稽有趣。

title: cite
sections: The lawyer cited a previous case to support his argument.
律師引用了以前的案例來支持他的論點。
It's no use citing the Bible to someone who doesn't believe in God.
對不信上帝的人引用《聖經》是無用的。
The soldier was cited for bravery in battle.
該士兵因作戰勇敢而受到嘉獎。

title: compromise
sections: I hope we shall come to a compromise.
我希望我們能達成妥協。
妥協方案，折衷辦法；折衷物 [C]
The interior decoration of the house is a compromise between Chinese and foreign styles.
這所房子的內部裝飾是中西兩式的折衷物。
She did it without compromise of her reputation.
她做這事而無損她的名譽。
You will compromise your good name if you associate with these people.
你如果與這些人交往就會損害你的好名聲。
放棄（原則等）；洩露（祕密等）
He refused to compromise his principles.
They found it wiser to compromise with her.
他們覺得與她妥協更明智。

title: neat
sections: 工整的；勻稱的，樣子好的
The dress is made of neat silk.
這洋裝是用光滑的絲綢做成的。
【美國英語 】【口語】 美妙的，很棒的
The party was really neat -- we had good fun.
這次聚會真是美妙極了，我們玩得非常開心。

title: conception
sections: The study of astronomy gives you some conception of what the universe is like.
學習天文學能使你對宇宙有所了解。
We studied the automobile from its earliest conception.
我們從其最初的構想著手研究了汽車。
This drug can increase the chance of conception.
這種藥物可以提高懷孕的機率。
The conception of the United Nations was in 1945.
聯合國創始於一九四五年。

title: masculine
sections: He likes to show off his masculine physique.
他喜歡炫耀他的陽剛之氣。
Our new manager is a middle-aged masculine looking woman.
我們的新經理是一位男子模樣的中年女士。
Host is the masculine noun for hostess. host是與hostess相對應的陽性名詞。

title: concede
sections: The candidate conceded that he had lost the election.
這位候選人承認他已經在競選中失敗。
They conceded us the right to cross their land.
他們容許我們在他們的土地上有過路權。
It is impossible for us to concede to your unreasonable request.
要我們對你的無理要求讓步是不可能的。
參議員只好承認競選失敗。

title: lessen
sections: The heat will lessen during the evening.
這次交談緩和緊張局面。

title: ray
sections: My eyes were blinded by the direct rays of light.
在光線的直射下，我看不清楚東西。
The gun can fire invisible rays.
這槍能發出看不見的射線。
All eyes directed their rays on the hero.
所有人的目光都匯集到那位英雄身上。
I was left without a ray of hope.
我連一線希望也沒有了。
他的眼睛閃爍著智慧靈光。
The sun was raying across the garden.

title: tune
sections: Tony wrote the words of the song and Kris wrote the tune.
湯尼寫歌詞，克麗絲譜曲。
The piano is out of tune.
She has never learnt to sing in tune.
她從未學會和著調子唱歌。
A person out of tune with his surroundings is unhappy.
一個與環境格格不入的人是不會快樂的。
She has changed her tune about children since she got married and had her own.
自從結婚生子之後她已經改變了對孩子的論調。
Are you in tune for study today?
He tuned his violin before he started playing.
演奏前他先將小提琴調音。
Please tune the television set to Channel 5.
請將電視機調到第五頻道。
The colors are perfectly tuned to each other.
The machine has just been tuned.
It's said that child could tune before it could speak.
據說孩子在會講話之前就會哼出調子了。
We always tune in to FM 100 to hear the 10 o'clock news.
我們總是調到FM100聽十點鐘的新聞節目。
The orchestra is tuning up ready to begin.
管弦樂隊正在調音，準備馬上演奏。

title: advocate
sections: They are advocates of free trade.
他們是自由貿易的倡導者。

title: craft
sections: He learned his craft from an old master.
他從一位老匠人那兒學得他的手藝。
She is a woman full of craft.
她是一個詭計多端的女人。
He told us a carefully crafted story.
他給我們講了一個精心編織的故事。

title: frustrate
sections: They made their preparations to frustrate the conspiracy.
他們作好準備挫敗以這個陰謀。
He was frustrated by repeated failures.
他因一再失敗而灰心喪氣。
The prisoner made a frustrate attempt to escape.

title: premium
sections: Hard-to-get theater tickets can be bought at a premium.
緊俏的戲票能以高價買到。
【商業】 優惠（讓價）；附贈禮品
If you buy three you get a premium of one more, free.
你買三個，可以再送你一個。

title: forecast
sections: The teacher forecast that twenty of his pupils would pass the examination.
老師預測他有二十名學生能通過考試。
這類事件可能是戰爭的預兆。
I listened to the weather forecast.

title: holy
sections: Teaching is one of the holiest tasks.
教書是最神聖的工作之一。
The poem sings the praises of holy love.
That precious child of hers is really a holy terror.
她那個寶貝孩子真是調皮得要命。

title: indicate
sections: The light above the elevator indicated that the elevator was then at the fifteenth floor.
電梯上方的燈指示那時電梯在十五樓。

title: pile
sections: A pile of dirty clothes lay by the washing machine.
一堆髒衣服放在洗衣機旁邊。
He's got piles of work to do this morning.
今天上午他有大量工作要做。
Mr. Hunter made a pile of money in the stock market.
漢特先生在股票市場賺了一大筆錢。
He piled the books on top of each other.
他把書一本一本地疊起來。
They piled the cart with fruit and vegetables.
他們把水果和蔬菜裝上大車。
She's been piling up money ever since she got the job.
自從得了那份工作以來，她一直在攢錢。

title: fulfill
sections: The doctor's instructions must be fulfilled exactly.
必須一絲不苟地遵照醫囑去辦。
履行（諾言等）；完成（任務等）；實現
他總是履行自己的諾言。
The company should be able to fulfill our requirements.
公司應該能夠滿足我們的要求。
這些插圖使正文臻於完整。

title: gamble
sections: He gambled heavily on the horses.
He gambles on the stock exchange.
He gambled away all his money.
The company gambled all on the new product.
公司將全部賭注都押在新產品上。
This is a gamble we have to take.
這是我們不得不冒的風險。

title: burst
sections: Her door was thrust open, and Mrs. Page burst in.
她的門被猛地推開，蓓姬太太衝了進來。
(用進行式) 塞滿，幾乎要脹破 [（+with）]
After ten days of rain the river burst its banks.
下了十天雨後河堤決口了。

歌聲結束之後響起了一陣掌聲。

title: plunge
sections: 使投入；將……插入；將……刺進；使突然前傾 [O]
He plunged his sword right into the heart of his enemy.
他將利劍直刺敵人胸膛。

斷電使房子陷入一片黑暗之中。
The boys plunged into the river to swim.
下降，急降；(道路等) 陡峭地下傾
(船隻) 顛簸；(馬等) 猛烈前衝

那颼船在風暴中前後顛簸。

title: capable
sections: She is capable of judging works of
她有鑑賞藝術品的能力。
The girl is capable of doing it.
有能力的，能幹的，有才華的
He is a very capable administrator.
他是個十分能幹的行政人員。
This passage is capable of various interpretations.
這段話可以有各種的解釋。
That ruffian is capable of any crime.
那個惡棍什麼勾當都做得出來。

title: tap
sections: 輕拍，輕叩，輕敲；(手指或觸摸筆) 點擊（螢幕）
He tapped me on the shoulder.
He tapped the ashes out of his pipe.
他輕輕地將菸斗裡的菸灰敲出來。
Mr. Smith was tapped for police commissioner.
史密斯先生被指定為警察局長。
Listen! Someone is tapping on the window.
There was a tap on the window.

title: casualty
sections: (事故、災難等的) 死者；傷者；受害人 [C]
There were dozens of casualties in the train crash.
在那次火車撞車事故中有數十人傷亡。

title: trace
sections: The archaeologists found some traces of an ancient civilization in that area.
考古學家們在那個地區發現了一些古代文明的遺跡。

湯裡簡直一點鹽也沒有放。

他說話總帶著一絲諷刺。

郵局設法查出那封丟失的信。
The book traces the development of philosophy.
該書追溯了哲學的發展過程。
The kids are learning to trace the letter.
His fear of snakes traces back to an experience in his childhood.
他對蛇的懼怕溯自他孩童時的一次經歷。

title: cease
sections: The general ordered his troops to cease fire.
那位將軍命令他的軍隊停火。
The matter has ceased to be a mystery to anyone.
這件事對大家已不再是個謎了。

title: ingredient
sections: (混合物的) 組成部分；(烹調的) 原料
What are the ingredients of the cake?
這蛋糕是用哪些原料做成的？

title: fierce
sections: My grandfather became fierce when he lost his temper.
我的祖父發脾氣時變得很粗暴。
After he got well Bob made a fierce effort to catch up with his classmates.
鮑伯痊癒後拼命用功，以期趕上班裡的同學。

激戰之後，敵人被迫撤退了。

title: legislation
sections: Legislation is the duty of a congress.

title: glance
sections: (粗略地) 看一下，一瞥；掃視 [Q] [（+at/round/over/through）]
He glanced round the conference room.
He glanced at the envelope and recognized his uncle's handwriting.
他瞥了一眼那個信封，認出是他叔父的筆跡。
His book glances at the burial customs of the Indian tribes.
他的著作簡略地提到印第安部落的殯葬習俗。
Their bayonets glanced in the sunlight.
他們的刺刀在陽光下閃耀。
Have you got time for a glance at this report?
你有沒有時間瀏覽一下這份報告？

title: breed
sections: They used to breed fish in the reservoir.
他們過去一直在水庫養魚。
They were bred up as acrobats.
他們從小被作為雜技藝人培養。
(尤指經人工培育的動植物) 品種 [（+of）] [G]
We have the finest breed of sheep.
我們擁有最優品種的羊。

title: grab
sections: The thief grabbed the purse and ran away with it.
這賊猛地一把抓住錢包逃跑了。
Dad grabbed some breakfast and went off to work.
爸爸匆匆吃了點早飯就去上班了。
He made a savage grab for the knife.

title: statistics
sections: I happen to have the latest population statistics with me.
我手頭正好有最新的人口統計資料。
He is a professor of statistics.

title: penalty
sections: There are now stiffer penalties for drunken drivers.
現在對酗酒開車的處罰更嚴厲了。
The penalty for spitting is US$10.
(行為等造成的) 不利結果；損失；苦難 [C] [（+of/for）]
He had to pay the penalties for telling lies.
他因撒謊而不得不自食苦果。

title: found1   find的動詞過去式、過去分詞 (→ find)
riot
sections: In May 1968 there was a massive wave of student riots.
一九六八年五月曾發生過大規模的學生騷亂。
They were drowned in riot all night.
他們通宵沉浸在狂歡之中。
(感情等的) 盡情發洩，放縱 [S]
The students broke out in a riot of laughter.
The garden was a riot of color in summer.
【口語】 非常有趣的人（或物） [S]
The play was a riot when it was first produced on Broadway.
這個劇本在百老匯首演時極為轟動。
參加（或發動）暴亂；聚眾鬧事
A mob was rioting against the municipal government.
一群暴民鬧事反對市政府。
把（時間，金錢等）浪費在放蕩的生活上 [（+away/out）]
他一生過著放蕩的生活。

title: branch
sections: The river has three main branches.
這條河有三條主要的支流。
分公司；分店；分局；分部；部門 [（+of）]
The bank has branches all over the country.
該銀行在全國各地均有分行。
(語系的) 分支；(學科的) 分科 [（+of）]
English is a branch of the Germanic family of languages.
英語是日耳曼語系的一個分支。
The tree near the house branched over the roof.
屋旁那棵樹的分枝長到了屋頂上。

title: formula
sections: (應酬話等的) 慣用語句，客套話 [C]
"How do you do?" is a polite formula. "您好。"是客氣的套語。
A formula for settling the border dispute has been worked out.
已擬定一個解決邊界糾紛的方案。
The formula of the medicine is still a secret.
【美國英語 】 配製成的嬰兒奶粉或奶水 [U]
If you are not planning on breastfeeding, you have to decide on a formula.
如果你不打算餵母奶，那麼你得決定選一種嬰兒奶粉（水）。

title: flee
sections: The robbers fled when they saw the police.
強盜看見警察便逃跑了。
He was lucky to flee the burning hotel.
他很幸運逃出了失火的旅館。

title: convict
sections: The judge convicted him of robbery.
使認罪；使深感有錯，使悔悟
He was convicted of his errors.
他認識到自己所犯的過失。

title: resist
sections: The nation was unable to resist the invasion.
This special coating is designed to resist rust.
這一特別的塗層旨在抗鏽。
健康的身體能抵禦疾病。
(常用於否定句) 忍耐，忍住 [+v-ing]
I couldn't resist the temptation to tease Ollie.
If the enemy continue to resist, wipe them out.
如果敵人繼續抵抗，就把他們消滅掉。

title: lane
sections: A carriage drove down the muddy lane.
一輛馬車沿著泥濘的小路行駛。
A four-lane highway connects the two cities.
一條四車道的公路連接這兩個城市。
The champion is running in lane 4.
The President walked down a lane formed by two lines of soldiers.
總統沿著兩列士兵組成的通道上走過去。

title: clinic
sections: He's gone to the clinic for a blood test.

title: twist
sections: 按順時針方向轉動旋鈕。
He twisted a rope out of threads.
She twisted flowers into a wreath.
她將花編成了一個花環。
He fell and twisted his ankle.
他摔了一跤，扭傷了腳踝。
He twisted his way through the crowd.
The leaves twisted and turned in the wind.
He twisted in his chair to see what was happening behind him.
他在座位上轉過身去看他身後發生了什麼事。
A piece of string has twisted round the propeller.
一根繩子纏在螺旋槳上了。
The boy twisted uneasily in his chair.
那男孩在椅子裡侷促不安地扭動著。
The snake twisted across the grass.
The big boy gave his arm a twist.
那個大男孩扭了一下他的胳膊。
捻成（或搓成，編成）的東西
He lit his pipe with a twist of paper.
The mountain road is full of twists.
He suffered a painful twist of the elbow.
She gave the facts a twist.
The story has a strange twist in chapter 15.
故事情節在第十五章有了出乎意料的轉折。

title: immigration
sections: pass through Immigration Control at the port
在港口通過移民管制站
【美國英語 】 (總稱) (外來的) 移民 [S1]
The immigration of 1956 included many people from Hungary.
一九五六年入境的移民中有許多匈牙利人。

title: command
sections: I command that he go at once.
I command you to start at once.
He was told to command his temper.
Who issued the command to fire?
控制，控制權；指揮，指揮權 [U]
He has a hundred men under his command.
She has a good command of spoken English.

title: bet
sections: 以（錢，物等）打賭；與（某人）打賭 [（+on）] [O5] [O1]
I'll bet ten dollars on the chestnut horse.
我要在這匹栗色馬上下十元賭注。
I bet against the feasibility of the plan.
我打賭斷定這個計畫行不通。
Let's have a bet on the result of the election.
讓我們就選舉結果打個賭吧！
The white horse is a poor bet.
那匹白馬輸的可能性大。
My bet is that she won't refuse his invitation.
我認為她不會拒絕他的邀請。

title: tidy
sections: Her room is always clean and tidy.
她的房間總是乾淨整潔。
None could produce a simple, tidy answer.
沒有人能提出一個簡單而又令人滿意的答案。
【口語】 相當大的；相當多的 [B]
$10,000 is a tidy sum of money.
一萬美元是相當大的一筆錢。
She told me to tidy my room.
她讓我把房間收拾一下。
Be sure to tidy up before going out.
出去之前一定要收拾一下。

title: float
sections: The empty boat was floating on the sea.
The orphan floated from town to town.
那個孤兒由一個城鎮漂泊到另一個城鎮。
Sterling should be allowed to float.
The divers tried to float the sunken ship.
They floated the canoe out into the middle of the river.
他們將獨木舟漂浮到河中央。
(透過發行債券等方式) 籌資開辦（公司等）
They decided to float a new company.
他們決定籌資創辦一家新公司。
The idea was floated at the meeting held in June.
這項意見是在六月召開的那次會上提出的。

title: explode
sections: The terrorists exploded a bomb in a store.
恐怖分子在一家商店引爆了一枚炸彈。
The boss exploded with anger when he saw the sales report.
當老板看到業務報告時，他氣炸了。
The city's population has exploded in the last few years.
在最近幾年裡這個城市的人口急遽增加。

title: castle
sections: The baron lived in a strong castle.
男爵住在一座堅固的城堡中。

title: refined
sections: 優美的，文雅的，有教養的
She has a refined way of speaking.

title: string
sections: I need a piece of string to tie this parcel up.
我需要一根細繩把這包裹紮起來。
A string of accidents happened at that corner.
在那個轉角發生了一連串的事故。
The monk wears a string of beads.
There are four strings on a violin.
(用線) 穿，串起；使排成一列
We strung the line from pole to pole.
我們把繩拉在兩根竿子之間。
使（精神等）緊張，使作好準備；使興奮，使敏感 [（+up）]
Those athletes were strung up before the race.
那些運動員在賽跑前振奮起來了。

title: celebrate
sections: We held a party to celebrate our success.
我們舉行宴會慶祝我們的成功。
The event was celebrated by poets and historians.
這一事件為詩人和歷史學家所讚頌。
Today is his birthday, so we're going to celebrate.
今天是他的生日，所以我們要慶祝一下。

title: absorb
sections: So many good ideas! It's too much for me to absorb all at once.
這麼多好主意！太多了，很難一下完全吸收。
使全神貫注；吸引（注意等） [H] [（+in/by）]
The old man was utterly absorbed in the book.
老人全神貫注地讀這本書。
Small businesses are absorbed by big ones.
小公司被大公司吞併了。
She won't be able to absorb another heavy blow.
她無力承受再一次沉重的打擊。

title: primitive
sections: Primitive people often lived in caves.
原始人常常住在山洞裡。
粗糙的；簡單的；未開化的
Living conditions in the village are still quite primitive.
這個村子的生活條件仍然很原始。
純樸的；自然的；(畫家) 自學的；未經科班訓練的
文藝復興以前的藝術家；風格純樸如此時期的藝術家
I've just bought a couple of French primitives.
我剛買了兩幅法國早期藝術家的作品。

title: side
sections: An old man was sitting on the side of the road.

站在他身旁的那個大個子可能是他的保鏢。
(問題等的) 方面；(爭論比賽等的) 一方，一派
He overlooked the other side of the question.
他忽略了問題的另一個方面。
(人體的) 側邊（指從腋下到腰上的部分）；(動物的) 半爿肋肉
She had a pain in her right side.
The grandfather on his mother's side is still living.
He gave her a side glance.
The job doesn't offer any side benefits.
這個工作沒有額外好處。
He sided with his brother in the argument.
他在辯論中站在他兄弟這邊。

title: assembly
sections: 與會者；(為了特定目的) 聚集在一起的人 [C] [G]
The former president addressed a large assembly.
前總統向眾多的與會者講了話。
the assembly of the airplane parts

title: vanish
sections: When I turned around, she had vanished.
Many species have now vanished from the earth.
許多物種已在地球上絕跡了。

title: dull
sections: 不明顯的，隱約的，模糊的
He had a dull pain in the chest.
It's very dull today but I don't think it'll rain.
今天天氣很陰暗，但我認為不會下雨。
乏味的，單調的，令人生厭的
愚鈍的，笨的；遲鈍的，不敏感的
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
只工作不玩耍，聰明孩子也變傻。
His hearing was dulled by age.
他的聽覺因上了年紀而變得遲鈍了。

title: multiply
sections: Four multiplied by five is twenty.
Such examples could be multiplied indefinitely.
Hot weather multiplied the bacteria in the food rapidly.
炎熱的天氣使食品中的細菌迅速繁殖。
As we climbed up the mountain, the dangers and difficulties multiplied.
我們越向山頂攀爬，危險和困難越是倍增。
He learned to multiply at the age of five.

title: assault
sections: The soldiers made a strong assault on the town.
The commander decided to assault the enemy in the darkness.

title: prescribe
sections: Do not prescribe to me what I'm going to do.
The doctor prescribed three days' rest for her.
醫生為她開了休息三天的處方。
We should all do as the law prescribes.

title: solar
sections: 太陽的；日光的；源自太陽的
他們精確地預告了日蝕。

title: confuse
sections: They confused me by their conflicting advice.
他們的建議相互矛盾，把我弄糊塗了。
你把澳大利亞和奧地利搞混了。
His granddaughter confused the papers on his desk.
他的孫女把他書桌上的書信文件弄亂了。

title: rob
sections: They robbed the jewelry store in broad daylight.
他們在光天化日之下搶劫了那家珠寶店。
They robbed the people of their liberty.
他們奪走了人民的自由。
He said he would not rob again.

title: dip
sections: She dipped her finger in the water to see if it's hot.
她把手指浸入水中，看水熱不熱。
She dipped up soup from the pot with a ladle.
She dipped into her purse for money.
The road takes a dip round the corner.
那條路在轉角處往下傾斜。
The price of grain took a dip.
We are going for a dip in the sea.

title: horror
sections: He expressed his horror of war.
他表示了對戰爭的憎惡。
We should not expose our children to horrors.
我們不應該讓孩子看恐怖片。
【口語】 極糟的事；討厭鬼（尤指小孩） [C]
That child of hers is a horror.
她那個孩子是個討厭的小搗蛋。

title: retreat
sections: He went to his mountain retreat for the weekend.
他去山中的休養所過週末。
(天主教) 避靜；靜修（期間）（僧侶）閉關修行 [C] [U]
He spent a few days in retreat.
The enemy retreated after heavy losses.
敵人在重創之後撤退了。
I will not retreat from my commitments.
我不會躲避承諾的義務。
After a week's work I like to retreat to the country to relax.
工作一週之後，我喜歡躲到鄉下鬆弛一下。
把……後撤；使後退；使往後移
He retreated his chair with intense disgust.
他極其厭惡地將椅子往後挪開。

title: venture
sections: 冒險；冒險事業，投機活動
They were the astronauts on the first venture to the moon.
他們是首次登陸月球探險的太空人。
He has started a joint venture in Singapore.
他已在新加坡辦起一家合資公司。
They ventured their lives in exploring the desert.
他們冒了生命危險去沙漠探險。
He ventured large sums of money on speculative stocks.
他將大筆的錢拿去做股票投機。
I venture that you are wrong.
No one ventured to speak to him.
He is too timid to venture upon a new undertaking.
他太膽小，不敢從事新的事業。
The children ventured out on the thin ice and fell through.
孩子們冒險踏上薄冰，結果掉了進去。

title: alert
sections: She is alert to every sound and movement.
她對每一個聲音和動作都很警覺。
The boy was alert in answering the stranger's questions.
男孩很機敏地回答了陌生人的問題。
She was always on the alert for some new calamities.
她總是保持警覺以防某種新的災難。
The doctor alerted me to the danger of a heart attack.
醫生提醒我注意心臟病發作的危險。
通知（軍隊，船隻等）待命；通知 [（+for/about）] [O2]
She's alerted me for weekend duty.

title: stream
sections: He always goes with the stream.
The pipe broke and water streamed onto the floor.
水管破裂，水流到地板上。

title: invasion
sections: France itself was threatened with invasion.
法國自身也受到入侵的威脅。
I object to these invasions of my privacy.
我反對這些侵擾我私生活的行徑。

title: rally
sections: The commander rallied his tired soldiers and they fought off the enemy at last.
指揮官重整疲憊不堪的士兵，最後他們終於擊退敵人。

他們作了最後的努力團結他們的支持者。
重新振作（精神等）；恢復（健康等）
The voters rallied to the Conservatives.
選民們團聚在保守派一邊。
His father rallied from his illness.
(尤指政治上的) 大集會，大會
They held a rally in support of the civil-rights movement.
他們舉行集會支持民權運動。
His sudden rally surprised the doctor.
他的突然復元使醫生大為驚奇。
派克贏得了上週汽車競賽會的冠軍。

title: tube
sections: He slipped the telescope into a steel tube.
他將望遠鏡收進一根鋼管內。
I need a tube of tooth paste.
【英國英語 】 (有時大寫) 地下鐵（道） [the S]
She goes to work by tube.
【美國英語 】【俚語】 未通過（考試）
She tubed every test last week.
她上星期測驗門門不及格。

title: outbreak
sections: The outbreak of MERS put the whole nation on alert. MERS疫情爆發之後，全國都緊張了起來。
the outbreak of the Second World War
第二次世界大戰的爆發

title: context
sections: 【语音/語言】 上下文；文章脈絡

我們往往可以從一個字的上下文知道它的意思。

犯罪活動得聯繫其社會背景來研究。

title: wipe
sections: 撒手；洗手不幹；和……斷絕關係
Please wipe the table with a dry cloth.
You'd better wipe the thought from your mind.
你還是打消那個念頭吧。
wipe the smile off someone's face
讓某人笑不出來；掃某人的興
Wipe the dust off the table.
The paint won't wipe off easily.
Give the table a good wipe.

title: ache
sections: Mother says she is aching all over with fatigue.
母親說她累得渾身疼痛。
His heart ached for the suffering child bride.
他對那個受苦的童養媳十分同情。

title: hesitate
sections: Don't hesitate about that. Do it at once.
對於那件事不要再猶豫了。馬上去做吧。

他毫不猶豫地請她坐在他身旁。

title: resemble
sections: She was not beautiful; she did not resemble her mother.
她不漂亮；她不像她的母親。

title: hatred
sections: She felt her dislike rapidly deepening to hatred.
她感到她的厭惡正迅速變成仇恨。

title: blank
sections: He handed me a blank check.

他建議刪去那幾個條目。
消失；變得模糊，成為空白 [（+out）]

title: manual
sections: 手的；手工的；用手操作的
You should read the manual before you turn on the new machine.

title: takeover   = take-over 接管；接收；接任
cave
sections: Our forefathers once lived in caves.
我們的祖先曾在洞穴居住。
The top of the car was caved in by the impact.
那個衝擊使得車頂塌了。
Our cellar caved during the earthquake.
地震時，我們的地窖塌陷了。
The school committee finally caved in to the demands of parents and teachers.
在家長和老師的要求下，學校委員會最後終於屈服了。

title: initial
sections: His initial reaction was one of shock.
(姓名或組織名稱等的) 首字母 [P1]
He carved his initials on the wall.
他將他名字的首字母刻在這牆上。
簽（或印）姓名的首字母於
他在文件上簽上姓名的首字母G.P.S。

title: raid
sections: Commandos made another raid on the French coast.
突擊隊對法國海岸又發動了一次襲擊。
(警察等的) 突然查抄，搜捕 [C] [（+on/upon）]

警方突然搜查這幢房子，尋找毒品。
劫掠；挖取（指從競爭對手處挖人） [C] [（+on/upon）]
The hungry children made a raid on the pantry.
飢餓的孩子把食品櫃洗劫一空。

title: pot
sections: She made a pot of tea for her guests.

他幫我把玫瑰栽入盆中。

title: bury
sections: 海盜埋藏了他們的財寶。
They buried themselves in their work.

title: category
sections: The strings are a category of musical instruments.

title: monetary
sections: She was in complete charge of all monetary matters affecting the household.
她全權負責一切有關家務的財政事宜。

title: crucial
sections: These negotiations are crucial to the future of our firm.
這些談判對我們公司的前途至關重要。

title: plump
sections: The baby has rosy plump cheeks.

title: accomplish
sections: They didn't accomplish the purpose desired.

他們成功地完成了任務。

花了五個禮拜走完全部旅程。

title: passive
sections: The slaves gave passive obedience to their master.

title: thoughtful
sections: That put us all in a thoughtful mood.
這使我們大家陷入了沉思。
You should be more thoughtful of your behavior.
你應該更加注意你的舉止。

她總是很體貼她的母親。

title: construction
sections: The new school is still under construction.

You will soon learn when to use this kind of construction.
你不久就會學會何時該用這種句法結構。
Let's put a good construction on her conduct first.

她根本不去幫助蘇菲亞。
