一部好詞典有助於語言學習。
He should be able to read this without the aid of a dictionary.
他應當能夠不用字典就讀懂這個。

title: virtue
sections: He is a man of great virtue.
他是一個品德高尚的人。
Kindness is but one of his virtues.
善良僅是他的美德之一。
"Patience is a virtue" is an old saying. "忍耐是美德"是句古老的諺語。
The car has its drawbacks and it has its virtues.
這汽車有其短處，也有其長處。

title: defect
sections: 優柔寡斷是他的主要缺點。

title: neglect
sections: He was so busy that he neglected his health.
他忙得連身體健康都無法顧及。
He was dismissed for neglecting his duty.
他因玩忽職守而被解僱。
Don't neglect to brush your teeth.
He neglected to return the book.
These children were in a state of virtual neglect.
這些孩子實際上處於無人照管的狀態。
The house hasn't been painted for years and years -- it's a sad case of neglect.
這間屋子已經多年沒有粉刷了，這是個可悲的疏忽。
He has shown a persistent neglect of duty.

title: remedy
sections: I know a remedy for headaches.
我知道一種治頭疼的藥。
I don't suppose there'll ever be a remedy for that.
我想那件事不會有任何補救辦法。
If I made a mistake, I will try to remedy it.
我如果有錯的話，我會改正的。

title: amendment
sections: 你的計畫需要作些修正。
An amendment to the United States Constitution limits the President to two full terms in office.

title: inmate
sections: (監獄，精神病院等的) 被收容者；囚犯，住院者；同坐牢的人，同住院者
Smoking is absolutely forbidden to the inmates of the prison.
這兒的監犯絕對不准抽菸。

title: trigger
sections: He pulled the trigger and the bottle was shot to pieces.
他扣動扳機，瓶子當即被打得粉碎。
Some people say that violent movies are potential triggers for juvenile delinquency.
一些人說暴力影片可能引起青少年犯罪。

他的行動已經引起一場危機。
一粒火星引起了這場爆炸。

title: boom
sections: (商業等的) 景氣，繁榮；(政治形勢等的) 突然好轉
The city is having a building boom.
這個城市正在大興土木。
發出隆隆聲（或嗡嗡聲等）
The big guns boomed in the distance.
激增，暴漲；迅速發展，興旺
The county boomed when gold was discovered there.
那個縣在發現了黃金後便繁榮起來。
蕭條之後生意興隆起來。
The foghorn boomed out its warning.
使迅速發展；使興旺；使出名
國外投資使這個城市迅速繁榮起來。

title: drag
sections: He grabbed her and dragged her away.
They were dragging the river for the missing child.
他們正用抓鉤在河底打撈那個失蹤的孩子。
The battle dragged and the rainy season set in.
戰爭拖延著，雨季來臨了。

This class is a real drag. Let's cut it.
這門課很無聊，我們蹺課吧。
The party was a drag, so we left early.
派對開得單調乏味，所以我們提早走了。

title: landmark
sections: The Taipei 101 Building is the most famous landmark of Taipei.
台北101大樓可以說是台北最有名的地標。
The pavilion on the hilltop was a well-known landmark.
山頂上的亭子是個著名的陸標。
(歷史上劃時代的) 重大事件，里程碑
The teacher outlined landmarks in the history of mankind.
老師概述了人類歷史上的里程碑。

title: subsidy
sections: This industry depends for its survival on government subsidies.
這個行業靠政府津貼而得以維持。

title: trail
sections: The boy trailed a toy horse after him.
男孩將一匹玩具馬拖在身後。
The children trailed behind their teacher.
孩子們跟在老師後面走。
The young girl's hair trailed over her shoulder.
There is ivy trailing all over the wall.
The hounds found the trail of the fox.
獵犬發現了狐狸的蹤跡。
They made a trail of protests against the decision.
他們對該項決定提出了一連串抗議。
The wagon left a trail of dust.
大篷車過處揚起一片灰塵。

title: whisper
sections: The wind was whispering in the trees.
"She is coming," he whispered. "她來了，"他低聲地說。
I've heard a whisper that he has cancer.
我聽到他得了癌症的傳聞。

title: elegant
sections: His elegant piece of reasoning impressed me deeply.
他簡要明確的論證給我留下深刻的印象。

title: folk
sections: 人們；(可用作稱呼) 各位 [P]
They are the best folks on earth.
I write regularly to my folks.
我定期寫信回家給我父母。
It is often used as folk medicine to cure snake bites.
它常被用作治療蛇咬傷的民間藥物。

title: amplify
sections: An electronic device amplified the speaker's voice.
電子設備放大了演講人的聲音。
Let me amplify my earlier remarks.
我來詳細說說我早些時候講過的話。

title: fade
sections: The flowers faded for want of water.
The color fades when exposed to light.
(聲音等) 變微弱；(光等) 變暗淡；逐漸消失 [（+away）]
The sound of the footsteps faded away.

title: witness
sections: I was a witness to the argument.
我是那場爭論的見證人。
He was called as a defense witness.
他被傳喚作被告的證人。
She was punished for giving false witness.
我目睹了那次交通事故。
The two servants witnessed Mr. Smith's will.
兩個僕人在史密斯先生的遺囑上簽名作證。

一八四九年匈牙利發生了一場大戰。

title: carrier
sections: I applied for the job as a mail carrier.
從事運輸業的人（或公司）
The commercial carrier is doing a lively business.
那家商務運輸公司業務繁忙。

飛彈是從航空母艦上發射的。
Meat, improperly handled, is a lethal carrier of bacteria.
未經適當處理的肉是危險的帶菌物。

title: gross
sections: 他的毛收入為五萬美元。
顯著的，十足的；嚴重的；惡劣的 [B]
He made a gross mistake but refused to admit it.
他犯了嚴重的錯誤卻不肯承認。

他講了一些粗話，對此非常後悔。

我粗略地判斷了一下這兩個城市之間的距離。
The gross for the year was $60,000.
該公司獲得三百萬美元毛利。

title: senator
sections: Three senators voted against the bill.
三位參議員投票反對這一議案。

title: vessel
sections: Cups, basins, pots, bottles, casks, etc., are vessels that hold liquids.
杯，盆，罐，瓶，桶等都是盛液體的容器。

title: rust
sections: (腦子等的) 遲鈍；(能力等的) 荒廢
She read extensively to keep her mind from rust.
她廣泛閱讀以防止腦子遲鈍。
(腦子等) 變遲鈍；(能力等) 荒廢
Don't let your mind rust during the vacation.
不要讓你的腦子在假期裡變遲鈍。
The leaves slowly rusted in the fall.
秋天葉子慢慢變成紅褐色了。
The rain will rust the iron roof.
雨水將使鐵皮屋頂生鏽。
使變遲鈍；使（能力等）荒廢
A six-year lay-off has not rusted his skills.
六年的待業並未使他的技術荒疏。

title: nightmare
sections: In his nightmares they burned his house.
在他的噩夢中，他們燒了他的房子。
夢魘般的經歷；恐怖的事
Her first few days in that foreign land were a total nightmare.
她剛到達異邦的那幾天簡直像是一場噩夢。

title: vibrate
sections: The ground vibrated during the earthquake.
(情感上) 被撼動；感應，共鳴 [（+to）]
Their hearts vibrated to the speaker's stirring appeal.
他們聽了演講人激動人心的呼籲心潮起伏。
The music vibrates in the memory.
The hammers strike the piano strings and vibrate them.
音錘敲擊鋼琴的弦並使之震動。

title: frame
sections: The frame of the umbrella is made of metal.
I need to buy new spectacle frames.
我需要買一副新的眼鏡架。
That athlete has a large frame.
He was in a bad frame of mind this morning.
你要給這張照片鑲上鏡框嗎？
The military plan will be framed tomorrow.
軍事計畫將於明天制定。
His lips could hardly frame the words.
The accused man said he had been framed.

title: panel
sections: 專門小組；評判小組；專題討論小組；參加猜謎節目的小組 [G]
A panel discussion was held on abortion.
就流產問題舉行了小組討論會。
Your name is down on the panel of jurors.
你的名字已列入陪審團名單。
The walls of the dining room were paneled with oak.

title: frown
sections: The father frowned on his son's behavior.
父親不滿他兒子的行為。
用皺眉蹙額表示（不滿等）
她皺起眉頭以示不贊成。
She looked at her son's composition with a frown.
她對兒子的作文皺眉頭。

title: subscription
sections: My subscription to the magazine will soon expire, I will renew it.
我訂閱的雜誌快到期了，我將續訂。

title: deaf
sections: She is deaf in one ear.
He was deaf to her warning.

title: complement
sections: Homework is a necessary complement to classroom study.
家庭作業是課堂教學的必要補充。
the entire complement of an embassy

title: endure
sections: The old man had to endure a toothache.
這位老人不得不忍受牙痛。
(常與cannot等否定詞連用) 容忍 [+to-v] [+v-ing]
I could endure it no longer.
我對此再也無法忍受了。
I can't endure to see/seeing you so discouraged.
我不忍看到你如此頹喪。
They vowed their love would endure forever.
他們海誓山盟地久天長。

title: pardon
sections: I beg your pardon. I suppose I should have knocked.
請原諒。我想我應該先敲一下門的。
Pardon me for not writing to you sooner.
請原諒我未能及早給你寫信。

title: swallow
sections: One swallow does not make a summer.

title: income
sections: 湯尼的花費超出其收入。
People on fixed incomes are hurt by price increases. [C]
收入固定的人受物價上漲之害最深。
她過著量入為出的生活。

title: flourish
sections: This type of plant flourishes in hot countries.
這種植物在熱帶國家生長茂盛。
(人) 健壯有力；處於旺盛時期
那個時期藝術十分繁榮。
He flourished his clenched fist at her.
他對她揮舞握緊的拳頭。
The scholar never flourished his knowledge.
那位學者從不炫耀知識。
She rode by with a flourish of her whip.
Her speech was full of flourish.
她的演講充滿了華麗的詞藻。
He showed us his new design with much flourish.
他炫耀地向我們展示他的新設計。

title: affect
sections: The amount of rain affects the growth of crops.
She was deeply affected by the news of her father's death.
她父親去世的消息使她深受震動。

title: reassure
sections: 使放心，使消除疑慮；向……再保證 [（+of/about）] [O5]
The coach's confidence reassured the whole team.
教練的信念使全體隊員又有了信心。

title: wreck
sections: The captain tried to save the ship from wreck.
船長試圖拯救這條船，使之免於遇難。
(被毀車輛，飛機，房屋等的) 殘骸 [C]
All around were the wrecks of previous crashes.
四周全是以前撞毀的汽車的殘骸。
Budget cuts mean the wreck of all our plans.
預算的削減意味著我們所有計畫的毀滅。
【口語】 受嚴重損害的人；變得極瘦弱的人；失去健康的人 [C]
My father was a complete wreck after the illness.
我父親病後身體完全垮了。
The ship was wrecked in a storm.
這條船在一次風暴中失事了。
他的酗酒毀壞了他們的婚姻。
The train wrecked at the crossing.

title: stern
sections: 嚴格的，嚴厲的；嚴峻的；苛刻的
Stern discipline did not achieve the desired result.
嚴厲的紀律沒有得到期望的結果。
Our team made a stern resolve to win.

title: compassion
sections: The nurse had great compassion for her patients.
那位護士十分同情她的病人。

title: even
sections: Her teeth were white and even.
The car went with an even motion.
Twelve apples makes an even dozen.
Even Mrs. Smith could not help laughing.
甚至史密斯太太也忍不住笑了起來。
(用於比較級前) 甚至更，還
This book is even more useful than that.
這本書比那本甚至還更有用。
He is ready, even eager to go.
他樂意甚至可以說渴望前去。
She evened the edges by trimming them.
Our team evened the score in the last minute.
我們隊在最後一分鐘將比分拉平。

title: quarrel
sections: He is good-natured and has never had a quarrel with anyone.
他脾氣很好，從不和任何人爭吵。
I have no quarrel with what you say.
我對你的話沒有反對意見。
She often quarreled with her husband over trivial matters.
她常因小事情與丈夫爭吵。
It's no use quarrelling about it with me.
關於這件事與我爭吵毫無用處。
He quarreled with my suggestion that television caused violence.
他反對我對於電視會引起暴力事件的看法。

title: slot
sections: 【美國英語 】【口語】 把……納入序列（或名單）中；安排
a job traditionally slotted for blacks
向來專供黑人做的工作

title: desirable
sections: 值得嚮往的；值得擁有的；令人滿意的
It is desirable that you should be there by two o'clock.
希望你兩點鐘前能到那裡。
There are several desirable houses in this street.
這條街上有好幾所合意的房子。

title: lesson
sections: She gives the children lessons in music.
一節課；(教科書中的) 一課
They usually have four lessons in the morning.
上午他們通常有四堂課。
The young man has learned his lesson and won't drive under the influence again.
小伙子已得到了教訓，再也不敢酒後開車了。
我要教訓教訓你，你這白痴！

title: quit
sections: He quitted Paris after a week.
She finally quit herself of fear.
If he doesn't pay his rent, he will receive notice to quit.
如果他不付房租，他將被通知搬出去。
It's almost 5 o'clock; time to quit.
都快五點鐘了；該下班了。
I'm going to quit next week.
I gave him money to be quit of him.
我給了他錢為的是要擺脫他。 quit的動詞過去式、過去分詞 (→ quit)

title: amusing
sections: It was amusing to watch the trained elephants perform.
觀看受過訓練的大象表演很有趣。
He told amusing jokes after dinner.
他在飯後講了幾則令人捧腹的笑話。 amuse的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ amuse)

title: peak
sections: 山頂，山峰；(有尖峰的) 山
The mountain peak was covered with snow.
Tourism is at its peak in August.
He wore a black cap with the peak pulled down low over his eyes.
他帶一頂黑帽子，帽舌拉得低低的一直蓋到眼睛。
六月份失業率達到了百分之八點一的高峰。
Beat the egg whites until they peak.
Traffic is very heavy at peak hours.
在高峰時間交通非常擁擠。

title: enhance
sections: 提高，增加（價值，品質，吸引力等）
Beautiful coloured illustrations enhanced the book.
漂亮的彩色插圖使這本書更具吸引力。

title: till
sections: (用於否定句) 在……以前，直到……（才）
He didn't leave the office till 8 o'clock.
他直到八點才離開辦公室。
The stranger waited till my master came home.
那個陌生人一直等到我主人回家。
(用於否定句) 在……以前，直到……（才）
The struggle will not cease till the country achieves independence.
要到國家獲得獨立，鬥爭才會止息。

title: whip
sections: 這些男孩子正在抽陀螺。
猛然挪動（或拿取，拔出等）；迅速作成；匆匆寫出 [Q]
The robber whipped out a knife.
強盜猛地拔出一把刀來。
I whipped the cream to make it thicker.
You can't whip our team this year.
今年你們不能擊敗我隊。
他急匆匆走進我的房間。
Then she whipped out a hairbrush and started to brush her long hair.
接著她迅速抽出一把髮梳，開始梳理她的長髮。
The old man seldom used his whip on his horse.
老人很少用鞭子抽他的馬。

title: integrate
sections: 使成一體，使結合，使合併 [（+with/into）]
It has been very difficult to integrate all of the local agencies into the national organization.
將所有的地方機構合併為全國性的機構一直非常困難。
I integrated your suggestion with my plan.
我把你的建議採納到我的計畫中來。
【美國英語 】 使取消（種族）隔離；使（黑人等）獲得平等待遇
It is an integrated school with children of different races and social classes.
這所學校有不同種族，不同社會階層的孩子，是一所無種族隔離的學校。
Some countries want to integrate into this organization.
一些國家想加入這個組織。

title: broker
sections: 經紀人，掮客，代理人，中間人

title: harbor
sections: During the gale the ships stayed in the harbor.
刮大風時船隻停泊在港內。
New York is a big harbor.
He is accused of harboring an escaped convict.
Your eyes were glued on her all the time. Were you harboring any evil thoughts?
你一直目不轉睛地看著她，是否心中抱有邪惡的念頭？
He still harbors a grudge against me.
避入安全地；躲藏；居住；生存

title: sustain
sections: The pillars sustain the roof of the pit.
The boat stranded on the rocks and the boatman had to sustain himself with live fish before rescue came.
船在岩石上擱淺，船夫在遇救前只好靠活魚維持生命。
一種不可動搖的信念支撐著他。
The sea wall sustained the shock of waves.
海堤經得起海浪的衝擊。
He sustained a serious wound in the stomach.
The new theory is sustained by facts.
這一新理論有事實證明。

title: undermine
sections: The convicts undermined the prison wall and escaped.
囚犯們在監獄牆下挖地道逃跑了。
The waves had undermined the cliff.
波浪沖刷侵蝕懸崖的底部。
They are trying to undermine my position.
他們在試圖損傷我的地位。
The bad cold had undermined her health.
重感冒損傷了她的健康。

title: resort
sections: It was after the failure of this attempt that he resorted to force.
是這次嘗試失敗之後他才訴諸武力的。
The beggar resorted to the restaurant for some soup.
這個乞丐常去該飯店要湯喝。
常去的休閒度假之處；名勝 [C]
There are many summer resorts in the mountains.
在山裡有許多避暑勝地。
A park is a place of popular resort in good weather.
天氣好的時候公園是人們愛去的地方。
Resort to force is forbidden in this school.
依靠的東西，憑藉的手段 [the S]
If I can't get the money any other way, as a last resort I could borrow it from Dad.
如果我沒有其他辦法籌錢，最後的辦法就是向父親借。
Books are her resort when she is lonely.
當她寂寞的時候就看書解悶。

title: slight
sections: The boss decided to pass over his slight mistakes.
老板決定原諒他的小錯。
Mr. Paul was highly respected because he slighted no one.
保羅先生非常受人尊敬，因為他不輕視任何人。
Cinderella suffered many slights from her sisters.
灰姑娘受到她姊妹的許多輕慢。

title: foam
sections: The surface of the water is full of foam.
The icy cold water foamed over the side of the boat.
冰涼的水在船邊泛起泡沫。
He foamed with anger when he found out his son had lied.
他發現兒子撒了謊便勃然大怒。

title: ballot
sections: I cast a ballot for him.
Chairman of the committee was elected by ballot.
該委員會主任是投票選舉的。
Her name has been put on the ballot.
(以無記名) 投票，投票表決 [（+for/against）]
They balloted for a new chairman.

title: smart
sections: You look smart in the new suit.
你穿這套新衣服很帥氣。
The boys in their smart school uniforms marched at the head of the parade.
身著整齊校服的男學生走在遊行隊伍的前列。
He is smart and can take care of himself.
他很精明可以照顧他自己。
She walked along at a smart pace.
(引起) 劇痛的；厲害的，劇烈的
She gave him a smart slap on the cheek.
她狠狠地給了他一記耳光。
The incision on my leg smarts.
我腿上手術的傷口會痛。
My eyes smarted from the smoke.
她因受到責罵而感到難受。
He shall smart for his foolishness.
他這樣胡來一定會自食其果。
The smart of the wound kept him awake.
傷口的疼痛使他不能入睡。
He could still feel the smart of being defeated.
他仍然感到被擊敗的痛苦。

title: chaos
sections: 混亂；雜亂的一團（或一堆等）
There was chaos in the town after the hurricane had struck.
颶風過後，城裡一片混亂。
Without rules, people would live in a state of chaos.
若無規則，人們將在混亂狀態中生活。

title: halt
sections: Production has come to a halt owing to the lack of raw materials.
由於缺少原料，生產已陷入停頓。
The soldiers halted for a few minutes.
使停止行進；使停止；使終止
那個軍官命令他的部隊停止前進。

title: retain
sections: She retains a clear memory of her school days.
她對自己的學生時代有著清晰的記憶。
Concentrated study will help you to retain knowledge.
專心學習有助於你記住知識。
He retained the best lawyer in the state.
他聘請了該州最好的律師。

title: satellite
sections: The number of known satellites in the solar system rose to 32.
太陽系裡已知的衛星數量增加到三十二個。
The space shuttle orbited a communications satellite.
太空梭將一顆通訊衛星送入軌道。
Three thousand armed satellites escorted his steps.
三千名武裝隨從緊跟其後。
The former Russian satellites now turn to the West for help.
從前俄國的衛星國現在轉向西方要求援助。
The party consolidates its power by building up satellite organizations.
這個黨透過建立衛星組織鞏固它的權力。

title: tackle
sections: John forgot to bring fishing tackle with him.
The tackle looked fair but a free kick was awarded.
阻截動作看上去並未犯規，但被判罰任意球。
Mr. Wells tackled the difficult problem, but he couldn't solve it.
威爾斯先生處理過這一難題，但未能解決。
I'll tackle the boss for a raise.
我將與老板交涉要求增加薪水。
擒抱並摔倒（對方球員）；阻截（對方球員）
He was tackled before he had a chance to shoot.
他還來不及射門即遭阻截。
擒抱並摔倒對方球員；阻截
那個大個兒後衛攔截兇狠。

title: anatomy
sections: We studied the anatomy of the snake.
我們研究了蛇的解剖結構。

title: circuit
sections: It takes a year for the earth to make a circuit of the sun.
地球繞太陽一周要一年時間。
A short circuit put the machine out of action.
The moon circuits round the earth.

title: portrait
sections: She painted landscapes as well as portraits.
The film is a love story, with routine portraits of a conductor and a violinist.
那部電影是一個愛情故事，對於樂隊指揮和小提琴手之間的愛情描寫都是老一套。
She is the very portrait of her mother.
她和她母親長得一模一樣。

title: weld
sections: It takes speed and skill to weld steel at this heat.
在這樣的溫度焊鋼需要速度和技術。

title: contempt
sections: I feel nothing but contempt for cheating.
She was fined for contempt of court.

title: embarrass
sections: 使窘；使不好意思，使侷促不安 [H] [（+with/by）]
Arthur seemed embarrassed by the question.
亞瑟似乎被這個問題弄得有些窘迫。
他子女多，這使他經濟拮据。
Wearing the heavy coat embarrassed his movements.
穿著厚大衣妨礙了他的行動。

title: rubbish
sections: Our job is to clear away the rubbish.
我們的工作是清除這些垃圾。
Teachers in schools have been rubbished for the last ten years.
過去十年學校教師一直受抨擊。

title: noble
sections: His friend is a man of noble mind.
他的朋友是個思想高尚的人。
Washington memorial is a noble monument.
華盛頓紀念碑是很宏偉的。
It was said that he was from a noble family.
據說他出身於貴族家庭。
(金屬) 貴重的，【化】不發生作用的；(氣體) 惰性的

title: interrupt
sections: I don't want to interrupt you. Go on with your story.
我不想打斷你。請把你的故事講下去。
The war interrupted the trade between the two countries.
戰爭使兩國間的貿易中斷了。
Go on. I don't want to interrupt.
說下去，我不想打斷你說話。

title: secret
sections: He kept his illness secret from his parents.
他沒有告訴他父母他生病的事。
The political prisoner was executed after a secret trial.
那名政治犯在受祕密審判後被處決了。
He left through a secret door.
He is secret about his past.
他對自己早年的經歷一向嘴緊。
I'll tell you a secret that I've never told a living soul.
我要告訴你一個我從未告訴過任何人的祕密。
One of the secrets of good health is regular exercise.
身體健康的訣竅之一是定時運動。

title: visa
sections: I obtained a visa to visit Japan.
我獲得訪問日本的簽證。

title: civilization
sections: (特定時期，特定地區的) 文化 [C]
Chinese civilization is one of the oldest in the world.
中國文明是世界上最古老的文明之一。
The civilization of these tribes will take a long time.
這些部落的開化將需很長時間。

title: geography
sections: He made a careful study of the geography of the province.
他仔細研究了該省的地形。

title: diminish
sections: The medical expenses diminished his savings.
醫療費耗去了他的積蓄。
The illness has diminished her strength.
削弱……的權勢，降低……的聲譽
Several unpopular decisions diminished the governor's popularity.
幾個不得人心的決定降低了州長的聲望。
Our water supply has diminished as a result of the drought.
由於旱災我們的水貯備減少了。

title: humble
sections: Many famous people are surprisingly humble.
許多知名人士都出奇地謙恭。
(身分，地位等) 低下的，卑微的
The family lived in a humble cottage.
這戶人家住在一所簡陋的農舍裡。
He had to humble himself in the presence of the prince.
他在王子面前只得低聲下氣。
使地位降低；使威信掃地
His failure in the competition humbled him.

title: secondary
sections: Virtually all secondary schools are in towns.
幾乎所有的中學都在城裡。
Many older people still believe that women's careers are secondary.
許多年歲大一點的人仍然認為婦女的職業生涯並不那麼重要。

title: rational
sections: 理性的，有理性的；明事理的

title: destination
sections: We reached our destination, tired and hungry.
到達目的地時，我們又累又餓。
The destination of her study is medicine.

title: gossip
sections: She had a gossip with her neighbor.
愛傳流言蜚語的人；愛說長道短的人 [C]
Don't tell her anything. She is a gossip.
什麼也不要告訴她。她愛搬弄是非。
It's getting late. I mustn't stay gossiping with you any longer.
時間不早了，我不能和你再閒聊下去了。

title: notorious
sections: 惡名昭彰的，聲名狼藉的 [（+for）]
The town is notorious for its casinos.
這個城市因其眾多的賭場而遠近皆知。

title: spare
sections: 分出，騰出（時間，人手）；分讓（多餘的東西） [（+for）] [O1]
Can you spare me a few minutes?
你能為我挪出幾分鐘時間嗎？
(常用於否定句或疑問句) 節約，省用；吝惜
Spare the rod, spoil the child.
He spared no expense in building a villa for himself.
他不惜工本為自己造了一幢別墅。
I want to spare him the trouble of seeing me off at the airport.
我不想麻煩他去機場為我送行。
They took his money but spared his life.
他們拿走了他的錢但饒了他一命。
We got to the train station at noon with time to spare.
我們中午就到了火車站，距開車還有一段時間。
He has nothing to do in his spare time.
Every car should carry a spare tire.
每輛車子應帶一個備胎。
The farmer is tall and spare.
This tire is damaged. Do you have a spare?
這個輪胎壞了，你有備胎嗎？

title: shed
sections: She shed tears over her loss.
The sun sheds light and warmth.
脫；使（籽，毛髮等）脫落；蛻（殼等）
Most trees shed their leaves in autumn.
This method can help students shed inhibitions.
這一方法能幫助學生去除顧慮。

title: fantasy
sections: George lives in a world of fantasy.
喬治整天生活在幻想的世界中。
The whole story is a fantasy.
這整個故事只是一個虛構。

title: whirl
sections: The electric fan blades whirled in the hot room.
電扇的槳葉在悶熱的房內旋轉著。
The car whirled down the street.
汽車在街道上疾馳而過。
The strong medicine made my head whirl.
這種烈性藥使我頭暈眼花。
The wind whirled the dead leaves about.
We were whirled away in a helicopter.
直升機迅速把我們運走。
The colorful whirl of the dancers was beautiful to watch.
舞蹈者多彩多姿的旋轉令人賞心悅目。
(一陣) 頭暈；(一陣) 昏亂 [S]
His thoughts are in a whirl.
Her life was a whirl of cocktail parties and dinner dates.
她的日子幾乎全是在一連串的雞尾酒會和宴會中度過的。
Let's give the plan a whirl.
我們嘗試一下那個計畫。

title: altitude
sections: The plane was then flying at an altitude of 8000 feet.
當時飛機在八千英尺的高度飛行。
He found it difficult to breathe at high altitudes.
他覺得在高空呼吸困難。

title: counterpart
sections: The two cars are exact counterparts in make, model and color.
這兩輛汽車的式樣、型號和顏色完全一樣。
互為補充的人（或物）；對應的人（或物），配對物
The U.S. Congress is the counterpart of the British Parliament.
美國的國會相當於英國的議會。

title: rage
sections: When I asked him to pay me what he owed, he went purple with rage.
當我向他討債時，他憤怒得臉色發紫。
The wind is in a rage.
He has a rage for collecting stamps.
Big earrings are the rage now.
大耳環是現在流行的東西。
The thought of the way she had been treated made her rage.
她一想到她所受的待遇就生氣。

title: sob
sections: She broke down and sobbed aloud.
她禁不住大聲哭了起來。
The wind sobbed in the trees.
She sobbed out her sad story.
她嗚咽著講出了她的悲慘遭遇。
A sob welled up in his throat.
他喉嚨裡發出一聲嗚咽。

title: mine
sections: (I的所有代名詞) 我的東西

title: spur
sections: The thought of the prize was the spur for the team.
奪取錦標的想法是該隊的動力。
A spur of rock stuck out from the mountain.
The rider spurred his horse on.
He spurred his players to fight harder.
他激勵他的球員更加努力地戰鬥。
He spurred forward to his destination.
他驅馬疾馳，直奔目的地。

title: clash
sections: 砰地相碰撞；發出鏗鏘聲
The car clashed against the wall.
那輛汽車砰地撞上牆壁。
Their views clash on the new tax bill.
他們在新稅法上意見相左。
We heard the clash of swords.
我們聽到劍噹地一聲相擊。
The demonstration ended in a violent clash with the police.
遊行示威以與警察的激烈衝突而告終。

title: merge
sections: It was decided that the two businesses should be merged.
人們決定應把這兩爿商店合併起來。
我們的銀行與他們的合併了。
The two lanes merge going into the tunnel.
兩條車道會合後引入隧道。

title: flock
sections: 羊群；(飛禽，牲畜等的) 群
A flock of wild geese flew overhead.
A flock of customers waited for the store to open.
一群顧客等著商店開門。
Birds of a feather flock together.

title: pepper
sections: 胡椒粉；辣椒粉；香辛調味品 [U]
I'd like to add some pepper to the tofu.
我想在豆腐裡加一點辣椒粉。
I bought some green peppers for the salad.
我買了些青辣椒做沙拉。
There was plenty of pepper left in the old man.
The reporters peppered her with questions.
記者們接二連三地向她問問題。
His face is peppered with freckles.

title: referendum
sections: The question was decided by referendum.
這個問題由公民投票決定了。

title: grave
sections: Is there life beyond the grave?

title: sanction
sections: Official sanction has not yet been given.
There is no sanction for autocracy.
The UN imposed economic sanctions against Iraq.
聯合國對伊拉克實施經濟制裁。
The church would not sanction his second marriage.
教會不會認可他的第二次婚姻。
他們拒絕支持種族隔離。

title: abortion
sections: Abortion is illegal in some states.
墮胎在某些州是非法的。

title: grain
sections: Not a grain of rice was wasted.
Farmers grow grain and keep cattle.
There is a grain of sand in his eye.
There isn't a grain of truth in his statement.
他的聲明裡沒有一點是真實的。
(木，石，織物等的) 紋理 [the S]
The mahogany table has a fine grain.

title: panic
sections: Rumours of an imminent earthquake started a panic.
謠傳即將發生地震引起了一陣恐慌。
When four banks failed in one day, there was a panic among businessmen.
當一天之內有四家銀行倒閉的時候，企業人士一片恐慌。
【俚語】 非常滑稽可笑的人（或物） [S]
The idea might panic the investors.
這個想法可能會使投資者惶恐不安。
【美國英語 】【俚語】 使大笑；使喝采
他的笑話令我大笑不止。
"Don't panic, boys; there's no danger." "不要慌，孩子們；沒有危險。"

title: adventure
sections: He is a man full of adventure.
他是一個充滿冒險精神的人。
They set out on a daring space adventure.
他們著手進行一項大膽的太空探險。
激動人心的活動（或經歷） [C]
The storm made our hike a real adventure.
暴風雨使得我們的徒步旅行成了一次真正令人難忘的經歷。

title: sweat
sections: There was sweat on his forehead.
【口語】 焦急，不安，神經緊張 [S]
We were all in a sweat over the final exam.
我們都為期末考試焦急不安。
This job's quite a sweat; I'm exhausted already.
這件工作是個苦差事；我已經精疲力竭了。
They saw his face was white and sweating.
他們看到他臉色蒼白，並且出著汗。
(物體表面) 結水珠，附上水汽
A pitcher of ice water sweats on a hot day.
盛著冰水的水罐表面在熱天會結水珠。
We were really sweating as we waited for the results.
我們在等待結果時真的感到非常焦急。
He sweated over his written reports.
He sweated his horse by riding him too hard.
他拼命策馬前行，馬都出汗了。
僱主讓他的工人死命幹活。
He goes to the gymnasium every afternoon to sweat off some weight.
他每天下午去健身房以減輕一點體重。
Fabulous profits were sweated out of these foreign workers.
從外籍工人身上搾取驚人的利潤。
【口語】 吃力地對付；焦急地期待 [（+out）]
He sweated out his composition in two hours.
他花了兩個小時費力地寫完了作文。

title: frighten
sections: The ghost story frightened the child.
這個鬼怪故事使孩子十分驚恐。
The alarm frightened the burglar away.

title: punish
sections: Motorists should be severely punished for speeding.
超速駕車的人應受嚴厲懲罰。
The teacher punished her students for cheating in the exam.
老師處罰學生考試作弊。
My boots were punished by our long trek in the mountains.
我的靴子因為我們在山中漫長的徒步而受損。
【口語】 大量消耗；貪婪地吃喝
The champion punished his opponent severely.
那位冠軍痛擊他的對手。

title: consent
sections: They would not consent to my leaving school.
Would you consent to work for us?

title: sensation
sections: Skeletons give a sensation of fear.
A dead body is without sensation.
The scandal about the mayor caused a sensation.
有關市長的醜聞引起了轟動。
The discovery was hailed as the scientific sensation of the century.
這一發現被譽為本世紀科學上的轟動事件。

title: companion
sections: Are you alone or with a companion?
你單獨一人還是與朋友在一起？
The Gardener's Companion was written by David Green. 《園藝指南》是大衛‧格林寫的。

title: gaze
sections: She turned to gaze admiringly at her husband.
她轉過身來贊賞地凝視她的丈夫。
He turned his gaze to the new comer.
他把目光移到新來的人身上。

title: modify
sections: We have to modify our plan a little bit.
我們得對我們的計畫稍加修改。
A noun sometimes modifies another noun.
一個名詞有時候修飾另一個名詞。

title: shy
sections: Small children are often shy of anyone they do not know.
小孩子在陌生人面前常常是怯生生的。
A deer is a shy animal.
鹿是一種易受驚的動物。
Don't be shy of telling them what you think.
你有什麼想法儘管跟他們講，不要有顧慮。
【美國英語 】【口語】 缺乏的，不足的 [A] [F] [（+of/on）]
The store is shy on porcelain cups.
the shy recesses of the woodland
The horse shied at the shrill whistle.
那匹馬聽到刺耳的汽笛聲，驚得往後倒退。
He isn't the man to shy at difficulties.
他不是在困難面前畏縮的人。
She shied from new involvement in the deal.
她不想再捲入那筆交易。
Her eyes shied away from mine.
她一見到我在看她就避開了我的眼睛。

title: hazard
sections: A soldier's life is full of hazards.
士兵的生活充滿了危險。
冒險作出；嘗試；大膽提出
As to the author of the book, I will hazard a guess.
關於這本書的作者，我來試猜一下。
【書面語】 使冒危險；冒……的危險
I'll hazard a dollar on the bingo game.
我在這局賓果遊戲上賭一元錢。
攀登岩石的運動員有時要冒生命危險。

title: conceal
sections: She tried to conceal what she had done to them.
她試圖隱瞞對他們所做的事。
He concealed his real motives from me.
他對我隱瞞了他的真實動機。
He concealed his key under the doormat.
他將鑰匙藏在門前擦鞋墊下。

title: wisdom
sections: I would question the wisdom of borrowing such a large sum of money.
我懷疑借這麼一大筆錢是否明智。
He showed great wisdom in what he said and did.
他在一言一行中都顯露出他那非凡的智慧。
看法；(古人的) 名言，教訓 [U] [C]
James voiced the conventional wisdom about it.
詹姆士說了對此事的一般看法。

title: prolong
sections: People have all along been seeking to prolong life.
人們一直在尋求長壽之道。

title: handicap
sections: Losing our best player was a handicap to the team.
失去最棒的運動員對我隊不利。

title: absurd
sections: 不合理的，荒謬的；可笑的，愚蠢的
It is absurd to go out in such terrible weather.
在這麼惡劣的天氣裡出去太荒唐。
他的想法是愚蠢可笑的。

title: dreadful
sections: 可怕的，令人恐懼的；令人敬畏的
There has been a dreadful earthquake in Iran.
伊朗發生了一次可怕的地震。
【口語】 糟透的；非常討厭的；極不合意的

title: obstacle
sections: His reluctance to compromise is an obstacle to his political success.
他不肯妥協是他政治上成功的一個障礙。
Her parents' opposition is an obstacle to her marriage.
她父母的反對是她結婚的障礙。

title: treasure
sections: It is said that the pirates buried their treasure on this island.
據說海盜把他們的金銀財寶埋藏在這個島上。
我的祕書是個難得的人才。
我們珍惜我們之間的友誼。
I treasure up my father's dying words.

title: perceive
sections: I perceived a man enter the house.
我看到一個人走進這間房子。
I can't perceive any difference between these coins.
我看不出這些硬幣有什麼差別。
He gradually perceived that his parents had been right.
他漸漸地了解到他的父母是對的。

title: cheerful
sections: She is a smiling, cheerful girl.
她是個滿面笑容，興高采烈的女孩子。
This is a cheerful, sunny room.
這個房間陽光充足，令人愉快。
My little brother is a very cheerful helper.

title: envy
sections: She said it out of envy.
妒忌的對象；羨慕的目標 [the S] [（+of）]
His talent is the envy of his colleagues.
他的同事都羨慕他的才能。
I envy you your good luck.

title: devote
sections: He was still devoted to the study of chemistry.
他仍專心致力於化學研究。
He has devoted his whole life to benefiting mankind.
他把一生都獻給了造福人類的事業。

title: postpone
sections: They postponed sending an answer to a request.
他們耽擱了對一項請求的答覆。
The concert has been postponed to Saturday.
The sports meet was postponed because of rain.
postpone private gain to the public welfare
把個人利益置於公眾福利之後

title: innovation
sections: The innovation of air travel during this century has made the world seem smaller.
本世紀空中旅行的革新使世界似乎變小了。

title: phenomenon
sections: The employment problem tends to be a city phenomenon.
就業問題常常是一個城市現象。
A child who can play the piano at the age of two would be called a phenomenon.
兩歲能彈鋼琴的孩子會被稱作神童。

title: swift
sections: The river is too swift to swim.
這河水流太急，不能游泳。
I noticed a swift change of expression in his face.
我注意到他臉上的表情很快地變化。
He is swift to take steps.
He is swift to take offence.

title: anguish
sections: The quarrel caused her great anguish.
爭吵給她造成了極大的痛苦。
The loss of her son anguished her deeply.
失去了兒子使她深深陷於痛苦之中。
Her heart anguished within her when she learned that her husband had fallen in battle.
得知丈夫陣亡的消息，她內心萬分痛苦。

title: sentiment
sections: 這首歌喚起了愛國情操。
They have hostile sentiments towards us.
She is a woman of sentiment.
她是一個多愁善感的女人。
I share your sentiments on this matter.
在這件事上我與你意見一致。
Mr. Jones was called on for a sentiment.
瓊斯先生應邀發表感想。

title: exceed
sections: His older brother exceeds him in intelligence.
He was taken to the police box for exceeding the speed limit.
他因超速而被帶到警察亭。
(在數量或品質方面) 超過其他，突出 [（+in）]
The enemy troops were finally defeated though they exceeded in number.
敵軍雖在數量上佔優勢，但最後還是被打敗了。

title: mode
sections: Riding on a donkey is a slow mode of travel.
騎驢子旅行是一種緩慢的旅行方式。
She is not used to the formal mode of address.
她不習慣於這種正式稱呼。
(服飾等的) 式樣，時式；流行，風尚 [the S]
Short skirts are the mode in her school.
短裙是她學校的流行服飾。
Each year brings a new mode and a new crop of artists.
每年都會產生一種新的風格，誕生一批新的藝術家。

title: prohibit
sections: Smoking is prohibited in the office building.
The high cost of the machine prohibits its widespread use.
這機器價格昂貴，很難普及使用。

title: accompany
sections: He wished her to accompany him.
He accompanied his speech with gestures.
他演講時附帶做著手勢。
鋼琴家為她的歌唱伴奏。
Her mother accompanied her on the piano.
她的母親為她作鋼琴伴奏。

title: subsequent
sections: The problem will be discussed at length in subsequent chapters.
這個問題將在後面幾章詳細討論。
(作為結果而) 接著發生的 [B]
His negligence of duty and subsequent dismissal from his job brought on a crisis in his life.
他玩忽職守，隨之遭到解僱，這在他的生活中引起了一次危機。
On the day subsequent to his visit, she disappeared.
在他訪問的第二天，她失蹤了。

title: personnel
sections: All personnel of the company are eligible for the retirement plan.
公司所有員工都有資格參加這項退休計畫。
人事部門；人事課（或室等） [U]
Please contact the personnel director for benefit information.
有關福利方面的情況請與人事課長聯繫。

title: lurk
sections: a man lurking in the shadows
Danger lurks in that quiet river.
那條平靜的河裡潛在著危險。

title: equivalent
sections: His reply is equivalent to a refusal.
等價的，等值的；等量的；等效的 [（+to）]
A meter is equivalent to 39.37 inches.
一米相當於三十九點三七英寸。
A dime is the equivalent of two nickels.
一角硬幣等於兩個五分鎳幣。 2

title: adjourn
sections: The case was adjourned until next Thursday.
該案延至下星期四審理。
The Senate adjourned for the summer.

title: fleet
sections: (統一指揮下的) 船隊；機群；(汽) 車隊
The company owns a fleet of cars for its sales force to use.
這家公司擁有一個車隊，供從事推銷的僱員使用。

title: peer
sections: She peered at him closely, as if not believing it could really be him.
她仔細地瞧著他，似乎不相信真會是他。
The moon peered out from behind clouds.

title: spin
sections: Mother used to spin her own yarn.
母親過去一直是自己紡紗的。
(蠶，蜘蛛等) 吐（絲），作（繭），結（網）
The spider was spinning a web.
The boy was spinning a top.
They were amused by the fantastic tales he spun.
他們覺得他講的怪誕故事很有趣。
The old woman was spinning in the corner of the room.
老婦人在房間一角紡紗。
My sister can spin on her toes like a dancer.
我妹妹能像舞者一樣踮著腳尖旋轉。
The automobile spun over the smooth expressway.
汽車在平坦的高速公路上飛馳。
【口語】 (汽車等的) 疾馳；兜風 [S]
Get your bicycle and come for a spin.
把你的腳踏車拿來去兜一圈。
【口語】 (價值等的) 暴跌，遽降
The news sent prices into a spin.
那消息使物價急遽下降。
He has been in a spin since the defeat.
他被擊敗以來一直情緒低落。

title: bear
sections: Mrs. Ann Bader bears all expenses.
安妮‧巴德太太承擔一切費用。
He could not bear that his friends should laugh at him.
他受不了朋友們竟也嘲笑他。
I can't bear to see you like this.
I don't feel very well. I can't bear this weather.
我感到不太舒服。我受不了這種天氣。
Her face bore signs of tears.
Those bamboo beams will not bear.
這幾根竹製的橫樑承受不住壓力。
Our apple trees will bear well this year.
今年我們的蘋果樹會結許多果實。

title: pit
sections: Dig a pit and bury the garbage.
He worked all his life down the pit.
他一生都在礦坑中工作。
使成凹；挖坑於；使留下疤痕
The surface of the moon is pitted with craters.
月球表面因有環形山而變得坑坑窪窪。
放入坑中；儲藏於地窖中；使掉入陷阱
His face is pitted with smallpox.
他的臉因天花而留下疤痕。
The managers want to pit the champion against John.
經理人想讓冠軍與約翰比賽。

title: slim
sections: A rigid diet will make you slimmer.
嚴格節食會使你身材苗條。
His chances for getting the scholarship were very slim.
他獲得獎學金的希望甚微。
He lived on a slim income.
The girl slimmed her figure with a rigid diet.
那女孩嚴格節食將體重減了下來。

title: reel
sections: (電線，棉紗等的) 捲軸，捲筒；捲線車
She took up some scissors and a reel of white string.
她拿起幾把剪刀和一軸白線。
The fishing line was hopelessly snarled on the reel.
釣絲纏到繞線輪上，亂得理不出來。
(電線等的) 一捲；(電影膠片等的) 一盤
A reel of the movie is missing.
那部電影的一盤膠帶找不到了。
He reeled in his fishing line.
Reel out two more meters of wire.
He reeled in a big trout.
他繞起釣絲，釣起一條大鱒魚。
滔滔不絕地講（或背誦）；流暢地寫 [（+off）]
He could reel off the names of all the capitals of Europe.
他能一口氣說出歐洲各國首都的名字。

title: fraud
sections: He was found guilty of fraud.

title: component
sections: (機器、設備等的) 構成要素；零件；成分 [C]
A computer consists of thousands of components.
電腦由成千上萬個部件組成。

title: pill
sections: She had to take sleeping pills every night.
她每天夜裡都得服安眠藥。
無法避免的討厭事，屈辱事 [C] [S1]
The defeat was a bitter pill.

title: chase
sections: She chased the children from her yard.
她把那些孩子趕出院子。
He never ceased to chase after his dream in his vigorous youth.
在精力充沛的年輕時代他從未停止過追求自己的夢想。
She chased all over town looking for a dress in her size.
她為尋找尺寸合身的衣服而滿城跑。
The chase is often more exciting than the kill.
追捕常常比獵殺更令人興奮。
被追獵的動物，被追逐的人 [C]
被追獵的動物逃過了獵人的獵殺。

title: streak
sections: The wall was smeared with streaks of dirt.
We got up at the first streak of daylight.
A dazzling streak lit up the sky.
一道耀眼的閃電照亮了天空。
There are streaks of ore in the mountains.
The man has a streak of cruelty in his character.
那個漢子性情有些殘酷。
(短暫的) 一陣子；一系列；一點點
I know only a few streaks about geology.
我對地質學只是略知一二。
I seem to be having a lucky streak.
在……上有條紋；使留下條痕
His hand was streaked with blood.
His hair is beginning to streak with grey.
他的頭髮開始變得灰白。
The cat streaked across the street.
The car streaked down the highway.
汽車在公路上疾駛而去。

title: apologize
sections: He apologized to her for not going to her party.
他因為沒有出席她舉行的宴會而向她表示歉意。

title: sincere
sections: 衷心的，真誠的，真心實意的
Henry was sincere about reconciling with his brother.
亨利真心願意與兄弟言歸於好。
He was decent, sincere -- a good man.
他為人正派誠實，是個好人。

title: greeting
sections: She welcomed us with a cheerful greeting.
她興高采烈地打招呼歡迎我們。
(生日等場合的) 祝願詞；賀詞；問候語 [P]
He sent his greetings to you in the letter.
他在這封信裡向你致以問候。 greet的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ greet)

title: tolerate
sections: I cannot tolerate your bad manners.
我不能容忍你的無禮行為。
Our teacher won't tolerate any cheating on exams.
我們老師容不得任何考試作弊行為。
我們這裡容許發表各種意見。

title: prestige
sections: Does she have enough prestige to win the nomination?
她有足夠的威望贏得提名嗎？

title: case
sections: He thought he had already solved the problem, but that was not the case.
他以為他已經解決了這個問題，可是實際情況並非如此。
Here is a case in point.
這裡有一個很好的例子。
The case was tried last Wednesday.
上星期三審判了該案件。

title: submarine
sections: Submarine cables were laid across the Atlantic.
鋪設了橫越大西洋的海底電纜。
Allied transports suffered greatly from German submarine attacks.
盟國的運輸船受到德國潛艇攻擊，損失慘重。

title: adapt
sections: He tried hard to adapt himself to the new conditions.
他努力使自己適應新的情況。
The author is going to adapt his play for television.
作者將把他的劇本改編成電視劇。
The boys adapted the old barn for use by the club.
孩子們將這個舊穀倉改造成為俱樂部用房。
He has not yet adapted to the climate.

title: compliment
sections: It's the nicest compliment I've ever had.
這是我聽到的最好的恭維話。
He complimented her on her new dress.
他稱讚她的新衣服漂亮。

title: freight
sections: 【英國英語 】 (船運的) 貨物；【美國英語 】 (水上，陸上，空中運輸的) 貨物
貨運（通常與快遞 express 相對）
They freighted the ship with grain.
It is less costly to freight merchandise than to mail it.

title: shave
sections: He asked me to shave the lawn.
The carpenter shaved off a small amount from the bottom of the door to make it close properly.
木匠將門底邊刨去了一點使它正好關上。
She bought a packet of shaved ham.
她買了一包切成薄片的火腿。
The airplane shaved the top of a tree.
He shaved through the math exam.
他勉強通過了數學考試。
The bus passed me by a shave.
公車從我身邊一擦而過。

title: evolution
sections: We studied the evolution of flowers from seeds and buds.
我們研究從種籽和花蕾到花的成長過程。
(生物的) 進化，演化；進化論 [U]
In the course of evolution, some birds have lost the power of flight.
在演化過程中一些鳥失去了飛行的能力。

title: worship
sections: Hero worship is part of human nature.
She became an object of worship.
她成了一個被崇拜的對象。
【英國英語 】 (用作尊稱) 閣下
"Yes, your worship," he said to the judge. "是，閣下，"他對法官說。
The Greeks used to worship several gods.
This is the church where we used to worship.
這就是那座我們過去常做禮拜的教堂。

title: abolish
sections: Bad customs and laws ought to be abolished.
不良的習俗和法規應予以廢除。

title: compose
sections: He spent his spare time composing poetry.
She composed herself to answer the letters.
Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
That child prodigy began to compose at the age of five.
那個神童五歲就開始作詩了。

title: marvelous
sections: 令人驚歎的；非凡的；不可思議的
You have a marvelous gift for science.
你有科學方面的非凡天賦。
He had had the most marvelous experience.

title: disturb
sections: I'm sorry to disturb you so early.
對不起，我這麼早打擾你。
They were charged with disturbing the public peace.
他們被指控擾亂公共治安。
She was disturbed to hear you had been injured in the accident.
她聽到你在事故中受了傷感到不安。

title: omit
sections: The typist omitted the last line of the letter.
打字員遺漏了信的最後一行字。
This part of the book may be omitted.
書的這一部分可以省略。
He omitted reading the second page.
He omitted to explain why he had been late.
他沒有解釋他為什麼遲到。

title: bleed
sections: 他向他們榨取一千五百美元。

title: masterpiece
sections: It is one of the great masterpieces of European
(個人或團體的) 最傑出的作品
Robinson Crusoe is Defoe's masterpiece. 《羅賓遜漂流記》是狄福的傑作。

title: utility
sections: The store deals in objects of domestic utility.
那家商店出售家庭用品。
公用事業；公用事業公司；公用事業公司股票 [C] [P1]
I found that I had forgotten to pay the bills for utilities.
我發現忘了付水電及瓦斯的費用。

title: skeptical
sections: Many were skeptical about this solution.
許多人對這一解決辦法表示懷疑。

title: intimate
sections: Both of them felt that they had become very intimate.
他倆都感到他們已經相當親密了。
He has an intimate knowledge of American literature.
A diary is an intimate book.

title: artificial
sections: The room was decorated with artificial flowers.
Her artificial manner made me sick.
她那裝腔作勢的樣子令我噁心。

title: console
sections: She consoled him with soft words.
她以溫柔的話語安慰他。

title: primary
sections: A primary cause of Tom's failure is his laziness.
懶惰是湯姆失敗的主要原因之一。
I started primary school when I was 5 years old.
The historian searched for primary sources of information about the past.
歷史學家尋找有關過去的原始資料來源。
The primary meaning of the word isn't used now, but you can look it up in a big dictionary.
這個字的本義現在不用了，但你可以在大字典裡查到。
【美國英語 】 候選人選拔會；初選
We lost the New Hampshire primary.
我們在新罕布夏州的初選失利了。

title: donation
sections: She made a donation of $5,000 to the Children's Hospital.
她捐了五千美元給兒童醫院。

title: nominate
sections: The President nominated him Ambassador to Russia.
總統提名他擔任駐俄國大使。
Trade Unions nominate representatives to public bodies.
工會指定駐公共機關的代表。

title: collide
sections: 他們的船與另一條船相撞。
If the aims of two countries collide, there may be war.
如果兩國目標嚴重對立，就有可能爆發戰爭。

title: refund
sections: If the shoes do not wear well the shop will refund the money.
如果鞋不經穿，商店將退還你錢。

title: utter
sections: When he heard the news, he uttered a sigh.
聽到這消息時，他歎了口氣。
We didn't utter a word during the test.
我們在測驗時沒有說過一句話。
She had made an utter fool of herself.
她的所作所為十足就是個傻子。

title: bless
sections: Good-bye, and may God bless you.
They blessed her for her kindness.
He was blessed with great talent.
他天資非常聰穎，真是幸運。

title: pop
sections: 發出砰（或啪）的響聲；砰（或啪）的一聲爆裂
The bottle popped when I opened it.
我打開瓶子時，瓶口發出砰的一聲。
(意外地，突然地) 出現，發生 [Q]
Your name has popped up from time to time in the papers.
你的名字不時在報紙上出現。
(突然地，迅速地) 行動，來，去 [Q]
He popped in to say hello.
The surprise made her eyes pop.
這一意外使她的眼睛瞪得大大的。
使發出砰（或啪）的響聲；使砰（或啪）的一聲爆裂
The boy popped a piece of gum into his mouth.
那男孩把一塊口香糖塞進嘴裡。
They popped a question at me.
他們冷不防向我提了一個問題。
He bought a machine to pop corn.
他買了一臺爆玉米花的機器。
I went out to pop some quails.
The cork came out with a loud pop.
瓶塞啪的一聲拔了出來。
【口語】 (汽水，啤酒等) 含氣飲料 [U]
She drank a bottle of orange pop.

title: exile
sections: 流放；流亡；離開本國，離鄉背井 [U] [S1]
He spent many years in exile.
被流放者；流亡者；離鄉背井者 [C]
He has been an exile for ten years.
He was exiled as a dissident.
他被作為持不同政見者流放國外。

title: rustle
sections: He heard a mouse rustling among his papers.
他聽見紙堆中有老鼠窸窣作響。
She heard a rustle in the bushes.
她聽到灌木叢中一陣窸窣聲。

title: fragile
sections: They carefully packed the fragile china into cartons.
他們小心地將易碎瓷器裝入紙箱。
The old lady looks very fragile.
那位老婦人看上去十分虛弱。

title: sour
sections: 脾氣壞的，乖戾的；刻薄的
It is said that the boss is sour toward his employees.
據說這個老板對他的僱員很刻薄。
He hated being stuck in the sour job but couldn't find another.
他討厭老是做這份枯燥乏味的工作，可是找不到別的差事。
She gave me a sour look.
我們過了一個濕冷的冬天。
The hot weather has soured the milk.
炎熱的天氣使牛奶變酸了。
使變得不愉快；使失望；使變得討厭無趣 [（+on）]
She was soured by his indifference.
她因他的冷漠而變得不快。
The milk has soured in warm weather.
牛奶在暖和的天氣裡發酸了。
Various adversity has soured her view of life.
一連串的不幸使她的人生觀變得酸腐。
I don't know why his temper has soured.
我不知道為什麼他的脾氣變壞了。

title: suppress
sections: The revolt was suppressed in a couple of days.
叛亂在幾天之內就被鎮壓下去了。
Each nation suppressed news that was not favorable to it.
每個國家都封鎖對它不利的消息。
Even the grave old gentleman could not suppress a laugh.
連那位嚴肅的老紳士都禁不住笑了。

title: naught
sections: I hope that all your efforts won't go for naught.
我希望你的努力不會毫無結果。
All their dreams came to naught.

title: mineral
sections: Those countries are rich in mineral resources.
那些國家礦物資源很豐富。

title: fabric
sections: These clothes are made of imported fabrics.
這些衣服用進口布料製成。
The whole social fabric was threatened with disintegration.
整個社會結構有瓦解的危險。

title: verdict
sections: 【法律】 (陪審團的) 裁決，裁定
The jury brought in a verdict of guilty.

title: deliberate
sections: 深思熟慮的，慎重的，謹慎的
His manner was quiet, his speech deliberate.
He is deliberate in his speech.
They are deliberating upon what to do.
The jury deliberated for three hours.
陪審團商議了三個小時。
仔細考慮，深思熟慮；商議 [+wh-]
I am deliberating whether or not to buy a new car.
我在考慮是否要買一輛新汽車。

title: provoke
sections: If you provoke the dog, he may bite you.
你如果激怒了這條狗，它可能會咬你。
The President's speech provoked much discussion.
總統的演說引發了許多議論。

title: sponsor
sections: Two Virginian Congressmen sponsored the bill.
兩位弗吉尼亞國會議員提出這一議案。

title: straighten
sections: 他把那彎曲的金屬片弄直了。
We can straighten out the matter there.
我們可以在那裡把事情澄清。
我們把房間整理一下吧。
As she straightened up, the ache in her back grew worse.
她直起身子時，背部的疼痛更厲害了。

title: perspective
sections: 小孩子畫畫常常不管透視法。
view an issue from a historical perspective
用歷史的觀點看待問題
You have the wrong perspective on that situation.
對於那個情勢的未來發展，你的看法是不正確的。

title: auction
sections: They sold the furniture by auction.
They are going to auction the pictures at the end of the month.
他們將在月底拍賣這些畫。

title: drift
sections: He watched the boat drift downstream.
Many country girls drifted into cities to seek work.
許多農村姑娘流入城市找工作。
The firm is drifting towards bankruptcy.
The strong wind drifted the snow in piles.
There is a drift of farmers to the cities.
I didn't get the drift of his argument.
我沒有聽懂他論點的要領。
I can't quite catch the drift of his speech.
我不甚了解他的演講的大意。

title: platform
sections: He was coming by train, so I waited on the platform.
他坐火車來，所以我在月臺上等。
【美國英語 】 (火車，電車上的) 乘客上下平臺
She jumped off the platform while the bus was still moving.
公車還沒有停下，她就從門口跳了下去。
(政黨等的) 黨綱，政綱；宣言
The candidate ran on a platform of better housing and equal rights for all.
那個候選人的政見是改善住屋，均等權利。

title: retain
sections: She retains a clear memory of her school days.
她對自己的學生時代有著清晰的記憶。
Concentrated study will help you to retain knowledge.
專心學習有助於你記住知識。
He retained the best lawyer in the state.
他聘請了該州最好的律師。

title: spark
sections: A cigarette spark started the fire.
香菸的火星引起這場火災。
We saw a spark of light through the trees.
我們透過樹叢看到閃光。
Close the circuit and you'll see a blue spark.
接通電路你就會看到一個藍色的電火花。
(常用於否定句) 微量；絲毫 [S] [（+of）]
He showed not a spark of interest in the plan.
他對這個計畫一點不感興趣。
生氣，活力；(才智等的) 煥發
The spark of life still flickered in him.
他的生命之火還在閃爍。
He still retains a spark of decency.
他仍然保持著一點起碼的體面。
They were scheming to spark a revolt.
It was this incident that sparked her interest in politics.
是這個事件激起了她對政治的興趣。
This wood burns steadily with no sparking.
這木柴長時間燃燒正常，不爆火花。
Her mother sparked to the idea of an early wedding date.
她母親欣然同意早日舉行婚禮。

title: bound1   bind的動詞過去式、過去分詞 (→ bind)
probe
sections: The brain surgeon asked the nurse to pass him a probe.
腦外科醫生要護士將探針遞給他。
The police are working on a probe into suspected drug dealing in Florida.
警察正在對佛羅里達州的可疑的毒品交易進行調查。
用探針（或探測器）探查，探測
The governor appointed a committee to probe the causes of the strike.
州長委派一個委員會去徹底調查罷工的起因。
They are probing into the cause of the crime.
他們正在探究犯罪的原因。

title: confess
sections: I must confess myself completely puzzled by the question.
我必須承認我被這個問題搞迷糊了。
He confessed that he did not read the assigned book.
他承認他沒有讀指定的書。
He confessed himself to be unfaithful to his friends.
他承認自己對朋友不忠實。
He confessed to cheating on the exam.

title: transmit
sections: I will transmit the money by special messenger.
我將專門派人送這筆錢。
They are trying to find a better way of transmitting energy.
他們正試圖尋找一種更好的輸能方法。
Genes are transmitted from one generation to another.
The message was transmitted by radio.
這情報是用無線電發送的。

title: cheat
sections: They cheated the old woman of her house and money.
他們騙取了老婦人的房屋和錢財。
The salesman cheated me into buying a fake.
那個推銷員騙我買了假貨。
The fishermen cheated death in the stormy seas.
那些在波濤洶湧的海上作業的漁民們僥倖避開死神。
The balloonist cheated death in spite of the storm.
儘管風狂雨暴，乘氣球升空者幸免於難。
She thumbed through pictorials to cheat time.
她翻閱畫報，借以消磨時間。
偷稅逃稅事件已有所減少。

title: jealous
sections: He was jealous of his friend's reputation.
If other men spoke to her intimately he was immediately jealous.
一見到別的男人跟她親熱地交談，他便會醋勁大發。
小心守護的，唯恐失去的 [（+of）]
We are jealous of our hard-won freedom.
我們珍惜得來不易的自由。

title: pat
sections: I gave the cute child a pat.
我輕輕拍了拍那個惹人喜愛的小孩。
The headmaster patted the pupil on the shoulder.
校長輕輕拍拍那個學生的肩膀。
Snowflakes were patting against the windowpane.
雪花輕輕拍打著玻璃窗。

title: obey
sections: You didn't obey the manager's instructions.
你沒有執行經理的指示。
Obey your boss or you will be fired.
服從你的上司，否則你會被解僱。
The child obeyed and went to bed.

title: conscience
sections: I got nothing to hide. My conscience is clear.
我沒有什麼隱瞞的。我問心無愧。

title: blast
sections: A blast of wind blew my hat off.
一陣風吹走了我的帽子。
He gave a blast on his trumpet.
A blast of the trumpet gave her a start.
突然發出的喇叭聲嚇了她一跳。
【美國英語 】【俚語】 狂歡會[C]；狂歡
That was a great party. I had a blast.
那個宴會很棒，我玩得盡興極了。
猛烈的批評；狠狠的一擊 [C]
The leader of the opposition delivered a blast at the President.
反對黨領袖對總統進行了猛烈抨擊。
The front gate was blasted open with a cannon.
The dry hot wind blasted the seedlings.
The taxi-driver blasted the horn continuously.
計程車司機不停地按喇叭。
The newspapers blasted the political corruption.
報紙對政治腐敗加以強烈譴責。
The truck blasted toward the terminal.

title: prime
sections: 最初的；原始的；基本的；原有的
The community's prime need is a new school.
這個社區的第一需要是一所新學校。
The show was on television during prime time, when everyone was watching.
這節目在黃金時間播映，這時大家都在看電視。
青年；壯年；全盛時期 [the S]
He died in the prime of his life.
灌注，裝填；為……裝火藥（或雷管）
The gun was primed and ready.
這砲已裝上火藥，準備就緒。
You must prime the wood before you paint it.
油漆這木製東西前，你得先在上面塗上底漆。
事先給……指導；事先為……提供消息（或情報等） [（+with）]
The man on trial had been carefully primed by his lawyer.
這個受審人已得到他律師的仔細指點。

title: excerpt
sections: Several newspapers published excerpts from the book.
數家報紙刊載了該書的摘錄。

title: bunch
sections: Miss White received a bunch of flowers from her admirer.
懷特小姐收到愛慕者所送的一束花。
A bunch of children were at play.
His arm muscles bunched out when he lifted the stone lion.
他舉起石獅時臂上的肌肉一塊一塊隆起。

title: fiscal
sections: The U.S. government fiscal year legally ends on September 30.
美國政府會計年度法定為九月三十日結束。

title: loyal
sections: She was loyal to her faith.
He is loyal to his wife.

title: simultaneous
sections: 同時發生的，同時存在的；同步的，一齊的 [Z] [（+with）]
The audience burst into simultaneous applause.

title: famine
sections: Drought has caused famine in Africa.
乾旱在非洲造成了饑荒。
There was a famine of water in this locality.

title: revenue
sections: Rent is one form of revenue.
The Board of Directors was concerned at the drop in the company's revenues.
董事會對公司總收入的減少甚為關注。

title: boost
sections: He gave me a boost over the fence.
他抬我一把助我翻越籬笆。
請抬我一把，讓我跨上馬鞍。
The company boosted its sales this year.
這家公司使今年的銷售量增加了。

title: premier
sections: He was appointed the new premier.

title: fuss
sections: 忙亂；大驚小怪；小題大作 [U] [S1] [（+about/over）]
I don't want to make a fuss over such a trifle.
我不想為這種小事大驚小怪。
There was a fuss when the bus broke down again.
巴士又出故障時大家都抱怨起來。
The old lady soon got into a fuss.
一會兒老太太變得焦慮不安起來。
忙亂；小題大作；大驚小怪 [（+about/over）]
And you needn't fuss; there is no disgrace.
你不必大驚小怪；沒有什麼丟臉的事。
她對她那條狗過分寵愛。
Don't fuss him while he's doing his homework.
他在做家庭作業時不要煩擾他。

title: chop
sections: Tom was chopping wood for fire.
The fireman chopped a hole in the wall.
消防隊員在牆上砍出一個洞。
The budget has been chopped by half.
Joe was chopping at a tree when I walked past his log cabin.
我走經喬的小木屋時，他在砍樹。
He gave the tree one chop of an ax and it fell.
他用斧頭一劈就把樹砍倒了。
We will have pork chops for dinner.

title: decisive
sections: a decisive moment in his career
A decisive person is needed to deal with the situation.
應付這一局面需要一個堅決果斷的人。

title: refresh
sections: This glass of iced tea will refresh you.
喝下這杯冰茶你會感到清涼。
消除……疲勞，使重新提起精神
The cool water refreshed him after his long sleep.
久睡之後，涼水使他又清醒起來。
使得到補充；更新；使恢復
They refreshed their winter food supply by hunting.
他們透過打獵補充了他們的冬季食物儲存。
The ship refreshed for a voyage.
這艘船裝上補給品準備出航。

title: tidy
sections: Her room is always clean and tidy.
她的房間總是乾淨整潔。
None could produce a simple, tidy answer.
沒有人能提出一個簡單而又令人滿意的答案。
【口語】 相當大的；相當多的 [B]
$10,000 is a tidy sum of money.
一萬美元是相當大的一筆錢。
She told me to tidy my room.
她讓我把房間收拾一下。
Be sure to tidy up before going out.
出去之前一定要收拾一下。

title: chamber
sections: The king retired to his chamber.
國王回到他的房裡休息了。
The Senate chamber has a gallery for guests.
參議院的會議廳設有聽眾席。
The Senate is the upper chamber of Congress.
A bird's heart has three chambers.
把……關在房間裡；使有房間
The prisoners were chambered in a narrow cave.
囚犯們被關押在一個狹小的洞穴中。

title: prey
sections: The deer fell (a) prey to the lion.
The lion was hunting for its prey.
His anxiety about his father preyed on his mind.
他對父親的掛慮使他內心惴惴不安。

title: instinct
sections: Mother hens protect their young by instinct.
母雞保護小雞出於本能。
Spiders spin webs and birds build nests by instinct.
蜘蛛結網，鳥築巢，都是憑本能。

title: diverse
sections: John and his brother have diverse interests.
約翰和他兄弟的興趣迥然不同。
The program deals with subjects as diverse as pop music and ancient Greek drama.
這檔節目涉及包括流行音樂、古希臘戲劇在內的各種題材。

title: magnificent
sections: We visited a magnificent palace in the city.
我們參觀了一座城裡的宏偉宮殿。
The royal wedding was a magnificent occasion.
His magnificent ideas had a great influence on me.
他崇高的思想對我有過巨大的影響。

title: emit
sections: The chimney emitted thick smoke into the air.
煙囪向空中散發出濃煙。

title: alcoholic
sections: She has had enough of her alcoholic husband.
她對酒鬼丈夫再也無法容忍了。

title: pity
sections: The villagers took pity on the hungry travellers and gave them hot food.
村民們很同情飢餓的旅行者，端出熱的食物給他們吃。
She never asked for pity before.
It's a pity he missed the opportunity to travel abroad.
他錯過了去國外旅遊的機會，真是可惜。
We pity the victims of war.

title: suburb
sections: (城市周圍的) 近郊住宅區（或村，鎮）
New suburbs burgeoned all around the city.
城市周圍新住宅區如雨後春筍般興起。
His family moved to the suburbs.
他的一家搬到郊區去了。
The kingdom was in the suburbs of destruction.

title: dilemma
sections: Mary is facing the dilemma of obeying her father or marrying the man she loves.
是服從父親還是嫁給自己所愛的人是瑪麗面臨著的難題。

title: comprehensive
sections: 廣泛的；無所不包的；綜合的
具有充分理解力的頭腦

title: merit
sections: Her singing is totally without merit.
People may not like her, but she has her merits.
人們也許不喜歡她，但她也有她的優點。
He will judge the case solely on its merits.
他將完全根據是非曲直審理這一案件。
這一論點沒有法律依據。
That brave deed merited a better reward.
這種勇敢的行為應該得到更好的獎賞。

title: commodity
sections: In Thailand rice is an important commodity for export.
米是泰國的一項重要出口商品。

title: wicked
sections: He denied that he had done anything wicked.
他否認做過任何邪惡的勾當。
You wicked child -- go to bed at once!
你這個小淘氣，快去睡覺！
The wicked storm lasted three days.
災害性的風暴持續了三天。
He plays a wicked game of bridge.

title: moisture
sections: The sun will take the moisture out of the clothes.
太陽光會把衣服上的水分蒸發掉。

title: sore
sections: 痛的；疼痛發炎的；一碰就痛的 [（+from）]
惹人生氣的；引起反感的 [B]
His origins were a sore subject with him.
他的出身是個使他難堪的話題。
She was sore at him for not inviting her to the party.
她因他沒有邀請她去參加聚會而生他的氣。
The suffering of the refugees makes her heart sore.
她過著極度貧窮的生活。
(精神上的) 痛處，恨事，傷心事
我們可別再提舊時的傷心事了。

title: code
sections: Students must observe the code of the school.
He sent a message in code.
他用密碼發送了一份訊息。
為……編碼；把……譯成電碼（密碼等）
The librarian is coding the new books.
圖書館員在為新書編號。

title: embrace
sections: The cat family embraces lions and tigers.
抓住（機會等）；欣然接受（提議等）
She embraced his offer to help her with her English.
她欣然接受他幫她學習英文的提議。
People in this region embraced Christianity at the turn of the century.
這一地區的人在本世紀初開始信奉基督教。
She held her son to her in an affectionate embrace.
她親切地將她兒子摟在懷裡。

title: tribe
sections: America was once the home of many Indian tribes.
美洲曾是許多印第安部落的家園。
A tribe of artists live in Greenwich Village.
在格林尼治村住著許多藝術家。

title: exclude
sections: 拒絕接納；把……排除在外；不包括 [（+from）]
The club excluded women from membership.
該俱樂部拒絕婦女入會。
排斥（可能性等）；對……不予考慮
The possibility of food poisoning has been excluded.
食物中毒的可能性已被排除。

title: privilege
sections: It is a great privilege to know you.
認識你真是莫大的榮幸。
This pass will privilege you to attend the closed hearings.
有了這張通行證你便可以出席不公開的聽證會。

title: grief
sections: The mother went mad with grief after the child died.
孩子死後，母親因悲痛而發瘋了。
Her heroin-addicted husband is a grief to her.
她那吸海洛因成癮的丈夫真讓她痛心。

title: coalition
sections: (政黨、國家等) 臨時結成的聯盟 [C]
During the war Britain was ruled by a coalition.
大戰期間英國由聯合政府主政。

title: prosecution
sections: Tony has brought a prosecution against them.
湯尼已對他們提出起訴。
【文學/文學用語】 徹底進行；實行，執行 [U]
She has to travel a great deal in the prosecution of her duties.
她在履行職責中得作許多旅行。

title: device
sections: The television receiver is an electronic device.
電視接收器是一種電子裝置。
She got the information by some device.
她運用某種手段獲取了情報。

title: enforce
sections: The police department enforces the law.
Don't enforce your will on the child, please.
請別把你的意願強加給這孩子。

title: infant
sections: My infant for once lay quiet in his cradle.
我的嬰兒這一次總算安靜地躺在搖籃裡。
The expectant father is thinking of buying infant clothes.
那個即將做爸爸的人在考慮買嬰兒穿的衣服。
Tourism was then still in its infant stage.
旅遊業當時還處在初創階段。

title: retail
sections: He made the sweets himself and sold them by retail.
The retail price of the dress is 60 dollars.
這衣服的零售價是六十元。
以零售方式；以零售價格
They didn't sell their goods retail.
He intends to retail textile goods.
These books retailed at a dollar.

title: drown
sections: She fell overboard and was drowned.
她從船上掉入水中淹死了。
The noise of the machines drowned his voice.
機器聲將他的聲音淹沒了。
It is no use trying to drown your sorrows in drink.

title: stroll
sections: I used to stroll along the beach on Sundays.
我過去常在星期天沿海灘散步。
I noticed a stranger strolling the street of the village.
我注意到一個陌生人在村子的街上溜達。
Grandpa took a stroll after supper.
爺爺吃過晚飯出去溜達了一陣。

title: draft
sections: He had painfully written out a first draft.
He went to the bank to cash a draft.
他去銀行兌現一張匯票。
They were unwilling to register for the draft.
【美國英語 】 通風；氣流；通風裝置 [C] [U]
Turn the electric fan on and make a draft.
一飲；(藥水等一次的) 服用量 [C]
He drank the glass of wine at one draft.
【美國英語 】 (船的) 吃水（深度） [C]
The boat has a shallow draft.
I had to draft a cable home.
我得寫一份發往家裡的電報稿。
Her brother was drafted into military service.

title: empire
sections: He started off with one small factory, and now he's the head of an oil empire.
他開始只經營一家小工廠，如今已成為一個石油大企業的頭兒。

title: port
sections: We must reach port by evening.
我們必須在傍晚前抵港。
The former fishing village has now become an important port.
過去的漁村現已成為重要港口。

title: seal
sections: He affixed his seal to the document.
The envelope's seal was torn open.
封條；(裝飾用的) 貼紙
The seal on the jar was broken.
Their handshake was a seal of friendship.
他們的握手是友誼的象徵。
She forgot to seal her letter before mailing it.
她忘記在寄信前將信封上。
He signed and sealed the document.
The treaty was signed and sealed by both governments.
條約已經兩國政府簽字蓋章。
(以蓋章的方式) 保證；確認；批准
They sealed the bargain with a handshake.
The tube is sealed at both ends.
The judge's words sealed the prisoner's fate.
法官的話決定了這個囚犯的命運。

title: deter
sections: Failure did not deter him from trying again.
失敗並未使他洩氣罷休。

title: endeavor
sections: He endeavored to streamline the plant organization.
他努力使工廠組織簡化而更有效地運作。
His endeavors to get the bill passed failed.
他想使議案通過的努力失敗了。

title: nasty
sections: 齷齪的；令人作嘔的；使人難受的
This room has a very nasty smell.
這房間有一股很難聞的氣味。
In this area the weather is usually nasty in winter.
這裡冬天的天氣通常非常惡劣。
脾氣不好的；卑鄙的，惡意的
Never say nasty things about others.
千萬不可惡語中傷他人。
老鼠傳播非常嚴重的疾病。
I got a nasty cut on my foot while playing on the beach.
我在海灘上嬉耍時腳上割了個很大的傷口。
難處理的，問題多的；討厭的
This presented a nasty problem to the new governor.
這成了新州長的一個棘手的問題。
討厭的人；令人不快的事物（狀況） [C]
The people are looking forward to being delivered from the nasties.
人民期待著從不愉快的狀況中解脫出來。

title: frank
sections: He offered a frank apology to her for hurting her feelings.
他因傷害了她的感情而真誠地向她道歉。
蓋有"郵資已付"字樣的信封

title: vogue
sections: This hair style was brought into vogue by Hollywood stars.
這種髮型是因好萊塢的明星們而時髦起來的。
The novel had an enormous vogue in the 1930's.
這本小說在三十年代曾廣為流傳。
流行物；時髦事物（人物） [C] [the S]
Full-length coats are no longer the vogue.

title: client
sections: He has been a valued client of our bank for many years.
他多年來一直是我們銀行的重要客戶。

title: deteriorate
sections: 惡化；品質（或價值）下降；退化；墮落
Relations between the two countries have deteriorated sharply in recent weeks.
最近幾週那兩個國家間的關係嚴重惡化了。

title: thrill
sections: He was thrilled by her conversation.
She was thrilled with terror when she saw the scene of the murder.
她看到兇殺現場時，嚇得毛骨悚然。
感到緊張，感到毛骨悚然 [（+at/to）]
He felt a thrill when he got into the theater.
She whiled away the afternoon reading cheap thrills.
她看廉價的驚險小說消磨了一個下午。
Meeting the President was a great thrill.
會見總統是一件令人興奮不已的事情。

title: persist
sections: Why do you persist in writing these things?
你為什麼要堅持寫這些東西呢？
The storm persisted for a week.
暴風雨持續了一個星期。
He persisted that he had nothing to do with robbery.
他堅持說他與搶劫毫無關係。

title: adolescent
sections: 青少年的；幼稚的，未成熟的
Her remarks seemed a bit adolescent.
她的這番話似乎有點幼稚。

title: gloomy
sections: He came to see me in a gloomy winter day.
他在一個陰沉的冬日來看我。
I can tell by your gloomy face that the news is bad.
從你憂鬱的臉上我能看出情況不妙。

title: chest
sections: He has a severe pain in the chest.

title: exploit
sections: 功績，功勛；輝煌的成就；英勇的行為 [C]

title: scorch
sections: The grass was scorched by the hot sun.
草被炎熱的太陽曬枯了。
This material will scorch easily if it is too near the fire.
這種材料如果太靠近爐火很容易烤焦。
I could not wash away the mark of the scorch.

title: shelter
sections: The umbrella is a poor shelter from heavy rain.
雨傘不太遮擋得住大雨。
掩蔽，遮蔽；庇護，保護；避難 [U] [（+from）]
Their immediate need is for food, clothing and shelter.
他們所急需的是吃的，穿的和住的。
The wall sheltered us from the wind.
牆壁遮擋著，使我們免遭風吹。
She was accused of sheltering a murderer.
They sheltered from the sun under a tree.

title: dizzy
sections: When he got up he felt dizzy.
使人頭暈的；極高的；快速旋轉的 [B]
Prices keep rising at a dizzy rate.
物價以令人眩暈的速度不斷上漲。
Those math problems made me dizzy.
那些數學題弄得我暈頭轉向。
The ride on the roller coaster dizzied us.
乘坐雲霄飛車使我們頭暈。

title: hasty
sections: We had a hasty meal and then left.
我們匆匆吃完飯然後就離開了。
Don't be hasty. It's not so easy to find another job.
別草率行事。另找一份工作並不容易。
His hasty decision was a mistake.
他的倉促決定是個錯誤。

title: confront
sections: The soldiers were confronted by two terrorists as they left their camp.
士兵們離開營房時，迎面遇到兩個恐怖分子。
confront a prisoner with a witness

title: plank
sections: They performed on a makeshift stage of wood planks.
他們在一個用木板搭的臨時舞臺上演出。
【美國英語 】 (政黨的) 政綱條款；政策要點
The main plank in his election campaign is tax reform.
他競選運動的主要政綱是稅制改革。
【美國英語 】【口語】 當場支付 [（+down/out/up）]
He planked down his ten thousand.

title: concrete
sections: 有形的，實在的；具象的；具體的
The word "apple" is a concrete noun. "蘋果"是個具體名詞。
Shoes and trees are concrete objects.
His plan is not yet concrete.
Have you got any concrete proposals?
你有沒有具體的建議呢？
These buildings are made of concrete and steel.
這些房屋是用鋼筋混凝土建成的。
用混凝土修築；澆混凝土於
The workmen are concreting the road.
工人們在用混凝土鋪路。

title: malice
sections: She did it from pure malice.
He had no malice toward anyone.
他對任何人都沒有敵意。

title: slender
sections: She's got a beautiful slender figure.
The spider hung suspended on its slender thread.
蜘蛛懸掛在它吐出的細絲上。
The whole family lived on his slender earnings.
全家人靠他微薄的收入過活。

title: flavor
sections: You may choose from six popular flavors.
你可以從六種流行口味中選擇。
I like the flavor of chocolate.
It gives our little meals an eastern flavor.
它給我們的便餐增添了一種東方風味。
She flavored the fish with sugar and vinegar.

title: contemporary
sections: His lecture is on contemporary American novelists.
他的演講是關於當代美國小說家的。
Was Ben Jonson contemporary with Shakespeare?
班強森是否與莎士比亞同輩？
同時代的人；同年齡的人
He was looked down upon by his contemporaries.
他被他同時代的人瞧不起。

title: fatigue
sections: His health is deteriorating from fatigue.
他的健康狀況因疲勞而惡化。
It is a treat to have a drink after the fatigues of the day.
幹了一天的累活後喝杯酒其樂無窮。
He is too fatigued to eat.
他太疲勞了，不想吃東西。
The woman often complains that she fatigues easily.
那個女人常訴說自己容易疲勞。

title: shallow
sections: The boys splashed in the shallows of the pond.
男孩子們在池塘的淺水處嬉水。

title: condemn
sections: 我們譴責他的愚蠢行為。
The judge condemned the thief to one year of hard labor.
法官判這個賊服一年苦役。
迫使……處於（不幸的狀態）；使某人注定要 [（+to）] [O2]
Paralysis of the lower limbs condemned him to a wheelchair.
下肢癱瘓使他只好坐輪椅。
The old bridge has been condemned.
這座舊橋已被宣告不能使用。

title: charm
sections: The girl's warm personality is her greatest charm.
那女孩熱情的個性是她最迷人之處。
鏈條（或鐲子）上的小飾物 [C]

他的工作是輔導學生就業。

sections: The new law forbids smoking in offices.

sections: It's the most ridiculous thing I ever heard in my life.

使自己高興一下；讓自己享受一下 [（+in）]

sections: They wanted to fight all forms of injustice and repression.

He gave the orange another squeeze.
He gave my hand a squeeze.
She put a squeeze of lemon in her drink.
她在飲料中放了一點檸檬汁。
It's a tight squeeze to get five people in that small car.

sections: I was amazed at her ability to cope with the difficult situation.

sections: I haven't a ghost of a chance of getting the job.

sections: The enormous fish snapped the fly.

厲聲說；怒氣沖沖地頂撞（或打斷） [（+out）]

I snapped a nice photograph of her.

The dog snapped at the boy's ankles.

劈啪地響；(門等) 咯嗒一聲關上
The door snapped shut behind me.

啪地一聲折斷；(神經等) 突然崩潰
The branch snapped under his weight.
在他身體的重壓下，樹枝啪地一聲折斷了。
He is always snapping at his subordinates.

他給我看他假期裡拍下的快照。

The course was a snap for him.

啪一聲關上或扣上的；用彈簧的

sections: After the bombing there was a lot of debris everywhere.

sections: 她是一個老於世故的女人。

尖端武器 sophisticate的動詞過去式、過去分詞 (→ sophisticate)

sections: 適合少年的；少年特有的

Her parents' divorce had a profound effect on her life.

title: mar
sections: 沒有什麼能破壞他們的幸福。

sections: His father is in a temper today.
the temper of modern European poetry

那姑娘鼓起勇氣說出了自己的想法。

title: hail

The doctor transplanted skin to her face.
醫生給她臉上移植皮膚。
Adults are not flexible; they do not transplant comfortably to another place.
成年人適應性不強；他們移居異地會感到不舒服。

title: squad
sections: A squad is the smallest unit in an army.
班是軍隊的最小構成單位。
Anti-riot squads were called out to deal with the situation.
防暴隊奉命出動以對付這一局勢。

title: acute
sections: He is a man of acute intelligence.
She complained of acute pains in her chest.
It is urgent that the acute problem of air pollution in the city be solved.
該城市空氣汙染這一嚴重問題急須解決。
He fell ill with acute appendicitis.

title: furious
sections: He is furious at being kept in the dark.
他因為被瞞著而大發雷霆。
The ship can weather the furious storm.
這條船禁得起狂風暴雨的襲擊。

title: irony
sections: In her voice we could sense a certain tinge of irony.
從她的聲音裡我們可以感到某種譏諷的意味。
具有諷刺意味的事；出乎意料的結果；嘲諷的話 [C] [U]
The great irony was that despite all his explanations nobody believed him.
最具諷刺意味的是：儘管他竭力解釋，可沒一個人相信他。

title: polite
sections: 有禮貌的，客氣的；殷勤的
He's always so polite to people.
他對人總是非常有禮貌。
(文學作品等) 優雅的，風雅的
She is fond of polite literature.

title: spray
sections: We parked the car by the sea and it got covered with spray.
我們將汽車停在海邊，汽車上濺滿了浪花。
A spray of salt water hit her in the face.
飛濺的海水打在她的臉上。
Did you bring along some insect spray?
你有沒有帶些殺蟲噴液來？
He sprayed water on the flowers in the morning.
There was a hole in the hose, and water sprayed out all over me.
水管上有一個洞，水噴出來濺了我一身。

title: heart
sections: The boy's heart gave a jump.
She gave her heart to him.
She wore a diamond heart around her neck.
她脖子上佩帶著一顆心形的鑽石。
Let's get to the heart of the problem.
讓我們來談談問題的核心吧。
I didn't have the heart to tell you about it.
我沒有勇氣將此事告訴你。

title: boast
sections: The captain is always boasting of his military valor.
上尉老是自誇陣前之勇。
(指物) 以有……而自豪；擁有，包含 [W]
Our school library boasts quite a few rare books.
我們學校圖書館以藏有好多珍本書而自豪。
That brother of yours is full of boasts.
你那個寶貝兄弟滿口大話。
It is his boast that he has never been late for work.
他為自己上班從未遲到感到自豪。

title: emigrate
sections: Albert Einstein emigrated from Germany to the United States.
艾伯特‧愛因斯坦從德國移居到美國。

title: strife
sections: What is the major cause of the labour-management strife?
勞資衝突的主要原因是什麼？
She was unhappy because of the family strife.

title: alien
sections: 外國的，外國人的；外國僑民的
A law was passed to protect alien property.
通過了一項法律保護外國僑民的財產。
Her behavior is alien to our ethical values.
她的行為和我們的倫理標準格格不入。
(住在他國的) 外國人，僑民
Enemy aliens were imprisoned during the war.
戰爭期間敵國僑民遭到監禁。

title: eternal
sections: The eternal motion of the stars fascinated him.
星體永恆的運行使他著迷。
I couldn't stand their eternal quarrelling.
我不能忍受他們爭吵不休。

title: setting
sections: a diamond in a gold setting
鑲在金質底板上的鑽石
(桌面上一席位用的) 全副餐具 [C]
日落 set的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ set)

title: worm
sections: All the apples had worms in them.
The boy had worms, but he is fine now.
這男孩曾患寄生蟲病，但現在好了。
You're no worm, you're a man; so get up, lad, and fight.
你不是懦夫，你是一個男子漢；小伙子，爬起來，去搏鬥。
He felt a worm of unease.
He wormed his small body through the hedge.
他蠕動他那瘦小的身體鑽過了樹籬。
使緩慢前進；悄悄地行（走） [O]
They wormed their way through the undergrowth.
他們緩慢地穿過林下灌木叢。
She wormed the secret out of him.
她從他那裡探得這一祕密。
The vet prescribed a medicine to worm my puppy.
獸醫開了一種藥驅除我那小狗體內的寄生蟲。
He managed to worm into an important position in the government.
他設法鑽進政府竊據要職。
Once again she wormed out of trouble.
她又一次逐漸擺脫了困境。

title: compensate
sections: We compensate workers for injuries suffered at their work.
我們對工人在工作中受傷給予補償。
She used her good looks to compensate for her lack of intelligence.
她智力欠佳權以美貌彌補。

title: foresee
sections: It is hard to foresee what will happen.
很難預知將會發生之事。
He foresaw that prices would drop.
Nobody could foresee his running away.
We should have foreseen the trouble months ago.
我們幾個月前就該預見到這一困難。

title: testify
sections: The next witness will testify for the defense.
下一個證人將為被告人作證。
The excellence of Shakespeare's plays testifies to his genius.
莎士比亞戲劇的卓越證明了他的天才。
受感化的罪人向上帝懺悔。
The witness testified that he had seen the man shoot at his victim.
證人作證說他看到那男人向其受害者開槍。
Her deep sighs testified her sadness.
她的一聲聲長歎表明她的悲傷。
He testified his faith in Christianity openly.
他公開聲明信仰基督教。

title: ripe
sections: 成熟的；適宜食用的，醇美的
準備妥當的，時機成熟的 [F] [（+for）]
The time is ripe for a new foreign policy.
採用新外交政策的時機已成熟。

title: insult
sections: She could not forgive so terrible an insult to her pride.
她不能原諒對她的自尊如此嚴重的侮辱。

title: acquaintance
sections: I have some acquaintance with Spanish.
She has many acquaintances in the business community.

title: garment
sections: This shop sells garments of all kinds.
這家商店銷售各式各樣的衣服。

title: retort
sections: He retorted the invectives on her.
She retorted that it was all his fault.
她反駁說這全是他的錯。
She retorted upon me, saying I was to blame.
她反駁說我才該受到責備。

title: irritate
sections: His letter irritated me a little.
使過敏；使難受；使發炎；使疼痛
These tight shoes irritate my toes.
我的鞋太緊，夾痛我的腳趾。

title: desolate
sections: We saw few houses in the desolate valley.
在這荒涼的山谷裡，我們很少見到房子。

title: abstract
sections: Some people say beauty itself is abstract. Do you agree?
有些人認為美本身是抽象的。你同意嗎？
You explain things in a way that is too abstract for me.
你如此解釋事物對我來說太深奧了。
Modern art is often rather abstract.
現代藝術往往相當抽象。
Harper made an abstract of Prof. Hunter's lecture.
哈珀將亨特教授的講座做了摘要。

title: conform
sections: If you don't conform to the traffic laws, you might get hurt.
如果不遵守交通法規，則可能受傷。
Most people willingly conform to the customs of society.
大多數人都願意遵守社會習俗。
Every student is required to conform his behavior to the rules.
每個學生都必須遵守校規。

title: feast
sections: We prepared a feast for the wedding.
我們為婚禮準備了盛宴。
Christmas is an important feast for Christians.
耶誕節是基督徒的重要節日。
We feasted our eyes on the mountain scene.
The poor starve and the rich feast.

title: ugly
sections: 醜小鴨長大變天鵝，喻幼時醜，長大變美（典出安徒生童話《醜小鴨》）
險惡的；(天氣) 陰沉的，行將變壞的
【口語】 暴躁的；乖戾的；好吵架的
The crowd was in an ugly mood.

title: logical
sections: It is logical to assume that they will attend.
a logical result of an action

title: inhabit
sections: 居住於；棲息於；存在於；佔據
Before the arrival of the white man, Australia was inhabited solely by Aborigines.
白人到達之前，澳大利亞僅有土著居住。
他們居住在熱帶森林中。

title: administer
sections: It takes brains to administer a large corporation.
The nurse administered the medicine to the sick child.
護士給生病的孩子服藥。
The oath was administered to him.

title: endanger
sections: The oil spill endangered thousands of birds.
石油的溢洩危及成千上萬的鳥兒。

title: intrigue
sections: It is said that he is a master of intrigue.
據說他是搞陰謀詭計的老手。
The king's younger brother took part in the intrigue.
國王的弟弟參與了該陰謀。
They are intriguing against the government.
大多數孩子都十分喜愛神話故事。

title: textile
sections: The designers have created a new textile.
設計人員創造了一種新織物。
The textile industry employs many women workers.
紡織工業僱許多女工人。

title: beard
sections: The man with a beard looks familiar.
蓄山羊鬍的那個人看上去很面熟。
He didn't dare to beard his superior.
他不敢公然與上級對抗。

title: basin
sections: The Amazon Basin is very large.
Part of the harbour is a yacht basin.
港灣的一部分是個停泊遊艇的內港。

title: judicious
sections: 有見識的；明斷的；明智而審慎的
It would be judicious to remain silent.

title: arid
sections: The settlers irrigated the arid land.
移民們灌溉乾燥的土地。
The audience soon grew tired of his arid speech.
沒多久聽眾對他枯燥無味的演說就感到厭膩了。

title: mop
sections: Mops for cleaning the floor have a long handle.
擦洗地板的拖把有一個長柄。
【口語】 拖把狀物；蓬亂的一團；蓬亂的頭髮 [S] [（+of）]
You have quite a mop of hair.
I was asked to mop the floor.
He mopped the sweat from his face.

title: anticipate
sections: It is impossible to anticipate when it will happen.
不可能預料這事何時發生。
The first question is one which Jason has anticipated.
第一個問題是傑森料到的。
預先考慮到；預先做（或準備） [+wh-] [+that]
My wife anticipates all my needs each time I come back from a business trip.
我每次出差回家，妻子總會預先考慮到我的全部需要而作好安排。
先於……前行動，先發制（人）；早別人做；佔先
The Chinese anticipated the European discovery of gunpowder.
中國人先於歐洲人發現火藥。
No employees of the firm are allowed to anticipate their salary.
這家商行不允許僱員提前支用薪金。

title: isolation
sections: His older sister had been taken off to the isolation ward.
他的姐姐被送到隔離病房。

title: reconcile
sections: After each quarrel the children are soon reconciled.
每次吵架之後孩子們很快就會和好。
The teacher had to reconcile disputes among her pupils.
老師不得不調解她學生中的糾紛。
We must reconcile our statements with our conduct.
我們必須做到言行一致。
She could not reconcile herself to failure.

title: legitimate
sections: He is the legitimate heir to the property.
他是這宗財產的合法繼承人。
He had a legitimate reason for being late.

title: jolly
sections: 【口語】 令人愉快的，宜人的
We had a jolly time last weekend.
上週末我們過得很快活。
He's going to be a jolly tough candidate to beat.
他會成為很難擊敗的候選人。
【口語】 用好話勸（某人）做…… [（+into/out of）]
They jollied her into giving them a song.
他們哄得她給大家唱了支歌。

title: accumulate
sections: They set to work accumulating a huge mass of data.
他們開始累積大量的資料。
Dust had accumulated during her absence.
她不在時灰塵積了起來。

title: clue
sections: (解決疑案，問題等的) 線索，跡象，提示 [（+to）]
--"Do you know the time of the next train?" --"I don't have a clue." —"您知道下一班火車的時間嗎？" —"我一無所知。"
The police have no clue to his identity.
警察沒有可以確定他的身分的任何線索。

title: sheer
sections: 她純粹是因為勞累而暈倒的。
She wore a sheer white dress.
她穿一件白色薄紗洋裝。
It's very difficult to climb a sheer cliff.
攀登陡峭的懸崖是很困難的。
The mountain rises sheer from the plain.
這座山陡峭地矗立在平原上。

title: tender
sections: There are lots of tender blossoms in the garden.
花園裡盡是嬌嫩的花朵。
Her bruised knee is still tender.
她受了瘀傷的膝蓋仍然一碰就痛。
The nurse was very tender toward the sick children.
護士對生病的孩子很溫柔。
It is hard to have the tender situation in hand.
這樣微妙的局勢很難控制。

title: discard
sections: discard an old pair of shoes

title: distress
sections: Arthur's visits caused him more distress than pleasure.
亞瑟的來訪給他帶來更多的痛苦，而不是愉快。
The lifeboat went out to a ship in distress.
引起痛苦或悲痛的事物 [S]
The girl's indiscreet behavior was a distress to her parents.
那女孩行為不檢，使她父母十分痛苦。
Her husband's death distressed her greatly.
她丈夫的去世使她很痛苦。

title: interpret
sections: We have to interpret his words in a modern light.
我們必須以現代的觀點來解釋他的話。
We interpret a frown as a sign of disapproval.
我們把皺眉當作不贊成的表示。
(根據自己的詮釋) 演奏，演
Not everybody agreed with the way she interpreted the violin concerto, but it was still a technically perfect performance.
並非每人都同意她對那首小提琴協奏曲的詮釋，但是她的演奏在技巧上仍是無懈可擊。
Would you like me to interpret for you?

title: adversary
sections: The once friendly countries became adversaries in the war.
這些一度十分友好的國家在戰爭中成了敵對國。

title: murmur
sections: 輕柔持續的聲音，沙沙聲，潺潺聲 [C]
He sat listening to the murmur of the little brook.
他坐著傾聽小溪流水的潺潺聲。
She gave a murmur of approval.
He made no murmur at my suggestion.
他對我的建議沒有表示不滿。
The breeze murmured in the pines.
The people murmured against the government.
He murmured something she didn't quite catch.
他咕噥了一句什麼話，她沒有聽清楚。

title: shrug
sections: (表示疑惑，蔑視，無奈等) 聳（肩）
Don't just shrug your shoulders. Say something.
不要光聳肩。你講講話呀。
He shrugged his low opinion of the occupant of the room.
他聳聳肩表示對那房間的住戶不屑一顧。
他對我的建議只是聳聳肩。
With a shrug, he went out of the room.
他聳一下肩，走出了房間。

title: carrot
sections: We grow carrots in our garden.
我們在菜園裡種了些胡蘿蔔。
Dad is trying to persuade Jim by dangling the carrot of higher allowance.
爸爸以增加零用錢為餌企圖說服吉姆。

title: bald
sections: When he grew bald he bought a toupee.
他頭髮日漸稀少，於是買了假髮。
He's as bald as a coot.
Your tire is bald and unsafe.
你的輪胎磨平了，不安全。
He gave a bald statement of the facts.
他對事實作了枯燥無味的陳述。

title: exempt
sections: Good students are exempted from attending study hall.
成績好的學生免上自修課。
School property is exempt from all taxes.
學校財產免除一切賦稅。

title: shiver
sections: As the temperature dropped abruptly, the campers were shivering all over with cold.
由於氣溫驟降，野營者冷得渾身發抖。
The breeze gave a shiver to the surface of the lake.
That strange noise gave me the shivers.
那奇怪的響聲使我不寒而慄。

title: portion
sections: He left the major portion of his money to the foundation.
他將大部分錢留給了這個基金會。
He was hungry and ordered two portions of roast duck.
他很餓，因而叫了兩份烤鴨。
We must all accept our portion in life.
She portioned out the cake, so everyone had a piece.
她將蛋糕切成多塊，每人可得一份。

title: grim
sections: We had a grim struggle before we won.
我們經歷了一場惡鬥才贏得勝利。
We climbed to the top of the mountain with grim determination.
我們懷著堅強的決心爬上山頂。
陰森的，令人生畏的；猙獰的
He had a grim look on his face.
他臉上露出冷酷的神情。

title: circulation
sections: We observed the circulation of blood in frogs.
我們觀察了青蛙的血液循環。
(貨幣、消息等的) 流通，傳播 [U]
Many forged notes are in circulation.
(報刊等的) 發行量，銷售量 [S]
This paper has a circulation of more than a million.
這一報紙的發行量達一百多萬份。

title: aggregate
sections: The audiences aggregated a million people.

title: preside
sections: The general manager presided at the meeting.
The Prime Minister presided at the Cabinet meeting.
The manager presides over the business of this store.

title: sequence
sections: Farmers met with a sequence of bad harvests.
農民們遇到了接二連三的壞收成。
He described the events of that day in sequence.
他按先後次序描述了那一天發生的種種事件。
(電影中描述同一主題的) 連續鏡頭 [C]
There are several frightening sequences in the film.
影片中有幾組嚇人的連續鏡頭。

title: doom
sections: The dictator met his doom after ten years of rule.
獨裁者統治了十年終於完蛋了。
The project was doomed to failure.
The court doomed him to life imprisonment.
過多的雨水使莊稼歉收。

title: inherent
sections: 內在的；固有的，與生俱來的 [（+in）]
The problems you mention are inherent in the system.
你提及的那些問題是這一制度本身存在的。

title: expire
sections: 滿期，屆期；(期限) 終止
My lease will expire on September 30th of this year.
我的租約今年九月三十日到期。
The old lady expired within the hour.
那個老太太不到一小時就死了。
We expire used air from our lungs.

title: vague
sections: (形狀等) 模糊不清的，朦朧的
Everything looked vague in the heavy fog.
在濃霧中，一切東西看上去都很模糊。
(想法等) 不明確的；曖昧的，含糊的
I'm quite vague about what happened.
我對發生的事很不了解。
You should not make vague promises.
你不該作含糊不清的承諾。
He was a small man with vague eyes.
他身材矮小，眼睛沒有表情。
(在否定句中用最高級) 少許的 [B]
I haven't the vaguest idea what she means.
我一點也不知道她是什麼意思。

title: fragrant
sections: The air in the garden was warm and fragrant.
花園裡的空氣溫煦而又芳香。

title: agony
sections: They went through the agonies of war and famine.
他們經歷了戰爭和饑荒的痛苦。
The football fans cheered the winning team with agonies of wild joy.
足球迷欣喜若狂地向勝隊歡呼。

title: fertile
sections: (土地) 肥沃的，富饒的，豐產的
The land is so fertile that three crops a year can grow.
這片土地很肥沃，一年可種三季莊稼。
能生育的；能孵的；受精的 [Z]
Most chicken eggs are not fertile.
(創造力或想像力) 豐富的

title: meditation
sections: I'm sorry to interrupt your meditations.
我很抱歉，打斷你思考問題了。
He reached his decision only after much meditation.
他經過認真思考後才作出了決定。

title: sin
sections: (宗教或道德上的) 罪，罪孽，罪惡 [C] [U]
It's a sin to waste food.
(違反禮節，習俗的) 過錯，過失 [C] [（+against）]
It's a sin to stay indoors on such a fine day.
這樣的好天氣留在屋裡實在不該。
Alice is accused of sinning against this unwritten law.
愛麗斯被指責違反這條不成文法。

title: bankrupt
sections: His business failed and he went bankrupt.
他的生意失敗了，他也破產了。
已完全失敗的，枯竭了的
He was bankrupt of original ideas.
He has spent so much money on the venture that it will bankrupt him.
他花了這麼多錢從事這冒險買賣，到頭來會破產的。
這些人一點知識也沒有。

title: grace
sections: He gave me a month's grace.
【宗教】 (飯前或飯後的) 感恩祈禱 [U]
His family take turns saying grace before dinner.
他的家人吃晚飯前輪流說謝飯禱文。
By the grace of God, we have been saved from death.
謝謝上帝的慈悲，我們得救了。
He married a lady with many graces.
他娶了一位有許多美德的淑女。
His Eminence graced the banquet by his presence.
主教閣下的出席給宴會增添了光輝。

title: startle
sections: 使驚嚇；使嚇一跳；使驚奇 [H]
He was startled when his nephew came in.
當他侄子走進來時，他吃了一驚。
The baby startles at every sudden sound.
這嬰兒每聽到突然的聲音都要受驚。

title: weed
sections: The garden is full of weeds.
First thing tomorrow I'll weed the garden.
我明天一大早首先去除園內的雜草。
The general weeded out poor commanders.
將軍淘汰了無能的指揮官。
We have to weed out unqualified applicants.
我們必須淘汰不合格的申請人。
My mother is busy weeding in the garden.
我母親正在園中忙著除草。

title: rash
