sections: It is rash to cross the street without looking both ways.
不朝兩邊看看就穿馬路是莽撞的。

title: arrogant
sections: John is so arrogant that he thinks he is better than everyone else.
約翰太驕傲自大，以為比誰都強。

title: groan
sections: The man gave a groan of pain.
那人發出痛苦的呻吟聲。
The roof creaked and groaned under the weight of the snow.
屋頂被積雪壓得發出吱吱嘎嘎的聲響。
The nation groaned under the dictator's rule.
那個國家在獨裁者統治下受盡苦難。

title: medieval
sections: The Morality Play was a type of religious drama produced in the medieval age.
道德劇是西方中世紀時的一種宗教戲劇。

title: sneer
sections: I felt that every woman here sneers at me.
我感到這裡的每一個女人都在嘲笑我。
She sneered her contempt for his reply.
她對他的回答嗤之以鼻。
The remark was, of course, a sneer.

title: enroll
sections: 把……記入名冊，登記（名字等）
祕書登記了我們的名字。
使入會；使入學，招（生）；使入伍，徵（兵）
The school will enroll new students in August.
這所學校將於八月份招收新生。
They enrolled us as members of the club.
他們將我們吸收為該俱樂部會員。
Her son was enrolled for military service a couple of years ago.
她兒子於兩三年前應募入伍。
All contestants must enroll by Saturday.
所有參賽者必須在星期六前登記。
入會，參加；入學，註冊；入伍，應徵
She enrolled in the literature course.

title: meddle
sections: Someone's been meddling with my CD player.
有人擅自碰過我的雷射唱機了。

title: pedestrian
sections: 我們喜歡所有的步行活動。
(文章等) 平淡的，沉悶的；(人) 缺乏想像力的；平庸的
The circumstances and events of his life were anything but pedestrian.
他一生經歷的事情是很不平常的。

title: ascend
sections: The smoke ascends slowly to the sky.
His ancestors ascend to the 15th century.
他的祖先可上溯到十五世紀。
維多利亞於一八三九年登上王位。
He ascended the flight of narrow stairs to his bedroom.
他登上狹窄的樓梯到他的臥室去。

title: bias
sections: Some people have a bias against foreigners.
有些人對外國人有偏見。
The pianist has a bias in favour of Chopin.
The newspapers biased their readers against the new government.
報紙使得讀者們對新政府產生偏見。
He was biased against the plan from the beginning.
他從一開始就對這個計畫有偏見。

title: fur
sections: That cat has soft white fur.
Many people wear furs in winter.
冬天許多人穿毛皮衣服。

title: monopoly
sections: 獨佔；專賣；壟斷；完全控制 [the S] [（+of/on）]
The explosion of the Russian atomic bomb broke the American monopoly on nuclear weapons.
俄國原子彈的爆炸打破了美國對核武器的壟斷。
The government has a monopoly of oil production in that country.
在那個國家，政府獨佔石油開採權。
獨佔者；專賣者；壟斷企業 [C]
No one could compete with these steel monopolies.
沒有人能和這些鋼鐵壟斷企業競爭。
In many countries tobacco is a government monopoly.
在許多國家，菸草是政府的專賣商品。

title: custom
sections: The celebration of Christmas is a custom.
慶祝耶誕節是一種風俗。
Did you have any trouble with the Customs?

title: portable
sections: 便於攜帶的，手提式的；輕便的
He found that little TV extremely portable.
他覺得那臺小小的電視機攜帶極其方便。
I bought my son a portable typewriter.
我給兒子買了一臺手提式打字機。
手提式製品；手提式打字機（或電腦，收音機，電視機等） [C]
My sister's TV is a portable.
我妹妹的電視機是手提式的。

title: intact
sections: 完整無缺的；原封不動的；未受損傷的 [F]
內放精緻易碎物品的包裹完好無損地到達。

title: melt
sections: The sugar melted in the tea.
一種顏色漸漸變成另一種顏色。

title: rein
sections: Pull on the right rein and the horse will turn to the right.
一拉右韁，馬就會向右轉。
Few kings now hold the reins of government.
現在很少有國王是掌握政權的。
The officer reined in his horse at a crossroads.
軍官在十字路口勒住了馬。
You must learn to rein in your temper.
你必須學會控制你的脾氣。
He reined in as he approached the busy road.
他在靠近繁忙的公路時勒馬緩行。

title: blunt
sections: 耿直的，直率的；直言不諱的
Let me ask a blunt question.
允許我問一個直率的問題。
藥使得他的感覺遲鈍了。
You'll blunt the scissors if you use them to cut card.
用剪刀剪硬紙板，你會把剪刀弄鈍的。

title: applaud
sections: The audience applauded the singer for three minutes.
觀眾向歌唱家鼓掌喝采達三分鐘。
We applauded him for his courage.

title: compulsory
sections: 必須做的；義務的；必修的
Education is compulsory for children in most countries.
多數國家對兒童實施義務教育。

title: outlaw
sections: He was accused of giving shelter to a hunted outlaw.
The motor vehicle becomes an outlaw on the highways if operated without new registration.
機動車輛未經重新註冊在公路上開是非法的。
When was slavery outlawed in that country?
那個國家何時宣布奴隸制為非法？
剝奪……的法律保護；使在法律上失效；禁止，限制
I hope the sale of tobacco will be outlawed someday.
我希望有朝一日菸草製品會禁止銷售。
將……放逐；宣布……為不法之徒
The government will outlaw the rebels unless they surrender immediately.
除非反叛分子立即投降，否則政府將宣布他們為不法之徒。

title: scarce
sections: Food and fuel were scarce in this region.
這地區食物和燃料都很缺乏。
年代久的郵票是珍貴的。

title: grasp
sections: The little girl grasped her mother's arm.
小女孩抓住了她母親的手臂。
He will grasp at anything that might help him achieve fame.
他會搶著做任何有助於他成名的事情。
He held my hand in a friendly grasp.
他友好地緊緊握著我的手。
His ideas are beyond my grasp.
Victory seemed within the team's grasp.
勝利對這個隊看來垂手可得。
She is in the grasp of a wicked man.
她受到一個惡人的控制。

title: monument
sections: This monument was erected in memory of F.D. Roosevelt.
這座碑是為紀念F.D.‧羅斯福而建立的。
The ruins of the castle are an ancient monument, which the government pays money to preserve.
這一城堡廢墟是古代的遺跡，政府出錢加以保存。
Shakespeare's plays remain as monuments to his genius.
莎士比亞的戲劇是他天才的不朽著作。

title: subtle
sections: 微妙的，難捉摸的，不可思議的
I noticed a subtle change in his attitude.
我注意到他的態度發生了微妙的變化。
Jimmy was a subtle worker in gold and silver.
吉米是一個技藝精湛的金銀匠。
This enabled us to see through their subtle scheme.
這使我們得以識破他們的詭計。
The novelist has a subtle insight into human nature.
那位小說家對人性具有敏銳的洞察力。

title: despair
sections: He despairs of winning a scholarship.
他已不抱贏得獎學金的希望了。
So long as you help me, I shall never despair.
只要你幫我，我決不會失望。

title: partial
sections: 部分的，局部的；不完全的 [Z]
The film was only a partial success.
這部電影僅僅是部分成功。
【貶義詞】 不公平的，偏袒的 [（+to/towards）]
She is partial to her youngest boy.

title: adversity
sections: 逆境；厄運；(經濟方面的) 窘境 [U]
A good friend will not desert one in time of adversity.
好朋友不會在人遭到厄運時棄之不顧。
他在國外遭遇種種不幸。

title: diagnose
sections: He is only forty years old, but he has been diagnosed with diabetes.
他才四十歲，但已被診斷出有糖尿病。

title: pray
sections: They prayed that they would defeat their enemies soon.
他們祈禱很快打敗敵人。
The old farmer prays God's forgiveness.
The citizens are praying that the war will cease soon.
居民們祈禱戰爭快快結束。
I pray you to show mercy to the child.
我懇請你對這孩子仁慈一點。
The athletic meet is on Saturday, so we're praying for a fine day.
學校的運動會是星期六，所以我們虔心祈求好天氣。
They knelt down and prayed to God for help.
他們跪下，祈求上帝保佑。

title: weary
sections: She grew weary of staying home.
老待在家中，她感到厭煩了。
使人疲倦的；使人厭煩的
It was a long, weary journey.
那是一個漫長的，令人疲憊不堪的旅程。
Some programs on television have degenerated into weary repetitions of each other.
某些電視節目愈來愈糟，沉悶乏味，相互雷同。
長途旅行使我們疲憊不堪。
Eventually I wearied of the bureaucratic infightings.
我終於對官場的鉤心鬥角感到厭煩了。

title: horizon
sections: The sun has risen above the horizon.
At last, they saw an island on the horizon.
終於他們見到地平線上有一個島。
(知識，經驗等的) 範圍；眼界；視野 [C]

title: bind
sections: They bound him to a stake with a strong rope.
他們用一根結實的繩子將他綁在一根柱子上。
The book was bound in blue leather.
那本書是用藍色的皮革裝訂的。
The contract binds me to complete the work within two months.
這合同使我必須在兩個月內完成這項工作。
The mixture won't bind without water.
這種混合料不加水黏合不起來。
This coat binds through the shoulders.
Their refusal to sign the contract has put us in a bind.
他們拒絕在合同上簽字，這使我們處於困境。

title: ashamed
sections: She was ashamed of having failed in the examination.
她因考試不及格而感到羞愧。
恥於……的，因難為情而不願……的 [+to-v]
She was ashamed to tell anyone that she had fallen in love with him.
她羞於告訴任何人自己愛上了他。

title: sow
sections: He plowed the land and then sowed the seeds.
The farmer sowed the field with wheat.
農夫在地裡播上小麥種子。
He tried to sow discontent among us.
他企圖在我們中間散布不滿情緒。
The farmers here sow once a year.
這裡的農民一年播一次種子。

title: illusion
sections: He is under the illusion that his position is secure.
他誤以為他的地位很穩固。
Extreme heat can create an illusion of water on a highway in the summer.
盛夏酷暑會造成公路上有水的幻覺。

title: bend
sections: He bent the iron bar as if it had been made of rubber.
他將鐵棍折彎，彷彿那是用橡皮做成的。
The boys bent their attention on making model ships.
男孩們聚精會神地製作船舶模型。
She tried to bend her husband to her wishes.
她設法使丈夫順從她的願望。
All eyes were bent on me.
所有的目光都注視著我。
The road bends to the right.
The nurse bent down and kissed the child.
護士彎下身子吻了孩子一下。
There is a sharp bend in the road here.
這段路上有一處急轉彎。

title: awaken
sections: I awakened early because of the noise.
我因那嘈聲很早就醒了。
awaken somebody to a sense of duty

title: knit
sections: She's knitting her father a sweater.
The Chinese community is knit together by common interests.
共同的利益使華人社區團結起來。
He knitted his brows in deep thought.
他的斷骨很快就癒合了。

title: prevail
sections: His argument prevailed and I yielded.
他的論點佔了上風，我讓步了。
This custom prevails over the whole area.
這一習俗在整個地區盛行。

title: vigorous
sections: The nest held three vigorous young birds.
這窩裡有三隻活潑的小鳥。

title: delicate
sections: Take care with these delicate flowers.
需要小心處理的；微妙的；棘手的
In such a delicate situation I have to weigh my words.
在這樣微妙的情形下，我必須斟酌一下我的話。
她有著長而纖細的手指。

title: tariff
sections: The government is going to lower the tariff on imported cars.
政府打算降低進口汽車的關稅。
May I see your tariff, please?
請你給我看看價目表，好嗎？

title: swear
sections: They refused to swear on a Bible.
他們拒絕手按《聖經》發誓。
What is the woman swearing at?
Before giving evidence you have to swear an oath.
在作證之前你得先發誓。
The witness swore to tell the truth.
He swore that he had never talked with the girl.
他發誓說，他從未與那個姑娘說過話。
You must swear him to silence.
你一定要他發誓保持沉默。
The new president will be sworn in January.
新總統將在一月份宣誓就職。
He swore treason against his friend.
他宣誓對他的朋友犯有叛國罪作證。

title: heritage
sections: We must take care to preserve our national heritage.
我們必須注意保護自己的民族遺產。
生來就有的權利；長子繼承權
他出生在一個貧困家庭。

title: confine
sections: We'll confine our discussion to the main issue.
我們將只討論主要問題。
He was confined to bed by illness.

title: appetite
sections: Exercise gave her a good appetite.
At the moment she had no appetite for gossip.

title: dismay
sections: To his dismay, James saw a tear steal down her cheek.
令詹姆士驚愕的是，他看到一顆淚珠從她面頰上悄悄滾落。
The teacher was dismayed at the students' lack of response.
老師對學生的毫無反應感到沮喪。

title: glimpse
sections: She drew aside the window-curtain and had a glimpse of the river.
她拉開窗簾，瞥見了那條河。
I had a glimpse of her feeling.
我隱約感受到她的感情。
There was a glimpse of truth in what he said.
他的話中略微道出了一點事實真相。
He glimpsed at my new watch and said it was a good bargain.
他看了一眼我的新表，說買得很上算。
They glimpsed a village through the trees.
他們透過林隙隱約看見一個村莊。

title: warrant
sections: He had no warrant for his action.
【法律】 授權令；逮捕狀；搜查令 [C]
The police must obtain a warrant from a judge in order to search a house.
警察必須從法官處取得搜查令才可搜查房子。
He had no warrant for his suspicion.
委任書；委託書；證書；憑單 [C]
Have you got a warrant of fitness for your car?
你有沒有一張汽車合格證書？
向……保證，保證（貨物）的品質；擔保 [O8] [O5] [+（that）]
The storekeeper warranted the goods as of the first quality.
店主保證貨物品質第一。

title: hatch
sections: The eggs are hatched by the heat of the sun.
這些卵被太陽的熱力所孵化。
They hatched up a plot to overthrow the government.
Three eggs have already hatched out.
There are twelve chickens in this hatch.

title: discriminate
sections: Can you discriminate good apples from bad ones by their appearance?
你能根據外表辨別好蘋果和壞蘋果嗎？
The ability to think discriminates humans from other animals.
思維能力使人區別於其他動物。
It is important to teach children to discriminate between right and wrong.
教育小孩區分是非很重要。
有差別地對待 [（+against/in favor of）]
Our teacher never discriminates in favor of brighter pupils.
我們的老師從不給優生以特殊對待。

title: courtesy
sections: He wrote back to her out of courtesy.
他出於禮貌給她寫了一封回信。

title: massacre
sections: The second round was a complete massacre.
第二個回合是十足的慘敗。
The German fascists massacred almost all the Jews in town.
德國法西斯分子幾乎殺光了城裡的猶太人。
How did you manage to massacre your strong opponent?
你是如何設法徹底擊敗勁敵的？

title: wander
sections: During the storm the ship wandered from its course.
船在風暴中偏離了航道。
(精神) 錯亂；(思想) 混亂；失神，開小差
The stream wanders through the forest.
The poet wanted to wander those countries on his own.
詩人想獨自漫遊那些國家。

title: anonymous
sections: 出自無名氏之手的；來源不明的
An anonymous author wrote this book.
這本書出自無名氏之手。
無特色的，無個性特徵的

title: exotic
sections: We saw pictures of exotic birds from the jungle of Brazil.
我們看到了來自於巴西熱帶雨林的各種奇異鳥類的照片。

title: obligation
sections: (道義上或法律上的) 義務；責任 [C] [U] [（+to）] [+to-v]
We were under obligation to finish the work in a satisfactory way.
我們有義務圓滿地完成工作。
You are under no obligation to buy the house if you have not signed a purchase agreement.
如果你沒有簽訂購買合同，就不一定非買這房子不可。
Our parents fulfilled their obligation to support us.
父母親盡到了撫養我們的責任。
I will take care that my obligations to you shall be amply repaid.
我一定會加倍報答您對我的恩惠。
The builder failed to fulfill the terms of his obligation.
營造商未能履行合同的條款。
The lawyer drew up a legal paper discharging him from all obligations.
律師擬定了一份法律文件，免除他所有的債務款項。

title: skip
sections: (輕巧地) 跳來跳去，蹦蹦跳跳
The child skipped along at his granny's side.
小孩蹦蹦跳跳地走在奶奶一旁。
Every time the record comes to that part of the music, the needle skips.
每當唱片轉到音樂的那一部分，唱針就會跳過去。
The speaker kept skipping from one subject to another.
演講者老是從一個題目跳到另一個題目。
He skipped through the accounts before dinner.
他在飯前匆匆翻閱了一下帳目。
The stone skipped over the water.
石塊打著水面漂削而過。
She skipped off without paying her bill.
The boys liked to skip stones on the lake.
男孩子喜歡在湖面上用石子打水漂。
She skipped the jargon when she read the popular science magazine.
她讀那本通俗科學雜誌時把其中的術語跳過未讀。
I could skip every lecture for a month and still graduate.
我可以一個月不去上課還照樣畢業。
Her son skipped the second grade.
她兒子從一年級跳到三年級。
The child gave a skip of joy.
I read the book without a skip.
我從頭至尾閱讀了那本書。
He read the lengthy report without a skip.
他從頭至尾讀了那份冗長的報告。

title: brand
sections: This brand of tea is my favorite.
(某人特有的) 一種（風格，舉止等） [（+of）]
He has his own brand of humor.
The brand of a coward is a liability in a military career.
懦夫的汙名對戎馬生涯是不利的。
All cattle on the farm were branded with the letter A.
這農場所有的牛都烙上"A"的印記。
The press branded him a liar.
新聞界加給他騙子的醜名。
The bitter lesson is branded on his memory.
那個慘痛的教訓深深銘刻在他記憶中。

title: carbon
sections: I want two carbons for our files.

title: fracture
sections: The fracture of his left leg is very serious.
他的左腿骨折情況很嚴重。
Perhaps there is a fracture in the water pipe.
使破裂；使斷裂；使折斷；使骨折
The boy fell from a tree and fractured his arm.
那個男孩從樹上摔了下來折斷了胳膊。
His reputation for integrity was permanently fractured.
他那剛正不阿的聲譽被永遠地毀了。

title: soak
sections: She soaked the dirty clothes in cold water.
她將髒衣服浸泡在冷水裡。
We were soaked to the skin by the heavy rain.
大雨淋得我們渾身濕透。
The sponge soaked in the water on the desk.
海綿將書桌上的水吸了進去。
I put the shirt in soapy water to soak out the stain.
我將襯衫浸在肥皂水裡以去除汙漬。
He went to a bar and soaked himself.
他去酒吧喝得酩酊大醉。
She soaked herself in detective stories.
她沉湎於偵探小說之中。
【口語】 向……敲竹槓；向……徵重稅
He admitted he had been soaked in the deal.
他承認在這筆生意中他被敲了竹槓。
Give the clothes a long soak before washing.
洗之前先將衣服多泡一些時間。

title: artistic
sections: 藝術的；美術的；唯美（主義）的
He was conscious of the artistic value of his plays.
他知道他劇作的藝術價值。
富有藝術性的，精美的，精彩的
This is an artistic flower arrangement.
有藝術鑑賞力的；有藝術天賦的

title: foul
sections: The foul air is unfit to breathe.
骯髒的空氣不適宜呼吸。
The guests were shocked by the boy's foul language.
男孩的粗話使客人們感到震驚。
(天氣等) 惡劣的；(風) 逆的
The foul weather spoiled our vacation.
惡劣的天氣把我們的假期糟踏了。
他用不正當手段對待對手。
The footballer was cautioned for a foul on an opponent.
那個足球運動員因對對手犯規而受到警告。
油汙使這條排水管壅塞了。
那個籃球運動員又犯規了。

title: volcano
sections: Six other volcanos were still erupting.
還有六個火山仍在爆發。
No one knows when the social volcano below modern society will erupt.
誰也不知道埋在現代社會下的社會火山何時爆發。

title: aftermath
sections: 後果，餘波；事件結束後的一段時期 [S1] [（+of）]
Many people were homeless in the aftermath of the earthquake.
地震之後，許多人無家可歸。

title: compound
sections: "Broad-shouldered" is a compound word. "Broad-shouldered"是個複合字。

title: default
sections: be in default on a loan
不參加（比賽）；(中途) 棄權
The other team didn't arrive, so our team won by default.
由於對方球隊未到，我隊以其棄權而獲勝。
A default judgment was issued against the defendant.
Let's both try not to default on our commitments.
讓我們雙方一起努力，不違反自己的承諾。
不出場；不參加；不到案；棄權
The player defaulted in the tournament because of her injury.
在這次循環賽中，這位運動員由於受傷而棄權。

title: heap
sections: This heap of dirty clothes is for the laundry.
這堆髒衣服是準備要送洗的。
I have heaps of work to do.
The table was heaped with food.
They heaped more food on my plate than I could eat.
他們在我的盤子上堆了很多食物，我吃都吃不完。
He disapproves of heaping praise on young artists.
他不贊成對年輕的藝術家大加讚揚。
Garbage heaped up behind the house.

title: obscure
sections: The room is too obscure for reading.
模糊的；含糊不清的；晦澀的，難解的 [（+to）]
The meaning of the passage is obscure.
He came from an obscure mountain village.
他來自一個偏僻的山村。
It is written by an obscure young poet.
這是一位不知名的年輕詩人寫的。
The moon was obscured by the clouds.
His difficult style obscures his meaning.
他深奧的文體使他的意思晦澀難懂。
His success obscured his earlier failures.
他的成功為他早先的失敗遮了醜。

title: sinister
sections: A sinister expression appeared on his face when I called him a liar.
當我稱他為騙子時，他的臉上出現了一個凶惡的表情。

title: precise
sections: I can't give you a precise date.
我無法告訴你確切的日期。
His instructions were not very precise.
We had precise orders to come home by nine o'clock.
我們得到嚴格的命令須於九點前回家。
He was very precise in his manners.
他的一言一行都有板有眼。
At the precise moment the train started.

title: reinforce
sections: The general reinforced the fort with more troops.
將軍派更多的軍隊增援要塞。
強化，加深；使更具說服力
Newspapers like this tend to reinforce people's prejudices.
像這樣的報紙往往加深人們的偏見。

title: upright
sections: He was a tall upright old man.
他是一個個頭高大，腰桿筆挺的老人。
Move the machine in an upright position.
We are upright in our business dealings.
The guards stood upright at the gate.
衛兵筆直地站立在門前。

title: allure
sections: 引誘，誘惑；(強烈地) 吸引
The fine weather allures the ladies into the garden.
晴朗的天氣吸引女士們來到花園裡。
Do you feel the allure of the sea?
你是否感受到海洋的魅力？

title: dictate
sections: Afterwards he dictated a few letters to her.
之後他對她口授了幾封信。
The police dictated where the large, noisy crowd should stand during the parade.
警察指定在遊行時那一大堆喧鬧的人群應站的位置。
I won't have him dictating to me.
我不要他對我發號施令。

title: casual
sections: My car had stalled and I sought help from casual passers-by.
我的車發動不起來了，我就向碰巧路過的人求助。
He worked as a casual laborer and did not earn much.
他當臨時工，沒有賺多少錢。

title: epidemic
sections: Buying goods on the installment plan has become epidemic in recent years.
近幾年來，用分期付款的辦法購物十分流行。

title: roar
sections: (獅，虎等) 吼叫；(風等) 呼嘯；(雷，砲等) 轟鳴
Day and night heavy trucks roared past their houses.
重型卡車日夜不停地從他們家呼嘯而過。
大聲叫喊；狂笑；大聲歌唱 [（+at/with）]
The sergeant roared at his men.
吼，嘯；怒號；轟鳴聲；喧鬧聲
The little girl was frightened by the tigers roars.
小女孩被老虎的吼叫聲嚇壞了。
A roar of laughter greeted our ears.
一陣大笑聲傳入我們耳中。

title: unanimous
sections: 全體一致的；一致同意的；無異議的
People were unanimous in support of the peace effort.
人們一致支持為和平所作的努力。
It turned out that she was elected by a unanimous vote.

title: poll
sections: 民意測驗，民調；民意測驗記錄 [C]
We are going to conduct a public opinion poll.
Women were excluded from the poll.
婦女被排斥，不讓參加選舉。
He was returned at the head of the poll.
Few blacks went to the polls.
幾乎沒有黑人去投票選舉。
Your name is on the poll.
他抓了抓他那頭髮花白的腦袋。
A majority of those polled were worried about inflation.
接受民意測驗中的大多數人擔心通貨膨脹。
(候選人等) 獲得（若干票數）
He polled 54 percent of the votes.
他獲得百分之五十四的選票。
We polled the members about the change in rules.
我們就規則的變化請全體成員投票。

title: halve
sections: The store halved its prices during the big sale.
大拍賣期間這家店的價格減半。

title: bland
sections: The friendly salesman had a bland smile.
那個友善的推銷員面帶和藹的笑容。
The sick woman had only bland food.
那個生病的婦人只吃無刺激性的食物。
淡而無味的；枯燥乏味的
缺乏情節而枯燥乏味的故事

title: enclose
sections: The palace is enclosed by a high wall.
A white fence enclosed the house.
房子周圍有一圈白色的籬笆。

title: insert
sections: He inserted the wooden peg into the hole.
The book would be improved by inserting another chapter.
這本書如果再插入一個章節就更好了。
They inserted an advertisement in the newspaper.
他們在這家報紙上刊登一則廣告。
She inserted a patch in the sleeve.

title: shrink
sections: This dress material shrinks in the wash.
The boy shrank into a corner when the bully threatened to beat him.
惡棍威脅說要揍那男孩，男孩便退縮到一個角落裡。
When his influence began to shrink, his wealth also decreased.
當他的影響縮小時，他的財富也減少了。
Shortage of hands has shrunk our plant's yearly output.
人手不足已使我們廠的年產量減少。

title: consecutive
sections: It has rained for four consecutive days.

title: hollow
sections: These chocolate eggs are all hollow.
這些巧克力蛋都是空心的。
He was thin and his cheeks were hollow.
他很瘦，連面頰都凹陷了下去。
We heard a hollow boom of thunder.
我們聽到低沉的隆隆雷聲。
虛偽的；空洞的，無價值的
他的發言聽上去很空洞。
We filled the hollow in the drive.
我們把車道上的坑填平了。
Let's have a picnic down in the hollow.
咱們到下面的山谷去野餐吧。
He hollowed out a small dip in the ground.
他在地上挖出了一個小坑。

title: momentum
sections: The truck gained momentum as it rolled down the steep road.
卡車沿著陡峭的道路往下開時，衝力愈來愈大。
Building momentum is very important in any kind of sports games.
在任何一種運動比賽中，建立推動力是非常重要的。

title: tease
sections: The dog may bite you if you keep teasing him.
要是你不停地逗惹那條狗，它也許會咬你。
He hates to be teased about his balding head.
他不喜歡人家取笑他的禿頭。
He suspected that Laura was teasing him.
他懷疑羅拉是在挑逗他。
She has been teasing her mother all morning for a new dress.
她整個上午纏著她媽媽要一件新的洋裝。
Don't take it seriously -- he was only teasing.
別當真，他只是在戲弄你。
愛戲弄人的人；愛糾纏的小孩
She is a big tease, but she doesn't mean anything by it.
她很愛戲弄人，但她並沒有什麼惡意。
Be careful, that girl is a real tease; she's the town heart-breaker.
小心，那是一個愛賣弄風騷的女孩，她是鎮上專傷男人心的人。

title: litter
sections: There were piles of litter on the streets.
街上有一堆一堆的廢棄物。
Her room was in such a litter that she was ashamed to ask me in.
她的房間十分雜亂，她不好意思請我進去。
(豬，狗等生下的) 一窩（仔畜） [C] [G]
A female rat may have five or six litters yearly, and an average of nine per litter.
一隻雌鼠每年可產幼仔五至六窩，平均每窩九隻。
Don't litter up the floor with scraps of paper.
The fire-place was littered with cigarette butts.

title: pending
sections: He knew my examination was pending.
他知道我的考試就要來臨。
Pending his return, let us get everything ready.
讓我們在他回來之前把一切準備就緒。 pend的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ pend)

title: devil
sections: Her aunt said she was possessed by devils.
她姑媽說她被魔鬼迷住了。
The poor devil had another heart attack last night.
那個可憐的人昨晚心臟病又發作了。
【口語】 (用來加強語氣) 究竟，到底 [the S]
Kitty deviled her mother for a doll.
基蒂纏著她媽媽要個洋娃娃。

title: peculiar
sections: He looked at me with a very peculiar expression.
他用一種奇特的眼神看著我。
(個人或團體) 特有的，獨具的；獨特的 [（+to）]
This style is peculiar to him.
I have my own peculiar way of doing things.
我有自己獨特的做事方式。
It is a matter of peculiar interest.
這是一件有特殊意義的事。
I'm feeling a bit peculiar -- I think I'll go and lie down.
我感到有點兒不舒服，我想我要去躺一躺。

title: rot
sections: 未放進冰箱的食品腐爛了。
Without patriotism the nation will rot.
沒有愛國精神，國家就要腐敗。
使腐爛，使腐壞；使破損；使腐朽 [（+away/down）]
A strong household bleach might rot the fibers.
強力家用漂白劑可能會破壞衣物的纖維。
We should stop it the minute the rot sets in.
腐敗一產生，我們就應立即制止住。

title: assure
sections: I can assure you of the reliability of the information.
我向你保證這消息可靠。
The captain of the ship assured the passengers that there was no danger.
船長向乘客保證沒有危險。
We assured our clients of an enjoyable holiday.
我們使遊客確信準能過一個愉快的假期。
They assured themselves that the bridge was safe before crossing it.
他們直到弄清楚那座橋確實安全後才通過。

title: possess
sections: The country possesses rich mineral deposits.
這個國家擁有豐富礦藏。
Though plain-looking, Mary is possessed of great intelligence.
雖然相貌平平，瑪麗卻擁有智慧。
One main idea possessed her; she must get away from home.
她只有一個想法；她一定要離家出走。
He was almost possessed by a devil.

title: undergo
sections: You may have to undergo disappointment and failure before experiencing success.
你在嚐到成功的滋味之前，也許得忍受失望與失敗。
All the freshmen will undergo a physical examination.
所有新生都將接受體格檢查。

title: dispose
sections: They disposed troops along the river.
The good pay disposed him to take the job.
高薪使他接受了這份工作。
I want to dispose of these old books.

title: grind
sections: The flour was ground from barley.
I have to grind the knife; it is blunt.
He ground his teeth in anger.
Heavy tanks ground through the square.
重型坦克嘎嘎地穿過廣場。
He is grinding away for the examination.
他正在拼命用功準備考試。
【口語】 苦差使；單調的事；苦學 [U] [S1]
Hans finds learning Chinese a grind.
漢斯覺得學習漢語是件苦事。

title: polish
sections: He polished his spectacles with a handkerchief before answering.
回答之前，他用手帕擦拭了一下眼鏡。
The speaker spent several days polishing her lecture.
演講者花了幾天時間潤飾她的演講稿。
You should use wax polish on wooden furniture.
你應在木製傢俱上打上蠟。
A hot plate will spoil the polish on this table.
熱盤子會毀壞桌面的光澤。
Four years of college gave her considerable polish.
四年的大學教育使她更加完美。

title: brisk
sections: She spoke in a brisk tone of voice.
變得輕快；活躍起來；興旺起來 [（+up）]
I believe that the market will brisk up.
我相信市場會活躍起來。

title: convenient
sections: Please come whenever it is convenient to you.

title: estate
sections: He is a real estate agent.
他是一個房地產經紀人。
When his father died, he left an estate of one million dollars.
他父親去世時留下了一百萬元遺產。
Her family was of high estate.
There is no reason to believe that people of every estate will support the political platform.
沒有理由相信社會各階層的人都會擁護這個政綱。

title: slope
sections: The floor of the theater has a slope of four feet from the back seats to the front seats.
這戲院的地板從後排座位到前排座位有四英尺的傾斜。
It is dangerous to climb up a steep slope.
The land slopes gently towards the sea.
這地勢緩緩向海面傾斜。
They sloped the ground so that the water can run away.
他們將地面鋪得有坡度以便水能流瀉。

title: aspiration
sections: He has no aspiration for fame or gain.
She has aspirations to become a great writer.
the aspiration of "p" in "pin" "pin"中"p"的送氣發音

title: forthcoming
sections: When she was asked why she was late, no answer was forthcoming.
當問她為什麼遲到時，她沒有給予回答。
The girl at the reception desk was not very forthcoming.
接待處的那位小姐服務不太熱心。

title: disadvantage
sections: His lack of education was a disadvantage when he looked for a job.
他缺少教育，這在找工作時是一個不利條件。
Not studying will be to your disadvantage.

title: contrary
sections: His views are contrary to mine.
(天氣) 不利的；(風) 逆向的
The garden party was put off because of the contrary weather.
由於天氣不好，園遊會延期了。
He produced no evidence to the contrary.
他沒有拿出相反的證據。
You didn't bother me. On the contrary, I like your company.
你沒有打擾我，相反地，我喜歡有你作伴。
反面；對立面，對立的一方 [C]
Contrary to expectation, he didn't win in the contest.
與預期相反，他在競賽中沒有獲獎。

title: legacy
sections: His uncle left him a legacy of $50,000.
他叔父給他留下五萬元遺產。
Books are the legacies that a great genius leaves to mankind.
書是偉大的天才留給人類的精神財富。

title: propaganda
sections: 宣傳，宣傳活動（或計畫，方法） [U]
There has been a lot of anti-war propaganda.

title: specimen
sections: This is a specimen of the new fabric.
It was a specimen of his generosity.
這是他慷慨大度的一個實例。
His hobby is collecting butterfly specimens.
他的業餘愛好是採集蝴蝶標本。
You'll be asked to provide a blood specimen.
【口語】 (與形容詞連用) 傢伙，怪人

title: revenge
sections: The people of the village took revenge on the thieves by beating them with sticks.
村子裡的人們用棍棒打竊賊報復。
He wanted revenge for his father's murder.
他要為遇害的父親復仇。

title: chilly
sections: 冷颼颼的；冷得使人不舒服的
It grew chilly when the fire went out.
The governor was given a chilly welcome when he arrived at the factory.
州長來到那家工廠時受到冷淡的歡迎。

title: gust
sections: The wind was blowing in gusts.
In a gust of uncontrollable anger he broke the picture in pieces.
一陣盛怒之下，他將畫撕成碎片。
The wind will gust up to 40 miles an hour.
陣風勁吹，時速將達每小時四十英里。

title: dental
sections: I had undergone a major dental operation.
我經受了一次牙科大手術。

title: bold
sections: Mr. Jordan made a bold speech.
喬丹先生做了一次大膽的演講。
She was hurt by his bold remark.
她被他唐突無禮的話所傷害。
His drawings were done in a few bold lines.
他的畫以幾筆粗線揮就。
He drew on his bold imagination in composing music.
他憑借自由馳騁的想像力作曲。

title: funeral
sections: 【口語】 (與個人有關的) 麻煩事，倒霉事 [U]
If you are caught bullying his brother, that's your funeral.
如果你被撞見欺侮他弟弟，那你可要倒霉了。
Funeral customs vary with different religions.
葬儀的習俗因宗教不同而不同。

title: lame
sections: 她因患小兒麻痺症而瘸了。
站不住腳的，無說服力的
那不是一個充分的藉口。
The accident lamed her for life.
那次事故使她終身殘廢了。
The school was lamed by losses of staff.
學校因教職人員流失而開不了課。

title: uphold
sections: Eight columns uphold the big dome.
八根柱子支撐著這個大圓頂。
The coach upheld the referee's decision.
We uphold the principle of racial equality.
我們堅持種族平等的原則。

title: social
sections: Opinions on various social questions differ from person to person.
有關各種社會問題的意見因人而異。
George stayed out of the social life of the school.
喬治置身於該校社交生活之外。
Bees and ants are social insects.
蜜蜂和螞蟻是群居昆蟲。
He was invited to attend a barbecue social last Saturday afternoon.
上星期六下午他應邀去參加一個烤肉聚餐會。

title: haunt
sections: The building was said to be haunted by the ghost of a leper woman.
據說這幢大樓常有一個痲瘋病女人的鬼魂出沒。
(思想，回憶等) 縈繞在……心頭；使困擾 [H]
The grafter was constantly haunted by fear of discovery.
那收賄人因怕被人發覺而經常提心吊膽。
As a girl, she used to haunt the local theater.
小時候，她常去當地那家劇院看戲。
This coffee shop is one of his haunts.
這家咖啡館是他經常出入的地方。

title: relay
sections: He relayed the news to his mother.
他將這個消息轉達給他的母親。

title: itch
sections: I have an itch on my left hand.
They have an itch to travel abroad.
The boys were itching to let off their fireworks.
男孩子們急著想放煙火。
His wool shirt always itches him.
他那件羊毛衫老是弄得他身上發癢。

title: glow
sections: 發白熱光，灼熱；發光，發熱
The remains of the fire glowed for hours.
火的餘燼好幾小時都發著光亮。
(因運動或激動等而) 發熱，發紅；容光煥發 [（+with）]
His face glowed all over with pleasure.
(感情等) 洋溢；(怒火等) 燃燒 [（+with）]
The autumn leaves glowed in the sunshine.
秋日的樹葉在陽光照耀下鮮豔奪目。
Her face has the glow of health.
She felt a glow of pride at her daughter's achievements.
她為女兒的成就感到非常自豪。

title: census
sections: This country has just carried out a census.
這個國家剛剛進行過人口普查。
(經調查而得的) 統計數，記錄
At the 1985 census there were 230 chicken farms in the area.
據一九八五年的調查，該地區有二百三十個養雞場。

title: amiable
sections: The next-door neighbors are amiable people.
隔壁鄰居們都是和藹可親的人。

title: extract
sections: 用力取出；使勁拔出，抽出
He tried to extract his pole from the mud.
他試圖用力將杆子從泥中拔出來。
This substance is extracted from seaweed.
這種物質是從海藻中提取的。
The police extracted some information from the thief.
警察從小偷口中問出了一些情況。
He extracted some sentences from the book.
他從那本書中摘錄了幾個句子。

title: contemplate
sections: He contemplated the problem before making a decision.
他在作出決定前仔細考慮了這個問題。
She lay on the grass, contemplating the high, blue sky.
她躺在草地上，凝視著高高的藍天。

title: manifest
sections: Fear was manifest on his face.
他臉上顯露出恐懼的表情。
She doesn't manifest much desire to marry him.
她沒有表白真想嫁給他的意願。
The speech manifested the truth of the story.
演說證明了這故事的真實性。

title: dignity
sections: He maintained his dignity throughout the trial.
在整個審訊過程中他始終不失尊嚴。
A man's dignity depends not upon his wealth but upon his character.
人高尚與否不取決於他的財富，而取決於他的品格。

title: plea
sections: The prisoner made a plea for mercy.
She left the party on the plea of a headache.
她藉口頭疼離開了晚會。
He entered a plea of "not guilty" to the charges filed against him.
針對對他的指控他提出"無罪"的抗辯。

title: withhold
sections: The dam was too weak to withhold the pressure of the rising water.
水壩不夠牢固，抵擋不住水上漲的壓力。
Visas were withheld from some members of the delegation.
代表團的一些成員被拒發簽證。
The judge suspected the witness was withholding information.
法官懷疑見證人在隱瞞情況。

title: external
sections: They did it in response to external pressures.
他們這麼做是迫於外界的壓力。
She sets great store by external politeness.
This medicine is for external use only.
Our external trade has expanded during recent years.
我國的對外貿易近幾年來有所發展。
外形，外觀；形式；外表狀況 [P]
It is unwise to judge people by externals.

title: assign
sections: Each overseas teacher was assigned a studio.
每位外籍教師都分配到一間套房。
Jack was assigned to the assembly shop of the factory.
傑克被分配到廠裡的裝配間工作。
We cannot assign a cause to these events.
我們無法說明發生這些事件的原因。

title: compel
sections: They often compelled us to work twelve or fourteen hours a day.
他們常常強迫我們每天工作十二或十四小時。
He was compelled by illness to give up his studies.

title: mighty
sections: Once a mighty empire ruled the world.
一個強大的帝國曾統治世界。
The mighty iceberg came into view.
巨大的冰山出現在眼前。
他自以為聰明得不得了。

title: humiliation
sections: the humiliation of having to surrender

title: preoccupied
sections: I was too preoccupied to hear the bell.
當時我出神地想著心事，沒有聽見門鈴響。

title: sphere
sections: The earth is not a perfect sphere.
地球不是一個很圓的球體。
Young as he is, Kerry has become famous in many spheres.
克里雖然年輕，卻已在許多領域出了名。
He has extended his sphere of influence to the world of banking.
他已把自己的勢力範圍擴展到金融界。
She's used to mixing in an altogether different sphere.
她習慣於在一個完全不同的社會階層裡交往。

title: devastate
sections: The earthquake devastated a large part of the city.
地震毀壞了一大部分城市。
I was totally devastated by the news of my mother's death.
母親的死訊徹底擊垮了我。
老師的批評弄得他一蹶不振。

title: discharge
sections: Some factories in this locality still discharge waste water into the river.
這一地區有些工廠仍把廢水排入河中。
My brother was discharged from hospital last week.
He discharged the responsibilities of his job whole-heartedly.
他全心全意地履行自己的職責。
卸（貨物等）；卸下（船）上的貨物 [（+from/of）]
They discharged the cargo at Hong Kong.
The prisoner was glad to get his discharge.
囚犯獲准釋放，感到很高興。
She is competent in the discharge of her duties.

title: immense
sections: 巨大的；廣大的；無邊無際的；無限的
John felt an immense gratitude to Wilson.

title: tangle
sections: The little girl tangled the yarn her mother was knitting.
小女孩把她媽媽在編結的毛線弄得糾結在一起了。
Do you know how he got tangled in the quarrel?
你知道他是怎麼捲入爭吵的嗎？
The power failure had tangled traffic in the city.
斷電使該城的交通陷入混亂。
If I were you, I wouldn't tangle with them.
我要是你，我就不跟他們爭吵。
Her thoughts were in a tangle.
她的思想陷入混亂之中。
There is a tangle of ropes on the deck.
The boys got into a tangle over the rules of the game.
男孩子們在比賽規則上發生了爭吵。

title: acclaim
sections: 批評家們盛讚這齣新戲。
His achievements earned him the acclaim of the scientific community.
他的成就贏得了科學界的讚譽。

title: does   do的動詞一般現在時第三人稱單數變化形式 (→ do1, do2) doe的名詞複數 (→ doe)
defensive
sections: They were very defensive about their party's record on tax reform.
他們為他們的黨在稅制改革問題上的記錄百般袒護。

title: heir
sections: He fell heir to a large fortune.
他成了一大筆財產的繼承人。

title: thrift
sections: She learned from her father the virtues of hard work and thrift.
她從她父親身上學到苦幹和節儉的美德。

title: capital
sections: Dublin is the capital of Ireland.
都柏林是愛爾蘭的首都。
The corporation has enough capital to build another factory.
這家公司有足夠的資金來興建另一家工廠。
There is no capital punishment in some countries.
Proper nouns are spelled with a capital letter.
He came up with a capital idea.
他想出了一個絕妙的主意。

title: induce
sections: Nothing in the world would induce me to do that.
什麼也不能引誘我做那種事。
Her illness was induced by overwork.
她的病是由工作過度引起的。

title: vain
sections: 愛虛榮的，自負的，炫耀的
They made vain attempts to reach the mountaintop.
他們幾次徒然嘗試想攀登山頂。

title: blend
sections: He blended butter and sugar together.
他將奶油和糖混合在一起。
Animals' protective coloring enables them to blend with their surroundings.
動物的保護色使它們能和環境融成一體而不被發現。
This tie blends with your striped suit.
這條領帶同你那套條紋西裝很相配。
These cigarettes are a blend of the best tobaccos.
這些香菸是用最好的菸草混合製成的。

title: detain
sections: Allow me to detain you for a moment.
請允許我耽擱你一會兒。
Well, mother, I won't detain you any longer.
The police detained the man to make further inquiries.
警察拘留了那個人以作進一步的審問。

title: expel
sections: They expelled the journalist from their country.
他們把這個記者驅逐出境。
Water is sucked in at one end and expelled at the other.
水從一端吸進去從另一端排出來。
He was expelled from the club.

title: moan
sections: Each time she moved her head she let out a moan.
她每轉動一下頭，就發出一聲呻吟。
His constant moan is that no one understands him.
他老是抱怨沒有人理解他。
The sick man moaned all night.
The wind came moaning through the trees.
風發著呼嘯聲穿過樹林。
He is always moaning about how tired he is.
他總是抱怨如何如何累。
"I'm so stiff I can't move," she moaned. "我渾身發僵，動彈不得，"她呻吟著說。
He is always moaning his luck.

title: sway
sections: The branches are swaying gently in the wind.
The earthquake caused the wall to sway to the left.
He is swaying between two opinions.
他在兩種意見之間搖擺不定。
起支配作用；處於統治地位
That was the motive that swayed with him.
The wind swayed the branches of the trees.
The weight of the load swayed the boat to the left.
Nothing could sway him from his decision.
沒有什麼能動搖他的決心。
He swayed the biggest nation in the world.
他統治著世界上最大的國家。
The sway of the pail caused some milk to spill out.
桶的搖晃使一些牛奶溢了出來。
The beliefs which now hold sway may one day be rejected.
現在佔主導地位的信仰有朝一日可能會被摒棄。
He is under the sway of his friend.

title: migrant
sections: The Italian navy saved thousands of migrants on the sea.
義大利的海軍在海上拯救了數以千計的移民。

title: disperse
sections: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge.
After school the children dispersed to their homes.
放學後孩子們各自回家去。

title: aisle
sections: (戲院，列車，教堂等座席間的) 通道，走道
He followed the usher down the aisle.
他跟著領座員沿著通道走過去。

title: formidable
sections: A formidable prospect lies ahead of him.
He took on the formidable task of reforming the whole system.
他承擔起改革整個系統的艱鉅任務。

title: sue
sections: She sued the company for racial discrimination.
她以種族歧視為由對公司起訴。
The boy sued his father for mercy.
They sued for breach of contract.
他們以違反合同為由提出訴訟。

title: potent
sections: 強有力的；有權勢的；有影響的
他是一個強有力的統治者。
(藥等) 有效力的，有效能的
A new potent antibiotic will shortly be available.
一種新的高效抗生素不久將在市面銷售。
Mr. Adams produced his potent argument at the meeting.
亞當斯先生在會上提出了有說服力的論點。

title: handy
sections: The school is close to our houses, so it is quite handy for the children.
學校離我們家很近，所以孩子們上學很方便。
A vacuum cleaner is a handy household tool.
吸塵器是一種使用方便的家庭用具。
Henry is never very handy at fixing things.
亨利修東西總有點笨手笨腳。
易於操作（或操縱）的；(船) 易於駕駛的
This new motorcycle is really handy in city traffic.
這部新摩托車在市區的交通中很便利。

title: boundary
sections: The river is the boundary between the two countries.
這條河是兩國的分界線。
With the advance in science, the boundaries of human knowledge are being pushed further out.
隨著科學的發展，人類知識的範圍在不斷擴大。

title: impulse
sections: My uncle bought the house on an impulse.
我叔叔一時衝動買下了那房子。
I used to act out of blind impulse when I was young.
我年輕時常憑盲目的衝動行事。
The signing of the agreements will give an impulse to trade between the two countries.
這些協議的簽訂會促進兩國間的貿易。

title: pierce
sections: One of these gunmen pierced the protective cordon around the President's house.
其中一個持槍人突破了總統住房周圍的警戒線。
We use the machine to pierce holes in the steel sheet.
我們用機器在鋼板上打洞。
(聲音) 進入，響徹；(亮光) 照進，穿透
A ray of sunlight pierced the clouds.
A sharp cry pierced the air.
強烈地影響，深深地打動
Her heart was pierced with grief.
The sword did not pierce very deeply.

title: convey
sections: Passengers are conveyed by bus to the air terminal.
用公車載送旅客前往航空站。
A wire conveys an electric current.
I found it hard to convey my feelings in words.
我覺得難以用言語表達我的感情。
The old farmer conveyed his farm to his son.
老農夫將其農場轉讓給兒子。

title: precaution
sections: I took an umbrella as a precaution.
我帶了一把傘以防下雨。
We have taken necessary precautions against fire.
我們已採取必要的防火措施。

title: vivid
sections: (色彩，光線等) 鮮豔的；鮮明的；強烈的
The actresses were wearing vivid historical costumes.
女演員們穿著鮮豔的古裝。
His fiancee is a vivid young dancer.
他的未婚妻是個活潑的青年舞蹈家。

title: spoil
sections: 這場雨弄得我們的野餐一團糟。
The robbers divided up their spoils.

title: elaborate
sections: 精心製作的；精巧的；詳盡的
They made elaborate costumes for the play.
他們為這齣戲精心製作戲裝。
She made elaborate preparations for the party, but no one showed up.
她為了聚會費心準備，但是一個人也沒來。
She made an elaborate study of Shakespeare's works.
她刻苦研究莎士比亞的著作。

title: astonishing
sections: It was astonishing to everyone that the court had made such a decision.
法庭竟做出這樣的裁決，這使大家驚訝。 astonish的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ astonish)

title: cruel
sections: 令人痛苦的；刻毒傷人的；慘痛的
The death of their beloved son was a cruel blow.
他們的愛子之死是一痛苦的打擊。

title: municipal
sections: 市的；市政的；市立的，市辦的
He is in charge of the municipal housing project.

title: ratio
sections: [C] (plural ratios) 比；比率；【數學】 比例
The ratio of students to teachers is 35: 1.
學生和老師的比率是三十五比一。
The ratio of 15 to 5 is 3 to 1.
十五與五的比率是三比一。
We divided it in the ratio 3: 1.
我們將它分為三與一之比。

title: miniature
sections: He has a miniature of the Eiffel Tower on his desk.
他的書桌上放著一座埃菲爾鐵塔的模型。
Mr. Hunter collects early English miniatures.
漢特先生收藏早期英國人物小畫像。
小型的；微型的；小規模的 [B]
The little girl has miniature furniture for her dolls.
小女孩還有供洋娃娃用的迷你型傢俱。

title: approximately
sections: The time is approximately ten o'clock.
There were approximately fifty people there.

title: fatal
sections: 他犯了一個無可挽回的錯誤。

title: curse
sections: The old woman cursed her enemies.
那位老婦人詛咒她的敵人。
Loneliness in old age is the curse of modern society.
老年孤獨是現代社會的不幸。

title: harsh
sections: 刺耳的；澀口的；刺鼻的；刺目的
The harsh light hurt my eyes.
那耀眼的光線刺痛了我的眼睛。
He had no harsh words or even criticism.
他沒講什麼嚴厲的話，甚至也沒有批評。
He was subjected to the harshest possible conditions.
他遭遇了最艱苦的條件。

title: queue
sections: (人或車輛等的) 行列，長隊
The queue at the ticket window extended all the way to the street corner.
售票窗口的隊伍一直排到街角。
We queued up for the bus.

title: stubborn
sections: 倔強的，頑固的；不聽話的
He is as stubborn as a mule.
The defenders put up a stubborn resistance.
防守將士進行了頑強的抵抗。
This lock's rather stubborn; it needs oiling.
這把鎖很難開；得給它加點油了。
I had a stubborn cold and coughed day and night.
我得了很難治的感冒，日夜咳嗽。
This detergent can remove stubborn stains.
這種去汙劑能去除難洗的汙漬。

title: awkward
sections: 笨拙的；不熟練的，不靈巧的 [（+with）]
She is still awkward with chopsticks.
This machine is awkward to handle.
He asked several awkward questions at the press conference.
他在記者招待會上提了幾個難回答的問題。
不便的，不合適的；尷尬的 [（+for）]

title: creep
sections: 躡手躡足地走；緩慢地行進 [Q]
She crept into the room and kissed the sleeping child.
她悄悄地走進房間，吻了吻睡著的孩子。
不知不覺地到來；漸漸產生 [Q]
A smile crept across her face.
A snake was creeping along the wall.
(由於恐懼，厭惡等) 起雞皮疙瘩，汗毛直豎
The sight of the snake made her flesh creep.
That creep always quarrels with his neighbors.
那個討厭鬼老跟鄰居吵架。
His ghost story gave the children the creeps.
他講的鬼故事使孩子們毛骨悚然。

title: premature
sections: This disease produces premature aging of the brain.
這種疾病使大腦過早衰老。
不成熟的，倉促的，草率的
She was a bit too premature in giving up this job.
她放棄這份工作似嫌太草率。
He ventured a premature opinion at the meeting.
他在會上大膽發表了一個不成熟的意見。
Premature babies are kept alive in incubators.
早產嬰兒放在保溫箱裡保育。

title: allude
sections: 暗示；間接提到；轉彎抹角地說到 [（+to）]
She did not mention Mr. Lee by name, but it was clear she was alluding to him.
她沒提李先生的名字，但她顯然在暗示著他。
He did not even allude to his brother's engagement to Mary.
他兄弟與瑪麗訂婚的事他隻字未提。

title: exquisite
sections: 精美的；精緻的；製作精良的
She bought an exquisite china figurine.
她買了一尊小巧而精緻的瓷塑像。
I couldn't sleep for exquisite pain.
靈敏的，敏銳的；有高度鑑賞力的
The hostess had exquisite taste in clothes.
女主人對衣著十分講究。

title: naive
sections: Peter was laughed at for his naive remarks.
彼得因為講了一些幼稚的話而被嘲笑。
She's surely not so naive as to believe his story.
她肯定不會輕信他編造的故事。

title: slave
sections: There were more slaves than citizens in ancient Athens.
在古代的雅典，奴隸比城鎮自由民多。
奴隸般受控制的人；擺脫不了某種習慣（或影響）的人 [（+to/of）]
They are all slaves to fashion.
他們都是拼命趕時髦的人。
My mother has been slaving away all weekend in the kitchen.
整個週末，我母親一直在廚房裡忙碌。

title: imminent
sections: 那個士兵害怕逼在眼前的死亡。

title: spill
sections: Who spilt ink on my notebook?
誰把墨水潑在我的筆記本上？
He did not want to see any American blood spilt.
他不想看到任何美國人流血犧牲。
I wonder who spilled out the information.
我不知道誰洩漏了這一消息。
The boat upset and spilled the boys into the water.
船翻了，男孩子們全都落水。
咖啡從杯子裡溢了出來。
I saw the motorcycle skid and its rider spill in dust.
我看到摩托車打滑，騎車人跌落在地。
Near midnight crowds started spilling out of bars.
接近午夜時分，大群大群的人從酒吧裡湧出來。
Some would spill in spite of the gang's threats.
儘管有暴力集團的威脅，一些人還是會把消息洩露出來。
Fetch a cloth to mop up the spill.
拿塊抹布把溢出來的東西擦掉。
He had a bad spill trying to ride that horse.
他想騎那匹馬，讓馬給重重摔了下來。
Stocks took a sharp spill in today's trading.
股票在今天的交易中猛跌。

title: delicious
sections: He has a bag of delicious stories.
紅色有黃紋的芳香蘋果

title: faint
sections: A faint blush came into her cheek.
她的臉上出現了淡淡的紅暈。
I haven't the faintest idea what you're talking about.
我一點也不懂你們在談些什麼。
He fainted when he heard the news.
聽到這消息時，他暈了過去。

title: crude
sections: 天然的，生的，未經加工的
The country exports lots of crude oil.
這個國家出口大量原油。
他的粗野舉止觸怒了她。
The great man is said to have been born in a crude hut.
據說那個偉人生於一個簡陋的小屋裡。

title: mold
sections: 模子，模型；鑄模，鑄型；模具
We need to make a mold of this new product so we can mass produce it.
我們需要將產品做出模子才能大量生產。
They are cast in the same mold.
它們是一個模子澆鑄成的。
Women of her mold are easy to see through.
她那種性格的女人是很容易看穿的。
We need more people of his mold.
我們需要更多他那種類型的人。
Children mold figures out of clay.
孩子們用黏土塑造人像。
Western culture has been molded by the Bible.
西方文化的形成受到《聖經》的巨大影響。

title: swell
sections: The newly-arrived refugees swelled the ranks of the unemployed.
新來的難民增加了失業的人數。
The sails swelled out in the wind.
The river was swollen with melted snow.
A brisk wind swelled the sails.
Our boy is doing swell at college.
我們的兒子在大學裡表現出色。
他是位非常出色的教師。
There was a swell in the city's population.
【口語】 衣著時髦的人；風頭人物 [C]
His brother is a swell at boxing.

title: lump
sections: The artist started with a big lump of clay.
藝術家用一大塊黏土開始雕塑。
Vera found a lump in her right breast.
維拉發現右乳有一腫塊。
John dropped two lumps of sugar into his coffee.
約翰在咖啡中放入兩塊糖。
I would like my allowance in a lump sum.
我希望把我的零用錢全數發給我。
把……弄成一團；把……歸併到一起；把……混為一談 [O] [（+together）]
You can't lump all these different things together.
你不可以將所有這些不同的事物統統歸併在一起。
The words lumped in her throat.
笨重地行走；沉重地坐下 [（+along/down）]
The old lady was lumping along in the snow.
老婦人在雪中吃力地行走著。

title: aptitude
sections: Squirrels have an aptitude for storing food.
松鼠有貯存食物的習性。
He skipped the fourth grade because of his aptitude.
他因天資聰穎從三年級跳到了五年級。

title: graze
sections: Cattle were grazing on the meadow.
We graze cattle on our fields.

title: dilute
sections: She diluted the concentrated fruit juice with water.
她攙水沖淡濃縮水果汁。

title: bleak
sections: 荒涼的；無遮蔽的，遭受風吹雨打的
Thousands of trees were planted on the bleak hillside last year.
去年在荒涼的山坡上種了數以千計的樹。
I don't like the bleak winters in Moscow.
我不喜歡莫斯科的嚴冬。
淒涼的，陰暗的，無希望的
This is the bleakest novel I've ever read.
這是我讀過的小說中最乏味的一本。

title: enact
sections: Several bills were enacted at the end of this session of Parliament.
幾項法案在這屆國會的會議結束時被頒布。
They enacted the roles of hero and heroine in the play.
他們在這齣戲中擔任男、女主角。

title: patron
sections: He was lucky to have found a millionaire patron.
他有幸找到了一位百萬富翁贊助人。
We have a special offer for our regular patrons.
我們給予老顧客特別的優惠。
We were effusively welcomed by the patron and his wife.
我們受到老板和他妻子的熱忱歡迎。

title: avenue
sections: Fifth Avenue is a good place for window shopping. (紐約市)
第五街是逛街的好去處。
We explored every avenue but could not find a good solution.
我們什麼方法都試過了，但是找不出好的解決之道。
They explored every avenue but could not find a solution.
他們尋求各種途徑，但仍找不到解決辦法。

title: exclaim
sections: (由於興奮，痛苦，憤怒等) 呼喊；驚叫
She exclaimed in astonishment at the size of the bill.
她看到帳單上的數目嚇得叫起來。
The newspapers exclaimed against the outrageous distortion of truth.
報界強烈譴責對真相無恥的歪曲。
"How beautiful the lake is!" we exclaimed.
我們叫喊著說，"這個湖多美啊！"

title: dubious
sections: (對事物) 半信半疑的，猶豫不決的 [（+of/about）]
I am dubious about accepting the offer of the job.
我猶豫不定是否接受提供給我的那份工作。

title: preview
sections: 預看；預先審查（或檢查）；預習
They sent the recording for our preview.
他們把那錄音送來給我們預先審查。
(戲劇等的) 試演；(影片等的) 試映；(展覽會等的) 預展
We saw a preview of the new movie.
我們看了一部新電影的試映。
The play is due to be previewed tonight.

title: inflict
sections: 給予（打擊）；使遭受（損傷等）；強加
The typhoon inflicted severe damage on the island.
颱風給島上造成重大損失。
Don't inflict your ideas on me.
別把你的想法強加於我。
He inflicted severe penalties on the prisoners.

title: proclaim
sections: They proclaimed that he was a traitor.
The Government proclaimed a state of emergency.
There was a feather on the rock, proclaiming that a bird had been there.
岩石上有一根羽毛，說明有鳥到過那兒。

title: truce
sections: The two armies agreed to a truce.
They refused to sign a truce.
他們拒絕簽訂休戰協定。
(煩惱、爭吵等的) 中止，暫停
The hot weather gave the old man a truce from rheumatism.
熱天使這位老人暫時免受風濕病之苦。

title: dispatch
sections: He dispatched the report to his newspaper.
他將報導發送給他的報紙。
He dispatched an experienced worker to repair the damage.
他派一個有經驗的工人去修理損壞的地方。
迅速處理，迅速了結；匆匆吃完
He dispatched the job in three days' time.
他用三天時間迅速做完這一工作。
He couldn't quite believe the dispatch sent by his reporter.
他不敢相信他的記者發來的報導。

title: breakdown
sections: Our car had a breakdown on the road.
我們的汽車在路上拋錨了。
There has been a complete breakdown of law and order.
法律與秩序已蕩然無存。
(精神、體力等的) 衰弱，衰竭
She has had a nervous breakdown.
The accountant gave a breakdown of the expenses.
會計交出一份開支明細帳。

title: dim
sections: The light is too dim for me to read.
A dim sound came from the next room.
從隔壁房間隱約傳來聲音。
(眼睛) 模糊的，看不清楚的
Her eyesight grew dim with age.
她的視力因年歲的增長而變差了。
He is a bit dim about her sarcastic remarks.
他不太領會她的挖苦話。
The new economic policy dimmed the popularity of the president.
新的經濟政策使總統的聲望下降。
她的眼睛被淚水弄模糊了。

title: sole
sections: He was the sole heir of the large estate.
他是這一大筆遺產的唯一繼承人。
Jim had acquired sole control of the newspaper in 1914.
吉姆於一九一四年就取得了對該報的單獨控制權。

title: ponder
sections: They are pondering what to do next.
他們正在考慮下一步怎麼辦。
他仔細考慮自己的前程。
He pondered the problem for several days.
他對這個問題考慮了好幾天。
She pondered over her next words.
她仔細考慮接下去要講的話。
She pondered long and deeply over the matter.
她就這個問題深思良久。

title: authentic
sections: They found this authentic manuscript of the book from an ancient tomb.
他們從一個古墓裡發現了該書的真正手稿。

title: gleam
sections: A gleam came from the window.
I will not give up even if there is only a gleam of hope.
哪怕只有一線希望我也不會放棄。
The car's headlights gleamed in the distance.
汽車的前燈在遠處閃爍。

title: tablet
sections: (古時以木、象牙等製成的) 刻寫板，簡
Ancient peoples used tablets to write on before paper was invented.
古人在紙發明前用簡在上面寫字。
There is a tablet in memory of those who died.
那兒有一塊碑紀念死去的人。
The doctor told me to take two tablets after every meal.
醫生告訴我每頓飯後服兩片藥。

title: integrity
sections: The integrity of the judge is unquestioned.
這位法官的正直是毫無疑問的。
Our integrity as a nation is threatened.
我們國家的完整性受到了威脅。

title: providence
sections: It seemed like providence that he had escaped from the earthquake.
地震中，他幸免於難，像是上天佑之。

title: thrust
sections: They thrust him into the back room and tied him up.
他們將他推入後房並把他捆了起來。
He thrust the dagger into the guard's side.
他將匕首刺進警衛的腰部。
He thrust the tickets into my hand.
The tree thrusts its branches high.
那樹的枝條往上伸得高高的。
I thrust at him with my sword.
我拿著劍向他猛然刺去。
The woman thrust past me into the room.
那女人從我身邊擠進房間。
A thrust with the pin broke the balloon.
The invading army made a sudden thrust to the north.
入侵部隊突然向北猛攻。
要旨；目標；突出重點；要點 [U] [（+of）]
The practical thrust of the rules is to create an incentive for the networks themselves.
這些規定的實際目的是為網路自身創造一個動力。
He is a man of thrust and energy.
他這人幹勁十足精力充沛。
The direction of the thrust of the rockets is controlled by computer.
火箭推力的方向是由電腦控制的。

title: build
sections: The house is built of wood.
這房子是用木頭建造的。
You should build your arguments on facts.
你的論點應建立在事實的基礎上。
An elephant has a heavy build.

title: glue
sections: Can you glue the broken vase together?
你能把破碎的花瓶黏合起來嗎？
His eyes were glued to the television.
他的眼睛老是盯著電視。

title: soar
sections: Flames were soaring into the sky.
His plane continued soaring at 5000 metres above sea level.
他的飛機一直在海拔五千米的高空飛行。
Great trees soar above to cut out most of the light.
大樹參天，把光線差不多都擋住了。
The prices of new cars have soared.
His ambitions soared to the skies.
A glider can soar for many miles.
滑翔機可以滑行好多英里。

title: disguise
sections: 假扮，偽裝，用作偽裝的東西
I had to get out of that house in disguise.
我不得不化了裝離開那屋子。
Her happy smile was only a disguise for her sadness.
她喜悅的微笑僅僅是為了掩飾她的憂傷。
把……假扮起來；把……喬裝起來 [（+as）]
She disguised herself as a man.

title: realm
sections: The king sought to expand his realm.
He made outstanding contributions in the realm of foreign affairs.
他在外交領域作出了卓越貢獻。

title: soothe
sections: We did not know how to soothe the bereaved mother.
我們不知如何安慰那位喪子的母親。
A hot cloth pressed against your jaw will usually soothe a toothache.
把熱毛巾放在下巴上一般能緩解牙痛。

title: brutal
sections: 殘忍的，冷酷的；野蠻的；粗暴的
It was brutal of him to do that.
他做那種事是很殘忍的。
我們又度過了一個嚴冬。
令人不快卻又無可否認的

title: calculate
sections: He calculated the costs very carefully.
計畫，打算；使適合（某種目的） [H] [+to-v]
His remark was calculated to hurt her.
他的話是故意要傷她的。
【美國英語 】【口語】 以為，認為 [+（that）]
I calculate they will soon arrive.

title: hardy
sections: 能吃苦耐勞的；強壯的；堅強的
他們的孩子非常能吃苦耐勞。
Strawberries are hardy and easy to grow in all soils.
草莓耐寒，各種土壤裡都容易生長。

title: sermon
sections: The minister preached a sermon on humility.
牧師就謙恭的問題布道。
Father gave me a sermon on table manners.
父親就餐桌禮儀問題對我作了一番說教。
The guardian read his ward a sermon on his extravagance.
監護人嚴詞申斥被監護人揮霍浪費。

title: adverse
sections: The expedition encountered adverse weather conditions.
探險隊遇到了不利的氣候條件。

title: digest
sections: The baby is too small to digest meat.
I have digested most of the important points in the book.
我領悟了書中大部分要點。
This is a digest of the week's news.

title: mortal
sections: All things that live are mortal.
It's beyond mortal power to bring a dead man back to life.
要死人復活非凡人所能為。
你死我活的，不共戴天的 [B]
他是我不共戴天的敵人。
She lives in mortal terror of her husband's anger.
她極度害怕她丈夫發脾氣。
No mortal could have survived the fire.
沒有人經歷這場火災而能生還。

title: tenant
sections: Do you own the house or are you a tenant?
你是擁有這幢房子還是租住的？
Birds are tenants of the trees.
This house is tenanted by an immigrant from Asia.
這所房屋為一個來自亞洲的移民所租住。
That old house has not been tenanted for many years.
那幢老房子已經多年無人居住了。

title: neutral
sections: 中立的；中立國的；中立地帶的
He remained neutral during the debate.
I waited, but her eyes were neutral.
我等著她的反應，但她的眼睛沒有露出情感有什麼變化。
The water was of a pale, neutral color.
Cut back the covers of the neutral and live wires about one inch.
將帶電和不帶電的電線頭上的包皮割去約一英寸。
When you start the car, make sure it is in neutral.
確定在空檔才發動車子。
He pushed the handle into neutral.

title: antecedent
sections: 【语音/語言】 (關係代名詞的) 先行詞
The word "man" is the antecedent of "who" in "the man who spoke". "man"這個字是"the man who spoke"中"who"的先行詞。
That was antecedent to this event.

title: conspiracy
sections: crush a conspiracy to smuggle drugs into the country
粉碎偷運毒品入境的密謀

title: inject
sections: 注射（藥液等）[（+into）]；為（某人）注射 [（+with）]
They are injecting him with a new drug.
The doctor injected the drug into my arm.
inject a note of humor into a story

title: disable
sections: He was disabled in the accident.
他在那次事故中成了殘廢。

title: versus
sections: (法律和運動用語，常略作v.或vs.) 對；對抗
The big match tonight is England versus Spain.
今晚的大賽是英格蘭對西班牙。
the problem of determinism versus freedom
決定論與自由論相抗衡的問題

title: architect
sections: Tom is the architect of this building.
湯姆是該建築的設計師。
He was one of the architects of the republic.
他是這個共和國的締造者之一。

title: scent
sections: The scent of the narcissi was in the air.
空氣中散發著水仙花的香味。
The dogs easily picked up the scent of the murderer.
狗毫不費力地嗅出了謀殺者的氣味。
There is a scent of trouble.
He has a keen scent for errors.
他對錯誤有敏銳的察覺能力。
The girl uses too much scent.
那女孩子用的香水過多。
The dog scented a rabbit and ran off after it.
狗嗅到了一隻兔子便追了上去。
James scented something suspicious in this courtesy.
詹姆士發覺這殷勤之中有點可疑。
The air is scented with rose.
空氣裡充滿了玫瑰花的芳香。
She scented her hair with lemon juice.
她將檸檬汁灑在頭髮上。

title: supplement
sections: The money they get from fruit-picking is often a supplement to incomes earned in the town.
他們靠採摘水果所得的錢常常是城裡所掙收入的補貼。
(書籍的) 補遺；附錄；(報刊等的) 增刊，副刊 [（+to）]
The story first appeared in the Times Literary Supplement.
這個短篇小說第一次是發表在《泰晤士報文學副刊》上的。

title: sacred
sections: The Koran is the sacred book of Islam. 《可蘭經》是回教的聖典。
神聖的；不可侵犯的；莊嚴的；鄭重的
祭祀（某神）的；奉獻給……的；專供……用的 [Z] [F] [（+to）]
This monument is sacred to the memory of the Unknown Soldiers.
這一紀念碑是為紀念無名將士而建立的。

title: satisfy
sections: 那個回答不能令她滿意。
Our company will do everything to satisfy our customers.
我們公司將盡一切努力令顧客滿意。
You can't apply for the job until you have satisfied certain conditions.
符合某些條件前，你不能申請這個工作。
Are you satisfied that he is telling the truth?
你能否確信他是在講實話嗎？
她的一番話消除了他的疑慮。
償還（債務等）；履行（義務等）
Both sides strove to satisfy the contract.

title: peel
sections: 削去……的皮，剝去……的殼；替……削（或剝）…… [O1]
His job was to peel potatoes.
他的工作是削馬鈴薯皮。
The Indians peeled the bark from trees to make canoes.
印第安人從樹上剝下樹皮做皮舟。
He peeled off his heavy sweater.
The paint is peeling off the wall.
It got hotter, the boys peeled to get relief.
天氣越來越熱，男孩子們脫去衣服涼快涼快。
She threw the banana peel into the trash can.
她將香蕉皮扔進垃圾筒。

title: eccentric
sections: (人、行為等) 古怪的，反常的
My neighbor is an eccentric young man.
我的鄰居是個古怪的年輕人。
【天文學】 (軌道) 不正圓的；【機械學】 偏心的
The old lady is a bit of an eccentric.
這位老太是個有點古怪的人。

title: rotate
sections: The earth rotates from west to east.
Farmers rotate crops in the fields.
農民在耕地上輪栽農作物。

title: valid
sections: 有根據的；確鑿的；令人信服的
她的論點是站得住腳的。
合法的；有效的；經正當手續的
The ticket is valid for one month.

title: restrain
sections: We restrained the children from playing by the railroad.
我們阻止孩子們在鐵路旁邊玩耍。
The government has taken measures to restrain inflation.
政府已採取措施控制通貨膨脹。

title: rigid
sections: 堅硬的；堅固的；不易彎曲的
The support for the tent is rigid.
The new recruits are not used to the rigid disciplines of the army.
新兵不習慣於軍隊的嚴格紀律。
He is very rigid in his ideas.

title: incline
sections: The road inclines to the left.
I incline to his view on the matter.
我贊同他對這個問題的觀點。
I am inclined to agree with you.
Her remarks inclined me to accept her idea.
她的評論使我接受她的看法。

title: rude
sections: I did not intend to be rude.
People of the Stone Age used rude tools.
石器時代的人使用粗糙簡陋的工具。
未開化的，原始的，野蠻的 [B]
These rude tribesmen live in the rain forest.
這些原始部落人生活在雨林之中。
He told a rather rude joke, and every one looked embarrassed.
他講了一個相當粗俗的笑話，使每個人都非常尷尬。

title: endow
sections: The rich alumnus endowed the college with half of his fortune.
這位富有的校友把其一半的財產捐贈給這所大學。
He is endowed with an inventive mind.

title: majesty
sections: We could not help being impressed by the majesty of the lofty mountains.
高山的雄偉壯麗不能不在我們心目中留下深刻的印象。
The queen was seated on the throne in all her majesty.
女王威嚴地坐在王座上。
Policemen and judges uphold the majesty of the law.
警察和法官維護法律的權威。
We hope to see Her Majesty.
我們希望覲見女王陛下。

title: lick
sections: The cat is licking its fur.
(波浪) 輕拍，輕打；(火焰) 吞捲
The flames were licking the warehouse.
It was easy for our team to lick theirs.
我們隊很容易打敗他們隊。
It licks me how he did it.
我真弄不懂他是怎麼做成的。
(波浪) 輕拍，輕打；(火焰) 竄，燒
The flames are licking out of windows.
He gave the stamp a lick.
The car was moving at a great lick.

title: roast
sections: He roasted a chicken for dinner.
他烤了一隻雞當作晚餐。
They got roasted for losing the game.
他們因比賽失利而遭到嚴厲批評。
The beef is roasting in the oven.
Can we open the window? I'm roasting.
我們能開窗嗎？我都熱死了。
Give the duck a good roast.
We'll do a roast for dinner.
【美國英語 】 野外烤肉聚會 [C]
They had a hot dog roast last Sunday.
他們上星期天舉行了一次烤熱狗野餐會。
He is very fond of roast duck.

title: terminal
sections: We got off at the terminal station.
The terminal examinations will be held in early May.
期終考試將在五月初舉行。
He is suffering from terminal cancer.
(火車，巴士等的) 總站，終站
Work has started on the construction of a container terminal.
貨櫃碼頭的建設已經動工。
The current flows out of the output terminal.
The data will be fed into the computer terminal.

title: resent
sections: He did not appear to resent it.
他好像對此並不生氣。 resend的動詞過去式、過去分詞 (→ resend)

title: petition
sections: A thousand people signed the petition.
一千人在請願書上簽了名。
請求，申請；(向法院遞交的) 申請書 [（+for）]
The neighbours submitted a petition asking the town to put up traffic lights near the school.
鄰居們正式請求市裡在學校附近設置紅綠燈。
She has filed a petition for divorce.
They petitioned the Government for the release of the political prisoners.
他們向政府請願要求釋放政治犯。

title: ecology
sections: 【生物學/生理學/生物化學】 生態學
Ecology is a branch of science that studies the relation between humans and the environment.
生態學是一門研究人類與其環境之間關係的科學。
More attention has been paid to workplace ecology recently.
近來工作環境受到了更多地注意。
【社會學】 社會生態學，人文生態學
Human ecology is a branch of social science.
人文生態學是社會科學的一個分支。

title: liable
sections: Every man is liable to error.
會……的；【美國英語 】【口語】 可能的 [+to-v]
This article is liable to give offence to many people.
這篇文章很可能觸犯許多人。
負有法律責任的，有義務的 [（+for）] [+to-v]
The shipping company will be liable for damage.
運輸公司將對損壞負責。

title: dissolve
sections: The mystery remains to be dissolved.
(議會等) 解散；(婚約等) 取消
The coach dissolved into the blackness.

title: aggravate
sections: 冰水使我的牙痛加重了。
他專橫的態度使我惱火。

title: snatch
sections: He snatched the ball out of my hand.
他把球從我手裡搶走了。
He snatched the girl out of the icy water.
他一把抓住女孩，將她從冰冷的水中救了起來。
I packed, then snatched two hours' sleep.
我打好行裝，然後抓緊時間睡了兩小時。
He snatched at the book but not quick enough.
他想搶走那本書，但動作不夠快。
The thief snatched at the girl's purse.
小偷搶奪那個女孩的錢包。
She snatched at every chance to practice her oral English.
她把握一切機會練習英語口語。
The thief made a snatch at the woman's purse.
小偷試圖搶奪那婦女的錢包。
He had a snatch of sleep sitting in his chair.
他坐在椅子裡稍睡片刻。
We heard snatches of their conversation as they raised their voices from time to time.
當他們不時地提高嗓門說話時，我們聽到了他們談話的片段。
【美國英語 】【俚語】 抓走，綁架
Her father paid a $10,000 ransom to get her back from a snatch.
她父親付了一萬美元贖金將她從綁架中解救出來。

title: pregnant
sections: She was pregnant with her first child.
她懷著她的第一個孩子。
His words were followed by a pregnant pause.
他說完後接著便是意味深長的停頓。
Her eloquent argument was followed by a pregnant silence.
她的滔滔雄辯之後，緊接著的是意味深長的沉默。
He is a man pregnant with ideas.
他是一個思想豐富的人。
His writings are pregnant with poetry.
富於想像力的；有創造力的
一位想像力豐富的科幻小說作者

title: inspiration
sections: 沒有靈感我寫不出東西。
His wife was a constant inspiration to him.
他妻子是不斷鼓舞他前進的人。
After a good night's sleep, he had a brilliant inspiration.
他美美睡了一夜後想到一個絕妙的主意。

title: animate
sections: 使活潑，使有活力，使有生氣
Jim's arrival served to animate the whole party.
吉姆的到來使聚會的整個氣氛活躍了起來。
Her words animated us to greater efforts.
她的話激勵我們做出更大努力。

title: coincide
sections: 我的假期與約翰的假期碰巧在同一時間。
Our opinions did not coincide on this case.
在這個案例上，我們的意見不一致。
His tastes and habits coincide with those of his wife.
他的品味和習慣與他的妻子恰巧一樣。

title: frontier
sections: Everything is quiet on the frontier.
(探索活動的) 新領域；未完全開拓的領域 [P1] [（+of）]
Professor Field is devoted to the exploration of the frontiers of medicine.
菲爾德教授致力於探索醫學研究的新領域。

title: sip
sections: She took another sip of her tea.

title: colony
sections: India was once a British colony.
印度曾是英國的殖民地。
This is the Chinese colony in New York.
這是紐約華僑的聚居區。
【生物學/生理學/生物化學】 集群；群體；菌落 [G]
A colony of gulls inhabits the island.
一群海鷗棲息於這個島上。

title: pulse
sections: The doctor felt her pulse and wrote a prescription.
醫生為她診脈，開了藥方。
有節奏的跳動（或拍打，振動等）
The music's throbbing pulse was giving me a headache.
那樂曲的強烈節拍令我頭痛。
He knew the pulse of the nation.
In radar, the signals used are pulses.
在雷達中，使用的信號是脈衝。
The news sent the blood pulsing through his veins.
The transmitter was pulsed by an electron tube.
電子管使發射器產生脈衝波。

title: weave
sections: Womenfolks in this country are good at weaving rugs.
這個國家的婦女善織地毯。
They weaved a web of lies to fool the people.
他們編造了一套謊言來愚弄人民。
The author wove the incidents together into one story.
作者把那些事件編成一個故事。
A spider is weaving a web under the eaves.
He weaved his way through the crowd.
The river weaves through the woods.
Homespun is a cloth of coarse weave.
土布是一種織得粗糙的布。

title: slump
sections: (突然或沉重地) 倒下，陷落 [Q] [（+down）]
The old man slumped down in a chair.
(物價等) 下跌；(經濟等) 衰落；(健康等) 下降
This brought about a heavy slump in prices.
There was a serious slump in the 1930s.
二十世紀三十年代發生過嚴重的經濟衰退。

title: eligible
sections: 有資格當選的；法律上合格的 [F] [（+for）] [+to-v]
Only citizens are eligible to vote.
(尤指婚姻等) 合適的，合意的
海倫嫁給了一個中意的單身漢。

title: spouse
sections: Jobs are available for spouses on campus and in the community.
校園裡和社區裡有配偶可做的工作。

title: criterion
sections: (判斷、批評的) 標準，準則，尺度 [C]
What criteria do you use when judging the quality of a student's work?
你用什麼標準來衡量學生的學業？

title: preliminary
sections: 預備的；初步的；序言（性）的；開端的 [B]
Preliminary arrangements have been made for the talks.
會談的準備工作已經就緒。
He spent a long time on polite preliminaries.
開始時他的許多時間花在客套上。
These boxers did quite well to get through the preliminaries.
這些拳擊運動員以相當出色的成績通過了預賽。

title: ash
sections: The castle was left in ashes.
這個城堡成了一片廢墟。

title: decent
sections: I only associate with good decent fellows.
我只和正派的好人交往。
體面的；像樣的；還不錯的
For a week he didn't have a decent meal.
他一個星期沒有吃一頓像樣的飯。
親切的；寬容的；樂於助人的
The new manager is pretty decent to us.
新上任的經理對我們相當和氣。

title: linger
sections: Davis lingered for a moment in the bar.
戴維斯在酒吧逗留了一會兒。
The sound lingered in the air.
那聲音在空中持續了好久。
They lingered over coffee and missed the train.
他們慢吞吞喝著咖啡，結果誤了火車。
The old man lingered several months after the heart attack.
老人心臟病發作之後拖了幾個月才去世。
They lingered away the whole evening at the tea-house.
他們在茶館消磨掉整整一個晚上。

title: submit
sections: We'll submit ourselves to the court's judgments.
我們將聽從法庭的裁決。
The metal was submitted to analysis.
He submitted his proposal for urban development to the city council.
他將城市發展建議提交市議會。
I submit that the terms are entirely unreasonable.
我認為那些條件完全不合理。
I submit that more proof is needed to support the case.
我認為這個案子需要更多的證據證實。
She refused to submit to his control.

title: plead
sections: 【法律】 為（案件）辯護；作為答辯提出
The boy pleaded innocence and said he had not stolen the fruit.
那男孩辯稱無罪並說他未曾偷水果。
He pleaded illness as the reason for his absence.
他以生病作為缺席的理由。
I heard him plead in court only once.
我只有一次聽到他在法庭上作辯護。

title: nutrition
sections: Because of his poor nutrition, he has grown weaker and weaker.
他因為營養不良，身體越來越虛弱。

title: deprive
sections: These misfortunes almost deprived him of his reason.
這些不幸的事情幾乎使他失去理智。
The new laws deprived many people of the most elementary freedoms.
新法律剝奪了許多人的最基本的自由。

title: mute
sections: 沉默的；一時說不出話的；不用言語表達的
The prisoner sat mute, offering nothing in his own defence.
那個囚犯一聲不吭地坐著，沒說任何為自己辯護的話。
The child has been mute since birth.
【语音/語言】 (字母) 不發音的，閉鎖音的
The letter "e" in "mouse" is mute. "mouse"中的字母"e"不發音。
那畫家把色彩抹得柔和些。

title: vow
sections: We made a vow to stay friends forever.
My parents are under a vow to go to church every Sunday.
我父母許願，每星期日都去做禮拜。
I vowed never to reveal the secret.
我發誓決不洩漏這一祕密。
She vowed that she would take the matter to court.
她鄭重宣布要把這事訴諸法律。

title: precede
sections: (順序，位置或時間上) 處在……之前
He preceded me as Chairman of the Department.
He preceded his speech with a welcome to the guests.
他演講前先對來賓表示歡迎。

title: descend
sections: You can ride the escalator up but have to descend on foot.
你可以搭電梯上去，但要自己走下來。
The mountain path descends to the lake.
The custom has descended to our day.
這一習俗一直傳到今天。
Bob and his girl friend descended on us for the weekend.
鮑伯和他女友突然來我家過週末。

title: statesman
sections: Abraham Lincoln was a great statesman.
亞伯拉罕‧林肯是一位非常偉大的政治家。

title: render
sections: His stammer rendered him unfit for a teaching job.
他的口吃毛病使他不宜擔任教職。
We are ready to render them assistance.
The conquered rendered tribute to the conqueror.
被征服者向征服者納貢。
The treasurer rendered an account of all the money spent.
會計呈遞了一份開支的清單。
The knights rendered their swords to the victors.
騎士向勝利者交劍投降。
In English the future tense is often rendered by means of auxiliaries.
在英語中，未來式常用助動詞來表現。
作出（判決等）；執行，實施 10 (藝術上) 表現；表演；朗誦；演奏；處理（繪畫等的主題）
Hamlet was poorly rendered by him.
This sentence can not be literally rendered.
【書面語】 (past rendered, pp rendered, present rendering) 報償；酬報 [（+to）]
Render to each according to his work.

title: vital
sections: 生命的；維持生命所必需的 [Z] [B]
Growth and decay are vital processes.
生長和衰亡是生命過程。
充滿活力的，生氣勃勃的
The Chinese I knew were trusting, open, and vital.
我所認識的中國人信賴別人，坦率，充滿活力。
極其重要的，必不可少的 [（+to/for）]
The questions put forward at the meeting are of vital importance.
會上提出的那些問題極其重要。
他犯了一個致命的錯誤。
He was lucky that the bullet missed the vitals.
他很幸運，子彈沒有擊中要害器官。

title: priest
sections: (基督教) 牧師；(天主教) 神父
The priest conducts the church service.
牧師主持教堂的禮拜儀式。

title: betray
sections: That man is capable of betraying his friends.
He would suffer death rather than betray the secret.
他寧死也不肯洩露機密。
Her red face betrayed her nervousness.
她漲紅的臉顯示她很緊張。

title: exaggerate
sections: He exaggerated the importance of the event.
他誇大了這事件的重要性。
Take his words with a grain of salt. He always exaggerates.
對他的話要打折扣聽。他總愛誇張。

title: spontaneous
sections: He made a spontaneous offer of help.
(動作等) 無意識的，不由自主的
Hearing the joke, we burst into spontaneous laughter.
聽到笑話，我們不由自主地大笑起來。

title: bribe
sections: The official was dismissed from office for taking bribes.
They tried to bribe the reporter into silence.
他們試圖收買該記者，不讓他張揚。

title: attendant
sections: One of the difficulties attendant on shift work is lack of sleep.
輪班工作制帶來的困難之一是睡眠不足。

title: blur
sections: Everything becomes a blur when you travel beyond a certain speed.
當你超過一定的速度行進時，一切都變得模模糊糊的。
The letter had many blots and blurs.
信上有許多墨水漬和汙跡。
I blurred my report by spilling milk on it.
我不小心把牛奶潑了出來，弄髒了報告。
他的視線因淚水變得模糊不清。

title: comprise
sections: The medical team comprises five doctors and two nurses.
醫療隊由五名醫生和兩名護士組成。

title: splendid
sections: The king was wearing a splendid golden crown.
國王戴著光彩奪目的金王冠。
我們又贏得了輝煌的勝利。
【口語】 極好的；令人極其滿意的
My kid sister has a splendid memory.

title: flame
sections: A flame of anger lighted in his heart.
The fireplace flamed the opposite wall.
爐火照亮了對面的牆壁。

title: contradict
sections: 否定（陳述等）；反駁；提出論據反對
目擊者駁斥了早些時提出的證詞。
那些事實與他的理論相悖。

title: revive
sections: 淹得半死的游泳者已經甦醒了。
恢復精力，復元；恢復生機
The crops revived in the rain.
莊稼在雨中重又生機盎然。
The fine arts revived during the Renaissance.
在文藝復興時期美術復興了。
A little whisky may revive him.
喝點威士忌酒也許能使他甦醒。
使恢復精力，使復元；使恢復生機
Hot coffee revived the cold, tired man.
熱咖啡使這個又冷又累的人恢復了精力。
The Prime Minister promised to revive the economy.
The picture revived memories of his childhood.
這張照片使他回憶起他的童年時代。
Some of the old plays we had seen years before were revived on the stage.
我們多年前看過的舊戲中有幾齣重又上演了。

title: stiff
sections: The shoes are brand new and the leather is still very stiff.
這雙鞋是全新的，皮還很硬。
She cleaned the sink with a stiff brush.
I felt stiff after a long walk.
我走長路後覺得全身發僵。
拘謹的，不自然的，生硬的
He has a stiff manner of speaking.
他演講的樣子很不自然。
A stiff wind blew my hat off.
一陣狂風刮走了我的帽子。
The batter was too stiff to beat.
麵糊太稠了，不容易攪拌。 11
inflict a stiff punishment on sb.
對某人處以嚴厲的懲罰

title: crawl
sections: He watched the baby crawl across the room.
他看著嬰兒從房間這邊爬到那邊。
It was rush hour and we crawled along at 15 miles an hour.
遇上了尖峰時間，我們的車子以每小時十五英里的速度緩慢行駛。
(常用進行式) (為蟲，蟻等) 爬滿，充斥著 [（+with）]
The lawn was crawling with ants.
(由於恐懼，厭惡等) 起雞皮疙瘩，汗毛直豎
My skin crawled when I heard a sudden shriek in the dead of night.
夜晚萬籟俱寂時突然聽到一聲尖叫，嚇得我汗毛直豎。
He never crawls to his superiors.
他對上司從不卑躬屈膝。
The rosebush crawls along the fence.
The boss crawled him for loafing on the job.
老板因他磨洋工而訓斥他。
Traffic was slowed to a crawl.
來往車輛只得減低速度十分緩慢地行駛。

title: bundle
sections: My uncle sent me a large bundle on my birthday.
我生日時叔父給我寄來一個大包裹。
Dad found a bundle of spelling mistakes in my composition.
爸爸在我作文裡找出一大堆拼寫錯誤。
She bundled all the clothes into that bag.
她把衣服全都塞進那隻包裡。
The injured girl was bundled off to hospital.
那個受傷的女孩被匆匆送到醫院。

title: revolt
sections: The people revolted against their ruler.
Our whole hearts revolt against the way women have hitherto been treated.
我們對婦女迄今所受的待遇從心底裡感到厭惡。
The violence in the movie revolted me.
電影中的暴力使我反感。
The peasants' revolt was put down by the dictator's troops.
農民的反叛被獨裁者的軍隊鎮壓了下去。
It was not possible to think of such things without a revolt of his whole being.
他一想到這種事就全身感到噁心。

title: cripple
sections: My father was a cripple, my mother in poor health.
我父親是個殘廢人，我母親身體又不好。
The accident crippled him for life.
這一事故使他終身殘廢。
損壞；嚴重削弱；使陷入癱瘓
The traffic was entirely crippled for the day.

title: upgrade
sections: Soon the truck came into sight around a bend and on an upgrade.
不一會卡車就出現在一個拐彎和上坡處。
These products are available with many different options and upgrades.
這些產品有許多不同的選擇和升級品。
After a short break the climbers continued upgrade.
稍事休息後，攀登者們繼續往山上走。
Efforts to upgrade the schools must come from the community.
改進學校的努力必須來自該社區。
以高檔貨的價格出售（低檔貨）；提高……的價格
When several offers came in the house owner upgraded the price.
當有幾個人要買這棟房子時，房主提高了房價。

title: lodge
sections: 供給……臨時宿處；租房間給……住
Can you lodge us for the night?
你能讓我們暫住一夜嗎？
I had somehow got the bone lodged in my throat.
我不知怎麼把骨頭卡在喉嚨裡了。
He lodged a complaint with the manager.
He lodged those documents in my office.
他把那些文件存放在我的辦公室裡。
A bullet lodged in his left shoulder.
一顆子彈嵌在他的左肩。

title: costume
sections: He changed his costume for the party.
他換了衣服去參加晚會。
她曾為一齣歷史劇設計服裝。

title: sneak
sections: I didn't notice Tom sneaking up behind me.
我沒有注意湯姆從我後面偷偷走了上來。
The boy sneaked all the candies he could.
男孩把他能偷到的糖果全偷走了。
He sneaked a watch into his pocket.
他偷偷地將一隻表塞進口袋。
Why did he take a sneak?

title: beam
sections: The beam from a flashlight showed a beggar sleeping at his doorstep.
手電筒的光照出一個乞丐睡在他家門口。
He greeted me with a beam of joy.
Advertisers beamed their messages to fashionable female audiences.
廣告商們以趕時髦的女性作為宣傳的對象。
This transmitter will be beamed at East Asia.
這臺發射機將用於對東亞廣播。
Upon hearing the good news he beamed with joy.
一聽到這個好消息，他高興得眉開眼笑。

title: divine
sections: People used to believe in the divine right of kings.
過去人們相信君權神授。
The concert we attended last night was simply divine.
我們昨晚聽的音樂會真是棒極了。
占卜；預言；(憑直覺) 推測 [+wh-]
How can you divine the truth by mere guesswork?
你僅憑猜測怎麼能發現真相？
He claimed that he could divine the future.

title: reproduce
sections: Animals can reproduce their own kind.
This photograph of the painting reproduces the colors of the original extremely well.
這張畫的照片把原作的色彩印得十分清晰。
Some animals can reproduce lost parts of their bodies.
有些動物能再生身體上失去的部分。
(在腦中) 再現（過去的情景等）；使重現
I've never been able to reproduce the success of my first book.
我再也沒有能取得像我第一本書獲得的那樣的成功。
Bacteria reproduce by splitting into two.

title: revise
sections: He revised his story to make it shorter.
他修改了他的故事，把它縮短了。
The students are busy revising for the examination.

title: curb
sections: The public demanded a curb on military spending.
公眾要求限制軍事開支。
路邊，（人行道旁的）鑲邊石，邊欄
He parked his car close to the curb.
他將汽車停在緊靠人行道路緣的地方。
Measures have been taken to curb inflation.
已採取措施抑制通貨膨脹。

title: fossil
sections: 頑固不化的人；守舊的事物

title: prejudice
sections: I haven't got one particle of race prejudice.
我沒有絲毫的種族偏見。
He has a prejudice in our favor.
The attorney argued that the decision involved prejudice to his client.
律師論辨說這一裁決侵害了他的委託人。
使抱偏見，使懷成見 [（+against/in favor of）]
One unfortunate experience prejudiced him against all lawyers.
一次不幸的經歷使他對所有律師產生偏見。
I don't want to prejudice your chances in any way.
我決不想破壞你的機會。

title: bud
sections: The peach flowers are now in bud.
Any ill-feeling has to be nipped in the bud.
一切惡感都必須在萌芽狀態就消滅。

title: erect
sections: Soldiers are trained to stand erect.
He erected himself to full height.
A monument was erected in front of the town hall.
一座紀念碑在市政廳前建起。

title: farewell
sections: Farewell! I hope we meet in New York next time.
再見！希望下次能在紐約相見。
They waved farewell to their friends on board the ship.
他們對船上的朋友揮手告別。
His farewell speech was very touching.
他的告別演講非常感人。

title: rub
sections: The cat rubbed its back against my leg.
He rubbed himself with a towel after the cold shower.
他冷水淋浴後用毛巾擦身。
他粗野的舉止惹惱了她。
The door rubs on the floor.
Give the table a good rub.
把這張桌子好好擦一擦。
We need money badly, but there's the rub: no one will lend us any.
我們急需要錢，但困難的是：誰也不會借錢給我們。

title: overtake
sections: I had to walk very fast to overtake you.
為了趕上你，我不得不走得很快。
Utter weariness overtook me an hour later.
一小時之後，我感到困乏極了。

title: explicit
sections: The doctor gave me explicit instructions on when and how to take the medicine.
大夫詳細地告訴我該何時服藥以及如何服藥。

title: parallel
sections: She and her friends have parallel likes and dislikes.
她和她的朋友喜惡相同。
The parallels seem to come together in the distance.
平行線在遠處看上去似交合在一起。
類似的人（或事物），可相比擬的人（或事物） [C] [（+to/with）]
You do not have to go far to find a living parallel for these prehistoric organisms.
你不必走遠就可以找到與這些史前有機體相類似的生物。
There are curious parallels between medicine and law.
在醫學和法律之間有著奇特的相似之處。
The historian draws a parallel between Washington and Lincoln.
這位歷史學家將華盛頓和林肯作了比較。
The two generators operate in parallel.
這兩臺發電機並聯發電。
They paralleled his life with those of the saints.
他們將他的生活與聖人的生活相比。
Your story closely parallels what he told me.
你的說法跟他告訴我的情況極為相似。

title: appall
sections: 【美國英語 】 使驚恐，使膽寒 [H]
We were appalled by the news of the war.
聽到戰爭的消息我們大為震驚。
The number of people killed on the roads appalled me.
在路上斃命的人數之多使我膽寒。

title: petty
sections: Don't bother me with such petty things.
不要用這種小事情煩我。
He was arrested for petty theft.
A gossip has a petty mind.
Authority was distributed among hundreds of petty leaders.
職權由數百名小頭頭分掌。

title: exert
sections: He has exerted all his strength.
He's been exerting his influence on his friend to change his decision.
他一直在影響他的朋友改變決定。

title: abrupt
sections: The abrupt change of schedule gave me lots of trouble.
行程突然改變給我造成許多麻煩。
She was offended by his abrupt manner.
他的粗率無禮的舉止觸怒了她。
She did not dare to bike down the abrupt slope.
她不敢騎著自行車衝下陡峭的斜坡。

title: chronic
sections: (病) 慢性的；(人) 久病的
她的咳嗽已成了一種慢性病。
The economy flourishes despite a fairly high rate of chronic unemployment.
儘管失業率居高不下，經濟仍在蓬勃發展。

title: harass
sections: I felt harassed by all the work at the office.
辦公室的一切工作都令我煩惱不已。
我們的士兵不斷騷擾敵人。

title: perfume
sections: A faint perfume of jasmine came through the window.
從窗戶外飄進一陣淡淡的茉莉花香。
She bought a small bottle of French perfume.
她買了一小瓶法國香水。

title: virgin
sections: There were no footmarks on the virgin snow.
There are vast expanses of virgin land in the remote regions.
在邊遠地區有大片大片未開墾的處女地。
The new mayor delivered his virgin speech this afternoon.
今天下午新市長作了第一次演講。

title: bruise
sections: I'm okay; just a few cuts and bruises.
我沒有事，僅有幾處劃破和擦傷。
使受瘀傷，使青腫；碰傷（水果等）
He fell from his bike and bruised his knee.
他從自行車上跌下，擦傷了膝蓋。
受到傷害的自尊；受挫的傲氣
His sarcastic comment bruised her feelings.
他的挖苦話傷了她的感情。
(水果等) 易碰傷；(感情等) 易受傷 [Q]

title: garage
sections: He worked in a garage as a mechanic.
他在汽車修理廠當技工。

title: catastrophe
sections: The flood in Venice was a major catastrophe.
威尼斯的洪水是一場大災難。
(悲劇或其他文學作品的) 結局
The catastrophe of a tragedy usually brings death or ruin to the leading character.
悲劇的結局常常是主角的死亡或徹底失敗。

title: mock
sections: She mocked him as a country boy.
I have a pet monkey which attempts to mock all my actions.
我養了一隻猴子當寵物，牠試圖模仿我所有的動作。
Our team mocked the visitors' attempt to score.
我隊挫敗了客隊進球的企圖。
His bullying made a mock of all the fine things he said about kindness to others.
他那恃強欺弱的行為對於他所說的待人友善的漂亮言詞是一個嘲弄。
He took his mocks last October.
他去年十月參加了模擬考試。
The boys re-enacted the strategies in mock battles.
男孩們在模擬戰中重現了那些戰略。

title: scratch
sections: He pretended to scratch his ear.
His arms were scratched by thorns.
他的手臂被荊棘劃破了。
The cat scratched a hole in the ground.
We scratched the paint off the wall.
我們刮掉了牆上的油漆。
His name was scratched from the list.
他的名字被從名單上劃掉了。
He scratched a note and put it on her desk.
他草草寫了一張字條放在她書桌上。
He scratched his name on the bridge with a knife.
他用刀子將自己的名字刻在橋上。
A dog scratched at the door to be let in.
狗嚓嚓地抓門要想進來。
He fell into a thorn bush and was covered with scratches.
他跌入荊棘叢，弄得傷痕累累。
He heard the scratch of a match.
Theirs is a scratch team and did not expect to win the game.
他們是臨時組建的球隊，沒有期望贏得這場比賽。

title: chew
sections: I'll chew the problem over for a few days.
這個問題我會仔細思考幾天。
He chewed over the problem for several days before making his decision.
他對這個問題詳細考慮了好多天才作出決定。
He can't chew without his false teeth.
He took my offer after chewing on it.
仔細考慮後他接受了我的提議。

title: bolster
sections: Greece badly needs a loan from the European Union to bolster its economy.
希臘急需歐盟的貸款來支撐它的經濟。
Both sides offered statistics to bolster their arguments.
雙方都拿出統計數字來支持他們的論點。

title: rigorous
sections: These soldiers have to undergo very rigorous trainings before they become frogmen.
這些兵在成為蛙人之前都必須經過非常嚴峻的訓練。
He made a rigorous study of the plants in the area.
他對該地的植物進行了慎密的研究。

title: spit
sections: Spit your gum out before you come into the classroom.
進教室之前把口香糖吐掉。
The sky began to spit snow.
You'll be fined if you spit on the streets.
你如果在街上吐痰，要遭罰款。
(為表示輕蔑等) 吐口水；表示唾棄，表示輕蔑 [（+at/on）]
他對我的建議表示輕蔑。
貓生氣時發出呼嚕呼嚕的聲音。
The sausage began to spit in the pan.
鍋裡香腸開始滋滋作響。
(用it為主詞) (雨、雪) 霏霏下降 [（+with）]
It's only spitting. We don't need an umbrella.
只下一點毛毛雨，我們不需要傘。
Mary's spit flew as she shouted.
【口語】 一模一樣，肖像 [the S] [（+of）]
He is the very spit and image of his father.
他和他父親長得一模一樣。

title: accommodate
sections: 這家旅館可住五百名觀光客。
You will have to accommodate yourself to the changed situation.
你必須適應變化了的形勢。
The policeman accommodated us when we asked for help.
我們請求警察幫忙，他爽快地答應了。
The bank will accommodate him with a loan.
銀行將向他提供一筆貸款。

title: decay
sections: Sweet potatoes decayed after the frost.
霜下了之後，地瓜爛掉了。
The Turkish Empire decayed in the nineteenth century.
土耳其帝國在十九世紀時衰落。
They are figuring out a way to stop the decay of the ancient building.
他們在想辦法阻止這古老建築的朽壞。
他的智力衰退令人苦惱。

title: oral
sections: An oral agreement is not enough; we must have a written promise.
只有口頭協議是不夠的；我們必須有一個書面承諾。
He passed his German oral exam.
The oral opening in an earthworm is small.
The doctor prescribed an oral dose of medicine.

title: presume
sections: I won't presume to advise you on the subject.
我不敢就這個題目對你作任何建議。
I presume you will approve of the plan.
我相信你會支持這個計畫。
If a person is missing for nine years in that country, he is presumed dead.
在那個國家裡，假如一個人失蹤九年，就被作死亡論。
It would be presuming to camp in a person's yard without permission.
不獲允許就在別人的院子裡露營是一種放肆的行為。

title: coarse
sections: My clothes were made of coarse cloth.
我的衣服是用粗布製成的。
不要用這種粗俗的語言。

title: staple
sections: The letter was stapled to the other documents in the file.
這封信與案卷裡的其他文件釘在一起。
