title: damp
sections: It's damp and cold. I think it's going to rain.
天氣又濕又冷。我看要下雨。
There's still damp in these clothes.
Damp the cloth before you clean the windows.
在擦玻璃窗之前，把揩布弄濕。
The setback did not damp his zest.
挫折沒有使他降低熱情。

title: outrage
sections: They committed outrages on innocent citizens.
他們對無辜的市民犯下了暴行。
嚴重的不道德行為；不法行為 [C] [（+against/on/upon）]
Would the use of H-bombs be an outrage against humanity?
使用氫彈是否違背人道？
Such a lie is an outrage to anyone who loves the truth.
這樣的謊言對任何一個熱愛真理的人都是一種冒犯。
The public were outraged by the decision.
公眾對這一決定非常憤怒。
Such conduct outrages our rules of morality.
這種行為違背我們的道德準則。

title: limp
sections: The damaged ship limped back to port.
那艘遭到損壞的船艱難緩慢地駛回港口。

title: offset
sections: The pay raise will be offset by inflation.
增加的薪資會被通貨膨脹所抵銷。
In basketball, his speed and cleverness were an offset to his small size.
打籃球時，他的速度和機智彌補了他身材矮小的不足。

title: comply
sections: (對要求、命令等) 依從，順從，遵從 [（+with）]
We comply with all fire safety rules.
我們遵守有關消防安全的全部條例。

title: retard
sections: The heavy rain retarded our progress.
大雨妨礙了我們的進展。
Her death was retarded by five years because of good treatment.
由於良好的治療，她多活了五年。

title: patch
sections: The child's jeans had a patch at the knee.
這孩子的褲子在膝蓋處有一塊補釘。
(顏色等與周圍不同的) 斑駁，斑點
The flowers made white patches against the grass.
綠色草地上點綴著簇簇白花。
There was a patch of garden behind the house.
His clothes were torn and patched in a good many places.
他衣服破舊，好幾處都打了補釘。
We decided to patch up our differences and become friends again.
我們決定消除分歧，重歸於好。
They patched up a hasty peace.
他們匆匆達成和平協議。

title: sniff
sections: He sniffed the green tea in the cup appreciably.
他欣然聞了聞杯裡的綠茶香味。
He sniffed the fresh morning air.
他吸進早晨的新鮮空氣。
It's his job to sniff out abuses of power.
他的職責就是查究濫用權力的行為。
"I expected something rather nicer," she sniffed. "我指望的要好得多呢，"她輕蔑地說。
The dog sniffed at the stranger.
抽鼻涕；鼻子發呼哧呼哧聲
The boy caught a cold and was sniffing.
那男孩子得了感冒，呼吸起來鼻子呼哧呼哧的。
My roommate sniffed at my idea of becoming an artist.
我的室友對我要當藝術家的想法嗤之以鼻。
Dick sniffed suspiciously around the office.
狄克懷疑地在辦公室裡四處查看。
He cleared his nose with a loud sniff.
他大聲吸氣清了清鼻子。

title: depict
sections: Mediterranean scenes depicted in these paintings
這些畫中描繪的地中海景色
The book depicts him as a rather unpleasant character.
這本書把他描寫成一個不太討人喜歡的人。

title: staggering
sections: In the wind, the three oaks appeared staggering on the slope.
在風中，坡上的三棵橡樹像是搖晃欲倒似的。
The soldier received no staggering wound from any of the three shots.
三槍中的任何一槍都沒使這個士兵受到什麼驚人的槍傷。
Nobody can imagine what staggering pain she suffered in those years.
誰也不能想像她那些年所受的巨大痛苦。 stagger的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ stagger)

title: vouch
sections: I can vouch for the reliability of the machines.
我可以保證這些機器的可靠性。
He vouched his words by his deeds.
他用自己的行動證明了自己的言辭。

title: array
sections: The army was arrayed before the commander.
部隊在指揮官前列好陣勢。
The children were arrayed in pretty woollen sweaters.
孩子們穿著漂亮的羊毛衫。
(排列整齊的) 一批；一系列；大量 [S] [（+of）]
The government is beset with a complex array of economic problems.
政府為一系列複雜的經濟問題所困擾。
The whole city is in holiday array.
整個城市披上了節日的盛裝。

title: constrain
sections: I feel constrained to write and protest the decision.
我不得不寫信抗議這一決定。
Our research has been constrained by lack of cash.
我們的研究工作因缺少現金而受到限制。

title: designate
sections: Churches are designated on the map by crosses.
地圖上教堂以十字形記號標出。
The ruler of a kingdom is designated a king.
王國的統治者稱作國王。
He was designated to lead the expedition.

title: premise
sections: He acted on the premise that he was absolutely right.
他的行動是以"自己是絕對正確的"為前提的。
房屋及其地基；經營場地 [P]
The firm moved to its new premises in 1971.
該公司於一九七一年遷至新址。

title: steep
sections: The car labored up the steep hill.
車子吃力地向陡峭的山上開去。
急劇升降的，大起大落的
People were discontented with the steep rise in prices.
【口語】 (價格等) 過高的，不合理的
那是一個令人難以置信的故事。

title: blink
sections: 燈光在黑暗中閃爍不停。
The girl blinked at the height of the basketball player.
這女孩對那個籃球運動員的身高感到驚訝。
眨（眼睛）；眨眼睛擠掉（眼淚等）
Little Tom blinked his eyes in surprise.
小湯姆驚奇地眨著眼睛。
It is no use blinking the fact that inflation keeps getting worse.
不能無視通貨膨脹日益惡化這一事實。
The boy disappeared around the corner in a blink of an eye.
一眨眼，這男孩就在拐角處不見了。

title: ethics
sections: 倫理觀；道德標準；(某種職業的) 規矩 [G]
The ethics of his profession do not permit him to do that.
他的職業道德不容許他那樣做。

title: howl
sections: 嗥叫；怒吼；號啕大哭；大笑 [（+with）]
The wind howled in the trees.
有人大聲喊叫我的名字。
嗥叫；怒吼；號啕大哭；大笑 [C]
The little girl set up a howl.

title: solemn
sections: He was very solemn and refrained from talking.
He made a solemn promise to do better.
他鄭重保證要做得更好。
The inauguration was a solemn event.
就職典禮是一件隆重的大事。
The government made a solemn statement.
政府發表了一項嚴正的聲明。
正式的；神聖的，宗教上的
The President took the solemn oath of office.

title: shatter
sections: She shattered the cup when she dropped it on the floor.
她把杯子掉在地板上，摔得粉碎。
His hopes of finding a better job were shattered.
他想找個好一點工作的希望破滅了。
沒有什麼東西能動搖他的信念。
Harris was shattered by the news of his father's death.
哈里斯聽到他父親去世的消息大為震驚。
【英國英語 】【口語】 使筋疲力盡 [H]
The heavy rain shattered on the roof.
大雨嘩啦啦打在屋頂上。
The stone hit the window and a shatter of glass fell on their heads.
石頭擊中窗戶，一陣碎玻璃落到他們頭上。
A sea dashed the ship to shatters against the rock.
一個大浪把船衝到礁石上撞得粉碎。

title: thesis
sections: 他把自己的論點闡述得很清楚。
My friend is writing her doctoral thesis.
我的朋友正在寫她的博士論文。

title: foster
sections: We fostered the little girl while her mother was in hospital.
這小姑娘的母親住院時，我們領養了她。
音樂會培養對音樂的興趣。
There are three foster children in our home.
我們家有三個領養的孩子。

title: endorse
sections: 在（發票、票據等）背面簽名，背書；簽署（姓名）
She has already endorsed the check.
I am willing to endorse your plan without any qualifications. .
我願意為你的計劃背書，沒有任何條件。
批註（公文等）；【英國英語 】 在（駕駛執照背面）註上違章事項
His driving licence has been endorsed.
他的駕駛執照上有違章記錄。
Many senators endorsed the new bill.
很多議員贊同該項新法案。

title: stain
sections: His crimes stained the family honor.
他的罪行玷汙了家庭的名譽。
給（木材，玻璃等）染色，給……著色
He's got an ink stain on his shirt.

title: ample
sections: This leaves her ample time to prepare three meals a day.
這樣她就有充裕的時間準備一日三餐飯。
There is ample reason to believe that the man is innocent.
有充分的理由相信那個人是無辜的。
我們有一塊很大的草坪。

title: lavish
sections: 非常慷慨的；浪費的，濫花的 [（+of/with）]
He is lavish in donating money to charity.
他給慈善事業捐款非常慷慨。
lavish time and money on pets
把大量時間和金錢花在寵物身上

title: redundant
sections: Skills which have been made redundant by technological advance.
由於技術進步而變得多餘的技術。

title: crew
sections: 一組（或一隊等）工作人員
The maintenance crew will make repairs to machines in your department tomorrow.
維修組明天修理你們部門的機器。
一群人，一夥人，一幫人；少年幫派
The boys on that street are a rough crew.
那條街上的男孩是一群粗野的孩子。 crow的動詞過去式 (→ crow2)

title: epic
sections: That movie was an epic about the Roman Empire.
那電影是一部有關羅馬帝國的史詩般的作品。
The landing on the moon in 1969 was an epic achievement.
一九六九年的登月是一項壯舉。

title: stun
sections: 這一跤把他摔昏了過去。
使大吃一驚；使目瞪口呆 [H]
We were all stunned by the news.
這個消息使我們都大為震驚。

title: penetrate
sections: She had a wig on, but we soon penetrated her disguise.
她戴了一頂假髮，但是我們很快就識穿了她的偽裝。
Not many people managed to penetrate my disguise.
沒有幾個人識破我的偽裝。
The aroma of fresh bread penetrated the whole house.
滿屋子散發著新鮮麵包的香味。
The whole country is penetrated with fear.
I could not penetrate the mystery.
The organization was penetrated and the survivors fled.
該組織遭到滲透，倖存者已逃逸了。
The rain had penetrated through his clothes.
He strained his eyes to penetrate beyond the thick cloud of dust.
他竭力想透過塵埃看清那邊的東西。
The mist penetrated into the room.
(感情等) 深入人心，打動人心
Women's lib has not really penetrated here.
婦女解放運動在這裡並未真正深入人心。
那個新概念沒有被弄懂。

title: orthodox
sections: 正統的；傳統的，習俗的；通常的
The orthodox Thanksgiving dinner includes turkey and pumpkin pie.
傳統的感恩節晚餐包括火雞和南瓜派。

title: boycott
sections: 杯葛；聯合抵制；拒絕參加（或購買等）；一致與……絕交
他們拒絕參加那個會議。
杯葛；聯合抵制；拒絕參加 [C]
We put the production under a boycott.

title: net
sections: They caught fish in their nets.
The criminal was finally caught in the net of justice.
The boys were netting cicadas in the woods.
男孩子們在林子裡用網捕捉蟬。
They netted the fruit trees to protect them from birds.
他們用網罩住果樹以防鳥來啄食。

title: bush
sections: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
雙鳥在林不如一鳥在手。
那個工作弄得他精疲力盡。

title: ratify
sections: Over ninety countries ratified an agreement to ban the use of these chemicals.
九十多個國家批准了一項禁止使用這些化學品的協議。

title: laundry
sections: Send it to the laundry. Don't dry clean it.
把它送到洗衣店去吧，別乾洗。
送洗的衣服；洗好的衣服 [U]
Has the laundry come back yet?
送洗的衣服送回來了嗎？

title: solitary
sections: He formed the habit of taking long solitary walks through the streets.
他養成了在街頭長時間獨自漫步的習慣。

title: trait
sections: Jim's two most pleasing traits are generosity and energy.
吉姆最討人喜歡的特徵是豪爽和充滿活力。
The priest preached a sermon with a trait of humor.
那位神父講道有幽默感。

title: pathetic
sections: 引起憐憫的；可憐的；可悲的
It was pathetic to watch her condition deteriorate day by day.
看著她的健康狀況日益惡化，真是可憐。

title: dormant
sections: 【生物學/生理學/生物化學】 冬眠的；休眠的
Bears lie dormant during the winter.

title: reckless
sections: 不注意的，不在乎的；魯莽的，不顧後果的 [（+of）]
Some of these young motorcyclists are very reckless.
有些年輕的摩托車騎士很魯莽。

title: attain
sections: They are not likely to attain this aim.
他們未必能夠達到這一目標。
She tried in vain to attain to fame.
He will soon attain to manhood.
他很快就要到達成年期了。

title: timid
sections: He does not like his job, but is too timid to try to find another.
他不喜歡自己的工作，但膽子太小，不敢嘗試另找工作。
The timid girl didn't want to meet the new children in the neighborhood.
那個羞怯的女孩子不想見街坊裡新來的孩子。

title: pioneer
sections: They were the pioneers of the American West.
他們是美國西部的開拓者。
Henry Ford was a pioneer in the auto industry.
亨利‧福特是汽車工業的先驅。
這一公司首創在職培訓。
The Wright brothers pioneered in early aviation.
萊特兄弟是早期航空的先驅。

title: tailor
sections: [C] (plural tailors) (尤指男裝) 裁縫師；(尤指男裝) 服裝店
He had his dress made by a Paris tailor.
他請巴黎的裁縫師做衣服。
The clinic tailors its treatment to individual needs.
那個診所的治療方法適合個別需要。

title: void
sections: 無人佔用的；無人居住的；(職位) 空缺的
The position of secretary is void.
It's not like him to put forward suggestions wholly void of sense.
他才不會提毫無見識的建議呢。
That subject is void of interest.
His style is void of affectation.
他的文體沒有矯揉造作之嫌。
太空，空間；真空；空白 [the S]
He looked down at the gaping void at his feet.
他看著腳下張開的裂縫。
The death of his dog left an aching void in the old man's heart.
老人的狗死了，這在他心中留下了痛苦的空虛感。
The press gallery has been voided of the customary bulky desks.
記者席經常放著的大寫字臺被搬走了。

title: dot
sections: She watched the train until it was only a dot in the distance.
她一直看著火車，直到它走遠了，成了一個小點。
She is wearing a dotted dress today.
今天她穿一件帶圓點的衣服。
星羅棋布於；(星星點點地) 布滿；點綴
The lake was dotted with boats.

title: obsess
sections: David was obsessed with a girl he had just met.
大衛被一個他剛剛認識的女孩迷住了。
The hostages were obsessed by the fear of death.
人質被死亡的恐懼所纏擾。

title: theology
sections: Many theologies express the same ideas.
許多宗教理論表達同一種思想。

title: chip
sections: The ground was littered with chips of wood.
He has lost all his chips.
Techniques were developed to hook many transistors into chips.
將許多電晶體聯結到晶片上的技術已發展成了。
無價值的東西，瑣碎之物
Fame and gain are but chips to him.
He chipped old paint from the walls.
他將舊的油漆從牆上鏟下來。
He chipped a hole in the ice.
May I chip in a word?
If everybody chips in some money, we can buy something nice for her.
如果大家都攤點錢，我們可以給她買份好東西。
We all chipped in for the benefit of the orphans.
我們大家湊錢幫助這些孤兒。

title: strive
sections: This is the goal we are striving toward.
Today women are striving to occupy positions previously closed to them.
現今婦女正在努力爭取以往不對她們開放的職位。
The swimmer strove against the tide.

title: asylum
sections: 避難；政治避難權，庇護權 [U]
Belgium granted asylum to the political refugees.
比利時給予政治難民避難權。
收容所，救濟院；精神病院 [C]
The abandoned children were put into an asylum.
被遺棄的兒童送進了孤兒院。

title: giggle
sections: The absurd story made her giggle.
那個荒謬的故事使她咯咯地笑了起來。
她突然咯咯地傻笑起來。

title: marble
sections: At the center of the square stands a monument in black marble.
在廣場的中央聳立著一座黑色大理石的紀念碑。
He completely lost his marbles after the stock market crash.
股票市場崩盤後他完全失去理智。

title: ward
sections: He was put in an isolation ward.
Which ward does he represent on the council?
在理事會中他代表哪個區？
【法律】 受監護的未成年人（或瘋人等） [C]
The courts made him a ward of his uncle.
法院指定他舅父為他的監護人。
The soldiers kept watch and ward over the castle.
He flung up an arm to ward off the blow.
他迅速抬起手臂擋開這一擊。

title: pomp
sections: 華麗；壯觀；(典禮等的) 盛況 [U]
all the pomp of an imperial coronation

title: sober
sections: 沒喝醉的；不過量飲酒的
He seldom goes to bed sober.
He is as sober as a judge.
他十分鎮靜，嚴肅，像個法官似的。
He was dressed in sober gray.
他身著素淨的灰色衣服。
His estimate of the situation was sober.
他對形勢的估計是審慎的。
He drank a cup of strong tea to sober himself up.
他喝下一杯濃茶以使自己清醒過來。
The setback sobered all of us down.
這一挫折使我們大家都清醒了。
When you sober up, you'll be ashamed of what you've done.
你酒醒之後，會為你的所作所為而感到羞愧。
變得冷靜；變得嚴肅；變得持重 [（+down）]
The class sobered down as the teacher came into the room.
老師走進教室後，學生們安靜下來了。

title: spice
sections: Variety is the spice of life.
豐富多彩是生活的情趣所在。
The soup was heavily peppered and spiced.
湯裡加了許多胡椒粉和香料。
His speech was spiced with anti-government sentiment.
他的講話裡摻進了反對政府的情緒。

title: compile
sections: It takes years of hard work to compile a good dictionary.
編纂一部好詞典要花多年心血。
He compiled enough information on his tour of South American capitals to write a book.
他在南美各國首都旅遊時收集了不少資料，足夠寫本書。

title: naughty
sections: You ought to be stricter with him. He's very naughty.
你該對他更嚴格一些。他很調皮。
【委婉用語】 猥褻的，淫亂的
Nice boys do not use naughty words.

title: overhear
sections: 偶然聽到，無意中聽到；偷聽 [O3] [O4]
Do not talk so loud; you may be overheard.
別這麼大聲說話；別人會聽見的。
I happened to overhear what he said.
我碰巧聽到了他所說的話。

title: commend
sections: The general commended the soldier for his bravery.
將軍表揚了那個士兵的勇敢行為。
I should like to commend this method to you.
我想向您推薦這一方法。
They commended their child to my care.
他們把孩子委託給我照顧。

title: gratitude
sections: He acted so out of gratitude.
他是出於感激而這麼做的。
She felt an immense gratitude to Wilson.

title: ingenious
sections: 心靈手巧的；善於創造文明的；足智多謀的
The ingenious boy made a radio set for himself.
這個聰明的男孩自己做了一臺收音機。
It took a lot of imagination to come up with such an ingenious plan.
設計出如此巧妙的方案需有極大的想像力。

title: oppress
sections: The tyrant who oppressed the people was finally overthrown.
壓迫人民的暴君終於被推翻了。
使（心情）沉重；使煩惱，折磨 [H] [（+by/with）]
She was oppressed by many troubles.
許多麻煩弄得她心情沉重。

title: transparent
sections: Her mother disapproves of her wearing transparent underwear.
她母親不贊成她穿透明的內衣。
顯而易見的；一目了然的 [+that]
It was transparent that her pride was hurt.
很顯然，她的自尊心受到了傷害。
He is a man of transparent sincerity.
他是一個坦率誠懇的人。
I like her transparent style of writing.

title: yardstick
sections: Do you think the TOEFL score is a good yardstick for English proficiency?
你認為托福成績是一種衡量英語流利程度的好標準嗎？
She was a yardstick against which I could measure my achievements.
她是一個我可以用來衡量我的成就的準繩。

title: assent
sections: The judge assented to allow the prisoner to speak.
法官同意准許囚犯說話。
I won't assent to her plan.
The government gave its assent to the new project.

title: devote
sections: He was still devoted to the study of chemistry.
他仍專心致力於化學研究。
He has devoted his whole life to benefiting mankind.
他把一生都獻給了造福人類的事業。

title: liquor
sections: 【美國英語 】 (尤指白蘭地，威士忌等) 烈酒 [U] [C]
Are brandy and other liquors available here?
這兒能買到白蘭地及其他的烈酒嗎？
He often liquors up before he goes to bed.

title: nourish
sections: We need good food to nourish the starving infants.
我們需要好食品滋養這些挨餓的嬰兒。
I could find nothing to nourish my suspicion.
我找不到任何懷疑的根據。
She had nourished the dream of becoming a movie star.
她曾懷有成為電影明星的夢想。

title: disgrace
sections: And you needn't fuss. There's no disgrace.
你不必大驚小怪。沒有什麼丟人的事。
The dirty classrooms are a disgrace to the school.
骯髒的教室是學校的恥辱。
So it's you that have disgraced the family!
原來是你丟了全家的面子！

title: luggage
sections: They had left the luggage at the station.

title: infamous
sections: 聲名狼藉的，臭名昭著的；罪大惡極的
The infamous traitor was sentenced to death.
那個罪大惡極的叛徒被判處死刑。
I was shocked by her infamous behavior.
我對她不名譽的行為大為震驚。

title: second
sections: She lives on the second floor.
He plays second fiddle to Mr. White.
他充當懷特先生的副手。
It is not likely that you will be given a second opportunity.
人家不大可能再給你一次機會。
第二名，第二位，二等獎 [the S]
I got a second in the speech contest.
我在演講比賽中得了第二名。
His view was seconded by many experts.
他的觀點受到許多專家的支持。

title: prosperous
sections: 有利於棉花種植的天氣

title: barren
sections: Barren women are rejected by the tribesmen.
不孕的婦女被部落的男人遺棄。
(土地等) 貧瘠的，荒蕪的，不毛的
無益的，無效果的；沉悶無趣的
He was engaged in a barren argument with Paul.
他在同保羅作無用的爭論。
She is barren of creative spirit.

title: consolidate
sections: The government hoped to consolidate ten states to form three new ones.
政府希望把十個州合併成三個新的州。
The three banks in this town will consolidate and form a single large bank.
本鎮三家銀行將合併組建一個大銀行。

title: lucrative
sections: After three years in the business, they found out that running a convenience store was not as lucrative as they thought.
做了三年之後，他們才發現開便利商店並沒有他們想像的那麼好賺。

title: toss
sections: The little girl tossed her ball in the air.
使上下搖動；把……拋來拋去
I'll toss you for the armchair.
我和你用擲幣的方法決定誰坐這把扶手椅。
We'll toss a coin to see who does the wash.
我們將擲幣決定誰來洗衣服。
Toss the cooked vegetables in butter.
將煮好的蔬菜拌上奶油。
The ship tossed about on the stormy sea.
船在波濤洶湧的海面上顛簸著。
He tossed about in his sleep all night.
他整夜翻來覆去睡不著。
Let's toss to see who pays the bill.
讓我們擲錢幣決定誰來付帳。
He tossed out of the room in anger.
他憤怒之下一甩頭離開了房間。
After a few warm-up tosses, he put the shot 63 feet 6 inches.
幾次試擲之後，他把鉛球投出六十三英尺六英寸遠。
擲幣賭勝負；擲幣決定事 [the S]
A toss of a coin decided who should play first.

title: sterilize
sections: 牙科醫生給他的器具消毒。

title: feat
sections: The circus acrobats performed feats of dexterity and strength.
馬戲團的雜技藝人表演了顯示靈巧和力度的高超技藝。

title: prop
sections: Prop the door open with a brick.
He propped the ladder against the wall.
他支起了梯子，把它靠在牆上。

title: whim
sections: She is always full of whims and fancies.
突然的念頭，一時的興致
He had a sudden whim to go sailing today.
今天他突然想要去航海。

title: artery
sections: (鐵路，公路等的) 幹線，要道
This is the place where the three main arteries of West London traffic meet.
這是倫敦西區三條主要幹線匯合的地方。

title: hard
sections: The ice is as hard as rock.
George is hard to get along with.
He gave the door a hard kick.
她是一個工作十分勤奮的人。
I know that he has a very hard life.
我知道他日子過得很艱難。
冷酷無情的；嚴厲的；嚴格的 [（+on）]
She is too hard on her pupils.
(水) 硬質的 10 (毒品) 毒性強的，使成癮的 [B] 11 確實的；不容懷疑的 [B]
We confronted him with hard facts.
我們把鐵的事實擺在他的面前。 12 【軍事】
設重防的；(飛彈發射場或飛彈)
設於地下可免受敵方空襲的
她努力嘗試過，但未能成功。
The old man is breathing hard.
He held hard on to the rope.
One misfortune followed hard on another.

title: lag
sections: Some of the runners in the race began to lag.
參加比賽的運動員中有一些開始落後了。
The children were tired and lagged behind their parents.
孩子們累了，落在了他們的父母親身後。
The child lags his peers in intellectual development.
這孩子在智力發展方面比同齡人遲緩。
There was a long lag in forwarding mail to us.
郵件轉送我們前已有好長一段時間的耽擱。
(事件或現象之間的) 間歇 [the S]
There is a time lag of about 10 years.
有大約十年時間的間歇。

title: thread
sections: Please give me a piece of thread.
頭緒，思路；貫穿著的東西 [C]
I must have skipped a page, because I lost the thread of the story.
我一定跳過了一頁，因為我弄不清故事的脈絡了。
She threaded the needle for her grandmother.
The girl threaded the shells together.
女孩把一些貝殼穿成一串。
The hikers threaded their way through the thick forest.
徒步旅行者穿過茂密的森林。

title: crooked
sections: He walked down the crooked path.
他沿著彎彎曲曲的小路走去。
變了形的，扭曲的，彎腰曲背的
His back is so crooked that he can not stand upright.
不正當的，欺詐的，不正派的
不要同刁滑的人打交道。 crook的動詞過去式、過去分詞 (→ crook)

title: ordeal
sections: The parents went through a terrible ordeal when their child was kidnapped.
當孩子遭到綁架時，父母親經受了一次可怕的折磨。
Every plane crash is an ordeal for the surviving relatives.
每次的空難對家屬而言都是個嚴酷的考驗。

title: tread
sections: Beg pardon, did I tread on your foot, miss?
對不起，小姐，我是不是踩了你的腳了？
Our ancestors trod this same path.
我們的祖先曾經走過這同一條道路。
The sheep trod a path through the grass.
羊群在草地上踩出一條路。
The serf was trod to death.
I heard his heavy tread up the stairs.
我聽到他那沉重的腳步走上樓梯。

title: flesh
sections: (果實的) 果肉；(蔬菜的) 葉肉
The flesh of the peach was sweet and juicy.
這桃子的肉又甜，汁又多。
(相對於靈魂，精神的) 肉體 [the S]
The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak.
Good fodder fleshed the steers up.
He has fleshed out since we last saw him.
自從我們上回見到他以來，他發胖了。

title: simmer
sections: The soup simmered on the stove.
Her resentment began to simmer over.
激化（狀態）；即將爆發（狀態）
bring an issue to a state of simmer
把爭論推到一觸即發的地步

title: cluster
sections: There was a little cluster of admirers around the actress.
女演員周圍擁著一小群崇拜者。
The mountain-climbers clustered together for warmth.
The square was clustered with people.
廣場上聚集著成群的人。
Most of the foreign embassies are clustered in this area.
大多數的外國使館都聚集在這一區。
White buildings clustered on the hillside.
山腰上有一簇白色建築。

title: lengthen
sections: Ask the tailor to lengthen this skirt.
請裁縫把這條裙子放長。

title: breeze
sections: The flags fluttered in the breeze.
【美國英語 】【口語】 輕而易舉的事 [S]
Teaching is by no means a breeze.
There came a breeze that his wife had eloped with her lover.
有謠言說他妻子與她情人私奔了。
Helen breezed into the sitting room.
海倫輕盈地走進了起居室。
She breezed through that difficult book.
她毫無困難地把那本難讀的書讀完了。
他輕輕鬆鬆地通過考試。

title: fortnight
sections: I see them about once a fortnight.
我大約兩星期見他們一次。

title: splash
sections: She accidentally splashed ink on my sleeve.
她不小心把墨水濺在我衣袖上。
A passing car splashed her newly-bought dress.
一輛開過的汽車把她新買的洋裝濺髒了。
用……使液體飛濺；濺潑著行（路）
The boy splashed his way up the stream.
那男孩蹚著水往河流上游走去。
The paper splashed the news of their victory on its front page.
報紙在頭版上以顯著位置報導了他們勝利的消息。
The newspaper splashed the story on page one.
那家報紙把這件事當頭版新聞報導。
She splashed out $1500 on a camera.
她滿不在乎地花一千五百美元買了一架照相機。
The water splashed out of the tub upon the floor.
水從缸裡飛濺出來，落在地板上。
The baby liked to splash in its tub.
嬰兒喜歡在澡盆裡潑水。
The horse splashed across the brook.
【英國英語 】【口語】 揮霍錢財
They were cheap enough, so I splashed and got two.
這些東西夠便宜的，所以我一下子買了兩件。
The rain splashed against the window.
雨水劈啪劈啪地打在窗子上。
The children jumped into the river with a splash.
孩子們撲通一聲跳進河裡。
There's a splash of paint on the white wall.
白牆上濺上了一片油漆。
The dog is white with brown splashes.
狗一身白毛，夾有棕色的斑塊。
(攙酒用的) 少量的水（或杜松子酒） [S]
He poured in a generous splash of rye.
他攙入了相當多的黑麥威士忌酒。
He fell splash into the river.

title: monotonous
sections: (聲音) 單調的，無抑揚頓挫的
The preacher's monotonous voice put me to sleep.
傳教士單調的聲音催我入眠。
因單一而使人厭倦的；無變化的；無聊的
The explorers lived on a monotonous diet of beans and rice.
探險者靠吃豆子和米飯這些單調的食物為生。

title: falter
sections: She faltered toward the door in the dark.
她在黑暗中向門口搖搖晃晃地走去。
Her voice faltered, and then she lost consciousness.
她嗓音顫抖，接著她便失去了知覺。
Our hopes will not falter in adversity.
我們的信心在逆境中也不會動搖。
She faltered out an excuse for being late.
她結結巴巴地說出遲到的藉口。
I detected a falter in her voice.

title: hinder
sections: Age hinders me from moving about.
我年事已高，不能到處走動。
The policy will promote rather than hinder reform.
這項政策將促進而不是妨礙改革。

title: annoy
sections: His mother was annoyed with him for being so rude to their neighbors.
他母親因為他對鄰居如此粗暴無禮而生他的氣。
這些蒼蠅一直在打攪我。

title: dispense
sections: The government dispensed emergency food to the flood victims.
政府把應急食品發給水災受害者。
He dispenses equal justice to all.
他對所有人一律公平對待。
The pharmacist dispensed the prescription with great care.
The coach dispensed the injured player from practice.
教練准許受傷的隊員不參加訓練。

title: sanitary
sections: He worked hard to improve the sanitary conditions of the slums.
他努力改進貧民窟的衛生條件。
There was a small and not very sanitary inn nearby.
附近有一家不那麼衛生的小客棧。

title: bloom
sections: The daffodils are in full bloom.
最佳時期，最有利的時期 [the S] [（+of）]
She was in the bloom of youth.
Cherry trees bloom in early spring.
Poetry was blooming in China in the Tang dynasty.
中國的詩歌在唐代十分盛行。

title: sly
sections: That sly girl managed to get her friend's job.
那個詭詐的女孩設法取得她朋友的工作。
A slow sly smile was creeping around the corners of his mouth.
他的嘴角慢慢露出了詭祕的微笑。
They exchanged sly looks and smiles.
他們交換會意的眼色和微笑。
The sly cat stole the meat while the cook's back was turned.
淘氣的貓趁廚師轉身之機偷吃了肉。

title: ailment
sections: 病痛；(尤指輕微的) 疾病 [C]
He got timely treatment for his ailment.

title: resolute
sections: 堅決的，堅定的；果敢的；不屈不撓的 [（+in）]
Her resolute refusal came as a surprise.
她的堅決拒絕令人感到意外。

title: chore
sections: Does your husband do any chores after work?
你先生下班後做家務事嗎？
日常零星活兒，例行工作
He freed his assistant from some of her chores.
他免去了助手某些日常事務。
討厭的工作；困難的工作
Peeling bags of potatoes is really a chore.
給一袋袋馬鈴薯削皮真是件苦差事。

title: trifle
sections: A mere trifle brought about a quarrel between the brothers.
一點兒小事引起了兄弟間一場爭吵。
瑣碎的東西；小玩意兒，小裝飾品 [C]
I'll send you a few trifles for your birthday.
我要送你幾樣小玩意兒祝賀你的生日。
I have only a trifle of wine left.
It's wrong of you to trifle with the girl's affections.
你不該玩弄那女孩子的感情。
Jim is not a man to be trifled with.
可不能怠慢吉姆這個人。
The girl sat trifling with her skirt.
Stop trifling and get to work.
He trifled away the whole evening.

title: candid
sections: This is really a candid decision.
這確實是一個公正的決定。
To be candid, I don't like your hairstyle.
坦率地說，我不喜歡你的髮式。
(照片) 乘人不備時拍的，偷拍的 [B]

title: sew
sections: Mother used to sew me shoes.
母親過去總為我縫製鞋子。
The old lady did not stop sewing until midnight.
老太太直到半夜才放下針線活。

title: dimension
sections: What are the dimensions of the box?
這個盒子的尺寸是多少？
They have bought a house of generous dimensions.
他們買了一所寬敞的房屋。
No one realized the dimensions of his problems.
沒有人意識到他的問題有多麼嚴重。
There is another dimension to this problem which you haven't mentioned.
這個問題還有一個方面你沒有提及。
【數學】 維；【物理學】 量綱 [C]
Time is sometimes called the fourth dimension.
時間有時候被稱作第四維。

title: irrigate
sections: They irrigate their crops with water from this river.
他們引這條河裡的水灌溉莊稼。

title: smother
sections: 使窒息，使透不過氣來；把……悶死
The victim was smothered to death.
He smothered the flame with a wet blanket.
他用一條濕毯將火焰悶熄。
She tried to smother her sobs.
He attempted to smother up a scandal about his family.
他企圖掩飾有關他家庭的醜聞。
Mary smothers her children with too much love.
I'm smothering in this stuffy room.
在這個悶熱的房間裡我透不過氣來。
令人窒息的濃煙（或霧氣、塵埃等） [the S]
The air is polluted with the smother of traffic and industrial smog.
空氣被令人窒息的車輛廢氣和工業煙霧汙染了。

title: hop
sections: The frog hopped along the shore of the pond.
那隻青蛙沿著池塘邊跳躍。
【口語】 (輕快地) 上（下）車（或船等） [Q]
I saw him hop on a bus.
The boy hopped the ditch and ran down the path.
那男孩跳過溝，沿著小路奔去。
【美國英語 】【口語】 跳上（車，船，飛機等）；(偷偷地) 搭乘
The tramp hopped freights more than once.
那個流浪漢不止一次地偷偷搭乘貨運列車。
The pursuer cleared the fence in one hop.
追捕者一跳越過了柵欄。

title: ditch
sections: 把（車）開入溝裡；使（火車）出軌；使（飛機）作水上迫降
I ditched my car the other day.
前幾天我把車開到溝裡了。
He ditched an old TV set.
他丟棄了一臺舊電視機。

title: junk
sections: Get that junk off the table, will you!
你給我將那件破爛從桌上拿開！

title: recipe
sections: 烹飪法；食譜；(糕餅等的) 製作法 [（+for）]
I'd like to have your recipe for cookies.
你能不能告訴我製作小甜餅的方法。
He thinks the one recipe for success lies in hard work.
他認為成功的唯一訣竅在於勤奮。

title: superfluous
sections: 過剩的；多餘的，不必要的 [Z]
He had already been told, so our comments were superfluous.
他已被告知，所以我們的評論是多餘的。

title: rhetoric
sections: Despite their tough anti-American rhetoric, the government is privately trying to maintain good relations with the U.S..
儘管他們發表強硬的反美言論，政府仍試圖私下與美國保持良好關係。

title: rebuke
sections: She often rebuked him for carelessness.
她常常指責他粗心大意。
使相形見絀；作為對……的鞭策
His devotion to his work rebukes me.
他的敬業精神是對我的鞭策。
He dare not do it for fear of parental rebuke.
他怕父母訓斥，不敢為之。

title: scramble
sections: The children scrambled over the rocks.
The reporters scrambled for the phones.
He scrambled out of his clothes.
珍匆匆梳理了一下頭髮。
It's quite a scramble to get to the mountaintop.
費勁攀登才能到達山頂。
There was a scramble for the best seats.

title: abstain
sections: The doctor asked the patient to abstain from smoking.
Some voters abstained in the election.
一些選民在選舉中棄了權。

title: clumsy
sections: The clumsy boy bumped into the table.
笨拙的男孩撞到桌子上。
愚笨的，不圓滑的；不得體的
My clumsy answer hurt her feelings.
我笨拙的回答傷了她的感情。

title: greedy
sections: Don't be so greedy -- leave some of the food for the rest of us.
別這麼貪吃，留些食物給我們其餘的人吃。
The dictator was greedy for power.
渴望的；(興趣等) 強烈的 [（+for）] [+to-v]

title: scope
sections: Some technical terms are beyond the scope of this dictionary.
有些專門術語不在本詞典的範圍內。
He has no scope for his particular talents.
他沒有施展自己特殊才能的機會。
He is a man of limited scope.
他是一個見地狹窄的人。

title: mischief
sections: What mischief is he up to?
The frost did much mischief to the vegetables.
霜凍使蔬菜受到了嚴重的損害。
The boy is a regular mischief in school.
這男孩在學校裡是一個十足的淘氣鬼。
He is a real mischief to his family.
She tried to stir up mischief among the other pupils.
她試圖在其他學生之間挑起糾紛。

title: orbit
sections: The satellite was launched into orbit around the moon.
衛星被發射進入繞月球運行的軌道。
勢力範圍；活動範圍；知識範圍 [C] [U]
They knew each other by sight, but their orbits did not touch.
他們見面認識，但各有各的生活圈子。
環繞（天體等）的軌道運行
The space shuttle will orbit a weather satellite.
太空梭將把一個氣象衛星送入運行軌道。
The plane is orbiting over the field, waiting for the signal to land.
飛機在繞機場盤旋，等待降落的信號。

title: lament
sections: She lamented to us about her wretched lot.
她向我們哀歎自己悲慘的遭遇。
The widow lamented the death of her only child.
寡婦為她獨生子的死而悲痛。
We heard her laments at midnight.
我們在半夜裡聽到她慟哭。

title: abbreviate
sections: UFO is abbreviated from unidentified flying object. "UFO"是"unidentified flying object"（不明飛行物體）的縮寫。
Pupils had better read its abbreviated version.
小學生還是讀該書的節本好。

title: faculty
sections: He has lost his faculty of memory.
He has a great faculty for mathematics.
他具有很強的學數學的才能。
【美國英語 】 (大學或院，系的) 全體教職員 [G]
She has recently joined the faculty of Yale University.
她最近當了耶魯大學的教授。

title: insane
sections: (患) 精神病的；精神錯亂的；瘋狂的
The psychiatrists declared the killer insane.
心理醫生宣稱殺人犯有精神病。
精神病患者的；為精神病患者而設的
He works in an insane asylum.
他在一家精神病院工作。
It's completely insane to fly in this weather.
只有十足的瘋子才會在這種天氣飛行。

title: diploma
sections: She gained a diploma in Business Administration.
她取得了工商管理的學位證書。

title: evacuate
sections: The village was evacuated because of flood.
由於洪水這個村子已經撤空。
The civilians were evacuated from the city to farms.
百姓被從城裡疏散到了農莊。

title: suck
sections: The baby is sucking its finger.
吸收（水分）；吸取（知識）；獲取（利潤） [（+in/up）]
Plants suck up moisture from the earth.
The boat was sucked down into the whirlpool.
The old man sucked at his pipe.
這工作爛透了。我不想幹了。
This movie sucks. Let's leave right now.
這部電影真爛。我們現在就走，不看了。
The baby took one suck at the milk bottle and pushed it away.
嬰兒吸了一下奶瓶就將它推開了。
She had a suck of orange juice.

title: plague
sections: Europe suffered many plagues in the Middle Ages.
歐洲在中世紀屢屢遭受瘟疫。
The plague caused thousands of deaths.
The stores had to cope with a plague of burglaries.
商店不得不設法對付盜賊之災。
That child is the plague of my life.
那孩子成了我一輩子的煩惱。
Famine has plagued these countries for years.
這些國家遭受飢荒多年。
A severe back injury plagued him all his life.
嚴重的背傷終身折磨著他。

title: durable
sections: I want to buy a new durable car. My last one broke down in less than three months after bought it.
我想買一部耐用的新車。我的上一部買了不到三個月就壞了。
This raincoat is made of very durable material.
這件雨衣是用非常耐用的料子做的。

title: rehearsal
sections: The symphony is in rehearsal now.
這支交響樂正在排練中。
Can you save your rehearsal for later when we have more time?
你能不能把你的詳述留到我們有更多時間的時候再說？
The rehearsal of your answers to the most difficult quesitons would be helpful in your doctoral defense.
默述最棘手問題的答案對你的博士論文答辯會很有幫助。

title: hardware
sections: They chose to concentrate on simpler and more durable hardware.
他們選擇加強更簡單牢固的武器。
It really showed what you could do if you had the know-how and the hardware.
這讓你知道你若懂得竅門又有硬體多有可為！
Computer technology in all its phases from hardware to software has become less expensive.
電腦技術從硬體到軟體的各個方面都變得較為便宜了。

title: manipulate
sections: Do you know how to manipulate a computer?
巧妙地處理；(用權勢等) 操縱
A clever politician knows how to manipulate his supporters.
機敏的政客懂得如何操縱自己的支持者。
He was arrested for trying to manipulate the company's financial records.
他因企圖竄改公司財務記錄而被逮捕。

title: scrape
sections: He scraped the potatoes before frying.
他炸馬鈴薯前先將馬鈴薯刮皮。
He scraped the paint from the surface.
Mary scraped her knee when she fell off her bike.
瑪麗從腳踏車上摔下來擦傷了膝蓋。
Don't scrape your feet on the floor.
不要用腳摩擦地板發出刺耳的聲音。
The child scraped a hole in the sand.
這孩子在沙中刨了一個洞。
【口語】 (艱難地) 湊集，積攢；勉強過日子 [（+up/together）]
He has scraped together enough money to buy a car.
他已湊足了買一輛汽車的錢。
The bamboos scraped against the back wall of the house.
A chair scraped on the floor.
椅子在地板上拖得吱吱的響。
He heard the scrape of footsteps up the stairs.
他聽到有人上樓的嚓嚓的腳步聲。
He scraped through the narrow opening.
他勉強鑽過狹窄的開口處。
(艱難地) 積攢錢財；勉強過日子 [（+ by/along）]
The family could just scrape along but never asked for charity.
這家人只能勉強度日，但從沒有要過救濟。
He fell off the bike and got a scrape on his knee.
他從腳踏車上摔下來，擦破了膝蓋。

title: conceit
sections: 他的自負令人不能容忍。
He jotted down the conceits of his idle hours.
他記下了閒暇時想到的一些看法。
I don't have much conceit of his poems.
我對他的詩作沒有什麼好評。

title: incessant
sections: 不停的，連續的，持續不斷的
Her incessant complaining is tiresome to everyone.
她沒完沒了的抱怨使每個人都厭煩。
The incessant noise of the traffic gave us not a moment's peace.
交通車輛不停的喧鬧聲使我們得不到片刻安寧。

title: sculpture
sections: We saw sculptures of ancient Roman gods.
我們看到古代羅馬神的塑像。
I took a course in sculpture last semester.
我上學期選了一門雕塑課。
There are two horses sculptured in bronze at the gate.
在大門口有兩匹用青銅雕塑的馬。

title: tropical
sections: We've had tropical weather for the past few days.
我們過去幾天遇上了酷熱的天氣。

title: coward
sections: Only a coward would run from danger.
There was a coward silence when the stern principal came in.
嚴厲的校長走進來時，大家膽怯得不敢出聲。

title: seduce
sections: 誘惑；引誘；誘使墮落（或犯罪） [O]
The warm weather seduced me away from my studies to go for a walk.
溫暖的天氣誘使我放下書本去散步。

title: confound
sections: 使混亂；使困惑；使不知所措
Our clever tactics confounded our opponents.
我們的巧妙戰術弄得對手不知所措。
Don't confound the means with the ends.
不要把手段和目的混淆起來。

title: illuminate
sections: The streets were illuminated for the celebration.
We were greatly illuminated by the discussion.
這次討論對我們啟發很大。

title: scare
sections: They are scared that the ship might be wrecked.
My mother is scared to fly in a plane.
The watchdog scared away the thief by barking.
看門狗大聲吠叫嚇走了竊賊。
She was scared out of her wits.
You did give me a scare.
There was a rabies scare in town.
城裡發生了狂犬病恐慌。
【美國英語 】【口語】 駭人的；用以嚇唬人的 [B]
His scare tactics did not work.
他的恐嚇戰術沒有奏效。

title: satire
sections: That book is a satire on the administration of justice.
那部作品是對司法工作的諷刺。

title: prophet
sections: They listened to the words of the prophet.
他們聽著這個預言家的話。

title: adorn
sections: The hall was adorned with flowers.

title: deceive
sections: I deceived him and he found it out.
我欺騙了他，而他發覺了。
I was deceived into thinking that he was trustworthy.
我上當受騙，以為他很可靠。

title: fasten
sections: The little boy has learnt to fasten shoelaces.
這小男孩已學會繫鞋帶了。
The old lady fastened her eyes on the stranger.
老太太始終注視著那個陌生人。
It was wrong of you to fasten the blame on him.
你把過錯推到他頭上是不對的。
Fasten on what the teacher is saying.
There is no sense in fastening on that pretext of yours.
一味強調你那個藉口是沒有用處的。

title: superstition
sections: He holds that ignorance leads to superstition.
他認為無知會導致迷信。

title: antipathy
sections: He felt a strong antipathy towards them.

title: extravagant
sections: Don't be so extravagant; spend your money more carefully.
別這麼浪費；花錢節省些。

title: gasp
sections: She gasped at the ghastly sight.
那可怖的景象令她倒抽一口氣。
The seamen were gasping for the sight of land.
The wounded soldier gasped out a few words.
那個受了傷的士兵上氣不接下氣地說了幾句話。
The sick man's breaths were coming in gasps.

title: prone
sections: He was lying prone on the couch, fast asleep.
他俯臥在長榻上，睡得正香。

title: fraction
sections: He has done only a fraction of his homework.
他只做了家庭作業的一小部分。
The story does not contain a fraction of truth.
這故事沒有一點真實性。

title: slaughter
sections: Wholesale slaughter was carried out in the name of progress.
以進步的名義進行大規模的屠殺。
There is a campaign against those hunters who mercilessly slaughter baby seals.
一場反對那些殘酷屠殺小海豹的獵手的運動正在展開。
Millions were slaughtered in the war.
戰爭中數百萬人遭到屠殺。

title: tan
sections: Sun and wind had tanned the sailor's face.
日曬風吹使那水手的臉變得黑黝黝的。
棕褐色；曬成的棕褐膚色 [U] [S]
His arms and legs had a dark tan.
他的手臂和腿曬得黑黑的。
I bought a pair of tan leather shoes the other day.
前幾天我買了雙棕褐色的皮鞋。

title: aesthetic
sections: The professor advanced a new aesthetic theory.
那位教授提出了新的美學理論。
審美的；具有審美趣味的

title: ceiling
sections: The new houses in this locality have very high ceilings.
這個地區的新房子天花板甚高。
(價格，薪資等) 最高限度；最大限額
A new ceiling has recently been fixed on pay.
最近對薪資規定了新的最高限額。

title: esteem
sections: I have great esteem for his quick decision.
我對他的果斷甚為敬佩。
No one can esteem you more than I do.
沒有人會比我更敬重你。
I did not esteem him to be worthy of trust.

title: lure
sections: Life in big cities is a lure for many country boys.
大城市的生活吸引著許多鄉下小伙子。
誘惑力，吸引力；魅力 [the S] [（+of）]
He couldn't resist the lure of money.
他不能抵制金錢的誘惑。
這種價格對學生也有吸引力。

title: quota
sections: Our group fulfilled this month's quota ahead of time.
我們組提前完成了這個月的定額。
Each has his quota of work for the day.
每個人的工作日都有定額。

title: rip
sections: She ripped her skirt on a nail.
她的裙子被釘子劃破了。
The tailor ripped the hem and shortened the dress.
裁縫拆開下擺將連衫裙收短。
【口語】 狠狠地發出（詛咒等） [（+out）]
He ripped out an angry oath.
The car ripped along the highway.
She sewed up the rip in his sleeve.
她縫好了他衣袖上的裂口。

title: slap
sections: The rude boy got a slap in the face.
那個粗魯的男孩挨了一個耳光。
We heard the slap and plunge of people in the water.
我們聽到人們的擊水聲和跳水聲。
The remarks were taken as a direct slap at the existing government's policy.
那些話被看作是對現政府政策的一記耳光。
He slapped her across the face.
啪地一聲放下（或關上）；隨便地放置 [O]
He slapped a sack of cement down.
他砰的一聲重重放下一袋水泥。
【英國英語 】【口語】 胡亂地塗 [O]
We slapped some paint on the wall to brighten up the room.
我們在牆上塗了些油漆以使房間明亮一些。
The government slapped import quotas on foreign cars.
政府對外國汽車強制實行進口限額。
He slapped a libel suit on a newspaper.
他告一家報紙犯有誹謗罪。
The waves slapped against the jetty.
He slapped at the fly with a folded newspaper.
他用一張摺著的報紙拍打蒼蠅。
The thief ran slap into a policeman.
那賊與警察撞了一個滿懷。

title: affiliate
sections: a school affiliated with the church
接納……為成員（或分支機構）；使隸屬於 [H] [（+to/with）]
We are affiliated with a local club.
我們加入了當地的一個俱樂部。
They tried to affiliate that play to its author.
他們試圖追尋那個劇本的作者。
Our club has affiliated with a national society.
我們俱樂部加入了一個全國性協會。

title: cereal
sections: 穀類加工食品；玉蜀黍薄片；麥片 [C] [U]
I've just bought a box of cereal.

title: morale
sections: The army recovered its morale and fighting power.
這支軍隊恢復了士氣和戰鬥力。

title: relish
sections: Hunger gives relish to simple food.
The teacher had no relish for his jokes.
老師對他的笑話不感興趣。
Tom added more relish to his pie.
湯姆給自己的餡餅多加了些佐料。
We did not relish the prospect of staying after school.
一想到放學後還可能留下，我們便覺得不是滋味。
津津有味地吃（或喝）；欣賞，品味
有特定滋味；有特定意味 [（+of）]

title: spike
sections: a railing with long spikes on top
頂端有長長的尖鐵的欄杆
阻止；制止；使（計畫等）受挫
把烈酒攙入（飲料，水果，酒）
The boys spiked the drinks, so everyone at the party got drunk.
男孩們把烈酒攙入飲料，所以宴會中的每個人都喝醉了。

title: wig
sections: She used to wear a wig.
【美國英語 】【俚語】 頭髮；腦袋；頭腦
I have a pain in the wig.
The teacher wigged him for absent-mindedness.

title: maneuver
sections: 【軍事】 軍事演習，機動演習 [P]
The prime minister thwarted the opposition's maneuver to gain control of the government.
首相挫敗了反對黨企圖控制政府的陰謀。
maneuver for a position of power
He maneuvered his car into the garage.
他設法把汽車開進車庫。

title: crumble
sections: She crumbled an empty snail shell in her fingers.
她用手指捏碎了一個空蝸牛殼。
The recent earthquake crumbled the walls of many houses.
最近一次地震震坍了許多房子的牆。
This bread crumbles ever so easily.
In the end, the Roman Empire crumbled.

title: junction
sections: 接合點；交叉點；(鐵路的) 聯軌站；(河流的) 匯合處 [C]
The gas station is at the junction of two highways.
這個加油站位於兩條公路的會合處。

title: cue
sections: at a cue from the director
I threw her a cue but she missed it.
我給她暗示，可她沒有領會。
The band director cued the drums to begin.
樂隊指揮暗示鼓手們敲起來。

title: lethal
sections: In situations like this, she wished she had a gun or some lethal weapon.
在這種情況下，她真希望自己有一把槍或什麼致命武器。
Don't touch the bottle. It contains lethal chemicals.
不要碰這個瓶子。裡面裝有危險的化學品。

title: rattle
sections: A cold November wind rattled the windows.
十一月的寒風刮得窗戶咯咯作響。
【口語】 使窘迫不安，使驚惶失措；使惱火
She seemed rattled about our presence.
我們在場她顯得驚恐不安。
The window rattled in the wind.
The old wagon rattled down the road.
破舊的四輪運貨馬車喀嚓喀嚓地行進在路上。
孩子們興高采烈地哇啦哇啦講個不停。
We could hear the rattle of milk bottles.
我們可以聽到牛奶瓶的碰擊聲。
發出咯咯聲的東西；(嬰兒玩的) 撥浪鼓 [C]
The baby was playing with the rattle.

title: hug
sections: They hugged each other for the success.
他們為成功而互相擁抱。
She hugged her belief in ghosts.
The road hugs the side of the mountain.
The old friends hugged when they met.
老朋友重逢時緊緊擁抱。
She gave her son a hug and put him to bed.
她擁抱了一下兒子，然後讓他上床睡覺。

title: bashful
sections: 害羞的，羞怯的；侷促不安的
The boy was too bashful to ask her to dance.
那個男孩太羞怯，不敢請她一起跳舞。

title: embargo
sections: The country has put an embargo on all imports.
該國對所有進口品實行禁運。
impose an embargo on commerce with some country
lay an embargo on free speech
他們禁止那些船隻出入港口。

title: rod
sections: The rod bent as he pulled in the fish.
當他把魚拉上來時，魚竿都彎了。
Spare the rod, spoil the child.
I knew I was in trouble when I was taken to the garage with a rod.
當我被人拿著棍棒趕到車庫時，我知道我惹下麻煩了。
What do you think of the old saying: "Spare the rod, spoil the child."?
你對"孩子不打不成器"這句老話有什麼看法？

title: wardrobe
sections: Hang your suit in the wardrobe.
把你的那套衣服掛在衣櫃中。
(個人的) 全部服裝；(劇團的) 全部戲裝
他只有很有限的幾件衣服。

title: sanctuary
sections: The escaped prisoner found sanctuary in the temple.
逃跑的囚犯在寺院裡獲得了庇護。

title: patrol
sections: The policemen are now on patrol.
巡邏隊；巡邏艦隊；巡邏機隊 [C] [G]
Patrols were set up on the streets.
We've been patrolling for days but have seen nothing.
我們已巡邏了好幾天，但什麼也沒有發現。
I saw women patrolling the streets with rifles on their backs.
我看到婦女背著槍在街上巡邏。

title: evoke
sections: That old movie evoked memories of my childhood.
那部舊電影喚起了我童年的記憶。

title: antibody
sections: 【生物學/生理學/生物化學】 抗體 [C]
Antibodies are large proteins produced by plasma cells used by the immune system to identify and neutralize bacteria and viruses that invade the body.
抗體是由身體漿細胞產生的一種蛋白，可以辨識並且中和入侵的細菌或毒素。

title: dub
sections: The king dubbed him a knight.
授予……稱號；把……叫做；給……取綽號 [O9]

title: rave
sections: 胡言亂語；狂罵；激烈地說 [（+at/against）]
客人們極力誇贊可口的飯菜。
The wind raved through the mountains.
語無倫次地說，狂亂地說 [（+out）]
His mother raved out her grief.
他的母親語無倫次地傾訴心中的悲痛。
這男孩嚷得嗓子都啞了。
【口語】 熱烈讚美；讚揚，吹捧 [C] [U]
His new play received raves in the paper.
他的新劇本在報紙上受到讚揚。

title: magnet
sections: The West Lake in Hangchow is a magnet for visitors.
杭州西湖使遊客流連忘返。

title: wake
sections: I woke up at six this morning.
今天早晨我六點鐘醒來。

title: widow
sections: 使成寡婦（或鰥夫），使喪偶 [H]
His widowed mother brought him up.
他的寡母把他撫養成人。

title: scoff
sections: Why do they scoff at the idea that he will retire next year?
他們為什麼嘲笑他將在明年退休的想法？
他嘲笑他們動不動就驚恐萬狀。
He was the scoff of the town.

title: rug
sections: (鋪於室內部分地面上的) 小地毯；毛皮地毯
A thick, woolen rug covers the floor behind the desk.
一塊厚羊毛小地毯鋪在寫字臺後面的地板上。

title: indict
sections: 控告，告發；(尤指大陪審團) 對……起訴 [（+for/with）]
The jury indicted all eleven men named by the FBI.
陪審團對受到聯邦調查局點名的十一個人一併提起公訴。

title: crush
sections: Don't crush this box; there are flowers inside.
別壓壞這個盒子；裡面有花。
Their plot to overthrow the government was crushed.
他們企圖推翻政府的陰謀被粉碎了。
There was such a crush in the room that no one could move.
房間內擠得水泄不通，誰也無法動彈。

title: slam
sections: 猛地關上；啪嗒一聲關上
His neighbor slammed the door in his face.
他的鄰居當著他的面把門砰然關閉。
She slammed the book on the table.
她將書使勁往桌上一扔。
His habit of slamming friends made him unpopular.
他那苛刻指摘朋友的習慣使得他不得人心。
發出砰然聲；啪嗒一聲關閉
猛闖；猛撞；勢頭很猛地進行
The football players slammed into each other.
He threw his books down with a slam.
他砰然一聲將書摔在桌上。
【美國英語 】【口語】 猛烈的抨擊 [C]
對於你的謾罵我真受夠了。

title: ferry
sections: They waited for the ferry to return.
Two small boats ferry people back and forth.
兩隻小船往返為人擺渡。
The tourists ferried across to the opposite bank.

title: ruthless
sections: 硬著心腸下定決心的，堅決的
We'll have to be ruthless if we want to eliminate unnecessary waste.
如果我們要杜絕不必要的浪費，就得硬著心腸做。

title: shuffle
sections: The old lady shuffled across the room.
那老太太拖著腳步走過房間。
John shuffled the question off and changed the topic.
約翰避開這個問題，換了個話題。
Give the cards a good shuffle.

title: fabulous
sections: The museum has a fabulous collection of jewels.
該博物館有著驚人的珠寶收藏。
The dragon is a fabulous creature.

title: rifle
sections: He pulled the trigger of his rifle.
他扣響了他步槍的扳機。
The rifles lay behind the hill waiting for the order to fire.
步槍隊埋伏在小山後面，等待命令開火。

title: scarce
sections: Food and fuel were scarce in this region.
這地區食物和燃料都很缺乏。
年代久的郵票是珍貴的。

title: hover
sections: (鳥等) 盤旋；(直升機) 停留在空中
The helicopter hovered over the house.
直升機停留在那房子上空。
The dogs hovered around me while I was fixing their dinner.
我給狗兒們弄吃的時候牠們圍著我轉。
She is hovering between life and death.

title: crisp
sections: The celery is fresh and crisp.
We went for an outing on a crisp fall day.
我們在一個秋高氣爽的日子去遠足了。
乾脆的，乾淨俐落的；有生氣的
He has a crisp style of delivery.
使捲曲；使起皺，使起波紋
The bread crisped in the oven.

title: scatter
sections: The sun soon scattered the clouds.
He scattered his clothes all over the floor.
他把衣服扔了一地。（或：扔得滿地都是。）
The crowd scattered when the police charged.
當警察衝過來時，人群便散開了。
零星散布的東西；稀疏；少量 [S] [（+of）]
A scatter of applause reached him when he ended his speech.
演講結束時他聽到稀稀拉拉的掌聲。

title: friction
sections: Friction causes a rolling ball to stop finally.
摩擦力使得一隻滾動的球最終停了下來。
Constant friction wore out the heels of my shoes.
不斷的摩擦磨損了我的鞋跟。

title: subordinate
sections: A colonel is subordinate to a brigadier general.
Pleasure should be subordinate to duty.
與工作相比，娛樂應是第二位的。

title: banish
sections: He was banished from the country.
He tried to banish gloom from his thought.
他試圖驅除心中的憂愁。

title: dreary
sections: 沉悶的，陰鬱的，令人沮喪的
It was a dreary day, cold and without sunshine.
那一天天氣陰鬱，既冷又沒有陽光。
Copying manuscripts all the time is dreary work.
老是抄寫手稿是件枯燥乏味的差事。

title: hypocrisy
sections: 社會的不公以及政府的虛偽

title: mourn
sections: We mourn for our fallen soldiers.
The tribesmen are mourning the death of their chief.
那部落裡的人正在哀悼他們首領的去世。

title: robust
sections: Although some people say she has breast cancer, she proves that she is in robust health.
儘管有人說她得了乳癌，她卻證明她的身體好得很。
The once robust economy now lies in ruins.
這一度十分健全的經濟現已崩潰。

title: martial
sections: The sound of martial music is always inspiring.
軍樂聲總是令人振奮的。

title: stray
sections: A policeman took the old man who had strayed home.
一位警察把迷失在外的老漢送回了家。
They strayed about in New York for three days.
他們在紐約閒逛了三天。
Her mind had strayed back to her childhood.
她失了神，回想著自己的童年。
We are trying to help those young people who have strayed.
我們想幫助那些迷途的年輕人。
Her eyes kept straying from the page.
她的目光老是不由自主地離開書頁往別處看。
I found a stray cat crying at the door.
我發現一隻走失的貓在門口叫。
A stray bullet hit her in the leg.
一顆流彈擊中她的腿部。
走失的家畜；離群的動物
That cat is a stray that we took in.
那是我們收養的一隻走失的貓。

title: cherish
sections: They cherished the child as one of their own.
他們把這孩子當作自己親生子女一般。
She cherished the hope that he would come back to her some day.
她希望他終將回到她的身邊。

title: plow
sections: Plows are still pulled by oxen in some countries.
在一些國家犁頭仍由牛拖拉。
Farmers now use tractors to plow their fields.
現今農民用牽引機耕地。
We plowed our way through the crowd.
我們用力從人群中擠過去。
Farmers plow in autumn or spring.
農民在秋天或春天犁地。
Our great ship plowed through the heavy waves.
我們的大船穿越洶湧的波浪航行。
We've plowed through all the documents related to the case.
我們費力地閱讀了所有有關此案的文件。

title: amnesty
sections: The political exiles returned home under an amnesty.
流放的政治犯根據大赦令回到家園。
All the political prisoners were granted amnesty when the new President took office.
所有的政治犯在新的總統上任時獲得特赦。

title: sting
sections: A bee stung him on the back.
(心靈，感情上的) 刺痛，傷害
Their ridicule stung him into making a sharp reply.
他們的嘲弄刺激他作出了尖刻的回答。
They used to sting their clients.
Bees do not normally sting without being provoked.
如果沒有人惹它，蜜蜂通常是不螫人的。
My eyes are stinging from the smoke.
Be careful. The insect has stings.
The football team felt the sting of defeat.
足球隊嘗到了失敗的痛楚。
He felt a sting in the elbow.
(話中的) 刺；諷刺，挖苦；刺激性 [S]
Her words have a sting in them.

title: forge
sections: The blacksmith came out of the forge to fit the horseshoe.
鐵匠從鐵工廠出來安裝馬蹄鐵。
These machine parts have to be forged with the finest steel.
這些機器零件得用優質的鋼鍛造。
He forged a signature and cashed the check.

title: cart
sections: The farmer carted his potatoes to the market.
那個農民用車把馬鈴薯運到市場。
The police carted him off to jail.

title: plight
sections: He was in a sad plight, sick and penniless.
他貧病交加，處境十分困難。
Seeing the people's plight, he knelt down and prayed.
看到人民的困境，他跪下祈禱。

title: smuggle
sections: The gang smuggled weapons into that country.
這幫人將武器走私到該國。
These letters were smuggled out of prison.
這些信是從監牢中偷偷帶出來的。

title: trivial
sections: 瑣細的；不重要的；無價值的
Don't waste your time on these trivial things.
不要把你的時間浪費在這些瑣事上。
他是個非常淺薄輕浮的人。

title: fragment
sections: The glass fell to the floor and broke into fragments.
玻璃杯落在地上碎成破片。
The bowl fell and fragmented into bits.

title: alloy
sections: Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc.

title: preach
sections: He devoted his life to preaching the word of God.
他一生致力於傳播上帝的聲音。
The chaplain came and preached to a packed church.
牧師來給擠滿教堂的人們講道。

title: imperial
sections: 帝國的；(常大寫) 大英帝國的
By then Britain as an imperial power had declined.
到那時，英國作為一個帝國已經衰落。
皇帝（或女皇）的；最高（權力）的
Uncle is well known for his imperial generosity.
叔父的寬宏大量是出了名的。

title: hurl
sections: He hurled all the books out of the window.
A Saturn rocket hurled Apollo aloft.
一枚土星號火箭把阿波羅航天飛船送入空中。
The crowd hurled abuse at the police.
The tribesmen picked up great rocks to hurl at us.
部落男子揀起大石塊朝我們擲來。

title: shield
sections: Dark glasses are an effective shield against the glare.
墨鏡有效地阻隔強光保護眼睛。
Her hat shielded her eyes from the sun.
她的帽子遮住太陽光保護她的眼睛。
He lied to the court to shield his friend.
他對法庭說謊以包庇自己的朋友。
These trees will shield off arid winds and protect the fields.
這些樹林能擋住旱風，保護農田。

title: skeleton
sections: The ground floor of the museum is taken up by the skeleton of a dinosaur.
博物館的底層為一具恐龍的骨骼佔據了。
【口語】 骨瘦如柴的人（或動物）
He was reduced to a skeleton.
他瘦得只剩一把骨頭了。
He centers his constructions around reinforced concrete or steel skeletons.
他的建築主要是以鋼筋混凝土或鋼為骨架的。
She told me about the skeleton of her new novel.
她把自己一部新小說的梗概對我講了一遍。
The director set out the plan in skeleton form.
主任提綱挈領地說明了這一計畫。
Only a skeleton crew was needed while the ship was tied up in dock.
在船停泊在船塢期間只需要骨幹船員。

title: dash
sections: He dashed the glass bowl to bits on a rock.
他對著石塊把玻璃碗砸得粉碎。
The loss of his savings dashed his plan for a trip round the world.
他的積蓄丟失了，這使他作環球旅行的計畫成了泡影。
She dashed a glass of beer in his face.
她把一杯啤酒猛地潑在他的臉上。
She dashed off three letters in half an hour.
她在半小時內匆忙寫完三封信。
他的妻子上氣不接下氣地衝了進來。
He made a dash for the bus.
He finished first in the 100-meter dash.
他在一百米短跑中得了第一名。
Put in just a dash of vinegar.
Our troops attacked the enemy with a great deal of dash.
我軍極其勇猛地進攻敵方。
Her hopes met with a dash.

title: contingent
sections: 分遣隊；代表團；(大組中的) 一組 [G]
Have the Scottish contingent arrived at the meeting yet?
蘇格蘭代表團抵達會場了嗎？
the heir's contingent of the estate
繼承人所得的一份遺產
The time of his arrival is contingent on the weather.
他到達的時間要視天氣條件而定。

title: rib
sections: He broke a rib when he fell off his horse.
他從馬上摔下來折斷了一根肋骨。
They ribbed him for confusing the two words.
他們嘲笑他把這兩個字混淆了。

title: serial
sections: 連續的；一連串的；一系列的

title: fringe
sections: 穗狀物；(頭髮的) 劉海
She wore her hair in a fringe.
They put up tents on the fringes of the woods.
他們在樹林邊緣搭起帳篷。
The ancient city was fringed with wall.
這座古城四周圍著城牆。
A line of palm trees fringe the swimming pool.
游泳池邊緣圍了一圈棕櫚樹。
【美國英語 】 從屬的；附加的
These measures will help reduce fringe costs.
這些措施有助於減少附加費用。
The disturbance was made by a fringe group.
騷亂是由一個偏激集團製造的。

title: decree
sections: He is to be the new ambassador to Japan by decree of the government.
他受政府之命將擔任駐日本的新大使。
The court granted her a decree of divorce.
The minister decreed that there should be a full investigation.
這位部長命令要作詳細調查。
The committee decreed the movie unsuitable for children.
委員會裁定這部影片為兒童不宜片。

title: syndicate
sections: 【經濟學】 企業聯合組織，財團
A syndicate of local businessmen is bidding for the contract.
一個當地企業家的聯合組織在向這一合同投標。
透過供稿聯合組織在報刊上同時發表
The news was syndicated in papers around the world.
這一消息透過供稿聯合組織在世界各地報紙同時發表。

title: topple
sections: This scandal could topple the government.
這一醜聞可能使政府倒臺。
The pile of bricks toppled over.

title: incur
sections: I incurred his dislike from that day on.
從那天起我便惹他討厭。

title: brood
sections: 一窩孵出的雛雞（或雛鳥）；(昆蟲等) 一次產出的卵；一次孵化的幼蟲 [G]
The bird was trying to find food for its brood.
鳥兒在為牠的一窩小鳥覓食。
A brood of modern paintings will be exhibited at the museum.
一批現代畫將在博物館展覽。
憂悶地沉思，考慮；憂傷，擔憂 [（+on/over/about）]
The hen is brooding twelve eggs this time.
這次那隻母雞孵十二個蛋。
He brooded the problem all night.
他一整夜都在思考那個問題。
She was mad at her son for killing the brood hen.
她因兒子宰了傳種的母雞而對他十分惱火。

title: deplete
sections: 耗盡……的資源（精力等）；使空虛 [（+of）]
使湖中的魚類資源枯竭

title: militia
sections: 民兵部隊，義勇軍；國民軍 [the S] [G]
The militia is/are sometimes used for dealing with riots.
民兵部隊有時被召來對付暴亂。

title: salute
sections: 向……行禮，向……致敬；(以正式禮儀) 祝賀
We salute the flag everyday at school.
我們在學校每天向國旗行禮。
懷有敵意的喊叫聲傳入他們耳中。
He saluted the historic achievement of the government.
他讚揚政府的成就具有歷史意義。
The soldiers saluted with the hand.

title: witch
sections: I have heard of one old witch changing herself into a pigeon.
我聽說有個老巫婆把自己變成了一隻鴿子。

title: covet
sections: 他得到了人人都嚮往的職位。

title: school
sections: Which school does your child go to?
你的孩子在哪所學校唸書？
The whole school likes/like the headmaster.
全校師生都喜歡這位校長。
Does the writer belong to the Impressionist school?
這位作家是否屬於印象派？
You must school yourself to be modest and prudent.

title: paradox
sections: 似非而可能正確的議論 [C] [U]
"More haste, less speed" is a paradox. "欲速則不達"是似非而是的雋語。
The answer to the question is full of paradox.
對這個問題的回答矛盾百出。
It is a paradox that in such a rich country there should be so many poor people.
在這麼一個富有的國家中竟有這麼多窮人，真是咄咄怪事。

title: RSVP | ɑːrɛsviːˈpiː | abbreviation répondez s'il vous plaît; please reply (used at the end of invitations to request a response). verb (RSVPs, RSVPing, RSVP'd or RSVPed) [no object] reply to an invitation indicating whether one plans to attend: Are you coming? If you haven't RSVP'd make sure to do so | the event is free and open to the public; you just have to RSVP. ORIGIN French.
compact
sections: His uncle is a man of compact build.
The company came up with a new, more compact computer.
公司推出了一種新的更小型的電腦。
I appreciate his compact style of writing.
我欣賞他那簡潔的文體。
My wife compacted my clothes in a suitcase.
妻子把我的衣服緊塞在手提箱裡。

title: homely
sections: This hotel is a homely and comfortable establishment.
The psychologist explained my problem in homely terms.
那位心理學家用淺顯的詞語解釋了我的問題。
【美國英語 】 (人或容貌) 不好看的

title: haul
sections: A truck hauled the load away.
硬拖，硬拉；把……送交當局審處 [O]
He was hauled before the court on a charge of drunken driving.
他被指控酒後開車而被送上法庭受審。
It's a haul of ten miles.
那是十英里路程的拖運。
(一網的) 漁獲量；【口語】 一次獲得的量 [C] [（+of）]
We brought home a big haul of fish.
我們捕了一大網魚運回家來。

title: shuttle
sections: (織機的) 梭，梭子；(縫紉機的) 擺梭；穿梭般來回的東西
The shuttle moves backwards and forwards through the warp.
梭子在經線中來回移動。
We shuttled the passengers to the city center by helicopter.
我們使用直升機往返不停地將旅客運送到市中心。

title: warrior
sections: [C] (plural warriors) 武士，鬥士，戰士，勇士
A true warrior values glory and honor above life.
一個真正的勇士珍視榮譽勝過生命。

title: commute
sections: His sentence was commuted from death to life imprisonment.
他由死刑改判為終身監禁。
She commutes between Chicago and Rockford every day.
她每天通勤於芝加哥和洛克福之間。
commute with payment in place of labor
It's a long commute from New York to Boston.
從紐約通勤到波士頓路程很長。

title: scoop
sections: 【美國英語 】【口語】 新聞的搶先報導；獨家新聞；最新內幕消息 [C]
He got all the big scoops for the paper.
他為本報弄到所有的頭號獨家新聞。
scoop water out of a boat
搶在（別家）之前報導新聞；搶先獲得（新聞）；搶在……之前
We scooped the other companies by making the best offer for the contract.
我們為得到這一合同搶在別的公司前報出了最好的價錢。

title: dwell
sections: They dwelt in London for two years.
He dwelt in poverty most of his life.

title: clarify
sections: He clarified his stand on the issue.
他澄清了他在該問題上的立場。
他的說明解開了這個謎。
It requires great efforts to clarify sewage in cities.
淨化城市的汙水需要很大的努力。
My mind was clarified on this issue.
對這個問題我的頭腦變得清楚了。
他糊塗的頭腦突然清醒過來。

title: peril
sections: Icy roads are a peril to motorists.
結冰的道路對駕駛人十分危險。

title: intersection
sections: 交叉點；道路交叉口；十字路口 [C]
an accident at the intersection of North Road and Lemsford Road
在北路與萊姆斯福特路交叉口發生的事故

title: requisite
sections: She expected to achieve the requisite two-thirds majority for nomination.
她期望得到獲得提名所必需的三分之二多數。

title: degrade
sections: He was degraded for disobeying orders.
他因不服從命令而受到降級處分。
降低……的品格（或品質、價值等）；使丟臉
He degraded himself by cheating and telling lies.
他因欺騙、撒謊而損害了自己的人格。

title: obstinate
sections: She was as obstinate as a mule.
(疾病等) 難治的；難以控制的
These weeds are really very obstinate.

title: feeble
sections: 她因為生病而變得虛弱。
(智力，性格等) 弱的，軟弱的
He is a man with a feeble personality.
拙劣無效的；站不住腳的
A feeble cry came from the next room.
從隔壁房間裡傳來低弱的叫喊聲。

title: cliff
sections: It takes courage and strength to scale these cliffs.
攀登這些懸崖需要勇氣和力量。

title: grocery
sections: She bought a box of groceries.

title: recollect
sections: I recollect that the weather was cold.
I was unable to recollect the names.
我回想不起那些名字了。
I don't recollect having seen her before.
我記不起來以前曾見到過她。
As far as I can recollect, he was born in 1898 and died in 1972.
我記得他生於一八九八年，卒於一九七二年。

title: enlist
sections: 我們必須招更多的人從軍。
謀取……的贊助（或支持）；獲得（支持，幫助等） [（+in/for）]
Can I enlist your help in collecting money for the orphans?
我們為那些孤兒募集錢，你能出一點嗎？
Many people enlisted for the defense of their country.
許多人為了保衛國家而從軍了。
Many people enlist in the Red Cross drive each year.
許多人每年參加紅十字會運動。

title: conspicuous
sections: 明顯的，易看見的；顯著的
引人注目的，出色的，著名的 [（+for）]
Man's first moon landing was a conspicuous achievement.
人類的首次月球登陸是一個卓越的成就。
She's always conspicuous because of her fashionable clothes.
她總是穿著入時，引人注目。

title: spacious
sections: 我們來到一個寬敞的餐廳。

title: distract
sections: Noise distracted the writer from his work.
吵鬧聲使這位作者工作時注意力分散。
那個消息使她十分苦惱。

title: ambush
sections: The enemy fell into our ambush.
The general ambushed his troops in the dense woods.
將軍把部隊埋伏在濃密的樹林裡。

title: eloquent
sections: The speaker made an eloquent appeal for human rights.
該發言人就人權問題發出了強有力的呼籲。
Eyes are more eloquent than lips.

title: savage
sections: 野性的；兇猛的；殘酷的；猛烈的
The poor man received a savage beating from the thugs.
那可憐的人被暴徒們毒打了一頓。
未開化的，野蠻的，原始的
The inhabitants were still in the savage state.
這些居民仍處於野蠻狀態。
She was irritated by his savage behavior.
他的不文明行為激怒了她。
Her rudeness really made me savage.
她的無禮使我大為惱火。
These civilizations flourished while Europeans were still savages living in caves.
當歐洲人還未開化住在山洞裡的時候，這些文明已經處在發達的時期。
He was savaged by wild animals.
他遭到野獸的兇猛襲擊。
An opposition spokesman savaged the government's housing investment program.
一位反對黨發言人猛烈抨擊政府的住房投資計畫。

title: respiration
sections: I tried to gauge the depth of her sleep by the rate of her respiration.
我試圖透過她的呼吸速率來測定她的睡眠深度。

title: amuse
sections: A clown's job is to amuse the spectators.
小丑的工作就是娛樂觀眾。
It was too rainy to play outside, so she amused herself with a book.
雨大，不適合在外面玩，所以她看書消遣。
He amused himself by playing the flute.

title: melancholy
sections: Rainy days give me a feeling of melancholy.
雨天給我一種憂鬱的感覺。
All at once I fell into a state of profound melancholy.
我突然深深地陷入了憂思。
the melancholy sound of the wind

title: scrap
sections: Put the scraps of paper in the wastebasket.
將碎紙片放到廢紙簍裡。
Jimmy does not have a scrap of imagination.
吉米一點想像力也沒有。
All he could do was sell it for scrap.
他只得把它當廢物出售。
She read aloud scraps from the letter.
她高聲朗讀那封信的片斷。
He gave scraps of food to the dog.
他把剩餘的食物餵了狗。
About half of our new steel is old steel, otherwise known as scrap.
我們大約有一半的新鋼是舊鋼，也叫作廢鋼。
It is high time that the old plane was scrapped.
We had to scrap our plans.
我們不得不放棄我們的計畫。

title: dwindle
sections: His fortune dwindled to a few hundred pounds.
他的財產減少到幾百英鎊了。
他們會平安無事的希望變得渺茫了。

title: miscellaneous
sections: 混雜的，五花八門的；各種各樣的

title: tow
sections: The police towed the broken car away.
My car broke down; can you give me a tow?
我的車拋錨了，你能讓我把車掛在你的車後面拖行嗎？

title: extinct
sections: My hope of getting some employment was extinct.
我要找到工作的希望落空了。

title: nausea
sections: Early pregnancy is often accompanied by nausea.
She was filled with nausea at the sight of cruelty to animals.
她看到虐待動物滿腔厭惡。

title: turnover
sections: 營業額，交易額；證券成交額 [U] [S]
This product has a fast turnover, three shipments going out per day.
這產品的成交量很高，每天可出三批貨。
The shop has a turnover of 500,000 dollars a week.
該店營業額為每週五十萬元。
人員更替數；人員更換率 [U] [S]
That company has a fast turnover because of the poor working conditions.
那家公司因為工作環境很差，員工流動得很快。
They have a very high turnover of staff.

title: persecute
sections: They persecute those who do not conform to their ideas.
他們迫害那些不信奉他們思想的人。
In summer many people are persecuted by mosquitoes.
夏天，許多人受到蚊子的騷擾。

title: stalk
sections: 他始終無法擺脫內心的那種孤獨。
We stalked the woods for deer.
高視闊步地走過；(疾病等) 在……蔓延，在……猖獗
There are sharks stalking in those waters.
在那片水域有鯊魚出沒。
Drought and famine stalked the land.
乾旱和饑荒肆虐這片土地。
She stalked out of the room, her head high.
她昂著頭，高視闊步走出了房間。

title: bachelor
sections: He became a Bachelor of Arts at the age of twenty.
他二十歲時成了文學士。

title: plantation
sections: He once owned a cotton plantation.

title: hybrid
sections: The hybrid from a donkey and a horse is called a mule.
驢和馬的雜交種被稱為騾子。
混合源物；合成物；混合詞
"Cablegram" is a hybrid; half the word is Latin and half is Greek. "海底電報"一詞是混合語，半為拉丁語，半為希臘語。

title: nomad
sections: the nomad existence of the Gypsies

title: ammunition
sections: The ammunition depot is heavily guarded.

title: glare
sections: They stopped arguing and glared at each other.
他們停止了爭論，相互怒視著對方。
The sunlight glared on the ice.
陽光耀眼地照射在冰上。
The brothers glared hatred at each other.
兄弟倆用仇恨的目光對視。
She gave the rude man a glare.
她對那個粗魯的漢子怒目而視。
He had to wear sunglasses because of the glare of the sun.
因為陽光耀眼，他只好戴墨鏡。

title: obsolete
sections: Newer media are obsoleting the book.
更新的傳播媒介正在逐步淘汰書籍。

title: strenuous
sections: 游泳是很費力的運動嗎？
He made strenuous efforts to improve his reading.
他奮發努力提高閱讀能力。
It takes many years of strenuous training to be an outstanding athlete.
要成為一名傑出的運動員需要多年艱苦的訓練。

title: frantic
sections: (因喜悅，憤怒等) 發狂似的 [（+with）]
The mother was frantic with grief at the loss of her child.
母親因失去孩子悲痛欲絕。
He had a frantic rush to get his work done.
他急急忙忙把工作做完。

title: anchor
sections: 賴以支撐的人（或物），靠山
Her pledge to remain faithful to him was his anchor when he was in prison.
她對他忠貞不渝的保證是他服刑期間的精神支柱。
【美國英語 】 (電臺或電視臺) 新聞節目主播（anchorman, anchorwoman, anchorperson）
An anchor coordinates a newscast in which several correspondents give reports.
新聞節目主播在新聞節目中綜合整理若干記者的報導。
We anchored the tent with pegs.
She anchors a 45-minute news show at noon.
她每天中午主持四十五分鐘的新聞廣播。
那幾艘船在波士頓港外海面下錨停泊。

title: sprinkle
sections: We saw a huge vehicle sprinkling water on the street.
我們看到一輛車在街上灑水。
使星星點點地分布於；點綴 [O] [（+over/about/with）]
This region is sprinkled with small lakes.
這一地區星星點點地分布著許多小湖泊。
We had a sprinkle this morning.
我們這裡今天上午下了點毛毛細雨。
She put a sprinkle of sugar on the top of her cake.
她在蛋糕上灑了一點糖。
She covered the cake with chocolate sprinkles.
她在蛋糕上撒了一層巧克力。

title: loop
sections: Wind the wire in loops and put it away in the toolshed.
把鐵絲繞成圈圈，放到工具棚裡。
環狀物；環路，環線；(河等的) 彎曲處
The road makes a wide loop around the lake.
He looped the rope around the pole.
The path loops around the pond.
這條小路沿池塘繞一圈。

title: attribute
sections: He attributed his good health to exercise.
他認為自己之所以身體好是因為運動。
Do you think it proper to attribute weakness to women?
你覺得把軟弱當作女性的屬性適當嗎？
That play was wrongly attributed to Bacon.
那個劇本被錯誤地認為是培根的作品。

title: jingle
sections: (鈴、硬幣等金屬的) 叮噹聲
the jingle of the coins in a pocket
口袋裡的硬幣碰擊發出的叮噹聲
The coins in his pocket jingled as he walked.
他行走時口袋裡的硬幣叮噹作響。

title: embark
sections: They embarked on a campaign to get people to vote.
他們展開一場動員人們投票的運動。
The ship embarked passengers and cargo.
那艘船載上乘客，裝上貨物。
We are already embarked on a new course.
我們已開始踏上一條新的道路。
He embarked his fortune in trade.

title: gorgeous
sections: 【口語】 令人十分愉快的，極好的
The children had a gorgeous time in the amusement park.
孩子們在露天遊樂場玩得快活極了。

title: mandate
sections: (選民對選出的代表、議會等的) 授權，委任 [+to-v]
The government has a mandate from the people to increase taxes.
民眾授權政府增加稅收。

title: steer
sections: He steered his boat into the harbor.
She steered the conversation away from the unpleasant subject.
她設法擺脫這一不愉快的話題。
The country steered a middle course.
那個國家走了一條中間道路。
He steered into the parking area.
他把車子開進了停車區。
The freighter steered out of Santiago Bay that evening.
貨輪那天晚上駛出了聖地亞哥灣。

title: corps
sections: (醫務，通訊，軍械等兵種的) 部隊
His father served in the medical corps during World War II.
第二次大戰時，他父親在醫務部隊服役。
(經專門訓練或有特種使命的) 隊，組，團

title: aquatic
sections: We visited an aquatic city in Italy.
我們在義大利訪問過一個水上城市。

title: herb
sections: Many herbs are used in traditional Chinese medicine.

title: arena
sections: (周圍有觀眾席的) 比賽場，競技場
【比喻】 競爭場所，活動場所
A member of congress works in the political arena.

title: copyright
sections: The publisher sold the copyright on the novel to a movie producer.
出版商將這本小說的版權賣給了電影製造商。
a book copyrighted in somebody's name
版權歸某人名下的一本書

title: stumble
sections: He stumbled on the staircase and hurt his leg.
他在樓梯上絆了一跤，傷了腿。
The tired old man stumbled along.

title: atom
sections: He couldn't produce an atom of evidence.

title: franchise
sections: They were given the franchise a few years ago.

title: mob
sections: The police faced a mob throwing bricks and petrol bombs.

(盜賊等的) 一夥；犯罪集團
He is said to be a member of the mob.
據說他是犯罪集團的成員。

他一離開那房子就遭到了人群的襲擊。
Customers mobbed the store on its first day of opening.
商店開張的第一天顧客紛紛湧入購物。

title: hum
sections: 冰箱的馬達嗡嗡地響著。
The office is humming with activity.
She was humming a tune to herself.
He could hear the hum of the bees in the garden.

title: atrocious
sections: The Romans used atrocious means to treat their slaves.

【俚語】 頂呱呱的東西；稱心的東西

在……上開出溝（或槽等）；用溝（或槽等）連接
He was grooved in running errands for his neighbors.

【俚語】 過得快活；使人快活 [（+on）]

title: muse
sections: I like to muse about what I will do when I grow up.

title: lash
sections: The lash of public opinion compelled him to resign.

(風，雨，浪等) 猛烈打擊，猛烈衝擊

(風，雨，浪等的) 猛烈打擊，猛烈衝擊

title: siege
sections: The insurrectionary army laid siege to the capital.

sections: The haemoglobin molecule contains only four atoms of iron.

sections: Did you take out a patent on your design?

專利的；獲得專利的；有專利權的 [B]
Try some of this new patent medicine.
試試這種新的專利藥物吧。
給予……專利權；取得……的專利權

sections: Father was an austere man, very strict with his children.

我喜歡樸實無華的文體。

sections: The sky glittered with a myriad stars.

deplore the death of a close friend

sections: This land is rich with petroleum.
