We will hand on the torch which he has handed to us.
我們要把他傳授給我們的知識傳給後代。

title: emancipate
sections: 把某人從奴役下解放出來
This new machine will emancipate us from all the hard work.
這臺新機器將使我們從繁重的勞作中解脫出來。

title: poise
sections: The gymnast poised herself on the balance beam gracefully.
體操運動員優美地立在平衡木上。
把……拿著不動；使……懸著不動
He waited with his fingers poised over the keys.
他把手指擺在琴鍵上等著。
使（頭部等）擺出某種姿勢
他的頭擺出一副瞧不起人的樣子。
The diver poised on the edge of the high board.
跳水運動員在高臺邊上站穩。
The troops poised for a final battle.
She had perfect poise and never seemed embarrassed.
她非常沉著，從不顯得窘迫。
(頭部，身體等的) 姿勢，姿態
She was a beautiful girl with the grace and poise of a natural model.
她是一個美麗的姑娘，有著模特兒的那種優雅姿勢。
Good poise is important for a dancer.
保持良好的平衡對舞蹈演員非常重要。

title: cane
sections: Grandpa takes along a cane when he goes out for a walk.
爺爺出去散步時總要帶根手杖。
If you say it again, you will get caned.
你要是再講一遍，就要挨打。

title: ridge
sections: We drove up a hillside and finally stopped on a high ridge.
我們沿著山腰往上開，最後停在一個高高的山脊上。
The floor of the Atlantic ridges in the middle from north to south.
大西洋洋底在中部形成由北向南的海脊。

title: veto
sections: 否決；否決權；否決權的行使 [C] [U]
The President threatened to use his veto over the bill.
總統威脅要對這個議案行使否決權。
The old man put a veto on soccer in his garden.
老人禁止在他的花園裡踢足球。
The plan was vetoed by the government.
這個計畫被政府否定了。
His parents vetoed his plan to buy a motorcycle.
他的父母反對他買摩托車的計畫。

title: reap
sections: 收割（莊稼）；收割（田地）裡的莊稼；收穫
The farmers were busy reaping the rice in the field.
農民們忙著在田裡割稻。
Our firm is likely to reap a big profit this year.
今年我們公司很可能獲得巨額利潤。
They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.
流淚撒種的必歡呼收割。

title: tug
sections: Tug the drawer and it will open.
這抽屜用勁一拉就可以拉開。
The child tugged at his mother's sleeve.
小孩拉了拉他媽媽的衣袖。
He tugged all the year round to feed and clothe his family.
他終年為全家提供衣食而勞碌。
He gave the handle a gentle tug.
他輕輕地拉了一下把手。
拖船；(滑翔機的) 拖航飛機
Tugs were sent to the damaged oil tankers.
拖船被派去拉損壞了的油船。

title: bog
sections: 使陷入泥沼；使動彈不得 [H] [（+down）]
The truck got bogged down in the mud.
The talks with the union leaders bogged down on the questions of wages.
和工會領導人的談判在薪資問題上陷入了僵局。

title: sane
sections: 神志正常的，頭腦清楚的
No sane man would go swimming in this nasty weather.
神志正常的人誰也不會冒著如此惡劣的天氣去游泳。
He has a diseased body but a sane mind.
他身體有病但頭腦健全。
合乎情理的，明智的；穩健的
She has a sane attitude towards diving and never goes too fast.
她對於跳水的態度很明智，從不操之過急。

title: frugal
sections: She's always frugal of her money.
我們中午吃了一頓便飯。

title: superintendent
sections: (機關，企業等的) 主管，負責人
The school superintendent was worried about the lack of qualified teachers.
教育廳長對缺少合格的教師感到憂慮。
【美國英語 】 警長；【英國英語 】 警察督察長
The superintendent ordered a thorough investigation of the case.
警長命令對這一案件作徹底調查。

title: damn
sections: The expedition was damned from the start.
那次探險一開始就注定會失敗。
I don't give a damn what she does.
她做什麼我一點也不在乎。
I don't care a damn what he says.
Damn! I hit my thumb with the hammer.
Damn it! I forgot to turn off the gas.

title: wedge
sections: 導致分裂的事物，事情的起因
Her mother-in-law drove a wedge between her and her husband.
她婆婆挑起她與丈夫間的不和。
Open the door wide and wedge it with a wad of newspaper.
把門開大，再用一捲報紙把它楔牢。
Susan was wedged in the corner so tightly that she couldn't move.
蘇珊被緊緊地擠在一角，動都不能動。
Her foot wedged in the narrow crack.
她的腳卡在那狹縫裡了。

title: cannon
sections: The drunk man cannoned into a waiter.
那個醉漢撞在侍者懷裡。
A big dog came running round the corner, cannoned into him, and knocked him over.
一隻大狗由街角跑來，撞上他，把他撞倒了。

title: forum
sections: 公開討論的場所；討論會 [（+for）]
They are holding a forum on juvenile delinquency.
他們正舉行一個有關青少年犯罪的討論會。

title: deduct
sections: deduct a tax from one's wages

title: certificate
sections: 證明書；執照；(沒有學位的) 結業證書
To obtain a passport, you have to send in your birth certificate with the form.
要取得護照，你得把出生證和表格一起呈上。

title: tack
sections: Joe hammered a tack into the wall to hang a picture.
喬用錘子把一只大頭釘敲進牆中用來掛一幅畫。
If you can't persuade him, try a new tack.
如果你不能勸服他，那就試試新的方法吧。
We tacked some posters on the wall.
我們把一些海報釘在牆上。
They've tacked a couple of new clauses on to the end of the contract.
他們在合同的末尾加了兩條新的條款。

title: impending
sections: The dark clouds suggest an impending storm.
烏雲表明暴風雨即將來臨。
He was inadequately prepared for the impending examinations.
他對即將舉行的考試準備不足。

title: custody
sections: Parents have the custody of young children.
父母監護未成年的子女。
The documents are in the custody of my solicitor.
文件由我的律師保管著。
He was taken into custody immediately after the robbery.

title: odor
sections: His distrust of cities carries an odor of primitivism.
他對城市的不信任態度帶有一種原始主義的色彩。

title: plausible
sections: 貌似真實的，貌似有理的
Such a theory seems very plausible.
這一理論貌似十分有理。

title: skim
sections: She skimmed the soup to remove most of the fat.
她撇去了湯上的大部分浮油。
I skimmed the foam from the boiling syrup.
我撇去了煮沸糖漿上的泡沫。
Does private education skim off all the best students from the state system?
私立學校是不是會把公立學校最好的學生都挖走？
The lake was skimmed with ice.
Since he had no time to read the book in detail, he just skimmed it.
由於他沒有時間細讀那本書，所以他只把它瀏覽了一遍。
He skimmed through the newspapers over breakfast.
他吃早飯時瀏覽了報紙。
During the cold night, the puddles skimmed over.
夜間寒冷，水窪面上結了冰。
A skim of ice formed in the ruts.

title: dawn
sections: We must get up at dawn.
我們必須天一亮就起來。
The truth at last dawned upon her.
她終於明白了事情的真相。

title: gale
sections: 強風；時速32至63英里的強風
Trees were blown down in the gale.
I heard gales of laughter coming from the kitchen.
我聽到廚房裡傳來陣陣笑聲。

title: chant
sections: The chant of the crowd was "Work for all".
群眾反覆有節奏地呼喊的是"給大家工作"。
反覆（單調）地唱（或說）；吟誦
The crowd chanted their demand in front of the city hall.
群眾在市政廳前齊聲有節奏地呼喊著他們的要求。
After his first performance all the newspapers chanted the praise of this new actor.
首場演出之後，各報對這位新演員都大加讚揚。
反覆（單調）地唱歌（或說話）；吟誦
The demonstrators chanted in the square.
示威者在廣場上單調而有節奏地喊叫。

title: choke
sections: The child was almost choked by the heavy smoke.
這孩子幾乎被濃煙窒息了。
The storeroom was choked with furniture.
I managed to choke back my tears.
They choked the fire with sand.
花園裡野草叢生，什麼也長不出來。
The fish bone in her throat made her choke.
她喉嚨中的魚骨使她哽噎。

title: pertain
sections: We own the house and the land pertaining to it.
我們擁有這所房子和附屬的土地。
This lesson pertains to marine animals.
Her conduct hardly pertains to a lady.
她的行為與女士身分不太相符。

title: subconscious
sections: 下意識心理活動，潛意識心理活動 [the S]
My answer seemed to come from the subconscious.
我的回答似乎出自下意識。

title: deem
sections: [W] (past deemed, pp deemed, present deeming) 認為，以為；視作 [+（that）] [O8] [O9]
He was deemed a traitor by his own people.
He deemed that it was his duty to help the needy.
他認為幫助窮人是他的責任。
He deemed it wise to refuse the offer.
他認為拒絕這一提議是明智的。

title: carve
sections: The statue was carved out of marble.
那雕像是用大理石雕刻的。
He carved me a piece of meat.
They carved out an orchard where there used to be wild grass.
他們在曾是野草叢生的地方開闢了果園。

title: spine
sections: His spine developed a slight curve.
The land is flat and marshy before rising to a spine of low hills.
這一帶地形平坦而多沼澤，再往遠去地勢隆起，形成矮山陵地。

title: remit
sections: The prisoner's sentence cannot be remitted.
這個犯人的徒刑不能免除。
She remitted her efforts after the mid-term test.
她在期中考試以後放鬆了努力。
You will have to remit this problem to a higher authority.
你得把這個問題提交給上一級。
I promised to remit the balance by the weekend.
我答應週末前將餘款匯去。
Please remit promptly by money order.
請速將款項用匯票匯來。

title: flap
sections: I flapped the flies away but soon they flew back.
我把蒼蠅趕走，但一會兒又飛回來了。
使（上下，前後地）拍動，飄動；(鳥) 振（翅）
Some doves were flapping their wings over the square.
有幾隻鴿子在廣場上空振翅飛翔。
Taylor flapped the document down angrily.
拍動；飄動；(鳥翼等) 撲動
The flag flapped in the breeze.
What's the point of flapping about it now?
現在空談這件事有什麼用？
垂下物；(袋) 蓋；(帽) 邊；(信封的) 蓋口
I licked the flap of the envelope and sealed it.
我舔了舔信封蓋口，把它封好。
She was in a bit of flap.

title: bait
sections: The little fish took the bait.
He lured her with the bait of a good job.
他以給一份好差使引誘她。
獵人在陷阱裡下了誘餌。
He baited the broker by promises of higher commissions.
他答應給更高的佣金來引誘那位經紀人。

title: tumble
sections: Tom tumbled over and hit his head on the concrete.
湯姆摔倒，頭撞到水泥地。
The sick child tumbled restlessly in his bed.
生病的小孩在床上輾轉反側焦躁不安。
It only needed a push and the whole building would come tumbling down.
只要稍稍一推，那整幢房子就會倒塌下來。
Stock market prices tumbled after rumors of a rise in interest rates.
謠傳利率上升之後，股票市場價格猛跌。
匆匆忙忙地做；跌跌撞撞地走
【英國英語 】【俚語】 突然明白 [（+to）]
It was a long time before she tumbled to what I meant.
她用了很長時間才明白了我的意思。
Quite accidentally, the police tumbled on the answer to the mystery.
警察出乎意外地找到了那疑案的答案。
I could just see her face and her tumbled hair.
我只能看見她的臉和蓬亂的頭髮。
He tumbled his clothes and books into a big sack.
他把他的衣服和書胡亂裝進一只大口袋。
使翻滾；用烘乾機烘乾（衣服）
You can tumble the clothes dry in a dryer.
你可以用烘乾機將衣服烘乾。
Stock prices took a tumble in the afternoon.
The child is practicing a tumble.
His desk was a complete tumble of papers and books.
他的書桌上亂糟糟地堆滿了報紙和書籍。

title: squash
sections: He managed to squash into the car.
Five people in this car is a bit of a squash.
五個人坐這輛車有一點擠。

title: vinegar
sections: Use half a lemon dipped in salt and vinegar.
用半個檸檬蘸上鹽和醋。

title: defy
sections: He defied the order of the court.
I defy you to jump that high hurdle.
我倒要看看你能不能跳過那高欄。
她的古怪行為無法理解。

title: inscribe
sections: His name was inscribed on the ring.
Will you inscribe your name in the book?
能否請你在這本書上簽名？
inscribe a book to a friend
My father's words are inscribed on my memory.

title: delegate
sections: 代表；會議代表；代表團團員 [C] [（+to）]
巴比特是一名正式代表。

title: pious
sections: Her mother was a pious Christian.
她母親是一個虔誠的基督教徒。
Congress had done no more than set out some pious hopes.
國會除了提出一些不可能實現的希望之外別無所為。

title: din
sections: The children were making such a din that I couldn't study.
孩子們吵鬧得太厲害，使我無法學習。
din an idea into one's ears
絮聒不休地向某人講一個想法

title: intrude
sections: Don't intrude in a family dispute.
He tried to intrude his opinions on me.
他想把他的意見強加給我。
He intruded himself into the conversation without a word of apology.
他連招呼都不打就插進來講話。

title: splint
sections: She wore a metal splint on one leg.
她的一條腿上上了金屬夾板。

title: estrange
sections: His foolish behavior estranged all his friends.
他的愚蠢行為令所有的朋友與之疏遠。
The argument estranged him from his wife.
這一爭論使他同妻子疏遠了。

title: denounce
sections: The minister's action was denounced in the newspapers.
這位部長的行為在報紙上受到譴責。
At the meeting people denounced him as a traitor.
在會上，人們譴責他為叛徒。
They denounced him to the police as a criminal.
他們向警察告發，說他是罪犯。
He denounced the offenders to the authorities.
他向當局告發了肇事者。

title: filth
sections: Go and wash that filth off your hands.
快去把手上的髒東西洗掉。
How can you read such filth?
你怎麼能看這種下流的東西？

title: bark
sections: What are the dogs barking at?
The dog gave several fierce barks.

title: offspring
sections: His offspring are diligent and intelligent.
他的後代既勤奮又聰明。
The atomic bomb is the offspring of twentieth century physics.
原子彈是二十世紀物理學的產物。

title: stab
sections: The man was stabbed to death in his office.
這男士在辦公室裡被刺身亡。
The escaped prisoner stabbed at the policeman with a knife.
(疼痛、驚奇等) 突發的一陣 [（+of）]
I felt a stab of pain in the back.

title: tame
sections: 溫順的，馴良的，聽使喚的
Don't be afraid. These horses are tame.
The reactor was built for tame atomic energy use.
這座反應堆是為原子能的安全使用而建造的。
Bill is too tame to stand up for his own rights.
比爾太沒骨氣，竟不敢起來維護自己的權利。
【口語】 平淡的，乏味的，單調的
It was a tame book and he soon fell asleep over it.
那是一本平淡無奇的書，不久他就趴在書上睡著了。
She is an expert in taming animals.
Harsh punishment in childhood had tamed him and broken his will.
童年時代所受的嚴厲懲罰使他變得唯唯諾諾，缺乏意志。
This urge to take revenge is something that we have to tame.
這種復仇的衝動是我們必須抑制的。
Within two years they had tamed this inhospitable landscape.
兩年之內他們已經開墾了這片荒涼的土地。

title: china
sections: Please put the china away carefully.
請將這些瓷器仔細收好。

title: fuse
sections: A short circuit will blow the fuse.
He fused all the lights by using his electric stove.
他因用電爐，燒斷了保險絲，電燈全都熄滅。
We fuse copper and tin to make bronze.
我們把銅和錫熔製成青銅。
We fused the pipes with solders.
Lead will fuse at a lower temperature than some other metals.
鉛的熔點比其他一些金屬低。
We disagreed at first but eventually our ideas fused.
我們的意見開始時有分歧，但最後取得了一致。

title: orphan
sections: The boy became an orphan at six.
那男孩六歲時成了孤兒。
無雙親的，無父（或母）的，孤兒的
The girl was brought up in an orphan home.
那女孩是在孤兒院養大的。
The Collins adopted the child when she was orphaned.
當這孩子變成孤兒時，柯林斯一家把她收養了。

title: autobiography
sections: I enjoy reading Mark Twain's autobiography.
我喜歡讀馬克‧吐溫的自傳。
Autobiography is often less truthful than biography.
自傳常常沒有傳記真實。

title: detach
sections: The coupon is not valid if detached.
The officer detached thirty men to guard the railroad station.
那位軍官派了三十名士兵去守火車站。

title: crouch
sections: There was a cat crouching in the corner.
The servant crouched to his master.
那僕人向主人低頭哈腰。

title: rubbish
sections: Our job is to clear away the rubbish.
我們的工作是清除這些垃圾。
Teachers in schools have been rubbished for the last ten years.
過去十年學校教師一直受抨擊。

title: stall
sections: There were six stalls for horses in the stable.
There are traders' stalls on both sides of the street.
這條街的兩邊都有生意人的貨攤。
【英國英語 】 (劇場等的) 正廳前座區[the P]；正廳前座座位
I managed to get two seats in the stalls.
我設法弄到兩張正廳的票。
(教堂內的) 牧師座位；牧師職位
How long has he had his stall?
他擔任牧師職位多久了？
(發動機的) 熄火；(汽車的) 拋錨；(飛機的) 失速
The plane went into a stall.
The cows were stalled in the barn for the night.
牛被關在牲畜棚裡過夜。
使陷入泥潭；使動彈不得
We were stalled in the mud.
An inexperienced pilot can easily stall his plane.
沒有經驗的飛行員很容易使他的飛機失速。
My car stalled half way up the hill.
我的車子開到半山腰拋錨了。

title: overflow
sections: 浴缸裡的水滿得溢出來了。
他的心裡充滿了感激之情。
The crowd overflowed the theater into the street.
戲院裡人多得容納不下而被擠到街頭。

title: avert
sections: He could only avert his eyes; he had never seen such an ugly sight.
他只能避開眼去；他從未見過如此醜惡的景象。
There must be immediate action if chaos is to be averted.
要避免混亂就必須立即採取行動。

title: wharf
sections: We walked her to the wharf and put her aboard the ship.
我們陪她走到碼頭，將她安頓到船上。

title: trophy
sections: 戰利品；勝利紀念品；獎品 [C]
In his athletic career he won three cups and many other trophies.
在他的運動生涯中，他獲得三個獎杯和許多其他獎品。

title: flounder
sections: We floundered through deep snow to get to the store.
我們費力地踏著厚厚的積雪去那家店裡。
他張惶失措地作完了演說。

title: stitch
sections: Oh dear! I've dropped a stitch.
He had twelve stitches on his face.
The children in the pool did not have a stitch on.
池裡的小孩子一絲不掛。
She didn't do a stitch of work the whole afternoon.
她一個下午什麼事也沒有做。
He had a stitch in the side.
The doctor stitched the cut on his head.
醫生縫合了他頭部的傷口。
She picked up her embroidery and started stitching.
她拿起刺繡活兒繡了起來。

title: beast
sections: The lion is the king of beasts.
Greed brought out the beast in her.

title: concord
sections: 一致，協調；(國際的) 和睦 [U]
These neighboring states had lived in concord for centuries.
這些鄰國幾百年來和睦相處。

title: repent
sections: You should repent and start anew.
I have nothing to repent of.
He has bitterly repented his folly.
我悔不該作出那種決定。

title: transact
sections: transact some business in New York

title: brace

The little girl had braces on her teeth.
這個小女孩牙齒上戴著矯正器。
He came home with two brace of rabbits in the bag.
他帶著裝有兩對野兔的獵袋回家來了。
The roof was braced with four poles.
The villagers braced themselves for a possible flood.
村民們作了可能發生洪水泛濫的防備。
She braced up for the arduous task.
她鼓起勇氣去從事那艱鉅的任務。
It is urgent that we brace against typhoons.

title: perspire
sections: Hot and perspiring, he toiled up the dusty ascent.
他艱難地在塵土飛揚的坡道上爬著，熱得汗水淋淋。

title: scanty
sections: Crops are very scanty this year.

title: proficient
sections: She is a proficient in music.

title: cling
sections: She was wet through and her clothes clung to her body.
她濕透了，衣服黏在身上。
The little girl clings to her mother.

title: surge
sections: It failed to stimulate a surge of investment in industry.
這沒有能刺激工業投資的激增。

Every time a bus came, the crowd surged forward.

title: breach
sections: (對法律等的) 破壞，違反；(對他人權利的) 侵害 [C] [U]
Your action is a breach of the agreement.
你們的行為違背了協議。
Police arrested the demonstrators for committing a breach of the peace.
警察以破壞和平罪逮捕了示威者。
The waves made a breach in the sea wall.
海浪將防波堤衝開一個缺口。

那次爭吵後，他與表兄鬧翻了。
The enemy's fierce attack finally breached the wall.

title: precarious
sections: Our financial situation is still precarious.
我們的財政狀況仍不穩定。

title: counterfeit
sections: It is a crime to counterfeit money.

title: snore
sections: He soon fell asleep and began to snore.
他很快睡著並開始打起鼾來。
The old man snored away the afternoon.
老人打著鼾睡了一個下午。
他的鼾聲打擾了我們的睡眠。

title: tranquil
sections: There was a tranquil expression on her face.
她臉上露出安詳的神情。
They lived a tranquil life in the countryside.
他們在鄉下過著寧靜的生活。

title: hook
sections: 鉤，掛鉤；(衣服的) 鉤扣
Will you hang my coat on the hook?
幫我把我的外套掛在鉤上行嗎？
用鉤鉤住（或掛起）；扣（衣服）的扣子 [O]
Will you hook my coat for me?
你幫我把上衣掛好行嗎？

那個年輕女人決心釣個金龜婿。

這條路沿著湖岸蜿蜒伸展。

這件外套從前面用鉤眼扣扣住。

title: agenda
sections: 你今天有那些工作要做？

title: regime
sections: Under the old regime women could not vote.
在舊政權下婦女不能選舉。
飲食起居制度，食物療法，養生法（= regimen）
The baby's regime included two naps a day.
這嬰兒的生活規律包括一天小睡兩次。

title: engross
sections: She was engrossed in her book.

title: deform
sections: Her face was deformed by anger.

title: bastard
sections: 可憐的傢伙，他上當受騙了。
外形（或式樣）異常的，尺碼特殊的
外形相像的；近似然而不典型的

title: fling
sections: She flung the book onto the bed.
她將書使勁往床上一扔。

She flung him a scornful look.
Every morning Jane flings the windows open and breathes in the fresh air deeply.
珍每天早晨推開窗戶，深深吸一口新鮮空氣。
She flung off without saying goodbye.
她沒有告別就匆匆走了。

title: weird
sections: 鬼怪似的；怪誕的；神祕的
They were awakened by a weird shriek.
他們被一聲怪叫吵醒了。
【口語】 奇特的；不可思議的
That was really a weird movie.

title: spiral
sections: 螺旋形上升（或下降）；不斷加劇地增加（或減少）
軍事預算繼續急遽增加。

title: bullet
sections: A bullet-proof car stops bullets from passing through it.

title: perpetual
sections: They hoped to live in perpetual happiness.
他們希望生活在永久幸福之中。
【口語】 無休止的；連續不斷的

我對你無休止的嘮叨厭煩了。

那是一株雜種的四季開花的薔薇。

title: cartoon
sections: (以政治、時事為題材的) 諷刺畫
This is one of the most vivid cartoons I have ever seen.
這是我所見到的最生動的漫畫之一。
我的孩子們喜歡卡通影片。

title: drench
sections: It was raining and I was drenched when I got home.
天下著雨，我回到家時渾身濕透了。

title: trunk
sections: The trunk of this tree is four meters thick.
這棵樹的樹幹有四米粗。
(旅行用) 大皮箱；汽車車尾的行李箱
Let me put your baggage in the trunk.
我來把你的行李放在汽車後部的行李箱內。
The athlete has a powerful trunk.
那個運動員身軀強壯有力。

title: brass
sections: The brasses need to be cleaned.
How did she have the brass to ask for more?
她怎麼有臉開口再要呢？
銅管樂器的；聲音嘹亮的
Their band has some excellent brass players.
他們樂隊有幾個出色的銅管樂器手。

title: enlighten
sections: Can you enlighten me on this issue?
你能否在這個問題上指點我一番？
I like those TV programs which enlighten the viewer as well as entertain him.
我喜歡那些既使觀眾得到娛樂又使觀眾受到教育的電視節目。

title: paste
sections: He stuck the sheets of paper together with paste.
他用漿糊把這些紙張黏在一起。
Mix the butter and flour into a paste.
將奶油和麵粉合成麵糰。
She spread some tomato paste on the fried fish.
她在炸好的魚上塗了一層番茄醬。
Posters were pasted up on the bulletin board.
布告欄上貼了一些海報。
He had two pieces of bread thickly pasted with butter.
他吃了兩片塗有厚厚一層奶油的麵包。

title: forsake
sections: His children pleaded with him not to forsake them.
他的孩子們懇求他不要遺棄他們。
He forsook medicine to study literature.
他放棄醫學去研究文學。
She persuaded her husband to forsake his drinking habit.
她說服丈夫改掉嗜酒的習慣。
At fourteen he ran away, forsaking his home and friends.
他十四歲出走，離開了家鄉和朋友。

title: torment
sections: He suffered torments from a bad burn.
他因嚴重燒傷而受痛苦。
She is a real torment to me.

title: flank
sections: The commander decided to attack the enemy on both flanks.
指揮官決定從兩側對敵人發起進攻。

他們繞過雷區，繼續往北。

title: tentative
sections: 試驗性的，嘗試的；暫時性的
Each step he took was slightly tentative.
他每走一步都有些遲疑不決。

title: clan
sections: (由共同利益結合的) 幫派，集團
All the higher-grade engineers have formed a little clan of their own.

作為一名舞臺演員她失敗了。

He fell with a flop into the water.

title: stride
sections: He strode out of the room.
He strode across several rain puddles on his way home.
他在回家的路上跨過了好幾個雨水坑。
He strode the halls of the building, looking for the exit.
他在大樓的過道裡大步走著，尋找出口。

sections: 那位騎士打敗了每一個敵手。

title: innate
sections: 與生俱來的；天生的；固有的

某種處境所固有的滑稽性

sections: 冗長乏味的；使人厭煩的

如果我們同心協力，我們應該能夠打贏這場比賽。

他是一個有崇高理想的人。

【美國英語 】【口語】 小巧玲瓏的，令人喜愛的

I'm going to replace my battered car with a new one.
我打算買輛新車來取代我那輛破車。

海浪不斷地拍擊著海岸。

title: slang
sections: Their conversation was full of slang.

title: clinch
sections: 使（釘子等）釘牢而敲彎（或敲平）釘尖；用敲彎（或敲平）釘尖的辦法把……釘牢

(拳擊等) 用臂鉗住對手（使其不能有效出擊）
拳擊手互相用臂鉗住對手。

title: toil
sections: He succeeded after years of toil.
他經歷數年的辛勞之後成功了。
That book is a toil to read.

She's caught in the toils of despair.

他們整天艱苦地挖壕溝。

人們因他人格高貴而敬重他。

title: outfit
sections: 全套裝備；全套工具，全套用品 [C]

A television outfit went there to shoot the story.

登山者用最新的設備裝備起來。

title: stack
sections: The grain has gone mouldy in the stack.
He placed his books in a neat stack.
他把書整整齊齊放成一堆。

Mother is stacking the plates in the kitchen.
母親在廚房裡把盤子一個個疊起來。

The memberships of this committee are stacked to give the majority party substantial control.

How does their product stack up against those imported from foreign countries?
他們的產品與從外國進口的產品相比如何？

The tree grew on the brink of the cliff.

他把國家帶到了戰爭邊緣。

title: tumor
sections: The surgeon operated on him to remove the tumor.
外科醫生給他做手術以切除腫瘤。

title: ornament
sections: She went in this morning and noticed one of the ornaments was missing.
今天早晨她一進去就發現丟了一件飾品。
His writings are very plain, entirely devoid of any literary ornament.
他的作品非常樸素，完全沒有任何的文學雕琢。

他給他那一行大增光彩。
The hall is ornamented with Chinese paintings.

title: commemorate
sections: a plaque that commemorates the battle
一塊紀念那次戰役的匾

title: plaster
sections: The walls were in a dreadful condition -- their yellow plaster was peeling off.
牆已經破爛不堪，上面的灰泥都在剝落。
I dabbed the cut and applied a plaster.
我在切開的傷口上塗了一點藥並貼上一塊橡皮膏。
在……上塗灰泥；厚厚地塗抹 [（+over/with）]
My shoes were plastered with mud.
The nurse washed and plastered the wound.
護士清洗了傷口並在上面貼了膏藥。
He plastered his room with pictures of actors and actresses.
他在他房間裡貼滿了男女演員的照片。

They tried to plaster over the differences.
Our football team really got plastered last week.
我們的足球隊上星期遭到慘敗。

title: throng
sections: Mike dashed through the throng of people on the street.
The square was thronged with people.
People thronged to watch the football match.
人們爭先恐後地去看那場足球賽。

title: wretched
sections: They are living in wretched poverty.
他們過著可憐的貧苦生活。
This aching tooth makes me feel wretched.
這一顆牙痛得我難受極了。

title: adjacent
sections: The two families live on adjacent streets.
這兩家住在兩條相鄰的街上。

title: remorse
sections: With remorse and shame, he asked for her forgiveness.
他羞悔交加地請求她的諒解。
She had no remorse about what she had said.

title: click
sections: The lock opened with a click.
The camera clicked and their picture was taken.
照相機"卡嗒"一聲照下了他們的相片。
恰好吻合；(兩人) 一見如故，一拍即合 [（+with）]
【口語】 進行順利；成功，受觀眾歡迎 [（+with）]
The captain clicked his heels together and saluted his superior officer.
上尉喀嚓一聲立正，向上級軍官行軍禮。

title: vein
sections: Just over each temple there were little blue veins.
就在兩鬢太陽穴上面顯露著青色的細小靜脈。
After years of prospecting, they struck gold veins.
經過多年勘探之後，他們找到了金礦礦脈。

他年輕時沒有演喜劇的才幹。

I am not in the vein for jokes.
使有脈絡（或條紋）；使呈脈絡狀 [H]
The window was veined with cracks.
那窗戶布滿了道道裂紋。

title: magnitude
sections: No one comprehended the magnitude of the problem then.
當時無人認識到這一問題的嚴重性。
It is difficult to imagine the magnitude of the universe.
【天文學】 星等（指星的亮度） [C]
a star of the second magnitude
A giant earthquake registering 9.1 magnitude hit California, causing the death of several thousand people.
一個震度達9.1級的大地震襲擊加州，

title: throne
sections: Queen Elizabeth came to the throne in 1952.
伊麗莎白女皇一九五二年即位。
He swore allegiance to the throne.
The new king is throned today.

title: preface
sections: The book has a preface written by the author.
The accident was the preface to a great scientific discovery.
這一偶然事件成了一項重大科學發現的前奏。
Each chapter is prefaced by a short introduction.
每章前面都有一個簡短的介紹。
作為……的開端（或序幕，前奏） [O] [（+with）]
He prefaced his remarks with a smile.

title: annihilate
sections: 殲滅，消滅；徹底擊潰；毀滅

一枚原子彈能毀滅一個城市。
廢止，使無效；視……為無關重要
使他人的野心化作泡影

title: doze
sections: He dozed off during the sermon.
他在聽布道時打了一會兒盹。
他在瞌睡中度過了這個下午。
There's nothing like a little doze after lunch.

title: clip
sections: Fasten these receipts with a paper clip, please.
請用迴紋針將這些收據夾住。

請用迴紋針把這些紙張別在一起。

這張地圖能別在牆上嗎？

title: paramount
sections: 至高無上的；最重要的；主要的 [Z]

title: navigate
sections: The large ship could not navigate the river.
那艘大輪船不能在河裡航行。
He navigated the ship to a safe port.
他將船駛進一個安全的港口。
駕駛船舶（或飛機等）；導航
He has to learn to navigate by electronic instruments.
他得學會用電子儀器導航。

title: contagious
sections: Chicken pox is a contagious disease.
水痘是一種透過接觸而傳染的疾病。
(感情等) 感染性的；會蔓延的

title: apparatus
sections: They have installed wireless apparatus on board.
他們已在船上安裝了無線電設備。
The city's security apparatus needs reforming.
這個城市的治安機構需要改良。

title: curtail
sections: The government hopes to curtail public spending.
政府希望縮減公共事業開支。

title: tribute
sections: Many conquered nations had to pay tribute to the rulers of ancient Rome.
許多被征服的國家要向古羅馬的統治者納貢。
We must give tribute to all those who helped make this a free country.
我們必須稱頌那些為使這個國家成為自由之邦而出力的人。
The new engine's performance is a tribute to the skill of its designers.
這種新引擎的工作效能證明了設計者技藝高超。
The brigands demanded tribute from passing vehicles.
土匪向過往車輛勒索錢財。

title: abate
sections: 什麼都不能平息他的憤怒。
We must abate the smoke nuisance in our big cities.
我們一定要消除大城市的煙霧公害。

title: intuition
sections: She sensed what was wrong by intuition.
她憑直覺意識到什麼地方出毛病了。
直覺感知的事；直覺知識 [C] [+that]
She had an intuition that her friend was ill.
她有一種直覺：她的朋友病了。

title: stronghold
sections: The robbers had a stronghold in the mountains.
強盜們在山裡有一個據點。

title: vacant
sections: By the end of the game, the stadium was almost vacant.
到比賽結束的時候，體育館幾乎空了。
A vacant apartment in New York City is very difficult to find.
在紐約市內很難找到空著無人住的公寓。
That will leave plenty of hours vacant.
那樣的話就有許多空閒時間了。
(心靈) 空虛的；(神情) 茫然的；心不在焉的；愚蠢的

title: cogent
sections: 使人信服的；切實的；有力的
The coroner failed to offer a cogent explanation of the victim's death.
法醫對於受害者的死因提不出切實的解釋。

title: coffin
sections: The cards are coffined in boxes.

title: withstand
sections: The walls can withstand high winds.

title: sprain
sections: Rosa fell and sprained her ankle.
羅莎跌倒了，扭傷了足踝。

title: yearn
sections: She yearned to visit the village where she was born.
她熱切盼望能去她出生的那個村子看看。
He yearned after letters from home.
Her heart yearned for the starving, homeless children.
她的心憐憫那些挨餓的無家可歸的兒童。

title: thigh
sections: The water was up to my thighs.
The old man broke his thigh.

title: comet
sections: We can see comets only when they come close to the earth.
只有當彗星接近地球時，我們才能看得見它們。

title: zeal
sections: His boss highly appreciates his zeal for his work.
他的上司十分欣賞他的工作熱情。

title: bypass
sections: We took the bypass to avoid the town centre.
我們走旁邊的道路繞開市中心。

title: dusk
sections: He worked from dawn till dusk.
We could see nothing in the dusk of the hall.
大廳裡一片昏暗，我們什麼也看不見。

title: handout
sections: Even after losing his job, he was too proud to accept handouts.
甚至在失去工作後，他仍然很驕傲，不願接受施捨。
The bag lady never asked for a handout.
那個無家可歸的老婦從不乞求施捨。
傳單；印刷品；(發給學生的) 講課提綱；講義
我仔細看了這份分發的資料。

title: ardent
sections: He was an ardent disciple of Gandhi.
The boy is running an ardent fever.

title: duplicate
sections: 完全一樣的；複製的；副本的
He opened the door with a duplicate key.
他用一把複製的鑰匙打開了門。
完全一樣的東西；複製品；副本 [C]
Keep a duplicate of the letter.

title: pant
sections: Before he reached the top, he was already sweating and panting.
他還沒有爬到山頂就已經渾身出汗，氣喘吁吁了。
Can't you see she is panting for a part in the new play?
你難道看不出她渴望在新戲中扮演一個角色嗎？
The dying old man panted out his last wishes.
臨終的老人喘著氣說出自己的遺願。

title: tuck
sections: She tucked her letter into an envelope.
把……的邊塞到下面（或裡面）
His mother tucked in his blanket.
他母親幫他把毯子蓋好。
She tucked the baby in his crib for a nap.
她把嬰兒裹好放在童床裡小睡一會兒。
The man tucked up his trousers for wading.
那人捲起褲子，準備涉水。
The baby's dress was beautifully tucked with tiny stitches.
嬰兒的衣服用細針腳縫著漂亮的褶襉。
The boys tucked away a big meal.
By nine o'clock we had all tucked into bed.
九點以前我們都舒舒服服鑽進了被窩。
The boy tucked into the salad put in front of him.
男孩大吃放在他面前的沙拉。
The dress was too big, so Mother put a tuck in it.
衣服太大，所以媽媽在裡面打了襉。

title: countenance
sections: The whole countenance of this area has changed.
這地區的整個面貌改變了。
I am surprised you give countenance to such conduct.
我很驚奇你會對這樣的行為表示贊同。
Your father won't countenance you going abroad.
你父親不會贊同你出國。

title: engrave
sections: I had my initials engraved on the picture frame.
我讓人把我名字的縮寫刻在畫框上。
The stone was engraved with his date of birth.
這石塊上刻著他的生日。
The terrible scene was engraved on his memory.
這可怕的情景深深地印在他的記憶中。

title: misgiving
sections: He had never been away from home before: so his mother watched him go with some misgivings.
他從來沒有離開過家，所以他媽媽擔憂地望著他離去。
My heart is full of misgivings.
He looked with misgiving at the strange man in front of him.
他懷疑地望著眼前這奇怪的人。
He looked with misgiving at the overcast sky.
他不安地看著陰雲密布的天空。 misgive的動詞現在分詞、動名詞 (→ misgive)

title: lunar
sections: 按月球的運轉測定的；陰曆的

title: commonwealth
sections: (由共同利益或興趣組成的) 協會界

title: sullen
sections: 不高興的，繃著臉的；慍怒的
Susan was sullen in the morning because she hadn't slept well.
蘇珊今天早上鬱悶不樂，因為昨晚沒睡好。
This sullen weather disagrees with me.
遇上這種陰沉的天氣我就感到不舒服。
The blue eyes were reddened and sullen with weeping.
一對碧眼哭得發紅，沒了光輝。
A sullen stream winds its way among the trees.
一條水流滯緩的小溪蜿蜒流經樹林。

title: belly
sections: The snake crawls on its belly.
The wind bellied out the sail.
The sail bellied out in the wind.

title: prairie
sections: The vast prairie stretches west to the horizon.
茫茫大草原向西伸展，直至天邊。

title: discern
sections: 他一下子就看出她的打算。
He was just able to discern the road in the dark.
黑暗中，他僅能勉強把路辨清。
Is it easy to discern between fact and rumor?
辨明事實與謠傳容易嗎？

title: congenial
sections: 意氣相投的；性格相同的 [（+to）]
I met few people congenial to me in that city.
我在那個城市沒有遇到幾個意氣相投的。

title: prick
sections: She pricked her finger with a needle.
刺痛；刺傷，使內心極度痛苦
She got her finger pricked by a thorn.
她的手指被刺扎了一下。
用刺痕（或小圓孔）標出；圈選
I pricked the map with a pin to show our route.
我用大頭針在地圖上扎孔標出我們的路線。
He pricked up his ears at the sound of his father's voice.
他一聽到他父親的聲音耳朵就豎了起來。
His conscience pricked him on to admit his crime to the police.
他的良心驅使他向警方認罪。
My ears pricked up when I heard them mention her name.
當我聽見他們提到她的名字時，我的耳朵豎了起來。
I've got a prick in my finger.
He burst the balloon with a prick of the pin.
他用針一戳，氣球就爆了。
I felt a prick in my elbow.

title: auxiliary
sections: The auxiliary units are called in only when the main force has been overtaxed.
只有在主力軍承受過重壓力時才會召來預備部隊。
【軍事】 (艦船) 非戰鬥用的；輔助的
The doctor is hoping to find two auxiliaries to work under him.
這位醫生希望能找到兩名幫他工作的助手。
This club has a women's auxiliary.
這家俱樂部有一個附屬的婦女組織。

title: elude
sections: The fox succeeded in eluding the hunters.
這狐狸成功地避過了獵手。
She tried to remember his face, but it eluded her.
她想記起他的臉，可怎麼也想不起來。

title: prerequisite
sections: 首要事物；必要條件；前提
Patience and perseverance are prerequisites to success.
耐心與毅力是成功的前提。

title: quiver
sections: The building quivered as the explosive went off.
當炸藥爆炸時，大樓顫動不已。
There was a slight quiver in his voice as he spoke.
他說話時聲音有些顫抖。

title: puncture
sections: 這一事件損傷了他的自尊心。

title: dazzle
sections: The splendid room dazzled the young girl.
富麗堂皇的房間使得小女孩眼花了。
The bright morning sun dazzled him.
早晨明亮的太陽使他睜不開眼來。
She was not dazzled by her success.
她沒有被自己的勝利衝昏頭腦。
The fireworks on July 4th dazzled us.
七月四日獨立紀念日放的煙火使我們讚歎不已。
The dazzle of the spotlights made him ill at ease.
聚光燈的耀眼強光使他侷促不安。

title: permeate
sections: The smell of her perfume permeated the room.
房間裡彌漫著她的香水味。
The new ideas have gradually permeated through the people.
新思想已逐漸深入民心。

title: slack
sections: It's natural to slack off towards the end of a hard day's work.
一天緊張工作快結束的時候有些放鬆是自然的。
There's a certain amount of slack in the car industry at the moment.
眼下汽車工業不太景氣。

title: wither
sections: The flowers in the vase withered.
Links with the outside community withered.
使畏縮；使惶惑不安；使難堪
She withered him with a scornful look.
她輕蔑的一瞥使他無地自容。

title: queer
sections: Evidently he was queer in some way.
The manager would look into the queer goings-on in the office.
經理將調查辦公室裡發生的可疑事件。
【口語】 不舒服的，頭暈眼花的
I'm feeling a bit queer -- perhaps I ate too much.
我感到有點不舒服，也許吃得太多了。
She was a bit queer after her husband deserted her.
她遭丈夫遺棄後精神有點失常。
His blunder would certainly queer his chances of promotion.
他犯的大錯肯定會毀了他晉升的機會。

title: astound
sections: I was astounded that the mayor had taken bribes.
市長接受賄賂，這使我大吃一驚。

title: fluctuate
sections: He fluctuated between hope and despair.
他時而充滿希望時而失望。
The price of vegetables fluctuates according to the weather.
蔬菜價隨著天氣變化而波動。

title: relic
sections: This custom is a relic of ancient times.

title: blot
sections: Is there any way to remove the ink blot on my dress?
有什麼辦法去掉我衣服上的墨漬嗎？
(人格，名譽等的) 汙點，瑕疵 [（+on）]
Official misconduct was a blot on his predecessor's fair name.
濫用職權是他前任名聲的一個汙點。
He blotted his driving record by having an accident.
他因發生一次事故而在駕駛記錄上留下汙點。
(用吸墨紙等) 吸乾；擦掉；去除 [（+out）]
His name was blotted out from the list.
他的名字被從名單上刪掉了。
The dense fog blotted out the whole view.

title: provoke
sections: If you provoke the dog, he may bite you.
你如果激怒了這條狗，它可能會咬你。
The President's speech provoked much discussion.
總統的演說引發了許多議論。

title: appease
sections: Nothing could appease the crying child.
什麼都無法使孩子不哭。
It was a blunder for them to try to appease the aggressor.
他們想姑息侵略者，那是一個大錯。
Can you appease the boy's curiosity?
你能滿足這個男孩的好奇心嗎？

title: shriek
sections: She shrieked at the sight of the cobra.
她一見到眼鏡蛇便尖叫起來。
Outside the courtroom girls shrieked abuse at the lawyers.
法庭外面，女孩子們尖聲辱罵律師。
She let out a shriek of laughter.

title: barbarous
sections: It was barbarous to treat prisoners in that manner.
如此對待犯人，真是太殘忍了。
粗野的；無教養的；無文化的
It is barbarous to call at 5 a.m.
清晨五點給人打電話是缺乏教養的行為。

title: assimilate
sections: It's not easy to assimilate so many ideas.
吸收那麼多思想很不容易。
America has assimilated millions of immigrants.
美國同化了千百萬移民。
assimilate a conqueror to a robber
有些食物很容易被吸收。
Some foreigners assimilate easily into our way of life.
有些外國人容易被我們的生活方式同化。

title: dormitory
sections: 【英國英語 】 市郊住宅區的 [B]

title: insulate
sections: Children should be carefully insulated from harmful experiences.
應該小心地使兒童與有害身心健康的活動隔絕。
【物理學】 使絕緣；使隔熱；使隔音
The room is insulated against noise.

title: pasture
sections: Sheep are grazing in the lush green pastures.
羊在青翠蔥綠的牧場上吃草。
He is pasturing his cattle on the top meadow.
他在那片最高的草地上放牛。
There were smooth areas where sheep had pastured.
那兒有羊吃過草的平整的地方。

title: apprehend
sections: The police are anxious to apprehend a middle-aged man believed to be armed with a gun.
警察急於逮捕一名確信攜有槍枝的中年人。
你是不是怕有什麼困難？
You are, I apprehend, ready to renew the contract.
據我理解，你願意續訂這個合同。
Prices are, I apprehend, inclined to rise.
依我看，價格有上漲趨勢。

title: elastic
sections: Don't worry about him; he is a cheerful and elastic man.
別為他擔心；他是個快活開朗的人。
It snapped back like a piece of elastic.
它像一條橡皮帶那樣迅速彈回。

title: cockpit
sections: (飛機，小艇，賽車等的) 駕駛員座艙
The pilot climbed into the cockpit.
The Middle East has been the cockpit of modern history.
中東一直是現代歷史上的戰場。

title: rim
sections: (尤指圓形物的) 邊，緣；邊緣
Whisky splashed over the rim of his glass.
威士忌酒從他杯子的邊緣濺了出來。
He fitted the tire around the rim of the wheel.
The mother wiped the rim of milk from the child's lips.
母親擦去孩子嘴脣上沾著的一圈奶。
裝邊於；裝輪輞於；作……的邊

title: slant
sections: The carpenter slanted the roof to allow water to run off.
木匠使屋頂傾斜以便瀉水。
【美國英語 】 使有傾向性，有傾向性地編寫（或報導） [H] [（+for）]
The report was slanted in favor of the strikers.
那篇報導偏向罷工工人。
The newspaper stories on the border clash were slanted.
報上有關邊境衝突的報導有傾向性。
His handwriting slants to the left.
He slanted towards rejecting those proposals.
他傾向於拒絕那些建議。
The wooden floor has a noticeable slant.
這木地板可以看得出有些傾斜。
【美國英語 】【口語】 觀點，看法，傾向；偏見 [（+on）]
This newspaper gave a completely different slant on the tax reform.
這家報紙對稅制改革持有完全不同的看法。

title: dynasty
sections: I like paintings from the Qing Dynasty

title: arbitrary
sections: 反覆無常的，任性多變的
She married an artist with an arbitrary character.
她嫁給一個性格反覆無常的藝術家。
獨裁者即獨斷專橫的統治者。

title: epoch
sections: The years of the American Revolution were an epoch in the history of the United States.
美國獨立戰爭時的歲月是美國歷史上的重要時期。
Einstein's theory marked a new epoch in history.
愛因斯坦的理論標誌著歷史上一個新時代的開始。
值得紀念的事件（或日子）
His audience with the president was an epoch in his life.
他謁見總統是他一生中值得紀念的一件事。

title: mingle
sections: It was a cry that mingled fright with surprise.
那是一聲夾著恐懼與驚訝的喊叫。
混合起來，相混合；交往，往來 [（+with/in）]
Near the bridge, the waters of the two streams mingled.
在橋的附近，兩條溪流的水匯合了。
He rarely mingles with persons of his own rank in society.
他幾乎不與和他身分相同的人交往。

title: abide
sections: (常用於否定句和疑問句) 忍受，容忍
I cannot abide the loud noise anymore.
我再也無法忍受這麼大的噪音。
She resolved to abide the pressure her superiors put on her.
她決心頂住上司們向她施加的壓力。
He abided here for a month.

title: contrive
sections: The writer contrived a happy ending.
作者安排了一個大團圓的結局。
The couple contrived to bring up their children on a small income.
這對夫妻設法以菲薄的收入把孩子扶養成人。

title: evade
sections: Give me a direct answer, and stop evading the issue.
給我一個直截了當的回答，不要迴避這一問題。
They evade paying taxes by living abroad.
他們住在國外以逃避交稅。
Tim tried to catch her arm but she evaded him.
提姆想要抓住她的手臂但她避開了他。

title: grotesque
sections: 奇形怪狀的；古怪的；怪誕的
Grotesque faces are carved over the doorway of the old building.
那棟古老建築的門廊上雕刻了奇形怪狀的臉。
That is a grotesque painting with two-headed animals with wings.
那是幅風格怪異的畫有帶翼雙頭獸的作品。
The fat old man looked grotesque in his tight pants.
那胖老頭穿著緊身褲顯得很可笑。
怪異風格；怪誕的圖樣 [the S]
Bosch was a master of the grotesque in painting.
博斯是繪畫藝術中怪異風格的代表。

title: recline
sections: The tired girl reclined on the couch.
疲憊的姑娘躺在躺椅上。
She reclined her head on my shoulder.

title: agitate
sections: His fiery speech agitated the crowd.
他激昂的演說鼓動了聽眾。
They vigorously agitated for women's right to abortion.
他們開展了強有力的鼓動工作以爭取婦女墮胎權。

title: creed
sections: 他們沒有任何宗教信仰。
"Honesty is the best policy" was his creed in all his business dealings. "誠實為本"是他做生意的信條。

title: posterity
sections: This fine building should be preserved for posterity.
這一優美的建築應該保護好留給子孫後代。

title: assail
sections: The policemen were assailed by a shower of stones.
警察遭到一陣石塊的襲擊。
He assailed his studies with new determination.
他以嶄新的決心從事研究工作。

title: exterminate
sections: This spray will exterminate the termites.

title: sect
sections: 派別；黨派；(黨的) 宗派；學派
They belonged to different philosophical sects.
他們是不同哲學學派的成員。
【宗教】 分裂出來的教派（尤指異端）；宗派
Each religious sect in the town had its own church.
該城每一個宗教教派都有自己的教堂。

title: banquet
sections: A banquet was given in honor of the visiting President.
為來訪的總統舉行了宴會。
They banqueted him like a king.
他們猶如對待國王般設盛宴款待他。

title: prelude
sections: The fighting in the streets may be a prelude to more serious trouble.
街頭毆鬥可能是一個更嚴重事端的前奏。

title: anarchy
sections: Anarchy reigned following the death of the king.
國王死後出現了無政府混亂狀態。

title: confound
sections: 使混亂；使困惑；使不知所措
Our clever tactics confounded our opponents.
我們的巧妙戰術弄得對手不知所措。
Don't confound the means with the ends.
不要把手段和目的混淆起來。

title: slander
sections: The article is a slander on us.
這篇文章是對我們的誹謗。

title: gulp
sections: 狼吞虎嚥地吃；大口地飲 [（+down）]
He gulped down a cup of tea.
He tried to say something, but gulped, and no words came.
他想說什麼，但哽住了，什麼話都說不出來。
Ray took a gulp of coffee and rushed out of the room.
雷喝了一大口咖啡，接著便衝出了房間。

title: indignant
sections: He is indignant at her words.

title: calamity
sections: The recent flooding in the south was a calamity.
最近南方的洪水是一場災難。
His becoming blind was a great calamity.
他雙目失明是巨大的不幸。

title: roam
sections: We spent the day roaming around in the city.
我們漫步街頭度過了一天。
Bisons used to roam through the American Great Plains, but most of them were slaughtered by hunters.
從前野牛在美國大平原上漫遊，但是大多數都被獵人屠殺了。
A group of students roamed the riverbank.

title: broil
sections: They broiled a turkey over charcoal.
The desert sun broiled the travelers in the caravan.
沙漠上空灼人的太陽把旅行隊成員曬得渾身燥熱。
The fish broiled for ten minutes.
I'm broiling in this hot sun.
His success made his opponent broil with envy.
他的成功使他的對手妒火中燒。
He is in a broil of indignation.

title: anthem
sections: The band played the national anthem.

title: shrine
sections: 聖壇；神龕；聖祠；神殿；神社；(寺) 廟
Every day the old women went to pray at the shrine.
老太太們每天去聖殿祈禱。
Shakespeare's birth place is visited as a shrine.
莎士比亞的誕生地被參觀者視作聖地。

title: whiz
sections: The express train whizzed past the station.
那列快車飛速掠過車站。
He is a whiz at football.
他是一位打橄欖球的高手。

title: barometer
sections: 氣壓下降了。（或：天要下雨了。）
【比喻】 晴雨表，顯示變化的事物
The stock market is a barometer of business.
股票市場是商業的晴雨表。

title: tyranny
sections: A tyrant will always find a pretext for his tyranny.
暴君總可以為自己找到暴政的藉口。
The organization helps victims of domestic tyranny.
這個組織幫助那些家庭暴虐的受害者。
His diary recorded the tyrannies of the invaders.
他的日記記載下了侵略者的殘酷暴行。

title: reckon
sections: reckon the span of a bridge
His recent novel is reckoned as the worst of the year.
他最近問世的小說被認為是本年度最差的一本。
I reckon the train will soon arrive.

title: commence
sections: 他於一九八八年開始學習法律。
The bull-fight was to commence in twenty minutes.
鬥牛在二十分鐘後開始。

title: infer
sections: I infer that my proposal has been accepted.
我推測我的建議已被接受。
People inferred that so able a governor would make a good president.
人們推定，如此能幹的州長會成為一名好總統的。
infer a conclusion from the facts

title: recur
sections: Old memories often recurred to him.
往事常常重新浮現在他的心頭。
(問題等) 被重新提出，重提 [（+to）]
The builder recurred to the matter of the cost of remodeling our house.
建築商重新提起改建我們房子的費用問題。

title: bestow
sections: I hardly deserve the praises that were bestowed upon me.
The engineer bestowed much time on the project.
這位工程師把大量時間花在那個工程上。
My friend bestowed me for the night.

title: mishap
sections: With a little care you could have avoided the mishap.
要是你當時小心一點，就可避免那樁不幸事故了。
